review: Just home from our third time here, the staff are all very friendly and helpful, we had a side sea view, our apartment had kettle, toaster, fridge, hob, hairdryer, tv with plenty English channels bbc itv citv etc, air con wasn't the best but done the job, especially as it was no extra cost! Maid service good also the full place was clean. The rooms are quite dated but we weren't there to spend time in our room and it served its purpose. Every day of our stay we managed to get 3 sunbeds & we weren't at the pool earlier that 11am. The pool area is great, no lilos allowed though large rubber rings are. Pool bar served lovely food and very reasonable too, we were self catering but ate there most days. Entertainment throughout the day was water polo, archery,aqua aerobics etc and…

title: Stay at Hardin del Mar
review: Dear Cheryl,  We are pleased to read that you enjoyed your stay at TRH Jardin del mar. Thank you very much for your time and the trust placed in us. We hope to see you again.  Best regards  Quality manager TRH Jardin del mar

title: Great stay!
review: Stayed for 4 nights with 5 other friends. We wanted something cheap and cheerful and this didn't disappoint!  We got allocated rooms on the 3rd floor, 327 & 328. They were dated, but were very clean. To be fair we didn't spend that much time in the room, and if we had I'd have probably wanted something more modern. The view was rubbish, faced a wall and a car park, and the air con wasn't the best in one of the rooms.  For a 4 night stay it served its purpose though.   We only ate there at lunch by the pool and the food was very reasonably priced and nice. Very annoying that by 8am the majority of sun loungers by the pool were taken...not by people may I add, but by towels!!! You'd see towels sunbathing on loungers on their own for up to 4hrs before anyone sat on them. I think…

title: Second visit. Great value
review: Dear guest,  Thak you for your comments on Tripadvisor. We are working on improve our services and your opinions are the most important to do it.  Best regards  Quality manager TRH Jardin del mar

title: Donda26syms
review: We've not long returned from our 2nd visit to TRH Jardin and it won't be our last. This 3 star hotel has the most amazing views. Definitely worth paying a little more  for a seaview room. Family friendly. Adequate swimming pool. Clean rooms. Reliable maid service   Friendly bar and reception team.  We have used the 1/2 board . The food is what you would expect from a 3 star. Grilled meats and fish. Pasta, salad. Enjoyable  breakfast.  They're are also plenty of family friendly restaurants in the immediate vicinity.  With a huge selection of choice of both good and price. We loved pepper pots. (3 course set menu €10 including bottle of wine) and  Royal garden approx  €90 for a family if 4. (Fillet steak delicious) The hotel is well maintained. My only criticism would be that the…

title: Very clean hotel
review: Dear Esther,  Thank you for your kind comments about TRH Jardin del mar. We are glad to read that you enjoyed your stay in our hotel.  We hope to see you soon.  Best regards  Quality manager TRH Jardin del mar

title: great stay
review: 5 night holiday at end of June/July. Found staff friendly, room clean but dated, especially kitchen area, only used kettle as we ate out. Paid for sea view, we arrived late evening & when we went out onto balcony we didn't have a view just a huge bush that was spreading onto balcony, not happy, but neither were our neighbours, apparently they complained! As the next morning at 8am i was woken by an electric hedger, an hour later what i thought was a bush was actually a tree & it had been cut down to 1st floor balcony level, hoorah we had a pool & sea view after all! Beds were hard & there was some noise at night, but on positive side great location for the Sqaure for nightly entertainment, nice sea walk from hotel to main beach, plenty of good restaurants nearby, local lady did…

title: Nice hotel nice location good value for money
review: Okay hotel for the money. Looks modern from the outside but inside is shabby needs updating. Staff not friendly. Pool very small and crowded.  Good location for the square where there is live music. Cheap and cheerful.

title: Lovely stay
review: Dear guest,  Thank you for giving your opinion about TRH Jardin del mar.  We will study your comments in order to improve our service.  Best regards  Quality manager TRH Jardin

title: Great stay overall
review: Had a lovely stay at TRH. Nice location right beside the square where there is entertainment every night. There is entertainment in the hotel every night too, we only went down 2 nights and there wasn't many people there which isn't really the hotels fault cause it was actually really good. There was activitys everyday for kids which was great. There is supermarket and cafe and restaurants right across the road which was very handy, we didn't eat in the restaurant in the hotel so can't comment on it.  Rooms were very clean and cleaned regularly, there were 4 of us in 1 room which was a little bit cramped but this was down to us only booking 1 room but perfect size for a couple.  Pool area was lovely and clean with lifeguard on all day, plus pool side bar was handy Highly…

title: Things you need to know
review: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind coments. Your opinion is really important for us.  We hope to see you again.  Best regards  Quality manager TRH Jardin del mar

title: Average hotel
review: Went away with friends for a few days. We were welcomed into the hotel but we were waiting for 90 minutes to get checked in as there was a mix up with the rooms, the staff at reception were nice but they weren't engaging with us or explaining what was going on, they just made us stand there while they rapidly typed into a computer the same thing over and over again. When we finally got to our room the Rooms were very clean and spacious. We had booked a sea-view room and we had a view of a bush and nothing else. The pool was terrific, there were never any trouble getting sun chairs during the day but the pool closes quite early and the man closing off the pool was very pushy. The walls are very thin so you could hear a lot of the action going on in other rooms. It's more a family…

title: Extremely noisy and rude staff
review: People shouting, partying and arguing most nights till 3/4am. Nobody came down to stop them. One barman was very rude when I asked for some ice for my baby sons bottle. He said  it was 1 Euro or go to the fxxxxx supermarket and get it yourself. From of house staff seemed too busy to be interested when I mentioned the room hadn't been cleaned and we had dry towels. Also big group of lads on a stag do that drank a lot around the pool most days. This is definitely not a hotel for families. Unless you like to stay up with your kids drinking, shouting and swearing!!

title: Birthday Family Holiday
review: Dear guest,  Thank you for let us know the issues that you had during your stay in our hotel.  We would like to apologize for all the inconvenience. We are working on improve our services and your opinions are the most important to do it.  Best regards  Quality manager TRH Jardin del mar

title: Could be lovely, But made the most of it!
review: This is our third stay at Jardin Del Mar and it is still as good as our previous visits.  The hotel is located in an ideal spot for visiting the Centre, the Beach and is near to The Square which is suitable for family/adult entertainment.  There is a good choice of restaurants/bars to visit around the hotel and a ten minute walk to get to the centre of Santa Ponsa.  The only complaint we have for this hotel is the Swimming Pool, there is no shallow end to the pool and to get into the pool you either have to jump in or go down the metal steps, the steps only have 3 rungs and then you have a fair drop to touch the bottom.  I am 5 ft 5 and in the shallowest part, the water is shoulder level.  My mum has been in the water once while we were there but due to having a bad knee was…

title: A good bit tiered but ok for a short trip
review: We stayed at TBH from 11th to 18th June, Santa Ponsa was lovely lots of bars and restaurants nice play parks and lovely beach, we all really liked it and the lovely walk down to the beach and had some fun nights with the kids, the hotel itself is set on a lovely bay with beautiful views, and own little beach cove, pool is lovely lots of beds and nice bar and play area, the rooms itself are very small and we paid for a side sea view room which was basically overlooking a car park so book a pool or sea view definitely worth the extra, we tried to upgrade but decided to stay and save the money and make the most out of it, the rooms for self catering are rubbish so basic no microwave, oven, iron etc worse self catering facilities we ve ever had we like to do a mixture of eating out…

title: Hidden charges
review: I stayed In the Jardin del Mar for a short break of 5 days , I had booked a side sea view on a self catering basis. The reception staff were helpful and said they had a nice room for us on the first floor. My partner is a wheel chair user so first obstacle is always the lifts. The lift was ok and with a good bit of struggle I got the wheelchair and us both into it.down four floors into the base of the hotel and along to our room. Which on first look was ok, as it was a late check in we headed for some food then bed. The next day we  had a good look, the balcony was small and received no sun we could see the sea and hear it but we had a couple of balcony in front of us so didn't have the view, in front of us was a tower block so it was nice to look into someone's house NOT. In…

title: Nice views of the bay, hotel a little dated
review: Situated out of the centre of Santa Ponsa near to 'the square'  We went half board - standard quality that I expected from 3 star hotel, breakfast adequate, could have varied it at times. Evening meal was less appealing with limited choices, however we did conjure up something edible. Rooms comfortable but dated, largest enough for 3. Bathroom- shower over the bath with a curtain, which at times floods the floor. Small kitchen facility with fridge and small hob ( didn't use). Old key type access to room, which you also need for electric. Swimming pool area, good size and kept clean, only niggle is the depth- no gentle slopes. Sun beds - plenty available without rushing down at daft o'clock to reserve them, not enough shade, as only umbrellas were fixed in limited locations. Pool…

title: Very Relaxed
review: Would highly recommend! We asked for a sea view when we booked and got a superb one! Room was a little tired, but perfectly acceptable for our needs and the shower was AMAZING, with lots of hot water and fabulous pressure. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were friendly when we had dealings with them (check-in was a little slow, but hey we are on holiday!)  We were self-catering, but the room had toaster and kettle (which we didn't need to hire!!) Very quiet at night after the kiddie disco had finished! Great location with plenty of shops and restaurants. If you want 5 star, pay for it and go elsewhere, but this hotel is perfect for families or couples wanting a no frills relaxing holiday. Only gripe was no in-room safe, they were based in reception.

title: Ok after a gight
review: Arrived at the hotel to a "side sea view" and as you can see there was nothing like that was awful... complained to reception and was told come back in the morning there is nothing they can do by a very rude Spanish woman.. Paid for wifi and had no access in this bunker of a room!!!  Next day went to reception and another friendly Spanish lady advised we can upgrade to a sea view for (10€) a day and as we only had 3 days left I snapped her hand off.. she gave us a choice of rooms to view and after deciding she advised it would be ready for 12... went to get the keys and she didn't actually charge us and were put in a much nicer room... stayed room only and found the rooms dated but liveable!!! Didn't get maid service once tho... beds are not comfy so ended up on the sofa bed but…

title: Great find
review: Rooms are dated... this does not bother us as they are "functional". The location of this hotel is just brilliant! Exit the back way past the pool and its the best, prettiest walk to the beach!(about 10 mins on foot) lots of sunbathing opportunities along the walk by the water and also restaurants by the sea. Really is great for the price. If your looking to chill, catch a tan, take pretty walks day or night then this is the place. Hard beds though but they always are them stiff hard single beds.

title: Great location and beautiful  views
review: After checking in the hotel I was very surprised and relieved after reading so many negative reviews on here. Our room , although very basic , was spotlessly clean.We had a kettle, toaster and hairdryer included at no extra cost.  far better than i  was expecting and have stayed if far worse 4 star hotels. Only ate at the pool bar a couple of times which was nice and average price. Had breakfast one day which was average. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Lots of stag and hen parties arrived at the weekend but the staff were on standby so no bother as such. Pool overlooks the beautiful bay and the hotel has a small cove with a pebble beach. really pretty. Location is near to shops, bars and restaurants and not too far to the main beach and the center. We had a lovely time…

title: Great for the price
review: The hotel has a great coastal location, and lovely swimming pool area looking across Santa Ponsa bay. Its close to shops, restaurants and santa ponsa square, and about 10 minutes walk from santa ponsa centre. The rooms are very clean, but very basic and in need of an update...this could actually be an amazing place with some tlc. Other reviews suggested you have to pay extra for the use of a kettle and toaster but we had them in our kitchenette at no extra charge. Cant comment on the wifi...I refused to pay extra for something most hotels offer for free.  All in all a good budget base for a holiday

title: Great holiday
review: Lovely hotel! Well equipped room, plenty of sunloungers, indoor and outdoor pools with lifeguard in attendance. But what really made our holiday was Fabian who gave the kids such a great time with a really varied entertainment programme and fabulous mini disco every night! Thankyou!

title: Good sized rooms
review: Stayed here for a long weekend and got a room on 6th floor with sea view. We'd probably have been disappointed with a 1st or 2nd floor room as the view would just be the pool. Rooms are of good size and although quite basic had everything we needed.  There was a stag do staying the same weekend but the hotel staff did well at keeping them in check whilst they were around the pool. Breakfast was good, we'd definitely stay here again

title: Hotel
review: Great hotel for family's ideal kids play area pool etc very handy next to shops etc   Rooms were spacious with balcony reception staff very helpful  Has gym and indoor pool and restaurant ..nice walks to local beaches and local bus service to take teenagers into magaluf 10 mins on bus

title: False advertising ?
review: The hotel it self was great lot of thing you could do nice staff amazing animation team. but the website is kinda fishy: The pools look way bigger on the photo's also the rooms are smaller then they look online. Also the website says free internet but this is false information. Overal the things you see on the site are worse but the things you dont see are alot better.

title: Absolutely lovely place
review: Lovely place people so friendly the entertainment was excellent Fabian and Santo especially. Life guard by pool all day and is very safe. Had the best holiday because of the hotel would really recommend it

title: Short break away
review: We visited the Jardin del Mar for a short 3 day break.   We decided on this hotel due to it being the best value for money in Santa Ponca.   When we arrived there was some confusion as to whether we had booked breakfast (which we had) and then finally this was resolved.   The room itself is basic but a very good size with a seating area and lounge area with a small kitchen. The beds come as twin beds and not double so be careful not to fall down the middle when they move apart!   Breakfast was good with a selection of hot and cold food and drinks.   On the day we checked out our flight wasn't until the evening so we left our cases in the car and used the pool. The hotel let us use the gym changing rooms to shower which was a great gesture.   Overall a good stay and great value…

title: Fab stay .
review: Second time here ,lovely friendly welcome ,superior sea view room breathtaking view.A lot quieter in May than in August ,only 1 down side was the group of rowdy young men ,but hotel security did handle this really well ,loved every minute.

title: Really Good Hotel..
review: I Have Stayed at this Hotel 2 Times and Both Times was Very Happy. The Hotel is Beautiful and also in a Really Great Location With Shops, Restaurants And the Strip Very Near. The Room's are Grand Clean and everything you need for a nice Stay. Overall Really Good Hotel Would Love to Return..

title: First trip to Santa Ponsa
review: Dear Miriam,  Thank you for your kind coments on Tripadvisor. We are glad to know that you enjoyed your stay in TRH Jardin del mar for second time. We hope to see you again.  Best regards  Quality Manager TRH Jardin del mar

title: Apt lovely
review: Asked for sea few we were looking at apt when you were sitting out ,, had a bit of sea view , so make sure you don't get 44floor , hotel was lovely I would go back but make sure I get pool view staff very very good , pool was clean

title: Easter break
review: We arrived at about 1pm and expected to wait for our room,as check in is 3pm, but was pleased to be given key straight away. I had e-mailed the hotel previously and asked if we could have rooms close together; my husband and I in one room, my son and 5 year old  granddaughter in another, we were given rooms next to each other so that was great. The lady on reception was polite and helpful.  Our room, which was on the first floor and overlooking the swimming pool, was clean and spacious for the two of us. The kitchen area had all we needed for our stay. As previously mentioned the beds are extremely hard. The walls, also mentioned in other reviews, are paper thin and you can literally hear conversations!!!  We never ate at the hotel so can't comment on the restaurant or food.…

title: Fantastic
review: Just got back from a 10day stay at the hotel, greeted immediately when entering the hotel, pleasant staff. Room was lovely clean and tidy, my room was cleaned everyday with fresh bedding and clean towels. 15mins walks into town centre with lots to do before getting there. Lots of restaurants/clubs. Would happily recommend a stay at the hotel.

title: Perfect little 3 star hotel
review: With only staying three days we were after a clean decent priced hotel and for almost £150 for 3 nights and 3 people we really couldn't fault it. The room was more of an apartment with two twin beds and a sofa bed. The room also had a small kitchenette with a fridge for water or drinks. The hotel itself was very dated and was in need of some TLC but the room was clean and the location was brilliant. We had a lovely view which is unusual because despite staying in various rated hotels we've always had the view of a car park or trees. This time we had a first floor room with a swimming pool view. Outside the hotel was various restaurants however Santa Ponsa beach was only a 5-10 minute walk. There were more restaurants long the sea front and plenty towards the marina. There is a…

title: Fab place to stay
review: Stayed here for 5 nights mid April, before arriving I emailed the hotel to ask for a room on floor 5 or above after reading other reviews here.  I had paid the extra for a sea view which is definitely worth the money as the view is to die for.  On arrival the lady on reception was very friendly and helpful and we were given a room on the fifth floor.  The room we had was sufficient for the 4 of us, there isn't a kettle or toaster which can be hired but we didn't bother as there was a kettle in the room which can be boiled on the hot plates.  Enough crockery and cutlery for us all.  Bedroom is a good size with plenty of wardrobe space, the living area is not the biggest but was ample as we didn't spend much time in the room.  Bathroom good size with powerful shower over the bath…

title: Not bad.
review: This hotel wasn't bad. The appliances on the self catering were poor! You had to pay for a kettle and a toaster. Also for non self catering there are lots of restaurants about so don't worry about that.  Would recommend it.

title: great hotel, very good entertainment staff for the kids
review: just got back from jardin del mar and booking again for this year, gorgeous views and lovely clean hotel in a good area... best thing about the hotel for us was Fabian and Santo the entertainment staff, they are great with the kids and the most friendly and helpful staff in the hotel... can't wait to visit again.

title: Nice little apartments In a lovely part of majorca
review: What a great hotel. It's location is pretty good, right next to a little Cove and 5 minuets walk to the main beach. Since being in majorca and seeing 7 different beaches whilst there these two beaches I found the most beautiful.  The hotel itself is brilliant from the price. We got a superior room which overlooks the Cove with amazing views. Large apartment with all the main things you need for cooking and cups for drinks. There is a on the hob kettle for making hot water. Bed were two single beds put together which was a bit annoying but at least I get to keep my own cover. Ha. We found If you put the mattresses the other way to the bottom of the bed the bed stays as double with out moving.  The shower was powerful and there was always hot water. We have 4 showers a day and the…

title: Easter holiday week's break
review: Came for a week with my partner and two kids ages 10 and 4, we found the Hotel was clean and staff were very helpful and there whenever we needed them. The swimming pools are a good size and the indoor pool is great from them colder days. They also had a small park for the kids which kept them happy. Hotel is up a little hill but not a concern there are bus and taxi routes all near by. Beach restaurants and kids parks also all close by.  Would stay again without a doubt. Great location, great activities for the kids and beautiful views!!

title: Week sc break before Easter
review: We arrived late at night so went straight to our room after 10 mins wait sorting out our details with other fellow holiday makers in the reception.  Our room was on the 6th floor and we were quite happy with our room which had 2 twin beds in our bedroom for me and the wife and our kids had the sofa and fold up bed. Looked like it had been newly decorated as it had a new door compared to the others on the floor and was clean and tidy inside. Kids slept really well but me and the wife found the twin beds very hard so always woke up aching. We did ask for extra pillows that helped a bit.  Bit disappointed with the kitchen area as we were expecting an oven but it only had 2 hobs. We did manage to cook bacon and eggs for a few days. We also hired a toaster for 2€ a day and 10€…

title: Had a great week
review: Lovely hotel in amazing position next to sea, we were so lucky to get a sea view apartment really made the holiday special. Good size apartment but tiny kitchen glad we paid to upgrade to half board or we ate out as its really to small to cook a meal in. Fab outside and inside pools and a small kids pool and a play area so my kids were very happy! Also a kids club for an hour in morning and kids disco at night so kept them busy for a while. Most of the staff friendly and helpful especially our cleaner who was very nice and chatted away in Spanish as she was cleaning lol. We would go back here only took a star off as there was no lock on balcony or bedroom window and my daughter opened the window and could have fell out. And no toaster or microwave you usually get in apartments.…

title: Excellent location, poor view and noisy
review: The location of the hotel is excellent with the pool overlooking the lovely bay. There's even a small cove down a few steps which is absolutely stunning. It was still off season when we were there, which was nice as it meant that there were plenty of beds by the pool without the need to get up at the crack of dawn, and the hotel restaurant was always fairly quiet. A lot of the local bars and restaurants were still closed, which was a bit annoying, especially as we'd heard such good things about the square and unfortunately didn't get to see it open.  We thought the hotel food was decent, plenty of choice and was always re-stocked regularly.  The 2 things that disappointed us were the noise at night and our view. We paid £50 extra for a 'side sea view' but shouldn't have…

title: First time to Mallorca
review: This was our first experience of Mallorca and was a last minute one week holiday break. We stayed at Jardin del Mar aparthotel complex. We arrived late at night so went straight to our apartment following checkin.  We were pleasantly surprised with our apartment, it was really a decent size with a separate living room and bedroom, as well as a small but adequate kitchenette and a roomy bathroom. The entire apartment was spotlessly clean and well stocked with kitchen equipment and all the items that we would need. The bathroom was clean and again well stocked with towels and toiletries. The living room was simply furnished and included TV with the usual selection of channels, also this room had table and chairs and a couch which doubles aS an extra bed if required. The bedroom…

title: You get what you pay for!
review: At this hotell you will find what you need. It has a god location with supermarkets, restaurang and pubs just round the corner. Service and cleaning is ok. The beach near this big and sometime noisy hotel is very small and rocky. BEWARE OF BRITISH NOISY WOMAN HAVING A HEN PARTY OR JUST BEING LOUD PER SE!

title: Top of the Hill!
review: Lovely hotel situated away from Santa Ponsa centre. Has a super restaurant which serves buffet style meals, if you are staying self catering you can eat at the restaurant for a very reasonable price and it's all you can eat. Nice pool area with super views over the bay, Only downside is the walk up the hill from town.. not great if you have mobility issues,although a taxi will cost you less than 5 euros. Rooms are spacious and clean with bath&shower also hairdryers and shaving points.Could have more in kitchen for self catering, no toaster/microwave/kettle(you can hire at cost from reception) only 1 pot and 1 small frying pan not enough to cook a proper meal,this is the only fault we had about this hotel,so had to eat out 90% of our stay.

title: A lovely weeks holiday
review: We are just home from a lovely week here over the easter holidays. We arrived and my mother in law foolishly left her bag on the bus the staff were excellent getting it back for her thank god. Our room was nice & clean our balcony was amazing absolutely huge just really lucky I guess. Others in our party had smaller rooms a little dated but still clean. There was a bit of entertainment on mini discos, kids club etc... just enough and thank goodness for the indoor pool at this time of year. I would definitely stay again great week.

title: Great location
review: Dear Amy, Thank you for your comment on Tripadvisor. We would like to thank you for your compliments on our staff and we are happy to read that you enjoyed your estay in TRH Jardin del mar. We hope to see you again. Best regards

title: Not the best
review: Just back from santa ponsa , stayed in this hotel, we got a room with a sea view which was fab. The location is fantastic it's situated in a quieter part of santa ponsa but only a stone throw away from the Jardin square which sadly for us didn't get up and running until mid may - overall a nice place to stay but wifi is NOT free

title: Nice little hotel
review: Positive points first: - the views are incredible (especially if you get a room higher up, floor 4 and upwards - staff are friendly - powerful showers - decent satellite tv  Negatives: - walls are thinner than paper - the beds are really uncomfortable - the kitchenette is really basic and small (no toaster, kettle or microwave, one knife to chop things which was a bread knife) - attracts stag parties due to low costs  The last negative nearly ruined our whole holiday. We were only away for three nights and two of them we were kept up by the 20 strong party who chose to scream and shout the whole night long. The reception staff took pity on us when the loudest of the bunch had their room directly above us and moved us to a corner of the hotel which was bliss, until they decided…

title: Ok apartments
review: Dear costumer,  We are very sorry that you felt disturbed by the behavior of other guests. We always try to make every guest fell comfortable, therefore we are sorry that you could not enjoy your stay as much as we wished you would have. We would like to thank you for sharing your observations with us because this gives us the opportunity to make improvements for the near future.  Best regards TRH Jardin del mar

title: 5 NIGHT STAY SELF CATERING
review: We've stayed at this hotel 3 times before, very pleasant and helpful staff on reception, clean and well presented rooms with lovely views over the bay. We have had a superior room when available, worth the extra if you can get one but they go quickly. Heated indoor pool if it's too chilly in the outdoor pool. Plenty of shops and bars close by, nice walk down the seafront into Santa Ponsa passing plenty of bars and restaurants along the way. We go again in April, managed to book a superior room so that says it all really.

title: Okay stay not the best
review: I stayed here for a week self catering with a friend. We requested a side sea view but when we arrived we looked out to a bush and had no view at all. We complained and Pedro the hotel receptionist said that was the side sea view. We then got flies all over our balcony door and the cleaners did very little as they were not sure on how to clean it and get them away. I'm glad we were only self catering as I would not have touched the food.

title: okay
review: When we arrived at the Jardin Del Mar Hotel it was really late at night. It was around 1am in the morning and we were all really tired, and just wanted to get to our rooms. The guy behind the desk took forever to register us in, it was at least 45mins we waited. We finally managed to get to our rooms, and at that moment we really didn't care what the room looked liked, we just really wanted a bed to sleep on. It was very hard to sleep because the air con was quite loud but we managed.  We got up and dressed and went down to the pool and to discover there were no sunbeds which was a shame. We went to have breakfast and the food was lovely anyway. So we spent most of the day going for a wander, and swimming in the beach cove which was lovely and warm near the hotel, We got a…

title: Disgusting do not go
review: Stayed here for 7 nights room was lovely food was awful staff were awful and pool was terrible staff not interested in u being there we hated it wud the return of kids club or activities or night entertainment

title: Great hotel, great stay.
review: We hadn't originally booked this hotel however once we arrived at the hotel we did book, we were told by the receptionist that we had been moved to another hotel, the TRH Jardin del Mar, due to over booking. Well, I'm so glad we were moved. We had a Fab time from start to end. I'll definitely be booking up at the TRH Jardin del Mar again. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the hotel was very clean and had plenty of amenities, 2 swimming pools, 1 of which was indoor. Our whole stay there was wonderful. I'd give it 10/10.

title: Nice hotel in great location
review: Stayed here 24thoct 2016.its very nice hotel, indoor and outdoor pools are very good, staff where good  didn't use restaurant so cant comment. Rooms big enough for us family of four but bit dated. Only problem was that we came home one night and found a mouse in the bedroom got no help from reception as it was late, so had manage till morning.

title: Could be better
review: Arrived 24th Oct 2016 for 8 nites. Check in was smooth we had rooms 427 and 428 rite next to reception on level 4. Not a pool view but side sea view. Rooms basic but fine. Small kitchen decent bathroom with bath and fab shower. Bedroom with 2 single beds ( hard) living room with couch/bed really comfy.flat scream tv dining table and chairs. Balcony with chairs and little table. Hotel is immaculate can't fault it. No hassle with sun beds in the morning.good Pool but cold. Plenty of sun loungers indoor pool outdoor snack bar was shut but can order food at normal bar. Cheese and ham toasties went down well with kids. Lager was €3.10 pint sangria was €3.30 for glass €7.50 for 1/2 ltr. No issues with staff but entertainment was very poor but maybe that was due to being end of season.…

title: Never Disappointed .
review: This is our sixth stay at the Jardin Del Mar and we are never really disappointed.We always stay self catering as then you can please yourself where and when you eat.Eating in Cafes or Restaurants the food is freshly cooked,eating in Hotels the food is usually kept warm in heated trays,not good,Also eating out can sometimes be cheaper.Also we don't  want to pay for a 3 hour flight to be stuck in a Hotel for 10 days,this does not benefit the community.The Hotel could benefit from a much needed update but it is still clean and comfortable,we have never had any problems with the cleaning regime and the beds we find are comfortable.Any problems we have had in the past are very quickly sorted out by the very good staff.We have always found the Jardin to be good value for money and we…

title: Dissapointed
review: We are just back from a weeks holiday at this hotel. We were in this hotel 16 years ago on a self catering basis and this time we were half board. Unfortunately, the hotel has not changed at all. I think it still had the same curtains and bedcovers as on our first visit. The hotel is in a perfect situation right on the beach, but unfortunately, that's all it has going for it. The food is ,at best, average. There is not much of a variety and what there is is pretty bland. We took our five year old grandson and he ate pasta all week as they did not cater for children at all.  There was very little atmosphere in the hotel or dining room. The staff, apart from Hector and a lovely friendly waiter called Kevin, made no attempt to interact with the guests at all. When we arrived, our…

title: Terrible hotel
review: What can I say except don't stay at this hotel! The rooms are tired and date back to the 70's the beds are small and uncomfortable and the mattress are old and you ca n feel the springs! The apartments are big and roomy but need renovating the balcony however was huge with a fabulous view over the sea and harbour we were on the top floor and the view was stunning. The staff in the bar were miserable and made you feel like you were being a nuisance . The pool was quite small but a nice area with views over the sea.

title: Value for money
review: Stayed in this hotel from the 14th to the 21st October 2016. Upon arrival at lunch time we were told our room was available although the web site says check in is 3pm onwards. We did book this hotel direct with the hotel and not an agent.   ROOM : We were given room 701 which was on the top floor at the far end. This room had excellent views across the bay and we were very happy (see photos attached). The room was up to standard and very clean, as is stated on many reviews the rooms are a bit dated but we knew this at time of booking and when considering the price against standard this hotel came out on top. The room was made up of a very small kitchen area, bedroom. Shower and toilet room (no bath). Balcony with excellent views.   LOCATION : The location of this hotel is…

title: Good Hotel!
review: A great family holiday in June. Great location with lovely views of the sea from the hotel. Pool is a good size and the service at the pool bar was very good. We were bed and breakfast and thought there was a nice selection at the breakfast buffet. The rooms were very clean and had good facilities. However, we were disappointed with the balcony of the room as it was on the very bottom floor and looked out into nothing but a hedge. We tried to change but were told that the hotel was fully booked. Nevertheless, we had a lovely stay in the hotel.

title: Spectacular views
review: Just back today weather was brilliant,  hotel was good could do with the rooms updated but very clean both inside and out, the view from our balcony was stunning looking right onto the  pool and  sea, down steps to a little cove ideal for snorkeling continue walking along path and you hit the beach all in all a great holiday.

title: great views
review: Stayed here for 2wks in late September/early October. Booking in was easy except for the room we were allocated. I had booked and paid for a room with sea views but was given room with side sea views. Receptionist checked our booking then gave us an apology for the mistake and gave us a lovely room with full sea view. The room was very clean but in need of a full refurb as could other parts of the hotel. Pool area very nice and the pool bar and snacks were ok. We went to the square hoping to hear some music, but the season had finished so there was nothing only sports bars open. If you wanted a lively night out you had to go into Santa Ponsa main strip. Not a lot to do here mainly for the old or very young. Went by bus or by taxi to Palma Nova where it was a lot livelier.

title: A good week
review: We had a very nice week at the end of September - all the better because the weather was tremendous!  We found the hotel acceptable - the 1-bed apartment was very clean although dated as others have said but this wasn't a problem.  The bathroom was clean and tidy but be aware that you only get clean towels every 3 days.   The rooms could certainly do with a refurb however.  We did change rooms however - the first one (as booked by us on Thomson website) was for a limited sea view and it looked over a scruffy car park so we paid the 105 euros and then had a fantastic view over the stretch of water (and over the pool - room 606).  We went self catering so cannot comment on the food.  The kitchen area was the usual two rings but there seemed to be plenty of crockery/cutlery.  What…

title: Better than expected
review: We came here in October we where only staying for 3 days and we're dreading it after reading many reviews, reception staff were friendly , we had a room on the 6th floor looking over the bay fantastic views, room is pretty basic but clean with a very small kitchen, lounge area with television with some English channels, bedroom has single beds pushed together bloody pain, few shops outside but walked into Santa ponsa which is really nice, we went self catering but did do the breakfast which was really nice, overall really nice stay the people who do nothing but moan must be very fussy and just like moaning 😀

title: Excellent location
review: My first visit to this hotel although my friend had been before. Excellent location with shops and bars and restaurants very near. Hotel was clean and comfortable. The choice of food was great and staff first class.  I recommend this hotel and definitely going back.

title: Nice break
review: Just got back from a nice break at the Jardin .It is situated on a cliff on the outskirts of the main town ,if you walk along the sea-front it is a gradual sloping walk to the main beach area and takes between 10-15 minutes at a steady pace although there is a small cove with a pebble beach at the back down some steps.The hotel is spotless and the staff are friendly ,The food at the pool-side bar is good and does the job. the rooms are of a decent size and were adequate for what we needed. Out the front there are a few bars and restaurants within a 5 minute walk , there is a lot more choice if you go into the town which is located down the hill a 10-15 minute stroll.

title: A little dissappointing but overall OK place to stay for a week.
review: Period of stay Sept 24- Oct 1 2016. I booked through Start Tour charter a 2 room apartment with full sea view.   I additionally sent a email directly to the hotel requesting a room on the upper floors. I never received a reply to my email.    We arrived the first evening(Sat) and had an easy check in.  However, we were given a room on first floor with a view directly over pool and looking through palm trees with a glimpse of sea in the background.   The room is very dated and basic.  However very clean.   I requested at the desk to be moved.  Night manger said a move was not possible until Monday but they would note the request.   I also requested top mattress for both beds these were given to us on Sunday.   Beds are hard as cement.  I ended up on the sofa bed but this was also…

title: Clean hotel in good location
review: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel I was extremely cautious and was even thinking about changing hotels before I arrived. However I am glad I didn't, I cant comment on other peoples experiences but me and my boyfriend stayed here the end of September and we loved the hotel, we are a young couple and just wanted a week to relax. The resort is full of couples and families which suited us fine. The receptionists we had were very nice and helpful, there was maybe one who didn't have the attitude I would expect a receptionist to have, however we only seen her once and the others made up for the lack of friendliness she provided. The entire hotel is spotlessly clean and they cant be faulted on this. I would suggest anyone to make sure you book a seaview room, as the views…

title: had to wait for room over two hours, being overcharged on the tax and then being told we hadnt paid it  by the same recp
review: not a good one, room average , food awful, no variety in from breakfast to evening meals, very disapointing, cleaning not very good either, entertainment none , except for a childs vidio shown on saturday night because the entertainment guy liked walt disney films ,staff very grumpy

title: Unexpected visit
review: we booked the Sorrento but were moved here. weren't happy at the time but we enjoyed our stay. Lovely entrance, lovely pool, lovely resturaunt, lovely staff, especially Hector the entertainments guy. we booked a one bedroom apartment, the bedroom was fine, the bathroom was fine, the kitchen was a cupboard and the balcony overlooked a hedge (we were on the ground floor at the back of the hotel) if you wanted an electric kettle there was a surcharge but there was a hob kettle provided. you also had to pay for a toaster (the cooker had two rings, nothing else) we ended up paying for half board 14 euro per day each. good value as the meals were self service and a good variety. I would stay here again but would pay a bit extra for a pool/sea view

title: Great location poor reception service.
review: Didn't get off to a great start, I'm arrival at the hotel we were greeted with " your room is ready but it's not what you booked, but it is only for a night" we thought ok a night we can do until we saw the room. It hadi small room with 3 single beda for 4 of us, no kitchen and a small window meaning no balcony. We go back down to reception where they were very rude and insisted that there were no other rooms and it was touch as it was Spanish holidays and they get priority.  We were not the only disgruntled guests, 2 families were taxied off to magaluf with their small children and we coukd out that other families had had the same treatment as us. We stood firm at reception and we were eventually given another room with separate bedroom and enough beds with a balcony. We were…

title: nice and friendly in a good location
review: my husband and I spent 5 days here in September.  check in was quick and room had everything we needed. The tv had quite a few English channels . Our room had a side view of the sea and overlooking a footpath and the room was very clean. The pool area always had sunbeds available even when we arrived in the afternoon. We stayed self catering and are unable to comment on the food at the hotel although it did smell very nice.The hotel is 2 minutes walk to the main family square area where there are lots of bars, restaurant, shops and a few arcade games to keep the little ones amused for 5 minutes. If you walk along the beach area (10-15 minutes) to the main beach its very uneven so don't take prams or very small children. My husband has coeliac disease and is unable to eat food…

title: Nice
review: Stayed here first week of school holidays, a lovely hotel with basic rooms cleaned every day but thurs/Sunday.lovely area with great sea views and square on door step.Lovely pool and bar area the only negative is it's an absolute nightmare to get sunbeds like most hotels in peak season. We tried half board and loved the food so all in all had a great stay.

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Stayed here for a week in September. It was very cheap and good for the money you are paying. The rooms were very clean and cleaned regularly. My friend stayed on the sofa and it was very big and comfy. The pool area is amazing with breathtaking views, and has a little private stony beach a few metres away if you fancy a swim in the sea.

title: Holiday Stay
review: We have returned to this hotel after a lovely stay last year.  The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly.  We only stayed for B & B but the range of food catered for everybody.  The pool and pool area are clean, the only fault with the pool is there is no shallow area to enter it at your leisure, it is deep the whole way around, not ideal for older people and children!  Our room was clean and we had a side view of the sea but we were only in our room to get changed and sleep there.  It would have been nice to have a kettle available but those were to be hired from reception.    Overall our stay was enjoyable and we will be back next year.

title: Holiday
review: My sister in law and I stayed here for 2 weeks, and we thought it was lovely, and staff very friendly. We were given a room near the air conditioner which was very noisy, but we asked if they could change our room, which they did without any hassle. Room was very clean and they changed our towels every other day, the only downside is that they only changed the sheets once the whole 2 weeks we were there, but we had a lovely holiday and thank you Jardin del Mar !!!!

title: If you like hassle whilst on holiday? Book a room here!
review: Poor rooms, dirty, broken appliances, electrics not safe and tripping out all time, nothing like pictures in website, like taking a time warp back to 1970! Reception staff very rude an dun helpful, food is bland and not great quality. Not a family place to stay, no entertainment at all even though advertised. Would rate this mid range 2 star hotel.

title: Not up to standard
review: We arrived at 12 noon to find room not ready!!! We were asked to come back at 1pm. Left cases in luggage room went for lunch arrived back to be told to wait for half hour, then another half hour then another half hour by this time it was 2.30.  I asked why the room wasn't ready and was told booking in time was 3pm which we did not know about!!! and that the cleaner was doing her best, I said the rooms should have been ready for us when we arrived only to be shown the booking in time again, I explained that my sister was feeling unwell as we had been up since 01.30 that morning all I got was shoulders shrugged and told not my fault!!! As soon as I asked to see the manager a key for a room was magically handed over. We had booked a sea view and got a view of greenery no sea in…

title: Unexpected stay
review: I was transferred here due to overbooking at Portofino. I would rate this as an average accommodation as rooms are dated and kitchen facilities are minimal. Rental charge for kettle, toaster and Iron which should be included as basic needs.  On a plus point the location was great due to a small cove at hotel which was great for snorkeling, very clean apartments and reception staff were very helpful.

title: First Family Holiday
review: We arrived at TRH Jardin del Mar on Saturday 17th Sept 2016. We arrived at the hotel at approx 1:30, although check in wasn't until 3 they did say if we waited 30 mins we could have our room which was great with us having a 1 year old. Advised we were on the ground floor where the restaurant and pool were so not knowing the hotel we said great again thinking this was easy with the pushchair. We were not asked if we needed help or anything with our cases. As we walked away from the reception through the double doors we quickly realised we were on level 4 and in fact we need to go down to the bottom level. We went in the lift which with a push chair and 2 people plus cases was very tight, not the best sized lifts for a hotel. We then found our room and was shocked at how dated and…

title: Better than average but not a very good rating
review: We arrived at this hotel after being overbooked at the Deya Apartments on arrival ( i think could have been a blessing!)  It was very late when we finally arrived so first thing we wanted was sleep. On waking we had been placed on floor 1 overlooking the wall covered in greenery, bit disappointed but we didnt plan on staying in room for too long.  We used it as a base. Rooms could really do with an update and modernisation but again for just cooking a bit of breakfast was ideal. We had booked for 4 adults so was a little surprised when we got a fold out bed, surely 4 adults should have 4 proper beds?  Never used restaurant but looked nice and clean. Pool bar and snack bar was ideal, reasonable priced and lovely food. Pool ok, plenty of sunbeds. Probably too many to be honest but…

title: Great location, rooms a bit dated but ok
review: We stayed here for 2 nights only so were a bit disappointed when we could not check in till 1500hrs and had to be out by 12 on the departure day. The reception area looks rather swish so finding the apartments looking dated and requiring maintenance was a bit of a surprise.  The apartments were very clean and the location is great. I wouldn't want to stay at the back, request for a sea-view. Would go back.

title: 4 stars
review: Overall the hotel is very nice, lovely friendly staff and decent rooms. We had to pay €10 per week for a toaster, €15 per week for slim safety deposit box plus the new visitor tax.  The pool area was clean but with way too many sun loungers - crammed in like sardines.  Food in the snack bar was lovely - didn't try the restaurant.

title: Sea View? My foot!
review: This hotel appealed due to its stunning location with views out to sea so when booking this hotel for my partners birthday celebrations we specifically booked a side sea view to  ensure we were able to appreciate this. On arrival we were given a ground floor apartment and greeted with a 30 foot fence adorned with some rather nice foliage but no view out to sea, in fact to be able to appreciate the sea view from a side room you would need to be on at least the 4th floor. As we had booked in good faith I spoke with reception (booking papers in hand) to explain our predicament and ask to be moved to a higher floor, I was greeted with a rather curt "no this is how it is if you are in the side". The conversation went round in circles with me explaining several times that we had paid…

title: September in Jardin Del Mar, Santa Ponsa Majorca
review: The pool area is lovely, with great views of the bay.Very clean at pool.  Room are very basic and could do with a bit of a revamp but ok for a base.  Within 10 mins walk of main beach at Santa Ponsa with small stoney cove beside the hotel - great for snorkelling but first set of steps down, very dangerous as steps badly broken at the end and beach inaccessible this way, although the access isn't blocked off, it should be.  Supermarket right beside apartments.  Don't be misled by the side sea view description.  These apartments are not visible on the pictures and only look onto a wall covered in plants.  The "side" sea view they are speaking off, is if you lean over your balcony and crank your head to the right.  By doing this, you can see a small patch of blue in the distance. …

title: Just Average
review: Room clean but dated. Beds very hard and uncomfortable,my partner had to sleep on the sofa bed . Balcony very overlooked with lots of people shouting between them.  Generally noisy from about 8am. Staff on reception not very helpful and disinterested. Unable to check in before 3pm so had to sit across road in bar with cases  Good position for square if you like Irish bars and tribute acts! No toaster in room but available to hire. We were on 2nd floor next to lifts and stairs so generally quite noisy.  Generally ok for a base but could be much better if modernised ,had better beds and improved customer service.  Please note wifi not free. 12 euros for 3 days.  Good bar across from hotel called Arkles which did very good breakfasts and good bar up the road called bar lucinda…

title: Holiday
review: Hotel was clean enough and we had a sea view. Food was not up to our expectations though and not much choice.nice balcony though and swimming pool but unfortunately was too deep for my wife she is only small.

title: Lolly pool over looking the sea.close to everything you need.have been twice this year well done jardine del mar
review: Room was excellent for the money.everything was close.defo going back next year.buffet breakfast a must.pool and pool bar clean and tidy.this hotel is grate for all ages.also aircondion very good.see you next year

title: Not bad for a base, needs updating
review: I have just arrived home from a weeks stay at the Jardin Del Mar. We arrived just after lunch and got our room straight away no problem. The hotels itself gives a great first impression. Its clean and well presented, we were handed the keys to room 211 on the 2nd floor. On entry it looked tired and dated, it was well cleaned and liveable, but after how nice the outside of the rooms looked I was disappointed. Our beds were comfortable and the mattresses looked new. We paid for a sea view with Jet2 and yes we could see the sea but mainly to pool, would be nice to be higher up, didn't bother going to complain as we were happy enough. We stayed half board and I was disappointed with the evening meals. There were some strange combinations IE rabbit stew or a second option of rabbit…

title: Middle of september
review: I have just come back from this hotel we had a great week here. we arriived at the hotel abour 2 in the afternoon checkin was nice and fast and our room was ready when we got there. All the staff were really nice.The towels were only changed onces in the whole week i think they should be changed a little more then that. Bedding was never changed wile we was there the room was never moped or swepted just the bed made. Food was ok but some strange things on the menu. Rooms need a lick of paint as a bit dated. Was ok for sunbeds was always plenty doors did open at 8am and people run for them. The square were there some bars and there always something on at night time that was just a 2 min walk from the hotel. We payed extra for a sea view room but we was only put on the 2nd floor…

title: Basic but convenient
review: We just got back from a week at the Jardin del Mar. We arrived late and were checked in quickly by a friendly man on reception. The room was basic but clean and plenty of space, exactly what we were after. To cook, there was just a hob, which restricted meal options slightly but we ate out a few times as well. The views were fantastic, worth paying a little extra for a sea view.   The staff varied in attitude, some were very approachable and some less so. We didn't find it hard to find a sunbed or three around the pool - we got some together even if we rocked up in the afternoon so no problems there. We ate at the pool bar a couple of times, and found the food and drink to be reasonably priced, and much nicer than some reviews suggest. We also had breakfast at the hotel twice…

title: As you'd expect from a 3 star hotel
review: We arrived at the hotel at around 3am, and had no problems with check in. Room was fine for just the 2 of us, but dated. Mattresses were very hard, and pillows were thin. On one occasion, one of our towels had a hole in but nothing seemed dirty. We were lucky enough to get a room with a double balcony that wrapped round the corner of the building so that we had views of both the sea and the pool area. Had no problem with noise at night/in the morning.   As we were half board, we didn't really use the kitchen facilities but they seemed adequate. Breakfast was average, with a wide range of cooked foods, fruit, breads and yoghurts yet the juices were very watered down. My partner found the coffee to be undrinkable. Dinner was worse, with some often very strange choices (such as…

title: Beginning of September, a weeks break
review: Just arrived back from this hotel after a weeks stay. Arrived mid afternoon, check in was quick. Very accommodating chatty youngish gentleman on the reception desk - gave us our room key, safe key and informed us of hotel tax etc and then we were straight up to the room on floor 1. Room was clean upon arrival, with 2 single beds we could form into a double with a sofa bed for the daughter. Room was regularly cleaned thereon apart from 2 days the maid staff have off. Yes room was a tad dated, but had fully working TV with English channels on and we stayed self catering but didint use the facilities apart from the fridge as the hob was a little old and the kitchen was small. Didn't bother us, happy to eat out. Had working air con too.  Had a fantastic sea view from the room, with…

title: Group Holiday
review: A group of ten of us (age 18-19) arrived at Jardin Del Mar at the start of August 2016 after a late flight. The reception staff were really nice but told us the news that they had double booked our four rooms and had to ship us off to another hotel (which turned out great as it was right on the strip haha). We are all extremely laid back and didn't mind being sent to another hotel for the night, however I understand how frustrating this could of been for the likes of a family etc... They paid for our room and taxis to bring us back to the hotel he next day, however it was frustrating to find that they still did not have our rooms ready when we arrived the next day, thus our luggage was placed in a hold room while we were left to go back and forth to get towels/change of clothes…

title: Family summer break
review: Stayed in hotel del mar for one week at end of August. We arrived at 1am exhausted and ready for bed only to be told they had no record of us coming and therefore no room.Eventually we were given an emergency room untill we could find out the problem the next day.the emergency room was awful,stained bedding,very dusty dark and disgusting.We got no sleep that night. The next day after much confusion at reception we got our proper room. The hotel had made a mistake and lost our booking. No appology was given. Hotel itself was ok.Pool was lovely.Beds very hard.Location good. Would go back to Santa Ponsa but would not stay in Hotel Jardin Del Mar.

title: A little bit disappointed
review: We visited Jardin Del Mar in August. We arrived during the night & 1st impression from the front was very good. The check in procedure was slow & most of it could've been done the next day. On entering the apartment we were disappointed it was clean but very dated. We knew that the rooms were basic when we booked, the kitchen was tiny, so we only used the sink & fridge. However once we opened the patio doors & saw the view, that certainly made up for the room. The view was stunning. The subbed situation was a joke. The doors were closed until 8am, which isn't a bad thing but once those doors opened it was like a Boxing Day sale at Primark. People were running, shouting & even screaming for beds. Other family members were shouting from balconies so that they could get a bed. Half…

title: Chambers mcgrath family
review: Stayed 2nd  to 9th Sept. Hotel is very clean Pool area very good including a life guard.Pool bar is good and reasonably cheap .We stayed sc but you can upgrade to hb for €14 per day.We had a breakfast 1 day if you're not fussy it'll be OK for you .the rooms are dated but functional and very clean.the beds are an instrument of torture. Kitchen is OK you do get fridge and cooker .put kettle on and takes 10 or 15 mins  depending on how much water you put in no biggie put some will moan not a problem for us.Staff are good and polite .cleaners very good. Hotel generally needs updating.  Rated as 3* but needs change. Area very good . nice little cove at foot of hotel .10 mins walk into santa ponsa  .plenty of good places to eat and drink.Can feel like Dublin but with sun ha ha.Great…

title: Just OK
review: Rooms are old and tired but clean and bathroom where good, beds on wheels where everywhere and cracks. No wifi but pricey internet at the lobby throug hotels PC's. Terrible restaurant and unacceptable food both brekfast and dinner buffet. Pool area excellent except the bar where everything is served in plastic. Verdict: Miss

title: Just ok
review: Good location for the square but felt this hotel could benefit from an upgrade and although on the whole the staff were OK a few were quite rude and unhelpful. The walls are paper thin or we were unfortunate to get extremely noisy neighbours. Was a cheap break so couldn't expect too much but wouldn't return to this particular hotel would rather pay more in future. Pool area fair but always busy and couldn't get a shaded sun bed very easily.

title: Okay hotel
review: The hotel was located in a good area, close to the beach and shops.  The pool is nice. The nly let down were the waiters at the hotel were not very friendly.  also we had a late flight and were not able to keep our room for longer as they needed the room.  But that is understandable.

title: Family holiday
review: Stayed at this hotel for one week in August. We decided to stay self-catering so we could leave our options open, as a party of 4 adults and 4 kids we needed the freedom to eat when and where we wanted. Check in was nice and easy, reception was friendly and delt with us quickly even though one of the rooms wasn't quite ready. Decided to try the breakfast one morning at 7€ per adult 3.50€ for kids 5-12 under 5 free, can honestly say I was disappointed, go out of the hotel and find a great breakfast across the road. Everything else about the holiday was great, the staff were polite and friendly and the entertainment was ok. The kids pool was a bit to small for the amount of kids in it with inflatables, the large pool didn't have enough depth variation, so kids who were weak…

title: Great holiday
review: Just returned from our two week holiday at the Jardin Del Mar , this was our 3rd year here and was a very enjoyable stay , our room on arrival was ready within 15 minutes even though we were checking in two hours prior to the check in time , our room throughout our stay was kept clean , new towels left at each clean by the cleaning lady who was very pleasant indeed ! All other staff helpful and friendly too !  The appartments are set in a beautiful location , we spent most of our time around the pool , which is also kept spotlessly clean , but the hidden beaches down the slope are stunning and well worth a visit . There are plenty of good places to eat near by , our favourites this year were il Vivo , Mark Anthony's and Tuck In , all reasonably priced and delicious food ! Our…

title: very enjoyable stay
review: I can't believe all of the bad reviews for this place as I found it very good. I stayed there in 2012 & I remember having to run for the sunbeds each morning when the pool opened at 9am.   Before I went this time (last week in August), I read all the reviews & was a bit worried with what people posted. We travelled with another family & arrived at the apartments at around midnight. The staff were very friendly & our rooms were ready for us.   The next day we noticed the floor in the bathroom was wet as there was a leak in the ceiling. I contacted the reception & it was fixed within an hour & they sent a cleaner to clean the mess.   In relation to the pool, yes it opens at 8am & I went down at 7:15am each morning to ensure I got the sunbeds that I wanted as we had small children.…

title: Started bad, but improved.
review: Arrived Sat night at around 11.30pm. Our room wasn't ready ( we had booked a sea view room). We were put in holding cell overnight, very small and dated room, with a balcony overlooking a bush. After complaining we were upgraded to a superior sea view room around 11am on Sunday. We couldn't carry everything in one go, so moved our cases and hand luggage first and about 10 mind later went back to get everything else (food,cereal,butter,teabags, milk,mugs we had taken with us, cheese, ham etc. When we got to the room the cleaner was already in there, even though we hadn't handed the key in yet and had thrown everything in the rubbish. After again complaining they apologised. We had to go shopping again and they refunded us. Things did improve after that.  The new room was lovely…

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: Stayed here in August had read reviews on hotel and was pleasantly surprised . Some of the reviews were negative and unfounded. We stayed half board and found food nice always plentiful and good choice . The views overlooking santa ponsa bay are beautiful and one of the best around . The staff were always helpful and friendly. The hotel would benefit from  modernising . It looks like some rooms have already been done . The rooms are adequate and very clean . They are cleaned  sheets and towels changed regularly . The hotel is close to the square for entertainment every night about a 5 minute walk away about 10-15 minutes from beach. There is a rush for sunbeds from 8 am but that's no different from any other hotel. The pool area is clean and pool side bar is Good for lunch time…

title: Beautiful
review: Stayed here with my wife and two children for a week in August. On arrival I found the hotel to be very clean as was our room. We had a room which overlooked the communal pool and a lovely view of the bay which was stunning. All the staff were more than helpful and the air conditioning was a welcome treat as it was very hot during our stay. We always had clean towels and bed sheets were changed regularly. Will definitely return, well done!!!

title: Nice holiday
review: Stayed here with my husband and son. The hotel is in a great location short walk into the square and about a 15 min walk to the beach if you take the path behind the hotel and follow the coastline. Never ate in hotel prefer to eat /drink out and go to beach. The pool area is busy but there is a lovely cove next to hotel bit pebbley but gorgeous. Rooms are dated but clean and great. Shower was powerful overall a nice holiday

title: A few faults but a great time had
review: Booked through jet2 arrived at 1130 on the 8/08/16 great flight arrived at airport followed signs and eventually located a huddle of reps who directed us to appropriate coach NO rep, looked after by Spanish driver who shouted hotels as we got there needn't have bothered we were last drop off 20 min drive took 1hr 45min Having already paid for a superior room with a sea view on a low floor, was expecting good accomodation. Watch the receptionist search for our room shaking her head she eventually said our room was 709, but not ready til 3.30pm I asked her was it superior room and she said yes. I pointed out that it was to high and I had requested low floor due to fear of heights ,and did it have a wrap around balcony as described.   No room available til Wednesday but would sort…

title: Jardin del Mar
review: Very nice hotel ideal for families. Two grandchildren had a fantastic time and therefore so did the adults. B and b basis which was very good.  The  views from the balcony were stunning pool was well kept whole area was very clean and tidy.  A brilliant time was had by all.

title: Decent hotel.   Better than expected
review: Took the self catering option. Arrived in early hours .  Was directed to the 7th floor .  Room was large and had a great fridge !   Didnt need a toaster.  But just as well.    Pool was great.  Apart from the shananigans of the sunbed run at 08:00.   Never ate at the hotel apart from a few chips my got by the pool .  They were nice though.   We ate breakfast at  arkels and arkels 2.  Very good and reasonable.    Ate out every night and sometimes just went to the square area . Quite a good family area to watch the shows.   Other nights we would head more towards the irish area.  More lively bars and restaurantes.   Did a day trip to palma.  We all realy enjoyed that.   Overall a decent place to stay as a base for all that Santa ponsa has to offer.  Many thanks all staff at the…

title: Mr
review: Excellent location for bars & restaurants, (Arkells across the road😋) great Staff, Jardin outside bar are generous with the liquors & shorts ( Unlike UK) bar food & draft Amstel is great, ( fantastic chips) nice clean rooms & premises, Air con in rooms could be better, noisy at night on reception floor, If you know how to be nice to the staff they are nice to you( not rocket science 😏) Be aware you will not be able to book late check out on your room so its a long day getting home if your on the night flight which is £400 cheaper. ! Don't use the path to the beach nr the hotel it's a health & safety nightmare. Don't use this shop in the photograph there stuff is crap and she won't refund or change it it's behind the hotel on the hill

title: Nice hotel
review: Just back from a week here had stayed here about 10 yrs ago and liked the location so chose it again. I was dreading it after some reviews of overbooking and various other problems but our stay was great. Hotel was basic but clean, staff pleasant. We had a seaview room the view was amazing. We didn't eat in the hotel only the pool bar and the food there was lovely. The sunbed dash was hilarious but I waited until 8am after the doors opened and got a bed no problem. My daughter loved the pool yes it was a bit deep but it didn't stop the kids enjoying it. Only negative points would be not much entertainment in the evening and if you go self catering the kitchen in the rooms are not well equipped but apart from that we enjoyed our stay.

title: lovely place to stay
review: First stay here. Facilities a little basic but staff lovely and place very clean. Entertainers Hector and Ernesto brilliant with the kids. Good spot in santa ponsa near some great places to eat. As usual towels on beds an issue..need to queue up at 8am to get a bed... painful but worth it

title: Great location
review: Great location.Did not have a sea view which was disappointing.Trying to get a sunbed was a nightmare.Nearly got knocked down when the doors opened at 8am for our sunbeds.On arrival the hotel was overbooked so we were transferred to another hotel until the next morning.This was very disappointing as my mom in law who is 83 was not able for the toing and froing.Pedro at the front desk was very nice and helpful.if I was to return I would definitely opt for seaview.Apartments very clean and no shortage of clean towels.

title: Second Visit - no Moans
review: Second time here in 2 years - both in busy August This time had a standard frontal sea view rood (107) which was good for the 4 of us (2 adults , 2 kids 13+12)  Had a superior room with side views last year (120) Standard rood was better in some ways , despite being smaller (but adequate) it had a better view and because the bathroom was in the main room gave better privacy to the bedroom. The gripes from other reviews are noted but if you go prepared with this knowledge then yo will not be disappointed -  1. Food - we did not eat here , apart from the pool bar for snacks which were really good and reasonably priced. 2. Sunbed stampede - OK this is a contentious issue - funny to watch from the balcony but I could not think of another way of organising this without causing bother…

title: Best spot in Santa Ponsa!
review: Really impressed with the hotel! We went half board and always ate well. The rooms are a fair size with great views - ours had a sea view & overlooked the pool. The air con even worked too, so didn't need the fan I took ( after reading some reviews). We thought it was in the best location in Santa Ponsa. For a 3 star hotel at a fair price, you can't complain!

title: Brilliant location!
review: The location of this accommodation is perfect. Brilliant for kids. Food is poor. Indoor pool was closed. Our room was poorly kept but clean enough. Sun loungers were all gone by 8 on a morning! Life guard needs to concentrate more. Lady on reception was really helpful

title: Fantastic views
review: We booked a sea view room and had the most amazing sea views from a 7th floor apartment. Staff were very nice as said before the morning sun bed run is a nightmare and you really will not get a bed unless you queue early. Best meals were at Meson Del Rey which is hidden away but amazingly good with free drinks of your choice at the end They actually put a full bottle of Baileys on the table for us to have as much as we wanted. Our other favourite was Las Olas for fantastic views and setting but pricey. Fabulous cocktails at The Crown in the square. Tried some of the restaurants recommended on Trip Advisor near the apartments and found them very average.

title: stayed here
review: my husband & I stayed here for a week & found it to be a lovely aparthotel.  situated beside a little spanish square with bars & restaurants.  Entertainment most nights on the spanish square while we were there (May time)  Its a long walk to the main beach but there is a private beach just beside the aparthotel, so if you prefer a quiet spot rather than the main beach this is it.  We stayed here self-catering but it also does full board or half-board.

title: Will never visit this hotel again...
review: Do not visit this hotel if you want good customer service (terrible mannered and completely unhelpful day receptionist lady and the majority of other staff are really quite miserable). Dinner was mostly ghastly - especially the homemade desserts... breakfast was ok.  We arrived at 1pm and there wasnt a room ready for us, other guests told us stories of being sent to another hotel for their first night(s) (which was awful, one room had no lighting) due to overbooking. We had to wait over an hour in the reception area for our room, not the best start to our holiday but better than what some other guests had endured.  The room was ok, eventually. It was quite large and clean(ish). It also had a rather large balcony with sunloungers. The hotel isnt in too bad shape. It has a decent…

title: Never again
review: We booked our family holiday in Feb through Onthebeach.com. and had specifically asked for a sea view at this hotel which was on our booking, when we arrived it was late night early morning and as we were given our key and room number and directed to the lift we were to go to zero and our room no was 26, 4floors down from the reception we entered our room, the room was tidy but tiny as we stepped out on to the balcony to have a look at our view we were met with huge hedges in front of us and  to the left of us and to the right. We went to reception to complain and were told the hotel was full to capacity and if I came back in the morning they would see what could be done the staff were so blunt and rude. When I went back the next morning I was told the same. staff were still…

title: Started badly, but this a great place to stay.
review: We arrived for our 10 day family holiday having booked a front sea view. We were given a room looking at a wall!  Straight to reception (both girls who I dealt with at reception were extremely pleasant and very helpful) who said that alpharooms hadn't notified them and they would give us the correct room the next day. And true to their word we were given an excellent front sea view in a room that was also far bigger. This hotel is spotless clean and rooms are kept to a very high standard. Towels and sheets changed every few days. Kettles and toasters are available for hire at reasonable rates. We only ate once at the pool bar and it was also reasonably priced. The hotel has a good sized pool and is situated near a beautiful pebble beach cove and this is a lovely place to spend a…

title: Over booking
review: Where to start, firstly we arrived as a family having booked 4 apartments to find only 2 available. The receptionist was arrogant and ignorant told us to come back in the morning to speak to the manager, we did, the manager would not come to speak to us. We as a family of 14 guests, 12 of us had to sleep in 2 apartments the first night while 2 were sent to a different hotel. Our other apartments became available when people checked out the next day. This was systematic every day of our 2 week stay where guests were waiting at 10 am in the morning to get their room from the previous night. The day we checked out a couple with 2 young kids had been sent to a different hotel the previous night arrived up for breakfast they had paid for to be told, no breakfast for you its too late,…

title: A good place to stay in Santa Ponsa
review: When we arrived, the hotel was overbooked. However they went out of their way to book us a place to sleep and they were very apologetic. We were assisted by Paula who was working at the reception. She is a lovely lady. Paula communicated very well and she made the situation much lighter. The day of departure was a different story. When we asked a different receptionist to call for a taxi, she was very rude. She did not want to help and she does not even wear her name badge. Their food was great with variety and reasonable price

title: Nice hotel and area
review: Booked this break in January with Jet2, and thankfully booked a superior room with sea view option at that time. It was well worth it, we had an 'end' room with a huge balcony overlooking the small cove by the hotel, with fantastic views over Santa Ponsa bay. I don't think we would of been very happy with the 'side sea view' rooms with small balconies, especially the ones facing out onto the high hedge that ran down the side of the hotel!!! Small kitchen, but we only needed the fridge, and we bought our own travel kettle with us.  Hotel reception area was clean and tidy, and helpful reception staff.
