Room wasn't available until 3pm when we arrived (this is hotel policy), so we popped over the road to La Solana restaurant for lunch, very good food & reasonable prices.  Hotel pool…

title: Ok
review: I have just returned from here with my 2 children. It started off badly. Despite booking a package through Thomson, when we arrived we were told our room wasn't ready. We went out for lunch and when we returned we were then told our room wouldn't be ready until the following day! We were put in a 'holding room' that had no self catering facilties, a fridge that didn't work, very ineffective air con, no balcony and no view! We were compensated with a free drink from the pool bar, free breakfast and dinner for the first day and free WiFi for a week. I made up my mind there and then that I hated the place and that the holiday was going to be a disaster, however when you travel with children who are just happy to be on holiday, it's very easy to be influenced by them, and actually…

title: Overbooking major problem
review: We arrived at 3am with 2 children the youngest been 3 to be told they had no room for us despite booking the holiday in March! After initially refusing to leave in a taxi it was apparent after one hour we would be sat in reception all night if we did nt agree to go! We were sent in a 15 min taxi ride to an apartment at the other side of the resort with all our luggage pram etc and told to get a taxi back in the morning.  We returning at 10.15am we still had no room until after lunch and were told we could not have breakfast (we had paid for half board) as it had finished! Hotel refused to give us an compensation! When we did finally get a room it was pleasant spacious had a handy kitchenette fridge etc and the most stunning view imaginable. I found I could generally get sun beds…

title: "Okay"
review: Me and my family came here for a holiday and I was okay I guess and there was a good atmosphere but the staff were rude and this wasn't what I was expecting...I think the worst thing about the hotel was having to wake up about 7:30am to get a subbed but then you had to que and then fight for a sunbed you want and it wasn't easy for a big group...the hotel it's self was good because they supplied you with a hair dryer,a games room,indoor pool,gym,salon,baggage room for when you arrive and leave and it was very convenient because it was across the road from 3 cafes and a restaurant but then you walked 2 minutes down the road and there were 10+ and then there was the square were there was different entertainment every night such as :Take that tribute,singers and musicals...at the…

title: Hotel basic but clean
review: We stayed the first two weeks in August. Check in was slow but pleasant. First impression of room wasn't good, the kitchen was very basic but we only use the fridge so it was fine.  The rooms were clean and the cleaner was always pleasant and changed towels everyday if left in bath.  The view was stunning. We avoided the pool area because we had read about the sunbed situation-it was on par with a 'Black Friday sale'!!  There is a pool just passed the beach,no beds but we purchased lilos and if you buy from the bar you can use for free. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. Unfortunately for us we were next to a family that had little control over their kids and enjoyed smoking weed and arguing in the early hours!! It is noisy at night too,some people have…

title: What you need to know......
review: We have just come back from a week at the Jardin Del Mar. Having read the reviews we were expecting the worst. But its not as bad as some people say once your settled in. We did experience  over booking. Some people were sent to a different hotel. Many people were put in wrong rooms for the 1st night and moved to the correct to room and compensated (if you ask for it) with free use of a safe or meals for the 1st day. We negotiated free wifi (yes you have to pay otherwise) so the bad bits  Yes room beds are extremely hard and pretty uncomfortable and sun beds are indeed a 8am fun run to get what you want. See you tube for some films of it all. People watch the race from balconies and film the antics on their phones. There are single beds dotted around that you can group together…

title: Poor poor poor
review: Firstly I would like to state that I am not someone who often writes reviews but felt the need to do my best to stop people booking this hotel. Firstly the rooms are smelly and the decor is ancient to say the least it really is terrible. Secondly the swimming pool is an absolutely joke it has a tiny area for small children which means if your child wants to go into the pool they must stand like sardines no space at all, the other pool is far too deep for children so that ruled out the pool area for my children's holiday. Look up the sunbed dash at this hotel on YouTube it really is that bad, you don't expect to have to set an alarm to get a space at pool on your holiday another reason why we didn't use it! The food was well below average very little choice and very repetitive!…

title: Sun bed fights
review: Me and my 2 best friends have just come back from a week in this hotel after wanting a girly holiday. Well, what can I say, the hotel was awful!! We aren't snobby types and we not expecting 5 star luxury by any means but from the moment we arrived  it was a disappointment! We arrived at about midday and were initially told our room was not ready until  2. Although slightly annoying we were fine with this as obviously the cleaners needed time and we were happy to just nip out for some lunch, however, when we returned back to the hotel we were told our room would  not be available until the following day. Throughout our entire stay we also overheard this exact situation happening with  other  families 3 times! We were offered one breakfast and dinner each for compensation which we…

title: Great holiday
review: Well what can I say, we had a great stay, check in was easy and the staff where fab can't say a bad word, they where friendly and very helpful.  We stayed self catering but we did try the buffet and it was OK but you had lots of choice and for a family of 3 it was 27 euros. We found you had a better choice of food going into the town which was a 10 minute walk.  The only bad thing and everyone has said this you can't get a sun lounger but mid afternoon you will find one. You must get a sea view. We will be staying again.

title: Lovely location
review: Hotel is in a good location near square shops and restaurants. Everything can be reached in 15_20 mins by walking. Didn't need taxi. Staff friendly and room was always cleaned and clean towels when we asked never a problem. Pool area spotless  . Now the downside....everyone's rooms seemed to be double booked meaning you spent your first night in another room. Some families were moved to another hotel. Sunbeds....The only holiday were I've had to set my alarm for 7am...yes it's true you do have to queue for an hour ! We all liked santa ponsa as we were on holiday for the sun and not culture. Lots of big families go this hotel and most are respectful but there's always one who like to let their presence be known ! However all the kids were having a great time. Would I go…

title: Hotel fine...Santa Ponsa not so fine...!
review: Stayed here with 3 kids...clean, well equipped rooms. VERY noisy after 11pm. This hotel is in the best part of Santa Ponsa at the top where its not as noisy or crowded as the bottom part....The hotel is near the bustling square, which is good for entertaining the kids as there was no entertainment for them at the hotel. Pool OK. kids section where kids could play with inflatables was FAR too small and good luck getting a sunbed. People go down armed with towels at 8am then never use the sunbed until after lunch....I just sat on one of the empty beds and not once did anybody come back to use it before 1pm..!!! 20 minute walk down hill past the Irish/English themed bars to the beach which is fine and typical of what you'd expect in Majorca (ie) sunbed hire, pedalos etc.....  I…

title: Jardin Del Mar
review: Staff helpfull,rooms clean although the self catering appts are very poorly equipped,no toaster,iron or microwave and two hot plates that take forever to work.The Wifi is 6 euros per day and reception very poor while we were there.The views are the main selling point of this hotel and they are fabulous,if you are going to stay here you must book a front sea view.Would i stay here again,probably.

title: what is all the moaning about?
review: sorry to start like this but.... Dont go to Santa Ponsa if you arent prepared to slum it a little.....     This 3* is not a fantastic hotel and to be honest it lacks entertainment, decent beds and better food BUT     It is clean enough, and in good enough nick and arguably in the best location in Santa Ponsa.   for the money we spent for a weeks stay i cant complain, yes the beds squeaked and the kitchenette is from circa 5th century and there are safes in the room which you cant rent but this is a 3 star hotel in a 2 star resort.   santa ponsa is a resort in spain for those who want absolutely nothing spanish to get in the way of a drinking sesh in the sun. It is a resort where every restaurant is a pizza and burger bar first and foremost so if you go self catering i hope you…

title: Not the Thomson standard at all!
review: Very disappointed with the room, need updating and  not clean. 2 weeks the beds were never changed. Never cleaned. Had to pay for everything as we were supposed to be self catering, kettle toaster and iron, these are basic things that you would normally get. WiFi you have to pay! Not free please  don't be fooled. No entertainment! That's why we booked as we have 2 children. Fantastic views from our balcony. We were put in a different room on our first night and speaking to many other families they had the same problem. Not Thomson standard at all!

title: NO FREE WIFI
review: Please note - despite advertising as such, this hotel does not provide Free Wi-Fi. It costs €2 per hour PER DEVICE, or €24 per week per device.  If you are a family of 4 this could add €100-€200 to the cost of your trip.  In general, the rooms are very clean (if in need of a little TLC in places) and hotel and the grounds are serviced very well.  The cleaning, maintenance and pool staff are friendly and very professional.  Some of the reception staff are also helpful.  However, the 2 ladies at reception are extremely rude and evasive.  The older gentleman on reception - possibly the manager? - was also rude, dismissive and unhelpful.

title: Basic..
review: You literally have to pay for everything in this hotel,kettle,toaster,iron,wifi nobody should have to pay for these things as the rooms are expensive enough they should be provided with these items,says it has a gym which i got the key too i got weak when i walked into the gym they have two bikes & a cross trainer that's it no weights nothing that's false advertisement that's not a gym,four times i had to go asking for towels&toilet roll cleaner did not knock once for first 5/6 days was very disappointed with that,other then that room was nice & the pool area was nice it looks right onto the sea....

title: Nice hotel shame about beds
review: We found this hotel great nice clean rooms nice big pool the only downfall was the sun bed situation you had to be down to que for a sun bed for 8 am and the que starts around 7.20 am if you don't que for a bed the chances are you will never get one as soon as the door open at 8 am every one starts running like a January sale crazy !! The food was great I wasn't expecting the food to be any good when reading some reviews before I went but I found it better then most restaurants on the resort I would stay here again if the sun bed issue was resolved infact I think there is a YouTube video of this so funny I was shocked

title: Clean hotel very noisy
review: Hotel is very clean, but we booked this hotel for the kids club and full entertainment package, which there was neither, it is a battle everyday to secure a sunbed  you need to queue in a locked lobby from 7 am for an hour before pool,area opens, the kids are not allowed any inflatables in the pool you see mountains of new unused ones everyday,the food is not very appealing, and the staff are very rude, especially the reception manager who received lots of complaints during my two week holiday.we seen lots of guests arriving who where told they had to stay at another hotel due to over bookings, these people where being put into seedy, dirty, hotels described by some as looking like crack dens , we experienced other guests fighting and arguing in the corridor during the night,…

title: over booked on arrival
review: as arriving at this hotel on the 18th of july 2016 we were told there had being no room made available for me and my two children and we booked it in January after a long argument with staff i was given a room in the basement also could not be moved for three days other down sides staff have bad manors pools well over crowded and no sun beds to use fights to get in for breakfast this is a shocking hotel and there is so much more out there for your money i wont be back

title: Basic but good
review: We picked this hotel due to it being close to the square which it was!! Rooms are clean but basic exactly what you would expect from a budget hotel in Spain.  Pull not very big but does the job. You have to queue at 8am to get sun loungers which is pretty ridiculous !!!   Didn't eat at the restaurant so can't comment on the food.

title: TRH Jardin del Mar 3* accomadation with 2* clientte
review: Well were do we start, to set some context my daughters had been here 3 years ago and had a alright stay, but its wasn't all smooth sailing, firstly their room wasn't available until the following morning and then there was insufficient sub beds available so spent their time on the main beach. I said well that was 3 years ago things would have improved. However they had not,   upon our arrival (18July 2016) we (myself, Dad and my two daughter 16yrs and 19 yrs) we advised our room wasn't available as the hotel was over booked and the room if available wouldn't be until the following day so we were transferred to the DEYA in the main area and this is a 18yrs to 20yrs something apartment block as it was the only place with rooms available. we were one of six family's to be…

title: Staff were so rude!
review: This was my first visit to this hotel and will definitely be my last. My husband and I didn't choose this hotel, we were part of a large group attending a wedding nearby and went we the majority.  I found the staff at this hotel to be really rude and unhelpful, one member of staff actually physically pushed my 9 year old niece out of her way rather than saying excuse me and giving her chance to move out of the way, when we co planned to her she gave us a round of abuse in Spanish throwing her hands up in the air ! The rooms are very basic, it's classed as self catering yet you have to hire a toaster  and a kettle, these items should be included surely ! In the two weeks we stayed there we hardly had any sleep due to how noisy the hotel was at night and I other members of our…

title: A honest review of this hotel
review: Like lots of others I was worried about what I would find after reading other reviews I was delighted by everything about this place. Room was spotless maid service daily . Fresh towels and sheets every 3 days. Views amazing !!!only worry is the pool is very deep luckily we had a life reserve 4our young boy and life guard is always on duty. As 4 complaints about staff I watched them field complaint after complaint over silly things and they kept their cool. They where always friendly and polite 2 us. My advice stop looking 4things to find fault with and enjoy an amazing holiday

title: We just love Santa Ponsa
review: We are only back and really enjoyed our stay I was a wee bit iffy after reading the reviews but had a great time. Only thing that was disappointing was that there was no entertainment, but would go back again.

title: TRH jardin del Mar
review: A large group of us stayed here 1st July till the 15th was a bit sceptical after reading some of the reports on here but we had a fantastic stay excellent location all the staff were really friendly and helpful so good in fact when we got home we booked it for another 2 weeks next year would have been good to have some entertainment for the kids during the day or evening but all in all a great stay and can't wait to be back again next year

title: Worst hotel ever! Basic one star hotel
review: Worst hotel ever stayed in. The most rude staff ever particularly reception staff. Few reception staff didnt speak English in a hotel where 90% of guests are English speaking. Extremely unhelpful and unfriendly. Air con is awful. Kitchen tiny with only a hob and fridge. Must pay extra for toaster kettle iron etc. Wifi isnt free. You must pay 6 euro a day for one device and wifi is not great. No sunbeds unless you queue for 7. Absolutely no entertainment. Asked for a quiet room and lower apartment as had toddler with me. Was given a room on fourth floor around rowdy drinking argumentative young ones. Towels changed once in a week with four towels for four people. Simply not good enough. Sheets changed once a week. Kitchen was dirty when we arrived and damp smell in bedroom. Too…

title: not a hotel
review: This hotel is not a hotel but a self catering apartment block and is set up as such. You do not get maid service or clean towels everyday. Pool is deep, although there is a small children's pool. You have to be down at first light to get a sun bed, even although most lie with towels on them all day but no one uses them, staff should not allow this.

title: Booked through lowcostholodays
review: We booked the accommodation through low cost holidays , we were given a booking reference number ,  On finding out low cost had gone into liquidation I contacted the hotel straight away with our reservation number to make another payment via credit card. I was told to call back in 30 mins which I did and each time had the phone slammed down on me.  We were contacted 3 days later and told that our room had been resold on the 19th and I'm saddened to say that this was at a greater rate and fear that rather than offering an alternate method of payment to family's flying out to there accommodation , sold at double the price to customers desperately needing accommodation.   Shame as despite reviews hotel does look nice, just a shame profit comes before good customer service.

title: Fantastic holiday
review: Please ignore the negative comments...  I was very unsure about the jardin del mar from reading some of the comments on this but, rest a sure you will not be disappointed. We arrived last Wednesday evening due to our flights being delayed 😢😢 our frontal sea view apartment that we had booked wasn't ready so we had to stay in a side view room for a night. We were dealing with Pedro and he was very apologetic about this and offered us a voucher for free breakfast and dinner. We went down the next morning and our room was ready and all I can say is WOW the views are just amazing. Would definitely recommend you book a frontal sea view room.  We ate in the restaurant one morning and we didn't find the food great but, if that's my only complaint I have little to be giving out about.…

title: Poor
review: Nice clean but zero entertainment (was advertised ).  Kids club advertised it didn't exist    Lovely pool but no built in steps only steel steps very hard to get out of pool Food ok.   Bar staff good reception staff appauling.

title: Lovely Hotel.. our 4th time back here...
review: Just returned from Santa Ponsa.     True review... dont worry about the negative reviews...   We arrived and our sea view room wasnt ready...ao they gave us another room and we had to recheck into our correct room the next morning... not really an issue they compensated us by giving us free breakfast and free dinner voucher. In the morning the lovely receptionist told us that our room was nearly ready and they had only put us in one of our there superior Rooms...  Omg Wow Amazing... if your staying here it is so worth it. The views are stunning from the balcony... late night chill out and watching the sun rise over the ocean. .. bliss  Great variety of iteams for breakfast. Toast. Cereal, croissant, yogurt, fruit, bacon egg soft ir boiled.. fresh bread rolls. Etc... i would…

title: Sun bed nightmare !!!
review: Hotel is clean enough. Rooms fairly small. Kitchen not great no oven and you had to hire toaster & kettle. Hotel is more suited to young couple not families. Nothing for kids (8yrs & 10yrs) really to do. But the worst thing is the sunbeds you had to set your alarm to be up at 8 to try and get beds. Worst thing ever. YouTube video of it. Unfortunately we won't be returning

title: Fell in love with the views -not so much the hotel!
review: The views as others have said are fabulous from this hotel,the location is ideal for exploring its really central for the beach,bars,shops etc.The hotel could be great but it lets itself down the air con is useless they offer to hire fans for 10 euros a week but they didn't have any left kettles and toasters are the same price, all adds up! By the pool the usual notices it states no reserving sunbeds but of course ,this is totally ignored you wouldn't mind if people were actually using them but at least half were constantly empty all day! you carnt really blame people but the management should simply remove the towells that way everyones got a sunbed simple!!Beds OMG we slept in the lounge as we couldnt let the kids sleep on what was only a step up from lying on the floor the…

title: Okay not great
review: Just back tonight from Jardin del mar. Rooms are not the best decor could do with an upgrade we paid 1500 for the room alone so to be honest we were let down with it. Bathroom was shabby I actually cleaned it before I used it. We should have had four beds when we arrived and low and behold only 3 as it was in the early hours of the morning the man at the desk done his best and got us another within the hour so all good pool area was crowded and full of very argumentative people shouting and bawling at their kids. Had several trips with my two sons and wife on the boats and waterparks. Would maybe go back to Majorca another area as there is better value for money elsewhere.

title: Good hotel
review: Just back from a week at jardin del mar. Location and pool area are great, rooms are slightly dated but have everything you need, you get what you pay for so this is a typical 3 star hotel. Overall good hotel and would stay again, be prepared so get up early in order to get a sunbed tho!

title: Great location!
review: Can't fault the location as it was pretty close to everything. Some really nice bars and restaurants just outside the hotel and it is only a 10 minute walk to the beach and Santa Ponsa strip. Also taxi stand just around the corner if you want to go into Magaluf for the night which costs 10 euros. Rooms are quite basic and small but were clean as the maids cleaned everyday. I advise upgrading to a sea view room as it was amazing! There is the sun bed rush in the morning with people queuing from 8 am, but this didn't bother us as we spent most of our time at the beach. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat there but drinks are quite expensive. Also there wasn't really much happening in the hotel as it was quite dead with no entertainment at night. Overall we had a nice stay…

title: Santa Ponsa July 2016
review: I was a bit nervous about staying in the hotel following all the negative reviews, but the hotel was lovely, great pool.  Didn't try the food as we ate out every night, I don't think the restaurant was ever full which is a shame.  Would definitely go back.

title: Lovely Hotel but Terrible Food
review: This is a lovely hotel with a fantastic pool.  We didn't stay her, but on recommendation from friends (who were there a few years ago) we had Buffet Dinner which was dreadful.  All the food tasted the same and there was zero atmosphere

title: Great location
review: Decent hotel, great location, breakfast was lovely. Clean rooms, fresh towels, only bad thing was the sunbed race at 8am when staff opened doors the desperadoes sprinted like usain bolt for sun loungers.'comedy gold ' plenty sun loungers available in adults only section away from pool

title: Girls Holiday
review: This hotel was perfect for our first girls holiday. We wanted a location where there was a good night life in the town itself as well as being close enough to magaluf that there was the option of going in to the maga strip as well. We ended up loving santa ponsa night life as well as Magaluf. In Santa Ponsa, everyone goes to 'Manhattans' or 'green hills', both great nights with free entry but you pay for your drinks. (most people buy drink from the supermarkets and pre drink as it is so cheap). In magaluf, we got the 'Magaluf Club Pass' for $35 where you get entry to 4 clubs and a free bar in every one of them. All of them great; if you don't like one, you just move on to another. Well worth it and try and haggle with reps to get best deals, ie 5 euro off or VIP area. It seems…

title: Good situation
review: Would not rate it for self catering took 1hour to get a coffee no handle or slip mat in bath/Shower could be dangerous however on request i got a mat very quickly apart from these small difficulties i had a nice room on the 7th floor with sea view which made my holiday

title: Holiday
review: Stayed here for two weeks and I really did enjoy it. Staff at reception very helpful and friendly. We had a room with a sea view and boy what a view . Apartment very clean and towels changed five times a week. Good sized swimming pool and and plenty of space for sunbeds. It was just 5 minutes walk to the square were there is entertainment every night also plenty of bars and restaurants  About 15 mins walk to the centre were all the shops are and about 10 mins to the beach. Would I go back yes

title: Been
review: Good hotel whent end of june,sea view a must otherwise no point going.its good hotel going to waste because of no entertainment at night,I suppose it's because the square is only 2 mins away ,sunbed usual problem doors open at 8am mad rush people put towels down come back 3 hours later.good room sea view ,seen side view rooms not much of sea more like wall and trees .yes I would return but defo get sea view..

title: not the best hotel
review: booked side view sea room which was, albeit very much in the distance.  Room 23 on ground floor balcony looks onto a wall with greenery. Room in much need of upgrade, cracked and marked floor tiles, torn curtains.  Towels changed a couple of days through week but no actual cleaning of bath/toilet.  Very difficult trying to get a sunbed after 9am as all booked with towels. Breakfast ok something to suit everyone but not great choice.

title: Very nice stay.
review: Firstly I was a little concerned reading some reviews and I need not have been.  The hotel reception is very frendly and informative check in time is 3 but you may be lucky if your room is ready as ours was you get in early. The room was basic yes but has all you would need it could do with been done up that is not in question but we stayed for 12 night's and we're happy enough good space for 2 a little snug for any more  kitchen good but we did not cook in room just made snacks no kettle/toaster have to be hired for 10 euro per the fridge was big and worked well bathroom was nice very powerful shower. The view from the room was fantastic!!!!! worth the few negatives I would recommend you upgrade to a sea view!!  WiFi is not free but available as is a safe 15 euro per week air…

title: Ants
review: Was there for 4 days,long enough,there were ants in the kitchen and on dining table,when I told the maid she handed me an aerosol ant killer.Difficult to get a sunbed after10 o'clock mostly occupied by towels.

title: Very poor standard of accommodation
review: Hotel facilities not as advertised-gym equipment almost non existent. Indoor pool and sauna unavailable. No wifi in room. Inoperative air conditioning, with poor standard of decor. Twin beds only. No housekeeping service at weekend, fresh towels unavailable.

title: brilliant views over the bay
review: just got back from a 9 night stay 20th-29th june what fantastic views of beautiful bay. ask for a sea view. hotel needs a little bit of a revamp. but above, caters for the room room cleaned every other day also towels changed daily. only stopped bed and breakfast. breakfast very good choices and nicely presented. pool bar good quality food and good prices especially if you have children. swimming pool was quiet warm. night time go to the square where you have 2 hours free entertainment. plenty of resturants by hotel reasonable prices have a nice holiday,myself and partner did sit on the balconey,take in the med..

title: very good
review: room was clean tidy  bed room, kitchen area  room with sofa table  and chairs kitchen had a good size  fridge 2 hot plate cooker plenty of cutlery steam kettle  which took 20 mins to boil  but you can hire a electric kettle and toaster for 10 euros each per week but for us as a couple  who were never much in room it was ok

title: Great value in a great location
review: Just returned after a 9 night stay and I can't complain.  Comfortable room,  good food,  very friendly staff and a great location just minutes from the beach make this a great place to book.  You won't be disappointed.

title: Great spot
review: We stayed here for 12 days and all I can say is perfect! Took my 2 year old and hubby. Yes the Rooms are small but we knew this before we went on the holiday , they provided us with a clean cot and bankets on arrival,our view was a nice sea view. Staff where so nice and helped my every need, pool area was nice and clean with a play area right beside pool bar which was handy , only thing is you will have to go to pool at 8;30am to put your towls down as they filled up fast.  Shops and restaurants at front door and a walk into Santa ponsa but sometimes we got a taxi back as there is a steep hill but taxi is only €3.50. I will definitely return to this hotel as I loved it and my son enjoyed himself a lot also.

title: Trh jardin santa ponsa
review: Trh jardin is very dated very basic inside with no apeal the outside of the hotel looked lovely very disapointing inside and old inside .Lots of noise could be heard in the rooms surrounding.We asked to change rooms and got the same room but the views were fantastic on the 5th floor.What it was advertised has on the site was nothing like the pictures . Sauna wasnt working indoor pool was blocked off and to top it off the gym consisted of one old cross trainer and 2 old bikes and for me and my partner it was important to book a hotel with gym which this hotel was stated has having. The cooker in the room was so old all the numbers on the dials couldnt be seen .The hotel would only issue us with one keyfob which once you went out of the room switched all the electrics off so…

title: Holidays :-)
review: Good hotel. Stayed there for a week and liked it. We had a room on the top floor with stunning sea view. Self catering - we did not cook but there were: a kettle, pans, plates, cups, cutlery etc. Hotel swimming pool: true - lots of people put towels on the sunbeds in the morning to "reserve" them for later.  Lots of restaurants and shops close to the hotel - everybody speaks English and German. There is a taxi rank and a small bus stop (the bus runs few times per day) about 3 minutes from the hotel. However the main bus stop (for bus no 102 to Palma which runs very often during the day) and the main beach are in the city centre about 15 min away (on foot).   Mallorca is worth discovering: the hotel offers lots of excursion and all of them are also possible with public transport.…

title: Nice view and stuff, that's all
review: We had a room with sea view, that was great. Room wasn't. Everything was very old, worn... Example curtains was repaired by tape. Soundproofing was terrible, we couldn't sleep without earmuffs. Stuff was very friedly and cheerful. Location was very nice and there was many restaurants and markets just outside the hotel. Pool area was full in the afternoon, so take your place early in the morning.

title: Great hotel for a visit
review: Have just returned from a weeks family holiday in this hotel and I can't fault it at all.  We've stayed in Mallorca a number of times and this is one of the few hotels we've said we'd definitely book again.  The hotel is in a great location, only a 10 minute walk from the centre of Santa Ponsa but with plenty of local entertainment and restaurants nearby if you don't fancy a walk.  The hotel itself is spotlessly clean.  The rooms are quite small - a family of 4 will need to use a couch and fold out bed but we knew this in advance so no issues there. The room was cleaned 5 out of 7 days with towels refreshed every two days.  We had a pool/sea view apartment with fabulous views over the bay.  The hotel has a large restaurant and although we never used it i heard the food was good.…

title: no interest in there guests
review: stayed at this hotel 2 years in a row and everything went fine. However went back in June and what a change. We checked in a 9.30am, did not expect our room to be ready but still not ready at 3.30pm that day. The receptionist gave us keys to two rooms to go and check were they cleaned, never will go back there again. We asked for beach front for our other family members and were given a room on the side and the view was a palm tree, got the beachfront view after complaining.Our last day two people had there passport stolen from the safe and the reception could not wait to get them out the door, no help what so ever were given to the couple. will not go back,

title: Good holiday
review: We arrived late Saturday Night and our room was occupied therefore we where given the annex with no sea view. We got a sea view room at 2.00 pm the next day. In compensation we and our friends have received free breakfast for a week. The staff are friendly and the maids are willing to help. Great pool and stunning views with sightings of regular ships. Hairdryer in rooms and great powerful shower. Just round the corner from tuck inn which does fab food 😀

title: Loved it!
review: I,d read a couple of bad reviews but we loved hotel. Sea view premium room was great. Spotless, sun loungers on a double balcony, comfortable.  Staff were friendly and the hotel is in s good location with a good pool area too.

title: A week in Santa Ponsa, exploring a different side of the island
review: Just returned today from a week at this hotel with my daughter. We wanted a cheap-ish week away in apart of the island we hadn't visited before. After an awful transfer (nearly 2 hours!) we arrived at 1.30am, staff helpful on reception. We had a side sea view apartment which was adequate for our needs, no kettle or toaster in room, just two electric rings, ours fused the electrics as soon as I switched it on,prompt service to fix though. Air condition quite weak, and safety deposit box not available in the room, sited in reception area. ( not happy about that). We weren't able to hire a toaster as none available, room clean and plenty of hangers in wardrobe, spacious bathroom/shower. The pool area is lovely with plenty of loungers, unfortunately as usual, these were saved by…

title: Holiday
review: excellent hotel great food excellent service.very friendly staff been to this hotel 4 times just keep getting drawn back here as i have got to know the staff over the years.would highly recommend this hotel

title: Loved it
review: Would highly recommend, hotel was perfect location especially for family. It's a 10min walk to beach but the pool is perfect so no really drama of you don't fancy beach. Hotel is really clean, was slightly noisy at night when people were coming home but as your on holiday it's not a major problem. Staff were great and there was a young girl who was in charge of entertainment for kids and my 5 year old loved her. Didn't sample food apart from one pizza and its was great. We would book again

title: Poor Customer Service
review: Not the best start, arrived early for check in and the reception staff advised check in is at 3pm but might be able to get into room at 1:30pm, we asked if they had a store for our luggage and a place we could change as we had a 2 year old child with us, reception offered a key for a luggage store and sent us to a toilet to change, when we arrived back at 13:30 reception staff very dismissive and showed no interest in helping, other guests also trying to check in at this time who received the same attitude, we asked to speak with a manager and were told she was the manager, eventually did get a key and upgraded to a sea view room.    That evening I opened the door to the fridge within kitchenette area of room only for a lot of water to flood out causing me to fall.  No door on…

title: Loved it!
review: We were self catering at this hotel so don't know what the food was like but we absolutely loved it here. The view from our balcony was amazing couldn't of asked for better. The cleaners were very friendly and done a good job, the staff at reception were also polite. Pool area was good always got a sun bed. The only thing I would say is that the pool probably wasn't the cleanest but not bad enough that you wouldn't get in. I would definitely come back to this hotel if I come back to Santa ponsa. We were right opposite a couple of supermarkets and we were out the way from the noise of the bars. It was aprox a 15 min walk to the beach but it's a nice walk because you pass the hotdog stand and ice creams and crepes etc so it's an enjoyable walk.

title: what aplace
review: Excellent hotel  rooms excellent  cleaning staff excellent  hotel  reception staff excellent  Esther and Sandra in particular  bar food and drinks excellent  great family hotel  this hotel is great for families and  best value in Santa ponsa  I know I stayed there about 10 times

title: Great Stay made even better by George!
review: After a disastrous booking with Airbnb and false advertising we had to book into Jardin del Mar as we had no where else to stay on our hols in Santa Ponsa and everywhere within our budget was fully booked.    When we arrived at Jardin del Mar, we were greeted with such a warm arrival by the receptionist George who immediately made both me and my husband feel much more relaxed than we had been feeling. George was very friendly without ever being intrusive or false and was incredibly kind and even had enquired how I was feeling when I had been very ill. He was very accommodating and even went out of his way when we had problems with our online check-in. He really is an incredibly great asset to the hotel. The hotel isn't modern, I don't think this remotely matters though and…

title: Good location, would recommend !
review: I would recommend because of the amazing location, unlike places such as magaluff.. Santa ponsa is ideal for families or young couples or any couples ! The quiet comfortable pool area is lovely with a nice bar that serves great food in the outside part. DO NOT GO FULL BOARD .. Me and my boyfriend are 17/18 and we paid for breakfast and lunch and had to eat out for dinner most nights. Rooms are average, clean but had a bit of an ant problem ( room 231 side sea view) staff were pleasant. The hotel is more of a 2 and a half star no where near a 3.7 but we did really enjoy the stay because of the location ... Has beautiful views and close to everything such as beach and shops and taxi rank is right outside the hotel

title: 2 rooms
review: We booked self catering and although limited resources we managed, room 605 stank of stale cigarette smoke, the bins forgot to be emptied, but room 606 was a large room offering the extra space needed for a family of 6. Over an hour wait to check in due to a large party, reasonable upgrade to full board as kids half price and under 6 free, but food bland and repetitive.

title: Great location
review: Like many others I was apprehensive staying here reading some reviews but honesty some people moan about everything. I didn't pay a lot for a 1 bed sea view app for 8 nights so I wasn't expecting the luxury and mod cons of a 5star and u shouldn't, otherwise book at the fergus down the road! The view was amazing and the location was fantastic. Room was basic but clean. Would stay again as great value for money. Didn't eat there so cannot comment on food.

title: Excellent Location
review: Lovely location, the terrace is so relaxing.  The Buffet is only fantastic & is open to non residents, the cost is E11 pp & water is E2 per bottle, this includes soup & bread, salad bar - marvelous selection, Paella, fish, meats, 2 varieties of potatoes & fantastic choice of mouthwatering deserts, crisp white tablecloths & napkins.

title: Great location...shame about the rooms...
review: We have stayed at this hotel three times now,some of the the rooms are in need of a serious update,damp on ceiling,very uncomfy bed/sofa,old fashioned..We really cant fault the cleaning staff though,they were in everyday except thurs and Sunday to cahnge towels etc..The staff were very helpful and friendly..It is in perfect location to the square and Arkles round the corner serves great breakfasts!..

title: Great location, great value!
review: We stayed here for 6 nights over the Bank Holiday, booking very last minute.  We got a great deal, 1 bed apartment for just £58 a night with breakfast.  The hotel is located right around the corner from the main square which provides entertainment in the summer season.  There are endless bars and restaurant nearby, and lots of shops (mostly tourist stuff).  The room was fine, the main issue for the summer would be the air conditioning wasn't great, almost totally ineffective so we left the windows and balcony door open, it was reasonably safe to do this.  The bed was quite hard but the place was spotlessly clean.  The kitchen wasn't up to much as the hot plates didn't work, but the fridge was a good size and worked very well.  If I was coming again I would bring a travel kettle.…

title: Wouldnt return to this hotel
review: Booked sea view room ... As advertised on website. Arrived to an inland room ... And had to pay to move. Staff other than cleaners were very unfriendly.  Although we didn't pay a lot for 3 nights stay ... Service was not as good as we experienced a number of years ago! Wouldn't recommend!

title: Best option for the price, a great place if you're budget traveler
review: We really enjoyed our stay at TRH Jardin del Mar.  First, great location!  You could not be any closer to the main square, restaurants, pubs, shopping.  Short walk to everything.  Second, the view!  You must upgrade to the bay/water view rooms!  So worth it.  I only paid 50-55 euros per night for these amazing views!  What a steal!  The pool was good.  My only complaint is the the front desk service was pretty lousy.  Problem at check in with them not having our reservation.  We had printed a confirmation, but they did not have it.  Hopefully they stop losing reservations, and start giving guests better service.  But we decided to overlook this, and focused on our great views of the Mediterranean, and our awesome location! The room was good as well, for what you pay.  Great…

title: Very happy
review: We had read a few reviews prior to going to stay here some good some bad. Safe to say each to their own but we had a clean and tidy self catering room with a sea view. I can't comment much on the practicalities of cooking in the well equipped kitchen as we ate out every day.  The room was light and airy with tidy decor, good bed and good shower. There is a seating area and dining table, TV had basic English TV channels (itv 1,2,3,4 BBC 1,2). Small balcony with seats and a small table  The pools are good,  small indoor pool and larger unheated outdoor pool. There is a small Cove with a pebble beach within a five minute stroll,  access is not easy. The staff are friendly and helpful throughout our stay. There are a wide variety of restaurants within easy walking distance and to…

title: Lovely stay
review: I really enjoyed our stay in hotel..the staff were very friendly and helpful..I only ate once in snack bar near pool and it was lovely good big portions..it is a ten minute walk from Santa Ponsa but a enjoyable walk there is a walk along back of hotel aswell which is a little quicker...the apartments are basic but all you do is sleep in it..there is entertainment during the day for kids which my daughter who is 4 and a half loved the girl that does it Lula is her name is very good with kids Emma grow very fond of her..the only downside was the pool was freezing cold but it didn't stop us going in it was May I'm sure it would get warmer as summer goes on...

title: Hotel
review: Very old fashioned rooms very small & not well equipped no toaster or electrical kettle asked and paid for sea view it was terrible could only see the sea from a small side view .was not at all big enough for 33 people I being a child

title: Nothing to write home about
review: The hotel was mediocre, nicer than some but better places can definitely be found. We had a self catering unit which although did the job, wasn't aesthetically the most pleasing thing you will see in your life. Minute kitchen area circa late 18th century complete with an iron pot to boil water in, bathroom was slightly nicer and the basic sleeping areas served their purpose. Cute little terrace overlooking a car park with a peek of sea view if you stretched out far enough risking falling onto the concrete below. The 'beach' is just a load of pebbles, there's a nicer one around the corner about 15 mins walk away. The pool areas are nice looking but didn't get to try them, nor did we try the restaurant so can't comment. The service, as above, mediocre. Nobody went out of their way…

title: recommened
review: Myself and my husaband had a 3 night stay here on 27th april 2016.We hired a car and it took us about 35minutes from the airport to get here with the roads being easy to drive on and the directions were easy to follow.There is no car park at the hotel but plenty of free parking around it. The receptionist that greeted us was smiley and helpful and gave us a map of the area and explained how to get to the beach and the centre.We were able to check straight in although it was supposed to be 3pm but I think because it was out of season the hotel wasn't that full. there is a lift to all floors, we were on the 7th floor with fantastic sea views. We had booked a studio but they are one bedroomed apartments which was even better. a small kitchen area with fridge two plate hob and there…

title: decent hotel
review: we didn't have a problem staying at this hotel, room was clean and the cleaners where in every other day if not every day - staff are pleasant and its in a good location about 5/10 mins walk away from the main strip.  it has an amazing out look from the pool but good luck getting a sun lounger that was the worst part about this hotel and like most these days. you have people who rush out at the crack of dawn place towels down and then they are no longer seen all day which is annoying, good family orientated hotel and food at the pool bar is pretty decent, family that we met where all inclusive and didn't really like food at the hotel however said it wasn't the worst just not really there kind of thing mostly fish dishes. on a whole this hotel was decent not a dive and I would…

title: amazing sea views
review: Fantastic sea view room, cleaned regularly with linen changes. Me and my wife have stayed here 2 or 3 times both self catering and half board. For a 3 star hotel I have to say the meals were very good. A good choice at meal times and you are allocated a table at the start of your holiday and that's your table for the duration which I liked, much better than hanging around for a free table during busy periods. One word of warning book a frontal sea view room on a high floor for the best views. On our 1st visit we booked a side sea view and were given a room on the side of the hotel on a low floor looking at a graffiti wall [that separates the hotel from the local supermarket] and below us was a gully [probably a storm drain]. Yes we could see the sea if we leaned over the balcony…

title: Jardin del mar.
review: Visited there for 4 days in April.  You cannot check in before 3pm.  The rooms are basic and clean.  The staff are pleasent and helpful.  the hotel is near Square in the quieter end of Town.   Right beside the sea and a short walk from the beach.   About 600 metres.  Check out is at midday.   There are pleanty of shops and places to eat nearby. The Supermarket is on the doorstep.  I have stayed here many times and i will return.

title: Very good apartments
review: We have stayed here approx 9 times over the years and once again the trh came up trumps.  Stayed with my wife and 3 year old for a week 6th to 13th april.  Apartment's spotless. View of the pool and bay were perfect. Cleaners done there job nearly every day. Towels changed 3 times during out stay.  Front desk were very good as always. We stayed in room 301 which was good size for 3 people. Tv had various English stations including children's channels.  The lack of microwave did not really bother us as others have stated but it would be nice. Wifi at 24 euro was a bit steep but needed it for radio on my tablet.  Indoor pool was great as the main outside pool was cold.  Will definitely return to trh jardin del mar.

title: Location and value.
review: I am quite surprised at many of the recent reviews.  I booked a front sea view room , upper floor , direct with the hotel.  Upon arrival we were allocated a room on the top floor as requested. Check in was very quick and local information was given at the same time. Our room was clean and tidy, yes, the furniture is somewhat tired, but what a view from the balcony.  The small kitchen area was perfect for making an early morning coffee and a snack lunch. We stayed half board and found the food to be acceptable for the price that we paid. £25 per day half board and a room with a view. All of the hotel team were professional and always greeted you with a smile. The major number of guests were Scandanavians and Dutch. Previous reviews have covered the local area and attractions.…

title: Beautiful, convenient location, clean but noisy and not very secure
review: We stayed here for 3 nights, on arrival at 10am we were told we could not check in until 3pm which was a pain but were provided with somewhere to leave our luggage. We were a party of 5 girls, away for a 40th birthday, even though we booked the rooms together we were given rooms on the ground floor & 5th floor, the hotel was far from full so I cannot see why they couldn't at least put us on the same floor.    We finally checked in, the room was clean & had everything we needed.  The shower was really powerful which was lovely after a long day I the sunshine and the beds were comfortable.   The room door was not very secure, it locked with a normal key but did not seem to close properly, only one hard shove and I think anyone could have walked in.  The walls were paper thin, you…

title: JARDIN DEL MAR
review: Staying  here 18 April 2016 for four nights with my disabled teenage daughter . Arrived at 12.15 to be told my horrible receptionist check in is not to 3pm . Wasn't even offered to put my cases anywhere . Was stranded in a cafe across road stressed out . When eventually went over to reception  receptionist knew I was waiting to be checked in but when two other customers came into hotel to get checked in she checked them in NO BOTHER !  Then I went up n eventually got checked in . Room small but basic . Will not stay here again !!!!!  This hotel needs to employ staff who have communication skills at reception !!!!!

title: Wotst hotel I have stayed in
review: I booked through alpharooms. Arrived morning 19/04/16 and waited for the check in which is 3pm. To get told we are room 111. This is the lowest floor when I had requested (3 months ago when I paid and booked our 'sea view room') that I wanted to be floor 4 or above and clean as I am 7 and 1/2 months pregnant. I was very disappointed when they said we don't have that on our notes, I told them to look again, which they replied the booking company hadn't informed them and it was my problem, even though it was printed out on the 'hotel voucher' you had to supply them with on arrival . Surley they pay the booking company to get things like that right and inevitably gain business for them, so anyway they didn't do anything to help. I would have been better off paying the cheaper price…

title: Not very helpful
review: Lovely apartments staff at reception not friendly bar men are great .... Waitresses even less friendly lovely location spotlessly clean apartments small enough ..... We asked to be upgraded to a sea view told thyre was none ya right in April I don't think so !! Would I stay here again. No ...

title: Stay Here Bed and Breakfast Only.
review: We have just returned from this hotel and we went half board this was a big mistake, the food is cold and bland, even when we went when the dining room was just opened (7pm) apart from the soup everything was cold and tasteless.We ended up going to the chinese restaurant across the road from the hotel, there we got a great 2 course meal for 7.50 euro and it was hot. The breakfast was also cold ie cold beans, sausages, congealed fried eggs .also take your own tea bags as there's is so weak even 3 tea bags did not help. Now the rooms with sea view are first class the view is one of the best we have had, all be it I did ask for a floor from the 4th up but was given a 3rd floor room, when I asked at reception if we could change rooms I was told no yet I heard her say to a couple…

title: Early season
review: We had a relaxing week staying here. Despite reading the reviews we were quite satisfied with the cleanliness and the decor. Only complaint was the fridge....juice etc was frozen although it was at the lowest setting!  Views were lovely. The resort was far from busy but this might be because it was too early in the season. Royal Garden served reasonably priced good food. Pacos had 3 course meal incl wine & bread for €9.50

title: Not just tired worn out.
review: Room 102 smell of drains, horrid even after "fixing" air con/heating not working, hotel stuck in time warp, 1980's, curtains mended with gaffer tape, bed's not just firm rock hard.Cooked food tasteless, salad's/soup's okay, cold  and hot drinks from vending machines, just about drinkable (flavour's all mixed up chocolate tasting coffee) machine could do with a good clean out.Only 1 night singer, 1 night bingo for adult entertainment.Hotel public areas, clean, and rooms, bedding clean, small tear's in sheets and small burn hole's in blanket's . Staff unhelpfull travelled with husband grandson and sister wanted to put us in different part's of hotel  even after we had sent 2 emails requesting rooms near to each other. This "hotel" could be a real gem as are other hotel's we have…

title: My first time in Spain
review: Recently arrived back In the UK from a two night stay at this hotel, staff are very helpful and facilities are also very good! would highly recommend to families with young children as the entertainment for younger people is very good and keeps them amused for a while! indoor and outdoor pools are both very good and the views from the rooms are beautiful! only critique I could find was that online advertisement for the hotel states that the bar is open until 12:00 every night, but during my stay I found the bar was closed by as early as 10:30 one evening and 11:00 the next, unsure if this is because I chose to visit here when it was "out of season" but found myself moving elsewhere for drinks late at night! overall a very good hotel 🇪🇸🙏🏼

title: You get what you pay for
review: We had a room on the 7th floor and the view as amazing! If we didn't have a larger than large balcony and fantastic view I would of not been happy with our room! We had a 1 room self catering apartment that was frontal sea view booked via on the beach holidays £579 for myself and 2 kids incl flights from stansted, my partner decided to come at a later date so I booked him a flight and he joined us, on the beach wanted to charge £240 extra for him but I called the hotel and they said I had already paid for a apartment so no more to pay! Fantastic! I booked him a flight only which was £85. We had a sof bed for 1 person in the living area and a out you up fold out type bed so we were a little cramped to say the least but it was cheap so we put up and shut up. The electric rings…

title: Lovely Hotel with good sized rooms
review: Recently returned from a 6 night stay, 28th March - 3rd April, and we had a fantastic time! We stayed as a group of 5 and had two apartments next door to each other which was great! We loved the size of the rooms, as we we stayed half-board we didn't have a need for the little kitchen but we found the little apartments homely. Both the pools were great, the outside pool was quite cold due to the time of year, however it was a good size and the views out to sea were fantastic. The inside pool was a good temperature and never too busy. There was only a short walk to the beach with lots of shops on the way, or you could walk down by the coast line. We asked reception for a map and they were able to explain, in English, good places to visit, which was fantastic. The food was fine,…

title: Birthday Break
review: My girlfriend and I recently returned from the Jardin Del Mar as a 30th birthday present for myself. We went from the 29th March - 1st Apr and to be honest it wasn't a bad little place. Bar a few frustrating bits and bobs.   When we arrived we noticed that the Hotel itself is on a hill and about 10 minutes walk for nimble people to the beach. If your older it might be a pain but luckily there is a taxi rank right outside that will drop you at the bottom of the hill for 5 euros. Failing that bring your segway or hoverboard and you'll be fine.   It was early season when we went so we were not expecting there to be too much open, I would not recommend eating at about 80% of the nearby restaurants outside the hotel. It takes forever to cook and they can't even cook the simplest food…

title: Good accommodation  in great location
review: Just returned from a week staying in a one bed apartment. Although like many popular and well used places it would benefit from a little TLC, it was clean and comfortable. The pool area was great with fantastic views over the bay. Staff helpful and friendly. Plenty of local bars and restaurants within a few yards with a stroll down a gentle hill to the bay.

title: Hotel
review: Stayed for 5 nights , staff were very nice apt basic but clean very near to the square also pubs and restaurants on the doorstep there wasn't a lot of sun beds so in the summertime think it will be hard to get sun beds

title: Fabulous location
review: Stayed for 5 nights in a self catered 1 bedroom apartment in this hotel. The location is fabulous and most rooms have a lovely view across the bay.  As it was out of season the hotel was very quiet.  Nice heated indoor pool, bit on the small side but good to have.  The hotel was very clean, although a bit tired.  Staff were helpful..  Only negative point was the WiFi.  Paid €2 for 1 hour and was told that you could dip in and out until you have used the hour.  Not so, as soon as you connect to WiFi the clock starts ticking and you use all of your time.

title: Great hotel in very good location
review: Just returned from 4 night break here and was very impressed. Staff were very friendly especially reception staff. Nice clean bright apartment just the right size for us - 2 adults & 4 year old. Good TV with several English channels. Side sea view. Heating easy to turn on in eve. Good maid service. Lovely outside pool area & indoor pool heated nicely. Great location for restaurants and supermarket and pleasant short walk into centre of Santa Ponsa. Highly recommend.

title: Hotel from hell.
review: I've been coming to Santa Ponza for the past ten years and without a doubt this has been the worst apartment i've ever had the misfortune to stay in.  It wasnt even cleaned, I had to start and do it myself. There was black damp stains on the walls and cigarette burns on the kitchen surfaces, no door on the ice compartment of the fridge and no table on the balcony or rack to hang washing on.  The living room area floor was washed once the whole week, no other floors were washed at all. The kitchen floor and bedroom floor were never washed at all. There was a dead moth sticking on a wall lamp when we moved in, I left it alone to see if the cleaner would  notice it. It fell on to the floor the day before we left and she still didn't see it. It's probably still there.  It was the…

title: Nice Stay and lovely hotel but request a decent room view
review: The hotel was lovely and food was great . The only big let down was the room we got. We asked for a sea view but got a room with actually no view at all. The view was onto a brick wall. That was very disappointing but we didnt let it upset the holiday as the hotel is in a beautiful location if you didnt want to be right in the middle of the resort ( and still a short stroll to everything.  The Square is only about 4-5 minutes walk away and has a fantastic night life for both young children up to older people

title: Lovely!
review: This is a really nice hotel! Very clean with friendly staff, we weren't meant to stay here originally but were put with this hotel after ours shut down. It's right by the beach and overlooks a lovely cove (not the right word but the word escapes me). The only reason I put it at 4 stars not 5 is, due to the fact that we went at the end of season I assume, we found that the pool bar and inside bar was shut for the last 4 days of the holiday with no-one to be found! Going at the end of October I understand it's not going to be really busy, but if the hotel stays open everything within it should too.   Despite this, lovely hotel and I'm sure it will be great in the summer!

title: Holiday review
review: The Hotel TRH Jardin del Mar is a lovely hotel over looking the bay of Santa Ponsa it has very nice rooms and is worth booking a sea view room as the view is fantastic. The staff are polite and the rooms are kept clean, the beds are made on a daily basis and sheets changed once a week. My family and I always go self catering as the food leaves a lot to be desired .But there are lots of lovely places to eat locally and they are very well priced.

title: all HOTEL ROOMS ARE SMALL . PUT ME UP BEDS FOR A FAMILY OF FOUR NOT GOOD ENOUGH WOULD NOT USE THIS HOTEL AGAIN
review: Should have booked this through a cheap travel company, due to the fact NO Rep either on the Coach or at the Airport. Very bad. This Hotel was very quiet motre germans than english. DO NOT BOOK Marjorca in the October School Holidays. as resturants running out of food and closing last day of Oct some even earlier as with the shops. Lot of resturants and shops never opened whilst we were there 20th oct to 31st oct. Had to use the Hotel Buffet Dinner 3 times due to a couple of our fave resturants were closed. SEBASTIANS was excellent, meals were very good , the 3 course meals were very good value we ate here most of the time. ES Castellot outside the hotel front door door cheap beer 1 euro thirty for a pint of beer. Had one meal meal there very greasy although my carbornara was…

title: Much better than expected
review: We booked the Jardin del Mar for a 2 night stay prior to boarding a cruise in Palma. As this was a bonus holiday for us we wanted reasonably priced accommodation and the Jardin del Mar fit the bill; however, after reading some negative comments on here we wondered if we had made a big mistake. We should not have worried - we had an excellent stay and would have no hesitation in returning.  Literally as we were leaving for the airport I emailed the hotel to explain that my husband has serious health issues and needs to sleep upright so could he have 2 extra pillows - these were waiting for him on the bed when we arrived; thank you Jardin del Mar staff for excellent service. We arrived just before 9 p.m. and check-in was quick and easy - we were given apartment 414 on reception…

title: Fantastic holiday 10/10
review: Hotel is right on the beach, fantastic views, stayed for 9 days with half board.  Food was fantastic with lots of choice to suit everyone.  Room had sea view at the side and was clean and linen changed often.  Maid was very helpful and my request for extra pillows was immediately seen to.  Must compliment the reception who were so helpful and our Head Waiter who was brilliant.  Will definately be going back again, soon !

title: Family Holiday
review: We booked this Hotel with every intention of eating out in the evening. The kitchen facilities were far from perfect but ample if you are just eating breakfast and lunch. There is a kettle in the room that you need to heat up on the hob. Takes a while but does the job. Our room was on the 4th floor and had amazing views. Definitely worth paying the little extra for a sea view. Our children are aged 13 & 16 but even with only one room between us we didn't struggle for space. Cannot comment on the food as we didn't eat at the Hotel at all but lots of restaurants within walking distance. The little supermarket around the corner was perfect for fresh, warm bread and croissants and much cheaper than the spar shop. Just a lovely 10 minute walk to the beach where it was around £20.00…

title: Clean and basic hotel
review: I booked 7 nights here (in mid october) in a sea view apartment for myself, my partner and our two boys (aged 4 months and 20 months). I was a little nervous about some of the negative reviews, but there were also a number of good reviews which is why I went ahead and booked. The price was very good value, working out at around £45 per night. We went on a self catering basis so cannot comment on the food in the hotel, we had a couple of drinks at the bar which were a little more expensive than elsewhere in the area (3.50 euros for a beer). The room was very clean and the kitchen area was small but suitable for preparing basic food and drinks when needed. Bathroom good, and shower very powerful. The view from the balcony was very good, and the travel cots provided were good…

title: Good Hotel Nice Area
review: The hotel is big!  It is spread over 6 or 7 levels and generally very clean.  Reception is street level - which is level 4.  Pool and restaurant at the bottom level 0.  For the cost, it is better than I would expect, but don't expect too much.  Facilities are really good - Outdoor and indoor pool.  Restaurant, Bar, Internet (at a cost), Laundry Room (which is free to use), Gym.  We went self-catering and had a great sea-view room, which is well worth paying for if you haven't got one!  Rooms are very basic with a tiny kitchen.  Yes, you have to pay for a kettle and/or toaster.  We paid 10 euros for a toaster and 10 euro deposit (returned no problem) for a week. We ate in the restaurant 3 days.  11 euros for the adults and half price for kids 7+ (under 7s are free).  Great…

title: so-so
review: Hotel facilities were good and clean.  Our room was clean but is in need of some TLC.  The cupboard door was hanging off, there were no mugs (only tiny teacups), no teaspoons and you have to hire electric kettle, toaster and additional cooking equipment.  The hotel advertised free wifi but doesn't provide it (c. 24 euros for a week, and apparently its a bad connection) but that didn't bother us too much as there are plenty of local cafes and restaurants that provide free wifi in the near by.  Having food allergies the  buffet restaurant didn't have a great selection for me.  My partner doesn't have food allergies and isn't particularly fussy about what he eats and even he said the food selection wasn't great, but for 11 euros for all you can eat you can't complain (however we…

title: Nice hotel but....
review: From previous reviews I was well aware that the hotel needed updating - but for the price we paid for our two week stay this did not surprise me.  We paid the extra for a sea view which was definitely worth it.  The kitchenette was too small for full on self catering but was fine for preparing breakfast or lunch.  The pool area was lovely - we had no problem with sunbeds but it is October - show me a large hotel that could ever have enough sunbeds in high season when they are full.  I was disappointed that the pool bar closed at 5 pm as there where still people sunbathing and it was still warm.  Our room was only not cleaned on two days - both Thursdays.  New pillows are required but I think this is a result of the poor air conditioning and how hot it can get in the bedroom at…

title: four retired teacher friends from iceland
review: Fantastic 11 day stay, nothing to falt with hotel staff etc. We  i..e. asked for two bathrooms and  the third day we got a fantastic flat with the most enjoyable view . Had myse lf stayed in this same flat for few weeks fewv years ago. ThANKS all at the hotel. Hildigunnur in iceland

title: Nice view
review: Room basic pleased we took a travel kettle, nice sea and pool view,breakfast rubbish same thing every day menu includes sausage ,smoked bacon ,fried eggs , beans, fish fingers, or chips, or battered brockli lol , waiter bit ignorant,no friendly smile so glad we didn't have evening meal ! Next room to us was a couple in their 60's coming in at all hours shouting arguing was a night mare . I would never return to this hotel ,I don't usually right reviews but had to on this occasion.

title: Anyone stay between 10th/20th july experience ear trouble from pool
review: Anyone who stayed here around 10th July - 20th July experience any ear problems like I did my holiday was totally ruined by 2 inner and outer ear infections that was caused by the pool...just very curious

title: Not too bad
review: We arrived at the hotel at 12.30pm and by luck our room was ready.  It had a separate bedroom with plenty of storage space, a good sized bathroom and tiny kitchen area.  We had booked a side view room but we were on the 5th floor and near the front so we had a really good view of the sea and cove too. Room was cleaned 5 out of 7 days which was fine, towels changed every time.  Large flat screen TV in the living area had English channels which was ideal on the day it poured with rain all day.  The air conditioning was rubbish which made it really hard to get to sleep at night.  You could hire a fan which we decided not to do but in hindsight we really should have.  We didn't eat at this hotel at all so cannot comment on the food.  The receptionists were really nice but we didn't…

title: Better than we expected.......
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from 11th to 18th September and were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews but we actually had a really nice time......on arrival we were told our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm which we hadn't realised but we were told we could put our luggage in a secure room and get changed. We had paid £30 for a sea view (very reasonable compared to what some hotels charge) and we were more than happy with it....the view was lovely, we overlooked the pool and the view over the bay is gorgeous......we got the sun on our balcony from afternoon/evening.....our room (318) was basic but clean, fresh and well enough equipped for our needs, plenty hanging space etc and the spacious bathroom had the best shower we've ever had!!! Can understand…

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Like many others we were put in a room looking at a wall no.030 , but on pointing out that we had booked a side sea view they were more than happy to change it : next time we'd book a sea view. Rooms are very basic but it only a 3 star so that's expected : for us it was just a bed for the night . We didn't eat there so cant comment. No rush for beds by the pool as school holidays are over . Pool area lovely, overlooking the bay. Over the week had towels changed most days but a sign does say that as agreed with tour companies they would only change towels every 3 days. Rooms cleaned every day. Overall we would stay again but if your looking for what would be the equivalent of 3 stars in this country you have to go 4 stars or above.

title: Pretty average really
review: We where given a ground floor room which was totally unacceptable,Not big enough for a family of four, lots of insects, a view of a large hedge backing on to an alleyway at the rear of the Hotel, The "Balcony" doors had no proper lock , just a home made metal pin which came out when you shook the doors.  Felt like we where just waiting to be robbed !!. Not helped by a lack of a safe .  After complaining we where moved to a 4th floor room with great views over the pool and out to sea,  we had to pay 115 euros for 8 nights for the privilege.  Indoor pool was closed, the "gym" was crap, food (we where half board) was monotonous at best. we ate out mostly. Pool area was quite nice but not enough sun beds to go around.  Staff where pleasant enough when they had to be.  The location…

title: Basic Jardin Del Mar
review: Stayed for one week at this hotel with my husband, was told we had a side view of the sea but all we could see was a brick wall, the hotel itself is very basic and for over £600 each a rip-off, we asked to change our room 3 times and was told the hotel was full, clean towels took 4 days and even then we had to ask for them, breakfast was a poor excuse never any choice and boring, so we wont be back :(

title: Great location but Basic
review: First time at this hotel. Had sea view which was good. Very good location but rooms basic and need upgraded. Two hot plates to boil water in a small kettle provided. Even a basic hotel provides a proper plug in kettle. We had to hire a kettle and toaster....just a money making scheme. No evening entertainment to speak of, so out each night which actually suited as plenty happening. Seemed to be plenty of sun loungers, not that im a sun worshipper but up early morning before the sun was risen there were still people moving and lifting loungers around, organising their towels and then walking away....I'm assuming to get breakfast or do something else to then return later to lie the rest of the day. (VERY SELFISH PEOPLE AROUND). You can see why people get angry and throw these…

title: Had a nice stay
review: We stayed for a week on 20th September.  Booked a sea view but on arrival was told wouldn't be ready for the following day. They offered a free breakfast so I moaned and got free evening meal aswell.  Food was ok but was glad I was self catering.  Second room was on 3rd floor but a tree was mainly blocking view but put up with it. Room in need of complete make over. Had to hire everything which you shouldn't have to if self catering.  Air con rubbish.  We booked a taxi transfer with shuttle direct 55.00 return very glad we did. Got talking to a lot of people and the transfer bus took on some occasions 4 hrs.  Rediculas.  Pool area nice had no problems with getting a sun lounger.  Excellent for the square.  Wifi expensive.  We got a data sim for 4 days 10 euros and both used…

title: Lovely room, fabulous holiday
review: Just got back from a week at the Jardin del Mar. Arrived to find check in isn't until 3pm so had to store luggage and return after a couple of hours. However this the holiday companies error as they should inform customers of this when they book. Our room wasn't ready, as we had booked a superior apartment, the receptionist gave us half board for the one night to make up for this. We got moved into the correct room straight after breakfast the following day and it was lovely. Wrap around sea view with a large terrace complete with sunbeds. The room was kept very clean and towels and bedding were changed regularly throughout the week. No problems with getting sunbeds at this time of year. The walk into town was a long hill rather than steep and wasn't a problem to us. Our 11 year…

title: Basic but with great views
review: Stayed for a week. Had booked sea view but when we arrived was not available the first night. We're given a dark damp room for 1 night and then given room on 7th floor with wonderful views over the bay. Very friendly staff. We stayed b&b.  Food was adequate and dining room very pleasant and quiet.  It was very good having a fridge in the room as we could sit out on the balcony enjoying the views and having a nice chilled glass of wine. Indoor pool and gym was closed and as others have said, outdoor pool is very deep. We had no problem at all getting a sun bed but school hols were over.

title: Ok, but wouldn't go back
review: Definitely only 3 star, rooms tired but clean, staff friendly but not knowledgeable or forthcoming with information, quietish location but quite a hike into town and uphill all the way back although plenty of bars and restaurants to visit on on the way (Southwinds is great for food) coastal path dodgy if not sure footed and only suitable in daylight, plenty of sun beds available but key ones taken early by the usual suspects each day at 8am. Sea view is a must, alternative is dank view of 'cat alley'. If you hire a safety deposit box be warned they are not big, we just about managed an iPad, passports and a couple of wallets and you will either have lie on the floor to see into it or use a stepladder, all of which is happening in the main reception area! Santa ponsa good base…

title: 3 Star is right - clean & value for money
review: Hotel is great & main thing is the Sea Views are amazing...Santa Ponca bay is an exceptional bill.  If all you want is a value for money place to stay.  Cleaners were stand out, friendly and kept rooms V Clean.  We only stayed Self Catering, so cant comment on the food, but if all you want is a clean VFM place to stay this is it.

title: Disappointed by the way I was treated after going there twice a year for many years
review: Have been staying in Jardin Del Mar for many years in May and September usually stay in superior sea view rooms which I have to say are lovely.I booked to go out end of this month. I had been speaking previously with Ester the manager checking all was in order as I wanted the type of room I always request she was ok.Phoned to day to check all was in order and book an extra day as we have a night flight was treated on the phone obnoxiously by a member of staff who would not give me his name. Ester was not available not good enough complete disregard for all the years I have been a loyal customer. Needless to say I cancelled and won't return. Very disappointed.    Mary H

title: Lovely stay but ...........
review: My husband and I have just returned from a week at the Jardin del Mar.
