Yes the apartments are a little dated but are very clean and perfect for us - would definitely be too small for a family though and only 2 dodgy cooker rings - no grill, oven or microwave.  Toaster and kettle are extra to hire.  These should be supplied as standard in a a self catering apartment.   We had a sea view apartment and the view was just stunning- see photo!  The pool area is lovely but not suitable if you're not a confident swimmer as it's quite deep.  We didn't have a problem getting a sun bed but witnessed the rush at 8am when the pool doors opened!  We actually witnessed a flip flop fight because a family pinched another family's sunbeds!  The hotel need to address this - guests put towels down…

title: Never again, utter dump!!
review: Stopped here for 2 weeks end of August 15. Never again, declined the first room due to its below acceptable standard. Crisps on the floor when entering, cigarette packet, tissues and clothing tags behind the damaged bed head.  sun blind stuck together with gaffer tape and unable to close them.  Underwear of different sizes on the roof adjacent to the balcony that had clearly been there for some considerable time.  During the stay I can't remember having towels or bedding that although washed didn't have a stain on them or were torn.  The new room was marginally better although very tired to the point where there was no chance we'd cook in the kitchen area, it was very grubby.  The pool is a minimum of 5 foot deep with a tiny kids part. Lilo,s are not allowed in the pool at all.…

title: Jardin del mer
review: Stayed in July room 412 view  outstanding lovely  palm tree to give partial  shade on balcony  view not obstructed. Room could be updated air con might as well not be there. Wifi you pay for,cheek. The breakfast  good evening  meals yuck go out some lovely  restaurant s on the sea front. Sun beds not enough to go round so have to run the gauntlet every morning be downstairs ready to go at 7.45 if you can't beat them join them I did to the embarrassment of my kids watching from the balcony as mother  going full pelt but heyho family set up for the day round the pool. No air beds allowed but rules are to be broken and most people  chose  to ignore  the rule  the life guard didn't have a say in the matter so he just gave up. No night life in  the hotel  except for one night when an…

title: Good hotel
review: After booking the holiday i read the previous reviews and was very apprehensive about this hotel but there was need.  We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful.  Admittedly the rooms are a bit dated but they were very clean and spacious.  No trouble in getting a sunbed even when we went down to the pool at 10.30.  The food was good even though there could have been more choice of veg. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: We stayed at this hotel last week in August and were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is an older 3* aparthotel but we found it to be very clean in a good location, just a short walk to Santa Ponsa square.  All the staff were nice and helpful.  We stayed half board and thought the food to be of a good standard, but with only a small selection.  Some of the families staying were inconsiderate to other guests letting their children run wild, but unfortunately where ever you go you can encounter this and it is not fault of the hotel, along with the ones who come in at 4am in the morning waking everyone up!  The sunbed situation as mentioned in other reviews is annoying, people que up waiting for the doors to open then charge to the beds they want, but if you want to get one this is…

title: Basic but excellent location
review: Having read lots of mixed reviews I was a bit worried about staying here. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We booked a sea view room but On arrival they said they had none left, they put us in a room facing a wall for one night. True to their word we got our sea view room and it was lovely. The rooms are very basic and we had a nice balcony where we could sit out and have a drink. During the kids Hols there was a sunbed run which was actually quite funny to watch as people (mostly men) ran for ther sunbeds and were actually throwing their towels on the beds to get the one they wanted. As the kids went back to school (sept) we noticed this morning rush stopped and there were plenty of beds. The pool area is nice there is a big pool bar and pool table. The views are amazing…

title: DONT BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ
review: Just returned from a 10 day holiday at this hotel,,the rooms are basic but clean ,,The square is just around the corner where there is entertainment on every night Dont believe what you read about the sunbed rush , we were a party of 6 & never had a bother getting them no matter what time we went down ,,,,If we were returning we would go s/c,,we went h/b & the breakfast was great but evening meals werent good ,,

title: santa ponsa
review: hotel not bad but spoilt by poor quality food could have gone self catering and wished i had sometimes food was actually burnt and still put out for consumption ,fortunately jardine square was just round the corner so went there in the evenings good entertainment as hotel entertainment non existant.

title: Nice  hotel
review: This  hotel  is  just a short walk from the  beach  , shops and  restaurants . It  has  its own heated  Swimming pool  and  it is  a nice  quiet  spot. There  is no  entertainment  at   this  hotel. Santa posable Is a  nice  resort  to  stay in

title: Lovely Stay.... Expected the worst
review: We were very apprehensive about stating here after reading the reviews.... Especially as it was our first family holiday with a 1year old....  This hotel, in our opinion, has gotten a raw deal in the reviews. The staff were friendly & helpful. All staff members we interacted with were courteous & accommodating.   The room was small but very clean. Towels and sheets changed numerous times during our week, the cleaning staff were lovely. We had ITV channels & CBeebies which was a God send during the two days of thunderstorms.   The food at the pool bar was basic but lovely & the staff were lovely there too. We didn't visit the restaurant but it was always empty when we walked by.   As for the sunbed situation, there is a lot of reserving with towels at stupid O'Clock, it is a bit…

title: Good hotel,needs updating
review: Just spent 10 days here,this is a nice hotel,right on the square in Santa ponsa,apartments are small,we were 2 adults and 3 children in a one bedroom apartment,Air con not very good,get an extra key from reception for €10 and leave it in,room cool enough then,Get a sea view apartment (great views).good pool and pool bar,snacks were ok,(Be Warned) start queuing at 7.45 in the morning for sun loungers cause when the door opens at 8 o clock it's a (stampede),never seen anything like it in all my travels,just behind the pool are lovely coves and nice coastal walk to the main Santa ponsa beach,About 10 minutes walk (very nice),this hotel is good for family's beside the square which has family entertainment every night.Try the Hogan Stand pub on the square for the best pint of Coors…

title: A quieter part of Santa Ponsa
review: OK, so I have been visiting Santa Ponsa on and off since 1973, so I know it pretty well by now, in fact on my first visit this Hotel and much of surroundings had not yet been built.  Situated in the quieter part of St. Ponsa away from the centre the intrusion of Sports & Music Bars are accessible within a 10 to 15 minute walk, but the relative calm and quiet is not spoiled by the "Hoi polloi"   even at the height of the season so if you want a good nights sleep this is the place to be.   Most if not all rooms have a sea view and a small balcony to enjoy it on. The rooms are apartment style with a kitchen including a cooker, fridge, and all utensils and a dining table and chairs for 4, air conditioning is standard. The kitchen is showing a little sign of wear and tear but…

title: Value for money holiday
review: My daughters and I booked this for a week which included meeting family for a hen weekend. Our room 501 was booked as a sea view and we had an amazing view. The hotel was clean and well situated. We did not eat in the hotel except for the pool bar and the food was good. There were plenty of activities round about and lots of relly good restaurants within easy walking distance. There were people complaining about their rooms while we were there but my advice would be ask for a sea view on 5th floor or above when booking. We had no complaints at all.

title: Horrendous
review: Not sure where to start really, ive been going abroad for 25 years and have never had an experience as bad as this one. As you approch the hotel it looks great as does the reception area but it stops there. Wifi is not free its 20 euros a week per device, the rooms are awful, they dont sleep 4, a put me up is wheeled in but cant take the weight of an adult, (i weigh 12 stone) to fit the bed in you have to move table and chairs and cant use them, basic self catering is impossible, no microwave no toaster very few utensils, 3 cupsetc etc no cupboard space for food no electric kettle. But you can pay for a toaster and a kettle from reception !! The rooms have been converted from hotel to Self catering and are far from adequate. Paint flaking off the walls, cracked tiles,  you cant…

title: Wacky Races Sunbed Run!!!
review: To be honest the hotel was clean,adequate space and in one of the best locations possible.The hotel has next to no entertainment but there is a square a short walk away every night with different shows.Wifi is 24 euros a week which I think it's steep as its per item not room,if you have a couple of children it's expensive.The pool bar staff were very abrupt and nasty as was the room maids.THE LOUNGERS!!! In 36 years of my life I have never seen anything so stupid in my life.You stand from as early as seven so to run like you have lost your mind for a lounger when they can be bothered to open the doors.sometimes eight,sometimes they keep you waiting.As I have children I needed shade and everyone else was the same.Speaking to people about this they said that they would never…

title: Beautiful views worth the extra for sea view!
review: Just back from a weeks holiday panicked as had read a lot of bad reports about the place but the only bad points to me where the beds were rock hard I have a bad back and this made my stay unbearable at times (but that's my problem) rooms may be a bit small for 4 really rooms for 3. I was in 501 beautiful view (worth the extra) hotel brilliant for families kids club there by mine wouldn't go but the stuff they laid on looked good. At 11pm all music stops which was great for us so no noise at night. Would def use again. I went self catering arkles brilliant for food straight across the road. Wifi is not free but all nearby restaurants have wifi so just used them.

title: Great Location, Hotel needs to address a few issues
review: Generally happy with our stay based on the excellent location. Very poor evening entertainment and is aimed soley at the little ones apart from one dramatic knife throwing evening which everyone enjoyed. People generally venture out as better entertainment is on offer close by, but you get the feeling the hotel uses this an an excuse and evenings at the hotel are very quiet! Some of the hire fees high for basics such as fan, toaster, iron and deposit safe boxes. Agree with comments about sunbeds, staff don't seem to care about the situation. Hotel generally quite clean and tidy as is the pool. Cleaning staff cheerful, restaurant lacks atmosphere, food is ok but uninspiring, desserts very repetitive. Good hotel if you are not expecting too much.

title: Better apartments available elsewhere in resort
review: Just got back from a 10 day holiday to Santa Ponsa.  We have been to this resort lots of times and love the place but will not be returning here.  Firstly the rooms are fairly standard issue Majorcan apartments like you find around most of the island and could do with updating, but once they do that they will invariably increase in cost so I suppose you get what you pay for.  The hire charge for basic equipment like a kettle and toaster is a cheek.    Wi-Fi is not free, however pretty much every restaurant and bar around the resort have it free, you just have to ask for the code.  The sunbed run is a must see, if only just for the laughs.  All beds are reserved within minutes of the doors opening at 8 by people wearing trainers so they can run faster.  Don't worry if like us…

title: Pay for sea view
review: Fantastic view which we had paid extra for (room 318) made the holiday it really is worth every extra £. The room itself however is very basic tired and a bit scruffy but the view from the balcony is amazing. The system for sunbeds is just plain ridiculous though. There are notices to say reserving of them is not allowed yet the hotel opens the door to the pool at 8 and the pool at 9 which allows inconsiderate people the opportunity to run (literally!!) and reserve them so by 805 there are none left so unless you want to join in this race you will NOT get a sunbed at the pool which is not ok especially when the majority of those that are reserved don't get used until the afternoon. The hotel really needs to address this issue and enforce the rule as it spoils it for all…

title: You get what you pay for I guess....
review: We were meant to be going with 6 ppl so had 2 rooms booked. But my partners father had a stroke so him and his wife did not travel! So ended up myself my son n partner n her Down syndrome brother.   We were told by Thomas Cook it was cheaper to keep both rooms. Obviously we did not want to leave her brother alone so when we got to the hotel we asked to be upgraded to a larger family room and we would give back the 2 rooms. The declined immediately and gave us our keys and started checking in the next customer. We used one room for us to sleep and the other for the luggage etc. but on day 5 reception must have been told by the maid that we weren't sleeping in one of the rooms n they asked for it back and told us to use only 1. So we swiftly declined. The hotel had poor staff.…

title: Dissapointed
review: Back today after a week half board at this hotel, food is edible but not much choice, waiters and waitresses polite but not very friendly, same for poolside bar which didnt open until 12 pm, theres music played but so quiet you cant hear it, no atmosphere around poolside, lots of families , mostly irish, with little children which leads me on to  SUNBEDS !! Absolutely shocking, worst ive ever seen, people queing at 7.30 am until pool opens at 8.00 am and then there's a stampede for sunbeds, i have never seen anything like it, but if you dont set your alarm you've no chance of a sunbed, people were leaving towels even tho hotel policy states this is not allowed !! people reserved beds but didnt come back until 1.00 pm or even 4.00 pm, i complained to the lifeguard and reception…

title: lovely hotel
review: Just arrived back after 10 nights , really don,t want to be negative cos its not a bad hotel ,arrived about 11 ish room wasn,t ready which we did expect , went back only to be told our sea view wouldn,t be ready till  following day! Got vouchers for evening meal and breakfast after a lot of fobbing off and a phone call to alpharooms we got our sea view , fantastic .Don,t buy wifi waste of money and the sunbed run is comical , pool bar not very nice for food and expensive , cleaners in every other day , staff were very miserable and un helpful , better than the last hotel we stayed in there,its a beautiful place .

title: Let's start with the positive
review: I stayed with my husband and 22 year old daughter. Decent hotel, staff very helpful, friendly & welcoming. The food was ok. Situated in a nice area not too far from the beach. Seaview is amazing. Shower room (after checkout) is nice, big and clean and we were given towels to use. Now the negative Seems a bit weird that anyone can enter the hotel from the rear. Not very security conscious. I would prefer towels changed daily. Definitely could do with more entertainment to entice guests to stay in the hotel in the evening as the bar area is lovely. The policy of no floats is followed but as everyone else says the policy of not reserving sun beds IS NOT. The mad dash in the morning is ridiculous 99% of beds are covered with towels but no people. I asked at reception why this was…

title: Great place for a family holiday
review: We have just spent 2 weeks here. I agree with what the other reviews say.  The positives are the views, the pool area and the pool bar lunches. Our room had a side sea view and was clean but very basic. The air con is very ineffective too, so be prepared to be hot. overall though we enjoyed our stay.

title: Good hotel with suberb views and location - but come armed with knowledge and you'll be OK
review: Family of 4 (2 Adults + 2 Kids aged 11+12) Very apprehensive before arrival due to loads of poor reviews on TA. Nearly called on the beach to change hotel - but sooo glad we didn't. Arrived to find nice fresh modern reception and helpful staff. Was given a 'superior' room (120) which had recently been refurbished and was quite large with a massive balcony. Room had large TV in it with all UK channels - quite handy whilst winding down just before getting ready to go out for the evening. No kettle -  no problem , old fashioned whistle kettle boiled o hob in just over 10min. No Toaster - didn't pay the 10 euros for hire - removed a metal rack from top cupboard and placed over hob - quick and free toast!!! see photos No free Wifi - only main gripe - Hotel bar empty / closed on…

title: Good location
review: Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms regularly cleaned. Great location in a quite area (busy square nearby for those who wish for something a little livelier - we never actually visited the square but we could hear music & entertainment when walking to bars and restaurants).  Plenty of good bars/restaurants within walking distance.  Pleasant 15 minute walk to the beach.   Hotel room in definite need of an upgrade - wooden fixtures/tables grimy.  Kitchen tiny for 2 adults & two children 14 & 12 years.  Fit for making a sandwich &  little else.  Fourth bed was a camp bed in the lounge area - leaving very little living space.  Had to continually sit on & walk over bed to move around the room.  As a result of the camp bed being in the lounge the dining table was squashed into a corner,…

title: The room with a so called sea view you look out at a brick wall terrible and the staff are no better never again
review: Thought I was getting a room with a sea view no just a brick wall and road to look at and the staff are just not interested terrible never again stay at this hotel you ask about the room you thought I was getting and its management up at the crack of dawn for sun bed wait till 8'o'clock for the off grab one if you can don't get stamped on ask at reception about car hire or trips and they think you're from another planet very unhelpful

title: Amazing view!
review: We had a lovely stay at the jardin deal mar, the views were amazing and the pool area was beautiful and very clean, although you do have to get up early for the subbed rush. Food at poolside bar was lovely, we stayed self-catering so can't comment on food in the hotel. Rooms were small and basic and could do with a refurbe. Air con was okay not the best, towels were changed regularly. There was no entertainment at all in the hotel but we went into Santa Ponsa and all the bars had their own thing going on, we went to the square a couple of time but we found the entertainment quiet tacky but the entertainment in the pubs were good, Santa Ponsa was nice the further down you went. Western water park is worth a visit and also if your brave do the jet boat that you see passing the…

title: Fantastic sea view
review: We recently stayed here for 2 weeks and it was amazing. We were so lucky to have been allocated a superior room on the 7th floor which had a very large terrace with sun loungers and table and chairs, this meant that we didn't have to set our alarm to get up at the crack of dawn and join in the sunbed rush. It was hilarious to watch the stampede when the doors opened, with people sprinting and actually throwing towels to the beds from a distance.  The sea view over the bay was spectacular. Our room was spacious and very clean, the maids did a fantastic job. We took our own travel kettle which means you don't have the heat of the electric stove when you want a cuppa. From reviews we knew the air con wasn;t that good so I took my tower fan in my hand luggage and i'm so glad because…

title: Lovely holiday
review: We have just returned from a one week family holiday at this hotel; two adults and two children aged 7 and 13. We stayed in a one-bedroomed apartment which had a beautiful view over the pool area with the ocean beyond. We were surprised to find we had a television and could get a few English programmes. The kitchen area had crockery, cutlery, pans, utensils and bowls and there was fridge and two electric rings - it would have been handy to have a grill / toaster and microwave, but it wasn't the end of the world. The towels and bedding were changed regularly and the floors were swept; the communal areas were also spotlessly clean. All staff were friendly and helpful from reception, to cleaners to bar-staff. The pool area was lovely and the pool was never too crowded, despite it…

title: The view is amazing !!
review: A recent 2 week stay in the TRH Jardin del mar...... Firstly our transfer from the airport was a nightmare, between 2 and 2 1/2 hours, so bad that lots of people in our hotel chose a 45 Euro, 25 min taxi on the return. The hotel is basic and as reviewers have said is in need of an update. Another negative is the payment required for kettle, toaster, fan, security box, and high chair. You also pay for Wi-fi and this is only for one device. We had a sea view apartment (pay extra)The view is amazing, it gets better the higher your floor is, but it can be admired from by the pool anyway. The pool is adequate, it can get busy with the kids at times but it is the summer holiday guys, i chose to swim early on when it was quiet. The pool cant be mentioned without paying attention to the…

title: Moan Moan Moan
review: Let's clear up this sunbed situation that everyone is banging on about....  My motto was....if you can't beat them, join them. In order to whiteness the stampede to get a sunbed, you must be awake. So get on down there and secure a bed instead of moaning about it. But no, it is not ideal, however what else are you meant to do? Moan I guess!!  Also people say that the beds are empty ALL day. You actually can't tell if the beds are empty because people are in the pool or at the snack bar etc. If you couldn't get a bed...how would you know that the beds were empty all day? Surely you would hit the beach, not be watching over your balcony checking which bed is empty and for how long. Get a life! Enjoy your holiday.  I might add, what doesn't help is the doors to the pool area open…

title: Nice stay but updating required
review: I stayed here 4 years ago and when we arrived there had been no updating done at all in that time.....the room was comfortable and cleaned daily with fresh towels but very shabby decor and the air conditioning was terrible, especially in the August heat....we paid €10 for a spare key so we could leave the air con on full time which was essential. Didn't eat at the hotel or use the pool so can't comment but the staff were friendly, room clean and location good for The Square and walking distance to the beach and strip.

title: Lovely hotel and facilities
review: We stayed in an apartment overlooking a car park.  it did have views to the side of the sea, but, we enjoyed the people watching.  It has the most beautiful private beach just down some steps to while away a couple of hours.  The poolside was lovely, again, overlooking the sea, and new sun beds were just being delivered as we were there.  We went self catering, as there are some lovely places to eat in Santa Ponca, even a breakfast for 2 euros! The apartment had everything we needed and was comfortable.  We have family who live in Santa Ponca, so we got out and about a lot, but the hotel was a great base. The only downside was, as we were there at Easter, the little square was not open, therefore there was limited/no entertainment.  There was no entertainment in the hotel…

title: Dated accommodation in need of lots more sunbeds!
review: We stayed at this hotel which we booked last minute. When arriving the reception was very tired looking and the staff extremely unhelpful and surly.  After a very early start it was not the greeting that we expected.  There were no sunbeds available around the pool so we had to sit on hard chairs.  We learned that to get a sunbed you had tp queue at 7.30 for the pool doors to open at 8.00 - people wore trainers to run to the spaces that they wanted.  By 8.05 all beds were gone for the day!  Food was terrible - we ate out twice - no choice for the children and nothing for myself as a vegetarian.  The rooms were tired and the bed small and uncomfortable - my husband and myself could not both lie on our backs at the same time as we did not fit! The drinks and snacks in the hotel…

title: Never Again
review: I apologise to anyone who thinks this is a good hotel, we stayed here for 7 nights and will never stay here again. The room was very basic hardly any air conditioning we had to hire a fan at 26 euros, we didn't sit by the pool all week as the stampede for the beds was something you would watch on you've been framed people arguing over beds. People who stayed at this hotel would put towels on bed for three hours before going outside to sunbathe, the food was awful, terrible we ate out every night. One morning for breakfast there was broccoli in batter chef if you can call him that should be sacked, staff rude I went to get plastic cup from poolside bar to be told off as I hadn't asked even though I've paid to stay for one week.  Now let me tell you about brilliant hotel where my…

title: Sun beds at dawn!!!
review: Visited August 2015 with wife and 2 kids. The food was not very good with absolutely nothing the kids would eat. The room was dated and could do with an upgrade however the cleaners were efficient. The pool was clean and usually very busy. There was no entertainment at the actual hotel however the local square had basic acts on every night. There were alaso lots of bars and restuarants within a short walk. The hotel reception was manned 24/7 with the staff (pedro & paco quite helpfull. The main negative was the doors to the pool opened at 8am at which time at least 50 people wold queue teh make a mad dash for a lounger. Most peolpe would put there towels down, go back to bed and you wouldnnt see them until 2pm so this needs sorted as it was the most frustrating element of our…

title: Great location and good value for money
review: Enjoyable stay. Room could do with a little refresh but clean and more then comfortable for a holiday. Reasonable choice of food - if sometimes a little strange combinations. Lots to do in the resort and surrounding area. Nice beach at Peguera which is only a 7 euro trip from the local taxi rank. Recommend the train trip to Port Soller.

title: Hardin del mar
review: Just returned from 10 nights weather great but hotel basic but clean in need of refurb pool to small for the amount of people there as for sun beds they are non existent after the rush at 8am by 8.02 they all gone with sun towels on them but no 1 using them spoke to management and he said if no 1 returns after 5 mins to throw towels of and any problems c him beach nice but if u go be prepaired to be up at 7 every morn for the mad rush of beds at 8

title: Nightmare Hotel - Cant Stress How Bad This Dysfunctional Hotel Is...
review: Stayed here for 10 nights in July15... Booked last minute and paid the price for not doing our research... Never Again!!!  The Hotel The hotel is quiet at night which is what we were looking for. The pool and sun deck area was cleaned but is far too small for the size of the hotel.  The pool and kids pool in particular can get very crowded... The stampede for the sun loungers every morning at 8am was like a scene from Braveheart... this daily gauntlet really is a sight to behold!!! By 8.05 every sun lounger is 'occupied', most of which are not sat on for the majority of the day. On more than one occasion this lead to arguments amongst guests... lifeguard and hotel staff not interested in getting involved.   The Rooms We were on the 7th floor which had great sea views. Rooms have…

title: TRG Jardin del nar
review: The staff are very helpful .hotel is very clean and tidy ,views across the bay are stunning ,pool bar food is excellent very close to all   bars within 25 yards the square 200 yards taxi rank is 100 yards you could not ask for more we will be returning soon

title: Beautiful Views and very clean!
review: We visited this hotel as a family of four in July for ten days. We paid extra for a sea view and this was worth every penny as we weren't disappointed!   We found the hotel to be very clean and the housekeeping staff to be very friendly. The staff on hotel reception were ok at best and the staff behind the pool bar could be extremely rude at times!   As many people have already said the towels on sun bed situation was ridiculous! Our boys were sleeping until 9am so we took advantage of this to have a little lie in but this  meant we were unable to find a sun bed or only one between the four of us! I understand its first come first served but the fact that people were reserving them at 8am and not returning for hours is a joke! Also people reserving sun beds for their kids who…

title: Perfect, honest review.
review: Our stay was great. We stayed in room 405 which is larger than most rooms. ( ask for a room that ends in 05 for more space). I can't really fault the hotel, the only thing I would say is that dinner is not great, we had it one night and we were not too impressed . Breakfast was lovely, with a great selection. Shout out to the lifeguard, we had some top notch banter. The beach is a 7 min walk away however a taxi there or back only costs about €3.50 for a family of 4. Solid hotel, we got s great price of around £115 per night for four with breakfast.there are ships open till 2 near by. We also got the bus to Palma one day which was lovely, the bus only costs around 3 euros per person and goes direct from Santa Ponsa to Palma.

title: lovely lovely holiday !
review: great hotel. very clean and oh !those views. Waking up every morning to see that view. Worth every penny . Hotel was very handy for the lively square which we went to every night. We would like to go again. PS ! Food was good also.

title: 👿
review: The hotel was clean but the food was poor I had my son with me and all he would eat was chips there was no kids food on the menu not even pizza or chicken nuggets if you wanted them you had to pay for them at the snack bar durning the day and I was full board and I had to eat out 10 times out off the 2 weeks

title: would not stay again
review: Check in not until 3pm.. Room very basic and below average... needs a lick of paint... door handle feel off twice... Room not cleaned and bed sheets not changed the 6 nights we were there.. €24 per item for Internet (cash only)... no in room safe... safe boxes in reception area at a cost... Food below average... Pool area not up to scratch... indoor pool closed... Dirty socks in left in lift.. and were still there a couple of hours later... Sunbeds mostly taken by 9am towel on but no bodies all day... Would not stay here again... Complained to Jet2 Holidays but they are not interested in  negative feedback.

title: Enjoyable, would go back.
review: All the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the children's entertainer and the lifeguard. 5 minute walk from the beach and also has a private pebble beach/cove right next door. Wifi is €24 and was only good for us next to the pool. Hotel is surrounded by shops and gorgeous restaurants, and next to a square where all the evening entertainment is. Overall really enjoyed myself and the staff are lovely!

title: Nightmare - Read reviews before you decide.
review: So me and my boyfriend went to this hotel with my nan, granddad, cousin and auntie, all in the age gap of 15 - 83 so I am speaking on behalf of our whole experience.  We booked our holiday with on the beach.  After going on the long transfers we turn up to the hotel and our room wasn't ready until 3, when turning up to the rooms it wasn't too bad, with a good sea view from the balcony, and the room was overly clean. I then had a shower, with water leaking all over the floor, the towels we had were then used to soak up the river that was soaking the whole of the bathroom. The next day, thinking the towels would be changed at request I went to the reception to be told i wasn't allowed new towels and we have to use the same towels for 3 days and sleep in the same bedsheets for 5.…

title: nightmare
review: stay clear of this hotel 6 euro per day per device for wifi  you can only pay in cash they wont take a bank card daily stampede at 8 every morning for sunbeds food not nice at all staff at the pool bar ignorant and rude,watch your change worst kids club i have ever seen couldnt wait to get out of this hotel

title: Honest review of Jardin del Mar
review: We have just returned from a two week trip to the Jardin del Mar.  We are a family of 4, 2 adults, 2 children aged 8 and 4.  The hotel is a bit dated and needs to be modernised.  It is clean and the cleaning staff and really pleasant and kind.  The rest of the staff at reception, in the restaurant and the pool bar appear give the impression that they hate working there.  They never appear to be happy and the guy at the pool bar can be quite rude.  We went b&b and the food was awful.  I couldn't wait to leave this hotel.  It was an absolute nightmare trying to get a sunbed, people ran out first thing in the morning to put a towel down and a lot of the time the bed were vacant for the entire day.  It was really frustrating.  While we were there somebody pooped in the pool for 5…

title: Good value for money
review: Just back for a week mid July. Booked a room with sea view for three of us and wasn't disappointed, despite reading some reviews! Reception staff very friendly and helpful, hotel clean, room clean with cracking view of sea / harbour, think you have to request sea view when booking. Went SC so never saw the dining room. Great location with the square nearby for good food and mainly good entertainment. Only slight criticism is that whilst being SC there was no oven in the cooker just a hob. This didn't bother us unduly as we ate out very cheaply every night. It's a 15 minute walk to main beach with a small, private pebble beach just down form the hotel. Never tried the wifi as most bars have their own free wifi. Would go back to this hotel, good value for money and good location,

title: Great location
review: Stayed 11 nights location brilliant, life guards great fun and very observant, room 27 very bad location, ground floor right beside lift on pool level, and looking out on the back large covers ivy wall, room out dated cleaning staff so very very nice, did not have food in hotel, not kitted out properly for self catering safe is up at reception not good, all shops restaurants in around brilliant, great walks around up hills and down hills, access to beach from hotel would return if they upgrade rooms and lower prices if giving people bad rooms, man on reception did not think I had a bad room he was quiet rude, other reception staff lovley, beautiful views from hotel

title: Excellant service
review: As I have a tough health condition to manage, my 16 year old son undertook all the travel and booking arrangements.  I must include that he is exceptionally mature and speaks Spanish very well.  I was very impressed with the service we received in the hotel, from daily cleaning maid to receptionist, from breakfast staff to swimming pool attendant.  The room was basic, but very clean and hugely appropriate for our needs; my 3 children as well as mine.  There were excellent bus services and superb sunshine occurred every day; therefore all contributed to a very relaxing 2 weeks!

title: Needs upgrading
review: Had to pay 90 euro to upgrade our room as our initial room had no view whatsoever. The balcony looked onto a wall covered in ivy and was in complete shade. The hotel is very clean and the housekeeping staff were excellent however the rooms do need updated. Had to pay for wifi and the air conditioning needs improvement. The hotel staff should also enforce their policy on people reserving sunbeds with towels then not returning for an entire day! We waited on sunbeds every day when there was around a dozen beds with towels on them and no one was actually using them all day. I would not return to this hotel as I would prefer a hotel with free wifi and better air conditioning.

title: Comfortable
review: On arrival to reception staff were very professional and friendly.We had to wait a little bit before checking in as we arrived early but were soon checked to our room which was upgraded.The room on the 1st floor (109)was in the corner and had nice views of both sea and pool.Staff at all times and in all areas of hotel were friendly and excellent.Room/kitchen/bathroom was tastefully decorated and modern with all the features and utensils you would expect.However during our stay we found after having a sleep during evening/waking next morning we had been bitten a few times.Sadly the room or bedclothes had mites in them,the well supplied towels had a stench of burnt of them and also our clothes in wardrobe were damp bordering wet when taken out to wear.The pool area was very well…

title: Beautiful Location
review: Had a lovely week at Jardin del Mar, we were a group of three families who were very worried about our visit due to reading previous negative reviews. We should never have worried as everything was perfect from beginning to end with the exception of the early morning queue and rush for sunbeds which were then left empty most days with people leaving towels on them and not returning all day (a problem the staff need to try and sort out). We had three seaview apartments on the 5th floor which had a beautiful view over the bay and were extremely clean and had everything we required including good air conditioning.  Staff were friendly with a special thank you to Receptionist Tarana.  We hope return to Jardin del Mar on our next visit.

title: GOOD HOLIDAY AT THE JARDIN DEL MAR
review: Stayed at the hotel 07/07/2015 for one week hotel was in a prime location with some very good restaurants just a short walk also close to the square for night time entertainment. The hotel staff were very good and allways on hand to help if needed our room was clean but basic but our view was of trees and more trees at the side of the hotel but for the time you spend in your room it was fine.they only small gripe i would have was the swimming pool if you were a none swimmer and under 5ft 3in you could only go into the baby pool as the big pool was to deep wich at around 35 degrees each days meant my wife could not go in so had to spend a lot of time at the beach.

title: ideal location
review: We are just back from here, the hotels location is why i returned to it for the 3rd time. I read the other reviews before i wrote this,  all of what they say is generally true. The rooms need updated and are a little on the small side , they are for 2 people comfortably, but as other reviews say, how often are you in apartment , if you are in the apartment , it will be sitting on the balcony, so make sure you get  sea view room as to wake up and see the sunrising over the bay every morning is perfection.  The cleanliness of the rooms are excellent and towels changed every day. There are a few issues with the pool, the 8am towel run, for one and the early closing at 7 is another, but the cove right beside it makes thes issues non starters. i will probably return to this and as…

title: lovely apart from a few minor problems
review: Im 22 and went with 2 of my girlfriends for a relaxed holiday. It was a great location 10 mins walk from the beach, lovely staff, wonderful food and very good for the price (7 euros for breakfast) and clean rooms. However when we booked the holiday the website states free wifi- which it ended up being 12 euros and to be honest in this day in age isn't really acceptable, especially as it said on the website otherwise. The rooms are seriously dated and require an update for example: every time we switched on our hob in our room all the electrics tripped and we had to get maintenance in because the switch wouldn't go down. Although maintenance were there straight away which is a plus. The electric is turned on using a key instead of a card, which isn't a massive problem but its…

title: Poor service.
review: My friend and I have just returned from what was supposed to be a relaxing week in the sun, NOT SO we arrived very tired and wanted to go and unpack and go straight to bed only to be told the hotel was overbooked and there was not a single room available. we are two 60 year old ladies and it is now 12.30 am the very rude night porter said wait here we will get a taxi and send you to another hotel .at 1.40am  we were given the smallest studio ever with a small settee and a drawer underneath that we had to sleep in. We were told not to come back until 11 the next day so missed our breakfast and then told to get a taxi back which the hotel paid for. The taxi driver informed us that this hotel is always doing this as they have a crossover .from the early flight to the evening…

title: Mixed age group holiday.
review: Location of the hotel is great for bars, resturants and taxis. Just a two minute walk to the taxi rank, five minutes brings you to a large square with live entertainment for all age groups. The hotel pool is on the small side for the amount of people but it's always worth a day at the beach, beds / brollys are quite expensive so take your wallet. Hotel bar did not find it pleasant or friendly.  Stayed self catering, basic equipment but you can hire extras toaster etc. Overall clean comfortable stay.

title: hotel trh jardin del mar
review: i found the hotel a bit dated very noisy .found it quieter to spend the day on the beach although in a quiet location away from entertainment and livly area of santa ponca .you could get a good breakfast across the road at arkles,

title: Fantastic value, clean, friendly & fun
review: Wonderful stay at Jardin del mar with my family. Clean rooms & pool. Great shallow pool for kids with sun loungers next to it! Excellent buffet with lots of choice! All staff friendly especially the reception team who reunited my daughter with her cat and who went above and beyond their job roles to do so! We will be forever grateful! Thank you Jardin del mar we would definitely recommend you to everyone!

title: Great location
review: just returned today 20th July from jardin del mar this place is a prime location 2minute walk from the square 10 min walk to centre of santa ponsa had activities on for kids during the day and evening intertainment in the square was fantastic tribute bands snake shows ect the Chinese restaurant facing the hotel was excellent some nice 2course meals for 8.50 euro also Mrs Murphys kitchen great food and staff alike loads of bars and restaurants to fit everybody's taste food in the hotel was bout 7/10 breakfasts to suit all had dinner here every 2-3 nights was hit and miss with the dinner so would prob go bed and breakfast next time as for the room it was basic with no kettle or toaster these can be hired at reception 10 euro each but u can also get a full English across in Arkles…

title: great holiday hotel room situation bad
review: No complaints about service. Food very good ,plenty variety and always fresh. The Hotel was situated in a good position only a short walk to the beach. It was advertised as family and couple friendly but I found that the pool area cramped and only once in the week actually managed to get a sun lounger a lot being "saved" by families but not actually being used. unfortunately I did not book a sea view room and was given a side sea view on the bottom floor as far away from the sea as was possible with a beautiful view of a thirty foot high wall covered in ivy!!!  Also being on the bottom floor those lucky enough to be on a higher floor were able to throw their unwanted rubbish and cigarette ends over their balconies and get them on to our balcony. Lovely!!! The room was basic but…

title: Nice Stay
review: Just returned from a week's stay and really enjoyed our stay. Had so many problems with Jet2 and just about everything connected with the holiday but the hotel was great and certainly did the job. My only gripe really about the hotel is the situation with sunbeds!!! If your not up and out by 8 you'll struggle to get a sunbed for the day. Not sure what the solution is but having to get up at that time whilst on holiday is pretty annoying but had to be done.  The rooms are basic but again do the job, we were told we'd have a sea room side view which would have been great if we weren't on the ground floor - we had a view of a bush, again this was jet2's promise and not the hotel as we couldn't be moved due to them being full.  The pool is great and the kids virtually stayed in it…

title: A dissapointing stay.
review: Me and my children went for 7 nights self catering and found the hotel room to be a disappointment. As we were self catering there was no oven, toaster or grill, we only has a whistling kettle and two very slow electric rings. If you want a cup of coffee you'd have to wait at least 3-4 hours to fully boil. Another option was to hire a kettle and toaster at 10 euros each, we were not expecting this as we were self catering.  The room was very dated and not what was shown in the brochures etc, desperate need of updating. The beds were uncomfortable and very hard to sleep on. On the up side we did have English channels on the TV. The room was very clean and the housekeepers and reception staff were very kind.  As we were on the ground flour we had no sea view, even though we paid…

title: Great location
review: Just back from a lovely week in THR Jardine del mar. We took out 5 year old grandson for a weeks holiday we had a great time.staff room pool all fantastic.good entertainment nearby in the square and nice restaurant's.

title: Best location ever
review: Just litterly back now from Santa ponsa the hotel is located in a great area right beside the square my grandson loved the pool area and made some good friends the only minus was. My daughter hired a toaster and microwave but had to carry it up to her room and then drop it back to reception again we will be going back again in October can't wait

title: Average
review: Just Back from two weeks here.... Apartments are basic and clean, but are certainly not 'Self-Catering'- Toasters & Electric Kettles are available to hire at a cost of 10 Euro each per week - These items are not provided in your apartment!!  'Free Wi-Fi' is another myth - Wifi costs 24 Euro per week. The Pool - is small and overcrowds very quickly, despite several notices poolside stating floats are not permitted in the pool, this is completely disregarded and makes for dangerous scenarios in an already overcrowded pool. There is a life guard who sits under a sun umbrella out of sight of the pool - over a three day period the only time I saw him move was when he went in search of sun beds for females wanting to sunbath - he blatantly removed towels from other sunbathers beds and…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Stayed in jardin del mar for one week from 13th June. I cannot fault this hotel. We had the most amazing view over the bay on our roof top balcony from room 615. It was the exclusive apartment.  We stayed on a half board basis and cannot fault either the breakfast or evening meals, plenty of choice, all fresh and well presented. The location of this hotel is excellent. It's literally a 2 minute walk to Santa ponsa square  i will certainly be going back and would recommend it to anyone. Hope this review helps as there have been negative comments in the past from people who want 5 star accommodation at 3 star prices.

title: Fab hotel-amazing location
review: Stayed here with some friends and didn't have a clue what to expect, was plesantly surprised! The view from our balcony was breathtaking, the location was ideal! About a ten minute walk from the main beach and centre of Santa Ponsa, as well as opposite a Spar which was reasonable with a range of food and souvenirs, and next to a taxi (only a ten minute taxi journey to magaluf, always taxis there as well!)  Wifi isn't free, and you pay a price per device, 12 euros for three days, 24euros for a week, was relatively ok and you had wifi by the pool too. Room couldn't have been cleaner, plus the cleaners came everyday. although room was basic, it's all you needed and had a TV with some English channels. Room was also larger than expected and beds were comfy.  Staff were super…

title: 10Days in July
review: Stayed for ten days upon in July with my partner, upon arrival room was ready and hotel is immaculately clean , the room is very basic but you get what you pay for but I didn't mind as it was so clean and we got sea views as requested and fresh towels everyday. Unfortunately the pool is a little cramped in July but the private beach is beautiful . It's within walking distance of  everything and thee reception has all the info needed . The staff weren't the friendliest iv come across , the food in hotel is average its fine for breakfast but not for dinner, the hotel is very near a great pub called hogan stand. And Indian opposite is gorgeous . The  hotel advertises free wifi but  that is not the case as you have to pay daily. 5/10

title: great location
review: just returned from a group holiday staying in this hotel,location ideal overlooking the sea only a short walk to the square for evening entertainment, the food not great but they put a table foe 19 of us to dine together which I thought was a nice touch. rooms adequate although best view is over pool and sea to the back of hotel, overall clean with a lovely view and pool but self catering facilities terrible

title: Family hotel not for couples
review: We are still at this hotel and have been pushed out from round the pool full of families with children which most parents seem to abandon to sun bathe all day. There is no adult entertainment. Our room is lovely with sea view fairly clean, there is a kettle which you put on electric ring food is ok not brilliant if we were ever to return would nook room only, but won't be going back due to the amount of children and teenagers.

title: very disappointed 😞 j
review: Just back from a week in the jardin del Mar.The front and lobby of the hotel is grand.The rooms a very basic but clean.The thing that annoyed me so much about this hotel was.After paying for your hotel you expect to find the essential's in a self catering apartment.But it isn't you have to hire a kettle and a toaster an iron at a cost.And the air conditioning was awful.on of the days we were there it reached 42 degrees.It says a lit about the air con when they also hire out fans.my niece was with us and they charged  €24 for the week for WiFi..I love Santa ponsa but not the jardin del Mar.😢.

title: Fantastic Staff
review: Just returned from brillant holiday in Santa Ponsa where we had the pleasure of staying in Jardin Del Mar,rooms were spotless and the one little hiccup we had was rectified straight away,can,t praise the staff enough,yesterday i was trying to print my boarding passes out and the receptionist went out of his way to help,they were all very pleasant and helpful and today i had the disaster of leaving a bag behind when we left for airport containing valuble items which the staff retrieved and handed back to our friends with all items totally intact,we were so lucky!Can,t wait to nxt year o return,Brillant hotel with lovely sea views,deffo recommmended

title: Holiday
review: Had a fantastic holiday . The hotel was lovely. The pool great ,nice rooms .would definitely return to this hotel but would choose a front sea view next time .location was perfect just around the corner from the square perfect for a family holiday .

title: Ok hotel
review: Hotel is clean and a nice place to base your hol , it's in an ideal place for families right next to the square but a 15 min walk to main beach. The walls in room are paper thin though so u can hear everything from the next room. It's a typical 3 star Spanish hotel .

title: One of the nicest hotels
review: Did not book to stay at this hotel but was moved to here due to overbooking at another  Really nice hotel with spectacular views over the bay  Great food and lots of choice  One drawback though its location  Set on a rather steep hill the view would take away your breath if the walk up the hill had not left you breathless

title: Family holiday
review: I am currently staying at this hotel good but needs updating also air con is rubbish I am staying on the 7 th floor which is roasting air con not worth having on kitchen could be doing with getting updated as well pool area fine didn't eat in hotel so can't comment WiFi supposed to be free but its not better round at other side of bay more places to eat out we are just back from a weekend in the Sorrento and that was brilliant

title: June 15th - June 29th 2015
review: Hotel good , room ok needs upgrading but how long to you stay in your room on holiday ! We were in room 22 balcony facing a hedge. Wifi not great don't know whether it's because we were in the basement. Food good plenty of choice, always something we would eat. Walking distance to the square

title: Good Apartments
review: Good room overlooking pool and bay. Aircon was great kept the rooms cool and a lot less noisy than some. Great view over the bay. Never ate at the restaraunt but the food at the pool was good. Never saw much activities going on.

title: Basic
review: We went here in May it was a very clean hotel and basic enough. It didn't have a lot of entertainment but maybe because it was still early. Staff are very friendly the square in Santa ponsa is literally a two minute walk away! Hotel it's self wasn't that busy. Pool area was very quite I think this hotel is more for family's.

title: good for familys
review: Rooms were clean and tidy and all the basics you would expect Air con not great. OK at best. This place looks like it was made for children. When we went there were loads about all jumping in and out of the pool all day. Life guard on all day. There was also loads of activities for them. Staff were all nice and food was good.

title: Jot
review: Stayed at the jardin 15-22june our 4th time at this hotel, this year have all new sun loungers a new activity programme we didnt participate but looked like plenty to keep people occupied  for all ages.staff are very polite and welcoming and very helpful as they have been on each of our stays we cant ever fault any time weve been.. no thefts or miserable staff ever.the location is perfect for us as is near to everything and easy walking distance to most places.. we stayed in room 708 we always book a full sea view  request higher floor with travel agent fantastic views of the bay..rooms cleaned daily fresh towels every other day..we didnt eat at the hotel as like to pick restaurants we like and lots of lovely restaurants in santa ponsa.. but other guests said it was quite…

title: Was OK
review: We stayed here in August 2014 Self Catering - the room we had was ok but very basic and we were on the bottom floor more like the basement,we had NO view what so ever apart from a brick wall with leaves on it - very disappointed!! Also the wifi did not reach down to the bottom floor so was a waste of money.  We could never get a sun longer ever they were always taken - we spent everyday at the beach- the holiday was fab but i wouldn't stay here again for the price we paid.

title: quiet peaceful hotel
review: We stayed here in June 2015 for 10 nights.  The rooms are basic but ok, we requested ground floor and they granted this with also giving us a fantastic sea view.  We went half board and found the food ok but there was a few off nights - fish full of bones.  The childrens entertainers was great, in the afternoons they would do painting and sculpture making and some nights they would do a disco, musical chairs etc, they was fantastic with my children isabella and jacob.  The beach is about 15 min walk but worth it, the sea is lovely and very safe for young children mine are 3 and 4.  There is a entertainment square 5 mins away and they have live bands/acts on which was good.  The rooms were cleaned often and towels replaced every 2 days if not everyday.  I hope the hotel see this…

title: Hotel was ok
review: Stayed at this hotel for a week in 2008. Dropped off by bus hotel reception was clean and the staff checked us in quiet easily. Went up to our apartment and it was a little dated in decor and had a small strange little kitchen. Three of us staying in the apartment which to be honest was a little tight on space but three friends there to go out and party we didn't spend much time in the apartment anyway so it was ok for us. Two singles beds in bedroom and a couch that acted as a bed it did fine.  Apartment was clean and we had plenty of hot water for our showers. Nice big balcony to have a few drinks on before we went out or to just relax on after we spent the day being burnt by the heat, one day it hit 40 degrees.  The pool area was busy but we still had enough space to swim.…

title: Quite good, but could be better
review: Just returned from a short break at the Jardin del Mar and on the whole my friend and I had an enjoyable time. The location of the hotel is excellent, being in close proximity to reasonably priced restaurants and the sea views are beautiful. The downside for us was people putting towels on the sunbeds round the pool early in the morning and not occupying them until some time later, despite notices stating this was not allowed. One day we couldn't get one at all and we were only staying for 4 days. Also children and teenagers were constantly jumping into the pool and using large lilos and playing ball games making it impossible to swim,while the lifeguard watched and did nothing. Apart from that, the rooms are very clean and the breakfast is a very good buffet with proper…

title: very enjoyable
review: The hotel was lovely, staff very friendly couldnt do enough.  This is the first time we went self catering and really loved the freedom of it.  There is a great wee supermarket just 2 minutes from the hotel which was very reasonabilly priced.  The hotel is only a five minute walk to the bars etc.  Only down side to it was the beds they are very hard and not that comfortable but apart from that top class

title: jardin del mar review
review: went to this hotel may11.great hotel ,great pool area,really enjoyed it staff very good,hotel was only half full so no problems getting sun beds,short walk to the square for bars and shops,sea views were fantastic ,will be going again in september,had a great time

title: Animation team
review: Vakaris, Lithuania. Animation team is super and very friendly (Alba and Patrick) ! 😀 In hotel is clear, near supermarkets, no noise. Also can get all of information in reception if You need. From geographic side here is best destination targets.

title: Value for money & Spotlessly clean!
review: Stayed here for 1 week, we had a sea view which was fantastic the view is lovely! We were B&B which we didn't use as the food was awful however there is an abundance of lovely eateries which we visited and thoroughly enjoyed! The hotel is spotless and the maids cleaned our room regularly....The rooms are basic however they are well maintained and have everything you need. Beware however you cannot check in until 3pm! no matter what time you arrive which we weren't informed of before arrival! There are safety deposit boxes located in reception which has a small charge. I would definalty book this hotel again simply because it is located well and very clean but we will only be coming as self catering.

title: lovely holiday
review: just got back from this hotel it was fab hotel lovely and clean there are no kettles or toasters in room but you can rent them  dont pay for wifi go across road to bars its free definately go back the weather was to hot but plenty shade round hotel not far from town and round the corner from the square showing tribute bands every night very good  two bars across road from hotel very good cant remeber name of one its an oldish couple who run it they r lovely and nx door arkels lovely food  and they mske brill sandwiches you to take airport

title: All good and a fair price
review: Just got back back from a weeks stay at this hotel. We were staying on a half board basis, food was good but I thought it leant itself towards a continental pallette, although the breakfast was very good with full English available. All meals were served buffet style. The rooms were kept spotless regular towel and bed linen changes. The kids loved the swimming pool. Although not in the centre (10 minute walk away) there was plenty going on around the hotel supermarkets, bars etc. on the door step. Very enjoyable holiday, and I would stay there again.

title: Good hotel, good location
review: I stayed at the jardin de mar with my two friends, hotel was perfect for what we wanted. Clean rooms, staff were really friendly. Pool was really nice, really good location. Hotel is on the main road of Santa ponsa so there's plenty of local restaurants and it's right next to the music square which holds entertainment durning peak season. Beds are not the most comfortable. Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the beach. Overall a really good hotel for the price and great location. I would recommend.

title: what a beautiful hotel
review: we were moved here after being put in a very noisy hotel full of stag and hen do . This hotel was a joy very clean and the staff was very helpful It was in a lovely setting with plenty shops and cafe/restaurants . We did try the breakfast at the hotel good quality food and a vary food choice

title: Okay
review: Booked self catering for one week, thankfully we were out to spoil ourselves with eating out as kitchenette very poor... Hotel had no toasters for guests... Had to upgrade to seaview as first room was overlooking car park even though we booked sea view... When booking beware, no safe box in rooms, based in reception area of hotel for daily charge... Only young female and young make at reception were nice, two older men arrogant and rude... Outside hotel was fab and minutes walk from beautiful beach, restaurants and shops. Would return to area but don't think I'd go back to hotel.. Wifi is crap

title: Good budget hotel
review: Stayed here as a couple 7-24 May . Good budget hotel Only  complaint  was that our sheets not changed for whole of our stay which is unusual!Usually stay here may  and September each year .Does  need updating as rooms are tired and need new kitchen and furniture. Towels changed regularly.

title: Great room for price
review: This is our 2nd year at this hotel and have no problems, we go self catering so can't comment on food. We go  late May time as it's not to busy, but don't think I would go in height oh season as round po area would b to busy for me. All staff are very friendly , as are the restaurants n bars. Only a small walk to the square where there is nightly entertainment starting from June . Definitely  b back again .

title: good location
review: Stayed early May 15,2 adults.Overall a good hotel in an nice location within easy walking to resort centre & beach.1 bed appartment quite small & I would'nt consider it suitable for more than 2 adults &  1 small child.We were given a side sea view appt which was really awful as it over looked a car park and you would have to lean out over bacony to get a glimpse of sea! Had to pay an additional 70 euro to move to front sea view appt which I was annoyed about as hotel was quite empty, with two floors actually not in use that week.View from front appts fantastic but you would need to be very careful when booking.Beds comfortable & overall appt comfortable & clean.Poolside well maintained & good lunch menu at poolside cafe.

title: Ok
review: this apartment has a lovely setting right on the edge of the sea, but a fair wee walk if yr a beach person rather than the pool.there where plenty of loungers and for once we didn't have to run the national every am to get a sunbed although I was staying in mid May it might be different in high season. The rooms are basic but clean with good maid service and plenty of clean towels. I had no intention of self catering so for me this didn't raise too many probs but if u do plan to s.c. They are sadly lacking, no electric kettle,toaster, microwave grill or oven. All u have is too hot plates which take an age to boil enough water for two cups of tea, I think if u pay more u can hire some of these items. One big prob for me the beds as mentioned in previous reviews are as hard as the…

title: Clarkies
review: Just great we loved the view and the hotel was near to everything you need  Beach 15 mins walk but little cove in front of hotel very nice for a swim in the sea! We found the pool area clean and kept very nice no problems with sun beds great holiday think we shall visit again one day Wifi only free for 30mins so not free really It cost €24 for a week but only works on one item! We didn't eat at hotel so cannot comment

title: nice hotel
review: nice hotel with lovely views over the bay if you book a sea view room.  breakfast is good and the reception staff are very friendly it is right next to the square but this in only open in summer.  we will return next year

title: Good
review: Stayed here for1 week in April/ May 152 adults/2 kids.  clean hotel cannot fault  Location good No entertainment was only downfall Rooms cleaned daily with New towels n bedding every 3 day's. Lovely sea view room

title: Great for the price
review: Lovely stay! the staff were so helpful and very friendly  rooms are very clean and their is great views I would say if they were closer too activities and done some evening entertainment they would be close too 5*

title: Not Bad!
review: Just returned from a short break at the 3 star Jardin Del Mar in Santa Ponsa. Santa Ponsa is a really nice place and the hotel is situated in a nice peaceful part of the town, with great views from the balcony of Santa Ponsa Bay, which is beautiful. The hotel is clean and the staff are helpful and they have the added benefit of the kitchen if you need it. We stayed half board and unfortunately the food was very basic and there was limited choice. After trying the breakfast and the dinner on day 1 we decided to eat out for the rest of the trip, we are not fussy people but just felt the choice was limited with cold soup etc. I would stay here, as the prices are very good but would just go for room only. We did however find a lovely little cafe close by called 'casa Andressa' a…

title: Nice Hotel
review: Travelled as a family with daughter, 3 year old grandson and stayed on a self-catering basis.  First impression good  - friendly and informative man on reception.  We were allocated adjacent apartments which was appreciated. Accommodation suited our needs as we only had breakfasts there and ate out for other meals.  Small kitchenette with basic crockery and utensils.  There was a kettle which could be heated on the two ring hob or alternatively an electric kettle and toaster could be hired from reception. There is a large supermarket across the road from the hotel which stocks cereals, milk, fresh fruit etc.  We also found a nice bakery nearby which opened at 09:00 selling fresh bread, warm croissants and pastries.  We had rooms on the 6th floor which had side sea view.Outdoor…

title: good accommodation
review: we stayed here for a week the apartments are a good base to stay near enough to beach and town but not right in the middle to be noisy as most reviews say a sea view is a must lovely views went half board but if we stay again it would be bed and breakfast, breakfast was fine not to sure about the evening meals if you expect rooms cleaned and your beds made not a place to stay was quite shocked at lack of towels changed (once every 3 days ) not good also the beds where never made i make my own not a problem for me but a 3 * apart-hotel !! the facility's for self catering are two rings that's it kettle and toaster are charged for per week at ten euros the bar prices are extortionate two small beers 4 euro 20 wondered why the bar was empty no evening entertainment  over the road a…

title: Outside is better than inside
review: Hotel looks good from out side but inside is very dated. Pine louvre doors in bedrooms, safety deposit boxes are in some rooms but no keys are available, safety boxes in reception are very small. Beds are very hard and uncomfortable.On the whole staff are very friendly but bar service during the day is terrible, you can wait up to 20 mins for someone to appear! Indoor and outdoor pools are good and the area around them is clean and tidy.View from the terrace looks out over the bay and is great. Signage for amenities is not very clear as reception is on the 4th floor and pool area, dining room and bar is on floor grd floor very confusing at first.Shops , cash point bars and taxis are less than 5 mins away and there is a lovely walk along the cove to resort centre. I would stay…

title: Looks nicer from outside
review: Good basic hotel would go early or late season but wouldn't fancy it in the real heat of summer poor aircon and dated rooms you have to hire everything if s-c the staff not very pleasant either location very good next to bars cafes and the square

title: Great apartments in ideal location with fab views
review: We have stayed in these apartment numerous times as we like being up near the square. Everything you need is on your door step and the beach is just a 15 min walk away. The entertainment at the square is brilliant when the live shows are on which is normally June to September. The pool area at the hotel is great and the rooms are basic but have everything you need. Pay extra for a sea view as the views over the bay are great.

title: great apartments with stunning views across the bay
review: Stayed here as a couple from end of March to April 4th. The rooms are basic but very clean with comfy beds.The views from the room are out of this world,stunning. The staff on reception were lovely and very helpful.  Cant comment on the food as we were self catering and always ate out as it is so cheap to do so.The rooms are cleaned on all but 2 out of 7 days a week and always plenty of loo rolls, fresh towels left out. The pool area is large and clean with new sun loungers being put out as we arrived. There is a kettle in the room that you boil on the ring, but you can hire a kettle and toaster if you prefer. The hotel itself is very clean, well kept and managed. For the price we paid we could not fault this hotel and would recommend it as long as you are not expecting 5 star…

title: Lovely Hotel and stay
review: Went to Santa Ponsa with my partner for his birthday and stayed at the Jardin Del Mar... Lovely hotel, our room was nice, yes it was basic, but it was clean, we weren't planning on staying in the room much!  The view from terrace was amazing.. Absolutely loved sunbathing there.   Santa Ponsa is gorgeous, the scenery was beautiful, I think we fell in love with the place.   So many nice bars and restaurants all walking distance, we met some lovely people.   This place is gonna be our secret hideaway... Can't wait to go back!

title: Good hotel. Sea view is a MUST.
review: A must is a sea view else you will be looking at bushes for your stay. Late check out room extension is offered but unlikely  due to being fully booked. Out off season no pool bar. outdoor pool was freezing. Games for the children poor. Broken xbox game. Pool table ate your money without giving you the balls.  Breakfast was very good. Kitchen very basic but had fridge and air conditioning.  Would return but in season next time. We  visited there very early April

title: Nice hotel
review: Can't fault this hotel at all.room was nice and clean,bed was fine.its in a great location.5 mins from all the bars n clubs.directly next door is a supermarket where you can get everything you need.the beach is a 10 min walk as well.santa ponsa as a place is lovely and I will deffo be coming back

title: Beautiful scenery
review: Would advise if a sea view is important to you, do not opt for partial seaview. I made this mistake with our initial booking, and on arrival discovered our balcony overlooked dense shrubbery!We were fortunately able to upgrade our room to a seaview room for a reasonable €30.Comfortable apartment, albeit basic. Could possibly do with a little 'TLC' but really cannot grumble considering what we paid for our 4 night stay. Clean and tidy pool area. Problems with a couple of entertainment items eating up money and not working, but money was refunded with no quibbles, and maintenance were informed. Due to visiting before the season really got going, there was no evening entertainment and pool bar not open. Not really an issue for us. Several choices of breakfast ranging from standard…

title: Great hotel
review: I was here on a lads holiday and the hotel service was great. The bar by the pool & pool table was a nice touch as we could enjoy a beer in the sun outside the hotel. The rooms were cleaned daily and the staff were easy to talk to. The only downside was the look of the room itself - a completely different style to the outside.

title: Good all rounder
review: This was a nice stay and a purpose function hotel as I like to call it. It had a bed and provided food. Job done.  It's not a hotel I would go to if I was to stay there and not intend to leave the resort. It is however situated in a lovely part of the island so that walks to the town, beach and nightlife isn't difficult. Plenty of things going on and a short drive from nearby places if you want to explore the island.  Family wise it's good as they cater for children. We were provided with a travel cot, there was use of a highchair in the restaurant and they were always friendly and polite. It's quite quiet so if you don't want rowdy in your hotel it works, but for larger groups who have a sitter with them or grandparents on hand the local nightlife isn't too bad either.  Would…

title: Better than we expected
review: Having read earlier reviews of this hotel, we arrived with very limited expectations. Especially we were very concerned about the reports of high risk for theft. We were part of a Group of over 20 persons; but none of us had any problems in this direction, so the problem may be controlled by now? The rooms are nice and functional, if a little "worn". We had separate bedroom and a kitchenette, which gave us a fridge to store our wine and sangria in. The room had a large balcony, where we could sit every evening after sunset with our drink. When the sun was up, the balcony was too hot for comfort. The breakfast was varied and abundant. The buffet dinner was large and had enough possibilities to make sure, nobody starved. The dishes varied from day to day. There was a pool-bar,…

title: Don't expect too much
review: Just returned from a week at the jardin del mar. When we arrived it looked like a 5 star hotel from the front. Unfortunately the rooms were only 2 star at best with a very poorly equiped kitchen and the room was very tired looking and in the need of a 60 minute makeover. The pool was nice with great views and a real nice cove at the bottom of the steps. The indoor pool was closed until 1/11/14 regardless of the weather but luckily the weather was good. The hotel will charge you for anything they can ie toaster, wifi, kettle, coffee maker, iron and the use of the sauna at €10 an hour. So if you don't expect too much you won't be dissapointed. Santa ponsa is a great resort with some great pubs and restaurants. So as most of the reviews say, you get what you pay for. Would of…

title: a good hotel in a good location
review: Our trip to this hotel got to a bad start. On arrival staff said they had no rooms, other guests were being shipped off to other hotels only to reappear a few days later. Clearly something went wrong with their booking system.  We were offered a sub standard room, possibly staff quarters which we refused. Only a lot of negotiating and a stand off resulted in the reception staff finally producing a set of keys for the room type we had originally booked. Clearly we were being lied to. Also the supervisor or manager, a dark haired female possibly named ester was hard work, rude and difficult to deal with at this time. The remainder of our stay at the hotel was enjoyable, with the pool area in particular well attended, clean and offering great views across Santa Ponsa bay. We only…

title: great holiday
review: stayed here in june a lovely hotel very friendly great sea views close to the square entertainment every night nice pool not far from beach & shops only down side no electric kettle or toaster microwave in apartment as we were self catering but lots of places to eat out and about recommend going to mctavishes for some evening entertainment

title: Great Hotel for Price
review: Upon arrival at this hotel we were greeted by the hotel staff who were very friendly, we were given the keys to Apartment 131, when we entered the room it was a very basic layout it was a nice apartment, so we settled into enjoy our holiday, that's when the problem started. The problem was we were right next door to the air condition machines which was making noises every five minutes and it was very loud, we put up with this for our 1st night, then we went to reception next morning.  After meeting the receptionist a lovely lady called Esther we explained our situation, Esther was very helpful spoke excellent English and was sympathetic to our needs, by that afternoon Esther had found us a new room with a pool/sea view and at no extra cost.  So we moved rooms to this lovely…

title: Recent Stay
review: Just back from a week in Santa Ponsa and stayed at the above hotel. Based on price we were not expecting too much but have to say we were really impressed with the hotel and facilities and location. Had a really great time here. Just one small complaint and that was the mattresses were a little bit hard

title: pleasantly surprised.
review: We are staying here at the moment and apart from no air conditioning it is ok.
