There is a fan but it isn't air conditioning and it is very hot in the room at night.(about 24'- 25' ) which is unbearable to sleep in,but you gets what you pay for and it is a very cheap break so that's it. Apart from that beds are good, room is fine and all in all a good holiday. We would return but a bit later so it would be cooler at night.

title: Not good at all
review: We stayed here for a week and we didn't like it at all. We didn't expect anything more than 3 stars hotel, but still it was a big disappointment. Only thing we liked was a pool, it was very nice and beautiful. Also a nice beach was next to the hotel. (But sometimes you can smell cat pee quite strongly haha) . Service was so bad, they were so rude for us and you need to pay extra about everything. (Wifi 24e/per week for one machine, you need to buy more if you have for example laptop and phone) toaster was 10 euros per week, safety box was extra etc. You also need to bring own towel to the pool area and if you wanna use kitchen you need to do your dishes by yourself and buy soap etc also. Doing dishes was okay of course but I think it is weird you need to buy cleaning equipments.…

title: lovely hotel
review: stayed here for a few days 5-7oct it was very nice rooms were basic but clean everythink you need ,the 1st room we were given looked over a car park so went and asked for a sea view it was a extra 10euros a day but well worth it looked over the pool and the view was just super we went half board could not fault the food everythink was lovely and hot the only dissapointment was there was no entertainment so walked into santa ponsa plenty going on there  the staff were all friendly and very helpfull would go back again

title: Honestly honest review
review: If you're expecting 5 star accommodation you won't get it, but what you get is a very good 3 star with faults, those being: hard beds, leaf blowers being used early morning, pool beds that need replacing, some updating of the rooms and a few other things that wouldn't go amiss. The thing is if you think along the lines of Ryanair or Easyjet this is the equivalent - everything you need for a basic holiday is there but if you want a bit more go to the reception and hire it (though they are a bit pricey) like the internet access which costs 6 euros for 1 day, 12 for 3 days and 24 for the week. The rooms themselves only require some basic upgrading, like a bit of paint here and there and the odd tile needing replaced, but they are cleaned almost every day. The views from the…

title: Amazing hotel but please change the beds!!!
review: Can't really fault this aparthotel for the price you pay it is perfect and has a spectacular view of the bay. The pool is also one of the nicest of the many hotels. Did not try the food at the hotel so cannot comment on that. Only thing which is a pretty big negative for me was the beds were INCREDIBLY uncomfortable. I slept on the sofa for the 4 days we were there and i'm not sure i could've coped with a week in the rock hard bed. Its the only thing that would put me off returning.

title: Lovey Holiday
review: Spent a week at this hotel from 13 - 20 Sept on a B &B basis with my family. The apartments are completely functional if a little on the small side, I wouldn't like to see a family of 4 in one however ideal for 3 people. The location is ideal and the view is absolutely amazing. The pool was great and my 4 year old niece had a ball, I was pleasantly surprised about how warm the water was having holidayed in Santa Ponsa before at this time of year and the pool was freezing so we all made good use of the facilities. The staff were very helpful and always did their best to help however it was felt that you could have anything as long as you paid extra for it! The air conditioning was terrible and my sister asked for a fan for which she had to pay a deposit of €10 which was fine but…

title: Lovely place to stay
review: Booked this very much at the last minute.   Was well impressed by the location and by the standard of the apartment.   The swimming pool was lovely; we never had any problem getting a sunbed.   The little cove near the hotel offered rocky beach and bathing; nice for snorkelling, and the town beach 10 minutes away was sandy and suitable for children.   Plenty of restaurants, shops and entertainment nearby.   Staff helpful.   No problems with security while we were there.

title: A nice holiday
review: we stayed here late August for 9 days in room 417. Beautiful views of the pool and bay. Room was  a decent size with everything we needed a, although had to hire a fan in addition to the air con as very hot. Didnt hear of any burgalaries, however we did hire safe in reception , and a couple of times we left our door ajar, security knocked on to check which was reassuring.  The hotel is in a fab spot , close to ammenities. We had b&b and i can actually say it was ok, plenty of choice , all fresh , cannot comment on evening meal. Didn t experince a stampede for sunbeds, although if u want the best spots , as of anywhere , u need to be up early (8.30am) but we never struggled to get beds. Overall , a lovely holiday and i have to say i was dubious after reading some of the reviews,…

title: Basic
review: First impression was a bit disappointing. We found the one bed rooms to be basic at best. The facilities in the hotel however did meet our expectation of a typical 3* Spanish hotel. Pool area very nice (be prepared to be under starters orders for a sunbed!) dining area perfectly satisfactory. Friendly staff at 24hr reception.  Didn't see any evening entertainment which was no loss as santa ponsa has plenty to offer. The star of the show for us was the stunning view due to the location of the hotel.

title: Great holiday
review: Stayed here for a week at the end of August 2014 and thought the hotel was great, it was kept clean and the staff was only to happy to help out should you have any queries. The pool side bar staff even placed a plate of chips on our table the first day as we had been drinking at the bar for a short while, something they didn't have to do. They were also very friendly with the kids and made us all more than welcome.  We were self-catering and found a very good newly opened English bar called The Tuc-Inn, the food was amazing as well as the staff, but we also ate at the pool side which was also very good for bar food.  The room was small but hey we weren't in it for long when it's 37 degrees heat and your on holiday your normally out and about (we too are a family of 4), as for…

title: Honest review so please read.
review: We arrived and our room was ready we had a pool/sea view front facing the view  was lovely and I'm glad we chose this as many people were complaining about the side  seaview rooms facing walls and no  sea view at all  The room is quite small for a family of 4 and the air conditioning is the worst I've ever had in a hotel since going abroad they must know this as you can hire a fan from reception for 10 euro for a week and there were less than adequate we hired 2 and still couldn't sleep in the rooms. Good thing was the English channels on the TVr cleaner never cleaned our room just emptied the bin and gave us fresh towels. Sheets were not changed in 10  days.  The sunbed situation isn't as bad as people say we always got one whatever time we went down however i put a lilo down…

title: Great holiday! Lovely hotel
review: Stayed here with my family, 4 of us in a room which was a bit of a squeeze but it was a lovely room and was very clean with fresh towels every day.  We never ate at the hotel but simply because we ate out for all our meals. We didn't enjoy the square opposite the hotel as it was all Irish bars and very 'English'. We went round the road to the right where there were a lot more pubs and restaurants which were nice.  The beach was amazing in Santa ponsa and we spent most days there. The pool was nice but there was a lot of young children and you had to get up very early if you wanted sunbeds.  Overall a nice family holiday and would stay here again. You get what you pay for. I read bad reviews and was pleasantly surprised to find that they weren't true at all!

title: Family holiday
review: This has been our second visit to this hotel. We were there for one week 20th August 2014.We had three grandchildren ,son daughter in law + daughter, and I can honestly say we had a great week.We found the staff very pleasant and friendly. The accommodation basic but kept very clean with fresh towels and bed linen daily. I would certainly return again.

title: Average holiday
review: I visited here with my parents and younger sister for 10 nights this month (August 2014).  We were staying half board here and enjoyed the different food choices each evening and full english every morning. However we did feel like the staff weren't very friendly and never smiled once!  The rooms were very basic and we had to try create more space as the room was too small for 4 people. We had to put one of the sofa beds in the bedroom which even then was a squeeze! The bathroom was nice but the rest could do with modernising. The air conditioning we thought was quite poor and the room was always warm. We had our towels and sheets changed twice, however the cleaning in general we didn't find had been done well at all!  The pool area was alright however lack of sun beds and you…

title: Excellent location and service
review: A very good hotel. Some modernisation needed but overall the location and service was excellent.  Air conditioning struggled! Not sure about the security comments on here as we had no fears or concerns. Very safe we felt. Very close to the sea front with extensive sea views. You get what you pay for sea view wise and we feel we got very good value for money as we paid for a front sea view. The lack of sun beds needs addressing as it seams the only way to be sure of one is to get up at 8.30am and throw your towel over it and then go back to bed! They would be much better not letting guests reserve them in this way! It didn't bother us though however! Good service at reception and pool bar food service very good.

title: U GET WOT U PAY FOR...SIMPLES!!
review: Stayed for a week from 20th Aug to 27th and I paid for 2 adults and 2 children £1400!!! I have no complaints about the hotel wot so ever...now if I'd had paid 3 grand or similar I would have a few disputes n complaints to submit!!!  But come on its 3★...yes it may b a tad dated but so wot!!! It's was immaculately clean...towels changed everyday n plenty left for a family...The reception staff were fantastic...none of them were rude or nasty to me in fact I thought they went out of their way to please u...on arrival I'd booked a side sea view room as this was the only option left, but wen they gave me the key 128 I immediately asked for an upgrade as I so wanted to b on the front facing the bay. I paid €150 to upgrade and this thoroughly made my holiday...room 507 was amazing!!!…

title: Good value for money
review: After reading a few bad reviews was dubious to say the least, however, had a fabulous time at jardin del mar.There were three of us on the ground floor with a side sea view which was obscured by bushes but it was okay.Air conditioning worked so we were comfortable on an evening.Brilliant location ten minutes from the beach but had our own little cove which we went to most days.Food in restaurant was nice and waiters were pleasant. Maid service was excellent.Towels changed every day and rooms cleaned. Cannot fault the cleanliness.The square up the road had entertainment every night and plenty bars serving cocktails, beer etc... The only gripe we had whilst staying there was the other British guests.They hogged the sunbeds at eight in the morning covering them with towels so you…

title: Fabulous holiday
review: We arrived (my in-laws, mum, husband our son and I) on the 8/8/14. I was a little nervous as I had read previous reviews regarding thefts from hotel rooms. I was (before reading those) going to take my iPad like we always do when we go to Greece, but I decided to leave it at home and take the iPod touch instead.  We had an apartment which is a kitchenette, bathroom, lounge with sofa bed, bedroom with 2 single beds and an extra fold up single bed. We had room 527 (level 5) the view was the back of the shops up the hill but that didn't bother us as we booked late and spend most of the day out anyway!! The kitchen has an electric hob and a kettle which took at least 10 minutes to boil. You can rent a kettle and iron for around €10. The food was fabulous. We have always had self…

title: Overbooked no room on arrival, Santa ponsa lovely, TRH Never again
review: Booked here for 12 days, 11 nights in August, 3 adults, 1 teenager. On arrival told hotel were overbooked and we had no room, we were told it happens alot and 10 others had been moved that week, we were eventually sent to another lower star inland hotel and told to come back the next day and they will find a room ! Bear in mind we booked this months ago as a family holiday Tarana on reception showed no regret about how our holiday was not off to the best start, she was rude and smirked & shrugged her shoulders and said there was nothing they can do. We had no choice and went to other hotel which was nice, receptionist was friendly and told us we weren't the only ones ! Eventually the next afternoon we arrive back by taxi to be told room is still not ready, by the time this was…

title: Disappointing........
review: Was looking forward to a relaxing fortnight with parents and to 2 children. 2 rooms booked. Accommodation cramped to facilitate extra bed for 2nd child, sofa most comfortable and coolest place to sleep as beds very hard. Not to worry won't be sleeping at night, too hot as air conditioning does not work and will need to be up at 7:30 if you want a bed around the pool. Still at least get in for breakfast early enough before items run out. If had the time a cuppa in the room would be nice  but 2 hours for kettle to boil! Facilities no good for self catering. I was half board but still ate out some nights. Santa Ponsa great, save money from sea view upgrade and choose a different hotel.

title: August 2014
review: So I'm here now and want to be absolutely honest. The apartments whilst small are a great base, bathroom is nice and the shower powerful and always plenty of hot water. The view we have is lovely overlooking the pool and the bay..just gorgeous. The pool is nice but is very deep, it does have a small childrens section. All the staff I have encountered have been lovely, pleasant and helpful. We opted for a safe on arrival and as ours was broken in the room used one in the reception area..these are fine. The hotel has a small gym including a cross trainer, 2 bikes and a sit up bench plus plenty of mats for stretching again the view from the gym is beautiful. The hotel is up at the top of the hill so if you like the beach Santa Ponsa has a gorgeous beach which is quite shallow, our…

title: Great value hotel
review: We booked a week here at fairly short notice. We were a party of four and requested a one bedroom studio with a sea view. The view from the balcony was superb looking over the bay. The apartment was compact but clean with a small kitchen (which we didn't use as we ate out). Hotel staff were helpful and courteous, fresh towels every day. Pool and bar area were nice and all kept very clean and tidy. Had a minor issue with the electrics but managed to sort it myself but they still sent an electrician within half an hour of being notified. All in all a very good value hotel, well situated and attracting mainly families do no late night noise. I'd definitely recommend it and if I was returning to the resort would consider using it again

title: Brochure description
review: After reading reviews i contacted Jet2 customer service to say i was concerned about some i read. Please be aware that there is no entertainment during the evening at the hotel except for one night a week when there is a singer with what looked like a keyboard who was there for a couple of hours. Certainly not regular family entertainment. The children's entertainment consisted of an hour or so some days where they played table tennis,shuffle board or painted. Nothing else. Rooms were fine and clean and the restaurant was excellent with a wide range of food available. Could not fault either room or food. Santa Ponsa is a lovely family resort that i would recommend

title: Remember this is a 3 star hotel
review: Just arrived back from 2 weeks at this hotel , I will admit after reading the reviews was not looking forward to my holiday !! We arrived early hours of the morning , and was in room 324 with a side view . Apartment was basic but very clean and the view we had of the sea was fine . We stayed half board , breakfast is the same where ever you stay and evening meals where adequate just need  more variety . Sunbeds could do with replacing , and you had to be up early to get one , but we have had to do this even at 4/5 star hotels so are used to it.  Location was great could walk to Santa Ponsa within 10 minutes . On the whole this hotel is spotless and a great location , and for what we paid was happy . We did get a safe as soon as we got there due to previous reviews about theft .…

title: Avoid.
review: Stayed her for 8 nights, mid August on a family break & it was really one thing after another with disappointments. I will however begin with the few good points, because I do not agree with leaving a poor review & not recognising the good in the stay...  Receptionist Esther was as helpful as she could be, friendly manner.  The Janitor rang doorbell in our room whilst having lunch one afternoon to check we knew our door was slightly open, I think this shows they are addressing the numerous theft issues I've seen on their reviews...? Top floor panoramic views from balcony are stunning.  Good location, close to the busy night time square, shops, bars & only a picturesque 20 minute walk to the main beach of Santa Ponça.  Now onto the much bigger bad list...!  They overbooked the…

title: Wouldn't stay here again
review: The exterior of the hotel is impressive and the reception staff are all friendly and helpful. The accomodation however is dire. We had requested a 1 bedroom apartment with a side sea view. We did have side sea view but the main view was over a supermarket car park which was very noisy early in the morning and late at night.  The room was dirty. The floors were dusty and stained, the bathroom had mould and smelt of urine. The balcony furniture was smeared with what looked like the remains of a takeaway/kebab! There were ants in the bedroom, especially the wardrobe. There was a hole in the tiles above the bath where the ants trouped in and out constantly. The kitchen was dirty and the utensils looked old and worn. Kettles and toasters were available to hire but for 3€ per day.…

title: Pleasantly surprised in the end.....although a lot of room for improvement
review: Our family of 2 adults & 2 children have just returned from a one week stay at the jardin. I have to say after reading some of the reviews I had mixed emotions about going on the holiday before we went.  Unfortunately we incurred a 6 hour delay which put a great start to the holiday when we were already having reservations about the holiday in the first place.  We ended up arriving At the Jardin at 6.30am pretty fed up and tired from the delay only to be told by the reception staff that they had overbooked on the rooms and we didn't have a room for the night. As you can Imagine I was pretty fed up at this point and so were my two daughters, the guy at reception thought if was funny when i said to Him' please tell me you are joking' !! Which obviously made my mood worse!  Anyway…

title: Holiday for two
review: We found the room to be very clean. The staff were friendly and keen to help.  We were on the 5th floor (room 506) which had a brilliant sea view and lots of sunshine.  We were self catering but there wasn't a microwave, nor electric kettle.  There was a problem with the cooker which was very very slow.  The hotel was noisy on a night time.  The pool area was fine and our entertainment at the hotel was at 8 a.m. when watching people running at top speed with towels to mark their sun beds.  It was akin to a stampede. The taxi from Palma was 40 euros!!!  We had been told the cost would be £10.00.  Would go to santa Ponsa again as it was a really nice holiday resort.

title: what see views
review: We paid extra with travel republic for an apartment with side lateral sea views. This turned out to be pointless as the hotel could not guarantee sea views , if you are put in a apartment on floor zero or one you cant see a sea view at all, just a wall or a hedge with next to no sun shine. To make matters worse we had a apartment on the first floor at the end next to the air conditioning unit for the whole hotel, this kept making the loudest noise every 10 minutes , this was in between the constant groaning of the unit add to this that the air conditioning in all rooms was a waist of time, We came with 4 other families and all had the same problems . The hotel was over booked according to the reception staff and said it was travel republics fault we had no sea view, not there's.…

title: Very good hotel, sun loungers only downer
review: It was our third time staying here. We last stayed 3 years ago in May 2011. Upon arriving, we found reception very helpful. Our room was on floor zero overlooking the pool which was ideal as we have two young kids (aged 16 months bd 4). A small safe was €15 for the week with a €6 deposit. We opted for a slightly larger safe that was €18 for a week with the €6 deposit. The safes are in reception. Wi-Fi is €24 for the week or €4 a day. That price is per device though which I thought was steep. The room was clean although we did have some ants in the bathroom. We just got some spray for this. To be honest I've come to expect ants after years of sun holidays. The TV had 6 English channels - ITV1, ITV2 and ITV4, CBeebies, BBC1 and BBC2. CBeebies was very handy for the kids. ITV2 was…

title: Holiday fever
review: We were looking forward to this week on the beach. Santa Ponsa has a great beach, very flat and all sandy apart from the mini pebble beach at the hotel. I was a bit annoyed by the rude guests who put out towels on beds at night, so we went out everyday. What is wrong with people? The buffet breakfast was good and the staff tried hard but when we were late to eat it was a mess. Missed the fact that there was nothing to do at night, no entertainment, a bit strange. We resorted to going for walks along the sea front. Roll on next hoilday.

title: No faults.
review: This place was really really good. We arrived quite late last Friday 1st and were checked in. We stayed in 414. Very clean room and I recommend the sea view as it's unreal. Room consisted of small kitchen, bathroom, bedroom with 2 single beds pushed together and a sitting area with 7 English channels on the TV. We had heard of theft but we didn't experience any whilst there. We got a safe at reception for €15 a week a €6 deposit. Location is great. Very close to supermarket and Square on our doorstep. We ate breakfast most mornings in Royal Garden across the road and was great value, €5 for Irish breakfast. Pool was lovely and spacious. Got sun beds no problem. Short stroll to Santa Ponsa centre where there are bars and restaurants some great value but avoid the Chinese near the…

title: Sunbed fiasco
review: Nice hotel spoilt by the mad 8 o'clock frenzy to place towels on sunbeds. We found ourselves walking to a bar called the watering hole. They had a swimming pool and use of sunbeds for 3 Euros (1.5 for kids).

title: Great Family Holiday
review: Just back from 10 days stay at the Jardin Del Mar , We booked this holiday and went with mixed feelings after reading so many bad reviews , however we found the hotel to be very nice inside with lots of areas to sit and relax ,  staff especially Esther on reception very helpful , the pool area very clean , the pool itself beautiful .Our room was on level 2 with a seaview , blocked slightly by the palm trees but balcony had Sun all day which was most pleasant .The location of Jardin is excellent , the hidden beach stunning , plenty to eat and drink near by , we enjoyed some fun nights in the Square a short work away .We used a safe which are in reception , which cost us 24euros for the ten days ,no problems experienced for us with theft .Overall great family holiday will return…

title: Not ideal for a party holiday
review: We stayed in the hotel for twelve days! When we arrived we expected a lively atmosphere in the resort as our travel agent suggested it to us for a party holiday. The hotel has no entertainment, and the bar staff are very unfriendly. I was at the bar ordering a drink and the barman acted in a highly inappropriate manner by first ignoring me in favour of serving a man, then by making inappropriate remarks towards my appearance. However on a positive note the food at the bar was cheap and pleasant for the money we paid. The rooms are adequate. Having travelled with two others the size was standard however if you are travelling with a family it would not be suitable. I lay down on my bed to find that a rock would have been more comfortable! The sofa bed is actually far more…

title: Nice hotel
review: Just arrived back from two weeks at the Jardin Del Mar. Our children absolutely loved the pool and we had a great time. We stayed half board and the food variety was ok. The main issue was that they didn't clean the floors of the restaurant between dinner and breakfast so we did experience ants and a croakroach at breakfast time. Their explanation was that the cleaners cleaned only once a day after breakfast and they did not have brushes!  It is in a beautiful spot and the walk to the main beach was fine for my 5, 3 and 11 month old even in the heat.   On the first night they put us on  the ground floor where the door does not double lock and could easily open with one turn- not good with young children or with the thefts... they did not lock at all from the inside. However the…

title: great family hotel
review: Good pool, spoilt by inconsiderate people putting there towels on the Sun beds before most people are up. Great nearby bars and restaurants, great square nearby with free entertainment every night. Good small beach (cove ) near by for swimming and snorkelling. Hotel is very quiet at night, no entertainment.  Buffet style breakfast and dinner good variety.

title: Great stay
review: Just back from a week here. Stayed on the fifth floor with stunning sea views from balcony. Good children's pool. Breakfast suited us with the kids ie mellon, breads, juices, fried egg, rashers, beans, toast, cold meats, cheese etc. Convenient to shops, supermarkets and restaurants. We loved the small private pebble beach beside hotel. Staff friendly and accommodating. Security wise there are signs everywhere, and security guys walking around. Just be sensible will your valuables. Other beach is a good 10/15 minute walk which is lovely. Good shower over bath and air conditioning.  Enjoyed it and would go back. Definitely ask for a sea view room. Be prepared for noise from next door and overhead rooms.

title: Decent hotel with OK service
review: Our stay at Jardin del Mar was a pleasant visit for a family vacation. The small appartment's had a bedroom for the grown ups and a sofa for our young lady to sleep on, a nice balcony and a small kitchen and bathroom with most of the necessary equipment. We paid extra for a front view, but the many dead leaves on the palm trees outside really hindered a decent view . . . The hotel has some cleaning work to do if it wants to continue to get extra payment for the front views! The beds were too hard for European backs . . but my wife got an extra mattress after some days. But the room cleaning was attentive and did the cleaning when asked. Wifi internet is extra - 24 Euros for a week . . .  Most of our meals were taken outside of the hotel. La Solana close by the hotel was a very…

title: good hotel, great location
review: Stayed here early July and whilst we had booked a room with a side sea view we were immediately upgraded to a room overlooking the pool (floor zero) by Esther. We may not have had the views across the bay but it was ideal for us. Very clean, the maids were in every day and all of the staff were extremely friendly. The pool lifeguard was fab and helped a man who slipped and got trapped on nearby rocks. The location was superb, just a ten minute walk to the centre with bars & cafés all of the way. You can walk all of the way by the sea too which is very enjoyable. I would definitely go back.

title: Good Hotel
review: We stayed here for 10 days in July 2014 self catering. We stayed on the top floor and had a full sea view apartment and the view was amazing. However, the apartment had no toaster when it was self catering. There was no entertainment on between the 14th July and the 30th July which was a big disappointment. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean. Would stay again.

title: Good and bad
review: Room sizes good. There is a machine somewhere that seems to go all night.The 2 electric rings blew the fuses every time I tried to boil a kettle. I had the repair man out 3 times to no avail. Luckily I did not want to cook, they would have taken a week to cook anything anyway, I had a travelling water heater so was able to make coffees. One of my pyjama tops was taken away with the bedsheets, never to be seen again.The staff were friendly, except for one of the receptionists. I would not use the hotel again if I was ever to return to the island. It is a good 10 to 15mns walk to the bus stop and the hotel is up a steep hill. Price ok if booked early enough, I would have been very upset if I had payed the price of the room 4 weeks later.

title: not child friendly..
review: just back from 10 days with husband and 7 year old.  great room with view on fourth floor.. as requested. rooms cleaned every day and cooking facilities done the job.  Downside was kids entertainment was zilch... a girl came for bout half hour 3 times a week and showed no interest at all..lucky my daughter met great friends and they entertained themselves.. no entertainment at all night and hotel was dead.. thank god for the square across road.. Lynn who does the kids disco is an absolute gem.. and entertainment great.. If this hotel had a decent kids entertainer.. it would be hard to beat.. staff were very friendly from the reception to bar.We stayed half board.. again food was not geared up for kids whatsoever.. my wee girl lived on pasta or soup... food for us .. basic with…

title: Please Dont Go
review: If you like living in a rabbit hutch and like eating rabbit go to this hotel when people say you get what you pay their spot on with this hotel the staff were so rude i just stopped speaking to them the food was shocking not child freindly what so ever good location spoilt by unfreindly staff

title: Poor mans 3 star hotel
review: Just back from an 11 day family holiday staying in the jarden del mar on a half board basis . Was given a 6th floor room (very high up ) facing the back of the shops accross the road even although we had asked for a pool view and to be low down as we have 2 kids aged 7 & 4   Anyway there was absolute zero entertainment in the hotel whatsoever also said in the description there was a kids club this was defo not the case   The hotel is very basic the bedding is changed every 5 days and the towels every 3 days although it is overall clean enough   I have been to many 3 star hotels in the past and usually you have a good selection of food choice , well dont expect too much here as there is hardly any choice very very basic even at breakfast  the egs are actually floating in the…

title: Sarah driver
review: We arrived on 11th July 2014, we stayed at the plazamar apartments 3 years ago and liked the resort but fancied trying different apartment. . Rooms basic but ours was clean, was made aware by another holiday maker that there is a lot of thefts in hotel so we got a safe and never left anything in room!!!! Downside was a bit noisey when people coming back early hours but not a huge problem.. If booking room I would try get above 4th floor as balcony bigger and better sea view... poolside food reasonable price and good, One tip buy a lilo as sunbeds very hard... also we had kettle in our room it's a old fashioned whistle hob style but done the job....

title: Lovely stay
review: I guess it depends what you're looknig for in a hotel. Reception staff spoke flawless english and were very helpful booking trips and what not. Room was spotless, beautiful view over the bay. a few people I thinkmentioned theft but you can get safe deposit boxes and everyone sensible knows you dont leave expensive gear hanging around the hotel room. snack bar wasn't up to much. I would definately go back. Remember guys these are THREE STAR apartments, don't expect too much!

title: Horrible horrible place
review: My friends and I arrived to out this hotel on the 7th July to be told that we had only booked one room, when we had clearly paid for 2 and we had to get our travel agents on the phone from home to contact the hotel. The staff working at the time told us we had to pay an extra 200 euro for another room which is crazy. We were then told that was all fine and to come back in an hour to get our keys. When we arrived back we were then told we still hadn't the room and we needed to email the hotel out codes (whatever that meant) we then got our travel agents back into the phone and sorted everything out. After that big fascia we got to our rooms and met a few people about that we're telling us things were getting stole..  iPads etc. I have a feelings it's the staff stealing all of…

title: Worst experience of my life
review: We just arrived at the hotel(19 of us - away for a 60th birthday party) and it was early enough into the day approx. 1pm. We left all of our case's and valuable items in the room thinking they wore safe and changed into pool wear and headed on down to the pool which is nice and relaxing. We chilled out at the pool all having a nice time then went to the supermarket and back to the apartment with our shopping. As we arrived back to our apartment (303) my Dad who adores his iPad went to get the iPad we're he had left it,in my Mam's bag to discover it was gone. Immediately my mam reported the missing item hoping for some help off of the receptionist, which bearly had the telephone number off the police station which is located in Palma ( please notice there is no police station in…

title: majorca
review: This hotel is a cheap stay food not very good pool ok cleaners r not very good no entertainmen at all staff on reception good wouldn't go back best food and pint was at pie and pint at top of hill have a good day out  palma you gan get the bus down in santa ponsa bus 111 is express to palma no stops takes 25 mins cost 3.30 euros each way

title: Worst hotel ever!
review: Just back today from a family holiday to Santa ponsa for my mam's 60th birthday arrived on the 3rd July a total of 19 on our party. My sister and myself both got rooms upon arrival whereas the rest of the party had to wait for their rooms. This was at approx 1pm so we decided to go to the pool area! We went to the supermarket when we left the pool and we met a woman who hold us a woman from limericks iPad was taken from her room .Upon return to her room 303 my sister discovered her ipad which was in her handbag in the bedroom was missing !! She went straight to the reception to report this and was told she should have double locked her door !!! The reception were extremely unhelpful and barely have the number for the police which are located in Palma there's no local police…

title: We loved it pool was great size my kids had a great time
review: I would recamened these Aparments they are so clean staff all was cleaning best cleaned places I've stayed only thing was they could do with entertainment at night for family as noting to keep you in place at night but square so close. Ellie is fab with kids they lived her just pitty not on longer by day. All staff we meet where fab only on or fist night bar man was not that nice. Apparment not suit able for family's bigger than 4

title: Surprising
review: After reading reviews we were a little apprehensive, however, from the time we arrived the staff were welcoming, and extremely pleasant (even at 2am).  The room was clean, all-be-it basic and the sofa bed was already made up - there were 3 of us.  We stayed on a half-board basis and the breakfast was of good quality, and being buffet style meant as much as we needed to set up us for the day on the beach.  The supper was also of good quality with a variety of salad, meats, cheeses, rice dishes, noodles, chicken, pork and  fish dishes over the week.   Only critiques were: the problem in getting a sun lounger poolside due to the incredible array of towels occupying them, many overnight; the pickled fish which was not very palatable; the lack of a gym - a bike, a cross trainer and a…

title: Enjoyable Holiday
review: Was in room 531 side sea view. Been going to santa ponsa for 14 years and tried many hotels around the resort. Was a VERY clean hotel. Had clean towels and room cleaned everyday!! Slept well and no problems from noise. Had to wake up about 7:30am everyday to rush to take towels down as if you don't the beds get taken up very quickly!! Read a few reviews below of time when we was there saying there was theft in the hotel, we didn't experience any of this and on a daily basis left money in the room but just hid it away. Great holiday and would go back.

title: worst experience abroad!!!!
review: we arrived at the hotel on 29th june 2014 we thought it was clean and the staff seemed okay to start with. we went to buy 400 cigarettes for a present we left them under the bed in a suitcase on the 3rd of july we went to pack the suitcase ready to come back to the uk when we found out that all the cigarettes had been taken when we went to reception there was already someone complaining that an ipad had been stolen from there room which was next to ours, she also told us that the room next door but one to her had, had an iphone and a ipad stolen so we asked for the police number and the receptionist gave us a false number which rang down to the reception. All the receptionist could say was why didn't you double lock your door when we didn't get told to and she told us to put…

title: Great experience
review: Just back from a weeks stay in jardin del mar was very impressed had side sea view but not disappointed sun shining early morning hotel was spotless staff were very friendly espically Esther made r hoilday so relaxing pool area was lovely plenty of sun beds didnt eat at hotel but plenty of place to eat out supermarket straight across from Hotle lovely breakfast from a place called arkles again lovely staff santa ponsa has a lovely beach just 15 mins walk from Hotel beside hotel is the square plenty of bars  entertainment on every night to suit all ages pound shop for little gifts staff so friendly overall enjoyed our week so much going to book jardin del mar for next year

title: wont be back to the jarden
review: just back from a 10 day holiday,  after a very early start and a 3 hour bus drive to the app  arrived to find they had over booked so we had no room,we had to stay in another hotel wont mention where but it was  dive,came back the following morning to be told we had to wait till 2 pm for the key only to discover they had giving our room to some one else,but got a different one  over the kitchen so the fan kepted us from having any lie in,got a 3 course meal as compo but staff were not very nice,we felt because we weren't paying we didnt matter,but after all that we settled into to our holiday and were having a great time until monday evening after shopping went to the pool only to return to find our app hand been robbed no break in ??? over 400 euro worth of stuff gone my tablet…

title: Nothing Special
review: Old Hotel, once 4 star, now not more than 3 star. First we get a very very smoked room. After complaining we get another in the bottom of the hotel. Not smoked but smell like old pub underground.otherwise OK

title: lovely receptionists
review: Just returned home today from the TRH jardin del mar apartments reception really helpful and very pleasant (even though some reviews on here were not good maybe its the peoples attitude,when we first walked in apartment we thought bit small but when we opened the curtains and saw the view nothing else mattered it was beautiful.Would not like to cook a sunday dinner kitchen rather basic but I just like to make a brew in the mornings so it was fine.

title: great holiday
review: Stayed for a week in June, apartment with side sea view, would have preferred full sea view but cannot say I was disappointed as room was good size with air-con and very clean. Overall a lovely clean hotel  and good pool area, did not eat in restaurant but choice looked good.  Plenty of bars near and good choice of restaurants also, hotel is family friendly, would highly recommend.

title: Fantastic Week at the TRH Jardin del mar
review: I have just returned from a great week at the TRH Jardin. The hotel is spotless clean, from the foyer to the bedrooms. There were three of us and we had a one bedroomed apartment which was ideal. Two rings and excellent fridge with small freezer compartment. The pool area is great plenty of sunbeds, but the sunbeds are very hard, the hotel should replace them, most people bought lilos to put on the beds and passed them on to other people when they left. There is a small cove beside the hotel which you can swim in which is lovely of a nice 15 minute stroll to the main beach at Santa Ponsa. Lots of excellent places to eat fantastic meal at El Ceibo. The square which is beside the hotel has lots of nice pubs and free open air entertainment every night. There is a pool life guard on…

title: Basic but ok
review: Just returned back after a lovely week in Santa Ponsa. This hotel was basic but suited our needs. In need of a bit of TLC but clean. Pool area requires maintenance and the sunbeds are poor and very uncomfortable. The pool depth starts at 1.70 no good if your vertically challenged like me!! The indoor pool was closed and you had to give half a days notice to use the steam room.The walk to the beach was a nice 10 minute amble and there are plenty of nice places to eat - especially the Chinese close to the hotel and El Jardine just round from the supermarket.

title: Value For Money
review: My husband and I stayed 5 nights on a self catering basis in May.  When we arrived we found reception staff friendly and helpful.  We paid extra for a superior sea view room and were given room 320.  We had a living/dining area and separate bedroom.  The apartment was very basic but clean.  We had a large balcony with table, chairs, sunbeds and a sea view.  Unfortunately no sun in the afternoon.  Only two rings to cook on and if you want an electric kettle and toaster they have to be hired. We took a small toaster with us and just used the kettle provided but it took a long time to boil.   They have safety deposit boxes at reception and we hired one and put our valuables in it, we never leave money or valuables in our room.  If you are not looking for luxury but somewhere clean…

title: AWFUL - JUNE 2014
review: firstly when checking in,  i noticed there is a security issue with the hotel as they now have security guards and you are not able to use the safe in the room instead you have to use the safes which are in reception,  me and my partner wondered why   on monday 23 june 2014 we went shopping left our purchases in the room  tuesday 24 june 2014 we left the room to go outside for breakfast and to meet friends, when we returned back around 3-4pm our hotel door had been "left open" by the maid who was the last person to enter after us, we notified reception who made a note of this but did not come back with an explantation  tuesday 24 june 2014 when packing our stuff to return to the UK we noticed we had items that had been brought on the monday missing from the room (perfume) and…

title: nice hotel
review: Really nice hotel our room had a pool and sea view, very close to the square and lots of restraunt close by. Beach is about a 30 min walk but worth it as Santa ponsa has a lovely beach.also a supermarket round the corner from hotel

title: nice hoilday
review: just return from santa ponsa,had a great week,hotel was basic but clean and comfy,cleaner's came in every day,staff were very helpful when asked,have stayed here before and hopefully will be back next year.

title: Great time at Jardin del Mar
review: Really can`t understand why this great hotel is only 29 out of 35 in Santa Ponsa.  It is 3 star hotel and a very good one. Some people want 5 star and expect to pay 3 star prices. I can`t fault this hotel. We paid extra for a superior room. The room was recently refurbished and we had a huge balcony with a sea view. We also had our own fully adjustable sunbeds. The apartment was cleaned every day an was kept spotless along with the rest of the hotel (Room 520). We took breakfast option and it was good. Ok not english bacon and sausage but always found something each morning. Fruit, meats and cheese,boiled eggs,fry up,pastries and toast.  The staff were all very friendly and were always happy to help. The lady who cleaned our room was so nice and polite.  As for location, could…

title: Rude, unfriendly and unhelpful.
review: We paid for a room with a sea view however on check-in we realised our room was on the ground floor level with the pool, with people on sun loungers right outside - this is not a sea view. We managed to get a room move to 1 level up however we had a large bush blocking our view, we decided this was better than having people at the pool right outside so stuck with it. The room was nice enough and we settled in.   Our mood was angered and put a disappointing turn to a weekend away when we asked a member of staff (Esther) advice on a poster displayed in the hotel. She was aggressive and rude, waving her hands around and telling us we know more than her. If we had not already paid for our room, we would of been leaving at that point. To add insult to injury, she spoke about us in…

title: Returning  guest
review: Returned for our 5th time to this great wee hotel. Great location clean tidy well run staff great , cheap and cheerful could not fault it , will be returning again, pay for the sea view when booking well worth it Ester and Francisco at prescription are great  food from pool bar reasonably priced and great. Cleaners in regular with fresh towels Sat in rescription on last day awaiting transport and listened to silly complaints from guests so embarrassing   some people l e are natural moaners if you want five star pay for it this wee hotel suited my holiday and again I could not fault it  can,t wait to return next year I

title: Bit disappointed
review: My wife & I stayed at this hotel a few years ago & quite liked it.  We had asked for a side sea view & were impressed as we were high up over the pool & also had a great view over the bay.  However, having booked in February & asked for a similar room, I was disappointed with the view as you had to lean over the balcony to see the sea & also we were very low down.  Had a great view of the back of the supermarket & a car park!  Towels & sheets were changed regularly towels every day except Thursday & Sunday in fact.  However, though the bathroom was cleaned well, the main apartment floor got a once over!  The balcony was never swept in the 2 weeks we were there & the balcony table was disgusting (never washed at all).  Also found a dead cockroach in the slide for the balcony door…

title: Fabulous location but......
review: I loved the location of this hotel and would go again if they sorted the sun bed situation out.  Not enough to go round and even if you  manage to get one (have to get up early and possibly queue) they are so uncomfortable, no mattress and you have to lay flat. We paid for a sea view room which had a great view, the room was basic but had everything in that you would need, except a toaster and electric kettle. The maid was useless, she never made the bed or bothered cleaning up.  As it happens I am quite capable or making my own bed and tidying round. We had never been on a self catering holiday before but found this a good idea, we breakfasted at the Arkles and had our evening meal at Sebastions which  I can recommend especially the Chicken curry.  Sebastions is located on the…

title: If it weren't for the massive discount...
review: We managed to get a huge discount through booking.com and paid only 30 euros per night. For that price we find the place acceptable but if we would've paid normal rates I would definitely give less stars.  We were lured in by the "side sea view" announced on the website and thought it was just written in bad english. It turned out that if we get onto our balcony we see nothing but a massive wall covered in ivy, but if we lean over and look sideways we do indeed see a tiny piece of the sea on our right hand side. Cant hear any seagulls though as we're right next to a generator of some sort which sounds like a plane taking off every 5 minutes.  Kitchen is very basic but OK, although you have to pay extra to rent a toaster or a kettle. Sheets are clean but blankets look like they…

title: choose sea view
review: just returned from a week here.the apartments are clean and comfy towels changed regularly but our sheets were not changed at all this may have been because on arrival we changed rooms .We had booked a side sea view but this was a joke lot of neck craning needed.I think it would be better if they didnt advertise this as you are immediately disappointed even though above 5th floor the room and view are adequate and you do get sunshine in the mornings. the sea view rooms overlook the pool and santa ponsa bay gorgeous the pool area is lovely with as mentioned gorgeous views. snack bar had a reasonably priced menu with pizza baguettes fries etc which were very nice this was the only food we tried.Great location10 mins walk to main drag with plenty of shops bars and cafes on the way…

title: Family holiday
review: This hotel is well situated but the food was of a poor quality causing us to eat out every night breakfast wasn't much better it was cold so I would never stay there again the beds were made and clean towels but the room wasn't cleaned so would not recommend this hotel

title: Week in the sun
review: Just home from a wonderful week of no cooking or cleaning in the sun. Hotel was ok, room was clean a bit old fashioned but if it wasn't we'd wonder what had happened. Balcony with lovely sea views of Santa Ponsa. Handy for the shops only a ten minute walk to the lively parts. The big beach on the main drag is just lovely, more than enough beds and shades and you don't have far to go for something to eat. This was a lie in the sun week and we enjoyed.

title: choose sea view before booking
review: Just returned from a ten day stay at the Jardin del Mar Santa Ponca. We really enjoyed our time there and would certainly stay at this hotel again. Although the rooms were pretty basic you get what you pay for. The rooms were cleaned most days and we had plenty of fresh towels and toilet rolls whenever we needed them. The reception staff were very polite and helpful. The pool area was lovely and overlooked the sea and a small cove below where we spent most of our time sunbathing. The only downside was, on the few overcast/rainy days we had, the indoor pool and facilities were closed. There was a lovely bar/cafe right on the front below the Ceasar Apartments next door with free use of the pool. The bar staff there were really friendly and their pancakes to die for. During our…

title: Nice but....
review: Last minute booking, and thought the wife booked a hotel, but it turned out to be an apartment, but with sea view. Upon arrival we didn't have to wait long to check in, a quick trip in the lift to room 315, and we were expecting a room, that for the price we paid, was going to be nice and clean. Upon opening the door, it was clean, in fact, very clean. No smells at all. Like most hotels in Majorca, they could do with a repaint, and revamp. All cutlery was clean, cups and pans, clean. Bathroom was again clean but in need of an update, the shower was powerful and the water was scalding hot, which was excellent. TV had English channels which was great, the views from the balcony was amazing. This place is situated about 10 mins from the town centre, and it's worth walking along the…

title: Great Holiday
review: My husband and I have just returned from a short 4 day break at the Jardin Del Mar. We booked this last minute break and we were more than happy with the hotel, especially considering this was a cheap and cheerful break. The apartments are basic, but very clean. The main room was an open plan lounge and kitchenette, with table and chairs. The separate kitchenette was really handy, and would be ideal if you were a family and wanted to cook, having said that there was only a two plate hob, but better than nothing at all.  The balcony was great and the full sea view was stunning.  Location wise it suited us perfectly, a 10-15 min walk from Central Santa Ponsa. Loads of choice for food and drink and "the square - les jardines" is just opposite the hotel. On the down-side, the bed…

title: better than i expected
review: Just back from a cheap and cheerful week in Sana Ponsa. We found the apts at Jardin del Mar much better than we expected. Went from Cork to Palma had a week for two adults for 190 euro in Jardin del Mar the apartments are basic but very clean with a separate bedroom and a nice balcony with a very nice view, (sea view choice). The maid service was excellent we did rent  a safety deposit box after reading all the reviews but thankfully we had an uneventfull trip.  The beds are a  bit hard but are usual for spanish apartments.  Very nice helpful lady in reception who made us feel welcome and gave us some information on the area.  The location is excellent just off the main strip about 10 minutes walk from the lively area, but lots of restaurants and bars, supermarkets and shops…

title: Great place for everyone
review: The hotel is well located just few steps from rocky beach ad about 10 minutes walk from main sandy beach in Santa Ponsa. Reception very helpful-helped us with company responsible for the transfer to the airport, clean and cosy rooms with seaview, really amazing place perfect for holidays with friends or family.

title: Great holiday/Lovely views
review: This was our 4th stay at the hotel and we loved it. Staff are very friendly and helpful.We paid more for a pool view room which is great because you get a sea view room with balcony. Food at the pool bar is very generous and again very friendly staff.The room was cleaned every day apart from sunday and thursdays and was left immaculate.It is in a great location near shops,bars and restaurants.It is only 25mins from airport and taxi was 40 euros.

title: NICE HOTEL
review: we stayed for 5 days in april and enjoyed the hotel.  we booked a side sea view room and when we went in it overlooked a car par.  the nice gentleman on reception said we could pay more for afull sea view - which we refused - so he moved us to side sea view room nearer the sea.  the maid service was very good  and the dining room was lovely with very nice food.  the pool area was loveley and overlooked the sea - it was like being on a cruise ship and the pool snack bar did great pizzas. there was also an indoor pool and entertainment one night

title: My first holiday to Santa Ponsa
review: This was my first trip to Mallorca and was booked for me by from Sky-tours Dublin for 14 nights from 23 April to 8 may 2014 to Santa Ponsa, Fiona (Sky-tours) said considering my age (70)  that she would recommend the Jardin Del Mar. Our flight from Dublin was approx 2 hrs 40 min we traveled  Ryan-air,  Our journey to the Jardin Del Mar was with Resorthoppa our driver was a wonderful rep for Resorthoppa, he helped us with our luggage and directed us to reception (check in). It was now around midnight we left our home in Dublin around 2pm and just wanted to get some sleep. A young gentleman receptionist named Francisco welcomed us to the hotel was helpful in every aspect and completed our check-in with speed and efficiency. We were given a side sea view room, upon entering we were…

title: great views and location.
review: The superior room was quiet small to what we expected although the balcony was massive with fantastic views. Night porter was quite ignorant he was telling us to be quiet everytime we came home and us not even making any noise. The cleaners are really noisy banging and shouting up and down the stairs to each other 1st thing in the morning. The pool was fantastic and so was the location.

title: You get what you pay for
review: We booked this hotel through travel republic 4 nights away for £150, I was worried about some of the reviews but the price too good. When we got there the location was excellent, on a lovely cove and excellent sea views. We had booked a side sea view when we go to our room I couldn't hide my disappointment, the balcony was overlooking a car park and you have to have the ability of stretch Armstrong to bend your neck in a unnatural position to see the sea. I went to see the receptionist who upgraded us to room 712 which we were told the best room in the hotel, it cost us 80 euros. It was worth the upgrade, the view was wonderful, the balcony was massive with your own sunned,  table and chairs. The rooms are dated and are in need of some upgrading. Silly little things like the…

title: very happy,will return
review: we had a side sea view room on 7th floor,12 nights.the staff were very friendly,room well kept.went self catering(wanted to eat out) and found a place called tuck inn.the food was fantastic,cheap and filled you up.the owners were very friendly and didnt mind the kids playing,deffinetly reccomend.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: We did not book this hotel but were transferred here from another place following our complaint to the tour operator.On arrival following a really stressfull 18 hours off hell at our first hotel we were greeted by the smilling face of Esther the receptionist allthough she was expecting us she still had not recieved confirmation of our new booking from tour operator so could not allocate our room she told us to leave our luggage in the locker room and go for a meal and by then she would have it all sorted,true to her word when we got back our room was ready.The rooms are spotlessly clean consisting of bedroom with large mirrored wardrobe,nice bathroom with hairdryer lounge/kitchen area with good sized flat screen tv with selection of uk tv channels we had a room on 3rd floor and…

title: BEWARE OF THEVIES!
review: After arriving at the hotel at 11am the receptionist informed us that out room wasn't ready but we were a ale to get changed in the toilet and leave our luggage in the locked room next to the reception which was fine. Upon returning from the beach at 5pm our room was ready (524) we were given our keys and directed to out room. Once on the room I unpacked my suitcase to get a change of clothes to go out a run while my partner decide she would unpack later.  We both left at the same time 5:15pm, through the reception (3 or 4 staff there at this point) and I went out a run will my partner went to the Supermarket to pick up essentials. Once she arrived back ten mind later she could not find her iphone which she left on the table. Once I arrived back I tried calling but no answer.…

title: Great value and location
review: This is the best value holiday that we have had in years. The hotel is a bit dated but very clean. The location is great. Will be back for an off season trip. This is the kind of hotel that you could visit a couple of times a year for off season deals

title: Would stay again
review: We stayed here from 21 till 29th April over Easter Stayed in room 325 side sea view nice room ,very clean, small kitchen which had a fridge,2 ring hob, kettle, pans kitted out for 4 people Last 2 nights we upgraded at a cost of 15 euros per night to 610. This had a full sea view but the room was not in as good a condition...more popular, used more etc  Pools very clean .Deck good supply of fixed  loungers and chairs. Nice gardens. Good facilities for children If you want to eat out try meal of the day at Pacos next to English pub and Pepperpot...9.99 for a good 3 course meal If you need a toaster/electric kettle these can be hired from reception at a cost of 10 euros per week or bring or buy We plan to return with family to the 2 bed room

title: Bargain break. Loved it.
review: I stayed 19-26 April. I wanted a week lying by the pool reading my book. Room 410 had palm tree in front of balcony but could still see the sea. Room furnishing a bit tired but perfectly usable. Decent sized bathroom and mirrored wardrobes in bedroom. Flat screen TV with some British channels. I used the whistling kettle in the kitchen every day. I was half board and really enjoyed the food. I like the European style of eating. The sun beds are uncomfortable but I just used 2 towels to lie on. The outdoor pool is fab with great sea views. You can walk to the main beach from the pool following the coast line which is not far at all. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend  a short holiday ,off season, bargain break at this hotel.

title: Pleasant Stay
review: Booked Jardin del Mar for a very last minute holiday in Easter. Booked it for the location - just out of the main town of Santa Ponsa - which was nice. Just short 10 minute walk into town. We did not expect much from the hotel in terms of food quality and room comfort etc, but were pleasantly surprised about the comfort and space in the room. Basic double rooms include a living and kitchenette room, as well as utility cupboard and bathroom, bedroom and balcony. We were, however, quite disappointed with the "side sea-view" room. Do not expect much from this. The main view is actually of a hedged wall, and if you turn to the right, you can catch a glimpse of the sea! Also the walls are extremely thin, so expect to hear everything your neighbours are saying, even in whispers. The…

title: Beware of self catering
review: Self catering consisted of a 2 ring hob, no toaster, no grill, no microwave with stick every time pots. Could cost you an extra 100 euros to rent a toaster and electric kettle, what a con.. Also the way apartments situated  increases volume of noise from kids screaming in pool and even people talking in seatin area below...take your ear plugs!!!

title: Terrible reception staff - refused us the room we had booked
review: On arrival the hotel seemed nice.  We'd booked a sea view room through Alpharooms. On arrival to the room we discovered it was a side sea view and to be fair you could barely see the sea (just the road really!) ! We went to reception to explain and were told that we had booked a side sea view and that the papers we had were incorrect! We explained we had paid for a sea view and presented our booking info.  The receptionist then said that we had to ring the agent and get them to resend a fax.  To cut a long story short the receptionist ended up telling us we were wrong or lying about the booking! So so rude and were speaking to other guests whilst in the middle of the conversation with us! The hotel was far from full and the receptionist told us there were 20 free sea view rooms…

title: Perfect quite break
review: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment on a self catering basis, the kitchen was very basic but functional for basic catering. The room was clean ,as was the whole hotel,and very spacious. We paid the extra to have a sea view and this was worth every penny. We were in room 505 and the view was magnificent. The pool was very nice but a little bit cold but we managed to swim 6 out of the 7 days. There is a indoor pool for the not so brave at this time of the year which was a little bit warmer. We didn't have much contact with the staff but when we did they were very professional and friendly. The private beach which is stoney is very nice but be careful as the steps from the hotel down to it are perilous to say the least but if you go past them and follow the path around to the…

title: Room broken into
review: Firstly we have stayed ere for last four years upto four times a year unfortunately we left our room at 1 pm and returned 3 pm when we left our room was not made up - when we returned our room was made up and our belongings had gone - takingbintonaccount we were on 7th floor no access to anyone externally no damage to doors or windows - staff in hotel were unbelievably un helpful which shocked us with the amount of times we stayed there previously - we had to deal direct with police in Palma nova guardia civil - also had to take a translator for report - since guardia civil called to hotel they since fixed a window in our room - hotel was great location with great views - as previously mentioned stayed ere may times but never again - please make sure you use safes in reception…

title: Great hotel,good value for money
review: Reception staff most helpful, clean and everything you need for self catering,we stayed there for a short break in April 2014 7th to 12th thoroughly enjoyed our stay,would recommend this hotel,supermarket,restaurants ect right on the doorstep.

title: 'Value for money'
review: My teenage daughter and I have just spent one week staying in a one bedroom apartment at TRH Jardin del Mar on a self catering basis.   The apartment was basic, but clean and had everything you could need. I was not expecting a kettle (as the description at the travel agents stated that you had to pay this) there was a kettle in the room. There was also a hair dryer in the bathroom (also not listed).  The standard of cleanliness and regular cleaning was great. The only thing which was no major thing, just a bit inconvenient,  when the kettle was on the trip switch went a few times - it just needs to be flicked back up.  I did not feel the need to pay for a safety deposit box as I felt the security in the hotel was good enough.  As we were there before the season has not really…

title: Great Hotel, good value for money.
review: We have spent just under one week, room only at the THR Jardin del Mar. The hotel is very clean and the reception staff done all they could to help us with an early check in after an early flight.   The rooms are basic but clean and tidy, with everything you need for a self catering holiday, the supermarket being right outside the hotel.  The coast line in this part of the island is amazing and I recommend doing the costa lwalk in both directions from the hotel. One will take you the centre of Santa ponsa, the other, if you keep on for about an hour,  will get you to the next resort called Peguera.....this is a very hilly walk with a forest trek included!  The poolside area was kept clean and had plenty of room. The outdoor pool was very, very cold though. The sunbeds are very…

title: Can't fault it for the price
review: Can't fault it! Good position, friendly staff and clean rooms. We didn't eat here so cannot comment on the food quality. We ate out all meals, most at the pie and pint bar which does the best Sunday lunch at a great price.

title: Lovely Location in Santa Ponsa
review: TRH Jardin del Mar is a modest accomodation with a small private beach and offers excellent views of the bay in a secluded area of Santa Posa. The entire hotel complex is well kept and immaculately clean from the lobby, guestrooms, garden, restaurants and spa. The apartment where we stayed has one bedroom, a living room, a compact well equipped kitchen and a private balcony where one can relax and watch the sunset after a day of exploring the island. The meals served (we had halfboard) at the restaurants were freshly cooked and delicious. The hotel staff; receptionists, service personnel and chambermaids are courteous and friendly. However, during the peak of summer months, I can foresee difficulty in finding a parking place but other than that I surely can recommend this hotel…

title: Great views
review: We have stayed here on a number of occasions. We really like Santa Ponsa and we use this hotel because the view is so great. It is a little bit of a walk into the main town but don't let that put you off. Rooms are decent, breakfast is good but that view of the sea is wonderful. It is also good value.

title: Unspoilt Sea Views
review: Been here many times over the years. You pay for what you get. An  Upper floor apartment  with a sea view and balcony has outstanding views over the ocean, and beautiful views over the bay of Santa Ponsa. The staff are excellent and very helpful at all times. The apartments are clean, well maintained and very central for shops, pubs, restaurants etc. The complex is well laid out with plenty of sun beds. Good value for money.

title: Lovely hotel but got our stuff stolen!
review: Hotel was actually really nice and good value for money, rooms were basic but clean, pool was lovely, clean area, food was ok! Didn't eat there every night as it was very Sameish every night, breakfast was great though!   One main problem we had was we got our money stolen from our room. Went back one afternoon my purse which I wasn't using had vanished! Had all my cards in and about 100 pound in, we told reception but they wernt really bothered about it, told us to report it to the police, didn't bother asking any questions or anything.   Apart from this we had a lovely holiday and the hotel was nice :))

title: Quite enjoyable!!
review: Myself and my better half were in Santa Ponsa for 11 days and started off staying in the Holiday Park - another great location. We got an opportunity to extend our holiday but needed to get accommodation as the first place was booked for 7 nights.  I looked at extending the stay in the Holiday Park (where we had stayed the previous year), but it was not exactly attractive price wise (we were staying late in the season). So I came across this one the TRH Jardin Del Mar.  We got a great price for the extra nights so took a chance and booked. It was a great chance to try other accommodation in SP. It must be said that this place is a bit more up-market to the Holiday park (which we loved). The big plus was some UK TV channels, the better standard of sitting room (but was smaller)…

title: Not as described
review: We booked for a week and asked for a sea view by email. On arrival I was told that they were fully booked and had no sea views. Why did no one let me know before it was too late. Our room was on a lower level and was in the shade most of the day. Could not believe how you had to pay extra for every little thing kettle? what a cheek! Sunbeds were hard to get hold of, and the drinks were weak with loads of ice. Food was very sad, most meals were a long queue of sad people walking around a bit before going for the least greasy dish. The beach, did not exist, and when we wanted a beach had to go to the main one in the town. Nothing was as described and we felt ripped off with all the extras.

title: Great experience
review: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 1 week stay at the Jardin del Mar, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We were there with 12 other members of our family, to celebrate my Mams birthday.  We arrived a few hours too early to check straight into our rooms. This wasn't a problem, as a helpful lady on reception (one was helpful, the other a bit sulky) said if we can amuse ourselves for an hour or so, she would try and get us into the rooms early, and she did. We made use of a luggage room in the mean time.  The rooms were spotlessly clean, although slightly dated. Some previous reviewers have commented on how the rooms are decorated. Yes, they are dated, but if money was spent updating them, it would be too expensive to stay there!   We had a fantastic view of the sea and…

title: Tripple disapointment for Jardin del Mar.
review: We booked this Apart-hotel through "on the beach" in January 2013 for a September break the same year. The booking was done on the strength of its location, facilities and reputation, sadly we were to be very disappointed. We had requested and paid for a sea view on an upper floor to appreciate the views over Santa Ponsa bay, what we were given was a ground floor cave that looked onto the pool and received no direct sunlight during the day, I don't think so! We went back to reception and complained to a sullen unhelpful female who said they were full and we needed to ask in the morning to be moved, I don't think so! After much deliberation she offered us a room on the second floor which had huge palm trees directly opposite our balcony that you could just make out the sea if you…

title: Loved Santa Ponsa but the hotel was disappointing
review: We just came back from a 2 weeks stay and the hotel looks good but is better in pics and the room we were given was falling to pieces and was very disappointing. TLC is forgotten in this hotel. Also everything costs extra at this hotel. We thought that many had exaggerated when saying negative comments but after a 2 weeks stay I must say that they are true. Santa Ponsa is a fab resort and very clean with bars and restaurants for all ages. Daniel's Corner is a great bar and has a very good atmosphere. We are going to look to stay at Santa Ponsa, but at a different hotel, next summer.

title: Nice hotel in a sadly ex pat resort ,
review: We stayed for our anniversary in sept ,  pleasantly suprised with the hotel but the town it is stuck in a sadly mild magaluf type resort , it is our first experience of an "apart hotel" style accommodation, and based on this we would use one again,   The hotel is clean , the rooms are adequate and generally clean and comfortable , the room had a cooker and fridge/freezer and supplied plates and pans cups and glasses and cutlery / utensils,   The restaurant is clean and well services and stocked for a self service buffet although the choice was limited , especially on the fresh fruit in 5 days we only saw melon and grapefruit , this is the only let down we encountered with the food and the restaurant, decent choice of hot / cold buffet style food with rice and vegetable choices…

title: Good location, not very friendly staff...
review: We had a one bed-roomed apartment on the 5th floor which was okay.  Trouble with the cooker was resolved reasonably quickly when we complained.  The kitchen could do with an electric kettle (they had to be hired at reception) as the kettle on the hob took ages to boil.  Sheets and towels were changed regularly.  The reception and public areas look very tired and could do with a makeover.  The reception staff were unsmiling and not overly helpful, except for one young man.  Security was poor.  One evening we sat in a nearby restaurant and watched the staff (?) coming and going through the staff entrance which had a keypad entry system but the door was just left open.

title: Good location
review: This hotel is in a good location for sure-- very near the Square and far enough away from the night clubs.  Don't believe the location on its site. Yes it is near the SEA but I thought it was near the beach. Steps off the poolside take you to a little beach but no sand !!!just pebbles and rocks. The pool area is nice but the beds are very very uncomfortable. Tied down so you could not lift them up to read.!!! Also most people bought lie-lows to put on beds so as to lie with any comfort. Pity !!! Pool bar had very nice snacks and very friendly staff. Staff very friendly. Hard to believe we has to hire a kettle though !!! TV with English channels. Apartments small and basic but clean.  We didn't eat in Hotel but there are plenty of very good restaurants nearby.

title: You have to pay 4 star prices to get a decent room in this 3 star hotel.
review: Not a bit pleased, we got a studio when we had paid for a one bed room apartment. I went down to get it sorted and we then got a one bed room apartment in a worse position. Our view was of a large wall and a scruffy yard with an alley way running alongside it. The staff will describe this as a street view. We had to put up with the constant noise of the main air conditioning machines. The guy on reception I can only say was very, very economical with the truth. Others would most likely describe him as a liar. To say there were no pool view rooms available was most doubtful, when you see how many they have. It boils down to this, if you are not willing to pay 4 or 5 star prices you will get a crap room. If you consider that this hotel barely makes it past 2 star standards I think…

title: dodgy room allocation dont book with alpha rooms
review: We spent 8 nights here in September and would not go near the place again nor use Alpha rooms for anything. I have complained to Alpha rooms about how they handled my booking but they have not replied and my complaint has disappeared from the Trustpilot web.  Anyway we arrived at the hotel tired and wet but looking forward to a relaxing holiday only to find that whilst our documents showed one thing our room was another. No seaview except from a distance and we were opposite a car park/delivery yard.  We had to pay extra to receive what we had paid for already and then wait until the next day for a change of room.  This hotel's reception is the worse I have ever come across in all my travels.  Our new room did have a nice view but the balcony glass door was cracked from top to…

title: Must do better
review: I was here for 2 weeks at start of September and have stayed at this hotel before and had a wonderful time which is why I re-booked, this time though it was different, despite booking 10 months in advance requesting a specific floor we were put in  a room which had the sun for only 20 minutes during day, my partner had to contact staff as soon as we arrived as there were ants in the bathroom, under the mattress ( couch) there was a child's sword scabbard so room obviously not cleaned very well, air conditioning in bedroom not working, we requested a change only to be told that no rooms available which was very dis-appointing, after 6 days we arrived back to the room to find that it had been broken into and my partners's phone stolen and our possessions rifled through, luckily we…

title: Awful hotel
review: I don't know what these people are talking about. This is one horrible hotel and not a place to relax at all. The pool area is good for about 200 people but there are over 500 around the pool. No sunbeds, the pool area dirty and the apartment was utterly old. Electric went off twice a day and had to wait for someone to come and fix it and then we lived in fear in case it went on fire as we saw sparks several times. Check under your bed and see how great the cleaning really is! Would not go back if it was free.
