title: Fantastic stay great location!!
review: I was worried when i read reviews after booking here but thankfully have just returned from a fabulous break in santa ponsa!!  Check in is at 2pm, we arrived earlier so went a stroll- plenty restaurants and pubs/cafes metres away...and a 2min walk to spanish square!! Room was ready at 2:15 - room was spotless. View over the pool and onto the sea- brilliant!!  You do need to hire a kettle. Didnt bother me as i didnt need one.  The safety deposit boxes are located in reception- in my opinion you should always hire one, sad as it is, but i wouldnt trust leaving my valuables anywhere. Especially after the reviews on here!!! My passports, money, jewellery, hair straightners etc all went in there and it double locked - 6 euro deposit which was returned to me when i left- i canr…

title: good value
review: Very nice hotel right by the beach. It is located on a rock and has nice views. Just below the hotel, there is a little "private" beach with very clear water. The hotel is quite quiet and our room was clean. The cooking rings didn't work, but who cared really. Enough places to go for a meal or some drinks just outside the hotel.

title: "Lovely hotel, very clean."
review: This was our first time staying at his hotel in santa ponsa, we wanted a hotel nearer to shops and bars, so chose this one.  We did read reviews before booking to stay here and although some of them were mixed as they usually are we decided to give this hotel a go, we did read in reviews that it was recommended that u used the hotel safes and safety deposit boxes and also beware of pick pocketers, we were wary of this, didnt come across any pickpocketers,  everyday we locked away in our lugguage any valubles and money, laptop etc, and secured our lugguage with padlocks, that way we didnt use the hotel safe or safety deposit boxes which would have costed 4 euros a day so we saved 28 euros doing it our way. There was a notice on the wall in your room stating that they recommend…

title: Lovely hotel!
review: Lovely hotel! Gorgeous pool, perfect size! Has a volley ball court and children's outside play area! Great for family's. the only down side to this hotel is the burglaries! Keep valuables with you at all times!!

title: Beware of there sea views
review: as hotels go in the Santa Ponsa area of Mallorca, this one is not bad at all, overall the hotel is amazing for the prices, our sore point was our booking said sea view, upon seeing our balcony we strained our necks to see a pond at the end of the hotel, this they class as a side view, but all you really see is a little water, the typical view we had was vegetation and a cliff face.  But, there was a bright side to this, we didnt suffer with the suns glare heating up our room all day, that was a blessing as there air conditioning was useless. on entering our room we had to place a key in the room to turn the electric on, meaning, that if we was at the beach all day the fridge was turned off, so you couldn't keep much in it and keep it fresh.  The hotel was located right outside…

title: Lovely apartments overlooking sea
review: Just back from a week's stay at these apartments.  Was a bit wary after reading all the comments about thefts but we didn't see or hear of any problems while we were there and nothing was ever touched in our room.  We did hire a safety deposit box at reception for our money and passports.  There were always plenty of beds round the pool but maybe that's because we went at a quieter time of year so never experienced the rush for beds.   We had a room on the second floor and  the views were great, we booked a side sea view but got the full view at no extra cost, i would imagine the views from the higher floors would be the best as some of lower floors may have trees in front of your balcony!  The staff on reception were nice and friendly.  Our apartment was a good size, more than…

title: Great Week In Santa Ponsa
review: The Jardin Del Mar apartments were very central to all amenities, the square offers excellent entertainment every night.  Apartments themselves were small - though clean and comfortable - plenty of storage for clothes etc.  Hotel staff very friendly and helpful, especially the guy that worked at the pool bar.  Laundry facilities on site were very good for freshening towels etc.  Pool bar offered a good variety of snacks and drinks at very reasonable prices!  Overall great stay in Santa Ponsa. Pool facilities very good, although more sun loungers would be beneficial - it was extremely embarrassing at 9am each morning when people staying at the hotel had to scramble to reserve loungers!! Safety deposit boxes are located in the foyer of the accommodation which was fine although not…

title: Excellent apartments
review: This is our third year of staying in these apartments they never let u down brilliant location, basic but very clean and so quiet at night, always get a pool sea view , lovely at night sitting on your balcony looking out over the bay at all the boats. Rooms were cleaned every day bar a Thursday and a Sunday and clean towels every day . Would def recommend.

title: its really not that bad!!!!
review: Just returned from a week stay here...and thought I must be at a different hotel from  the bad reviews.was worried about coming because of them but things went smoothly..check-in was quick  but it was evening..the member of staff was pleasant and helpful.safety deposit is a must anywhere these days but didnt here of any thefts...leave your phones, computers and so on at home,,,, your on holiday!  Ok, so the room was dated, but it was clean and we had paid for a frontal sea view!! Its worth the extra as its stunning.first day the pool was crazy..so didnt even try but alot went home after that and never had any mad rush after that, but the little private cove next to hotel is lovely, so you dont need the pool. Location is amazing, much better than the main bit of santa ponsa,…

title: We had a great time - don't know what people expect when they go away????
review: After reading the reviews before we went I was optimistic.  I went with my husband and two children, aged 18 and 14 yrs.  We had a one bed apartment and went half board.  The accommodation was very clean with clean towels daily.  The maid was very nice, friendly and helpful.  My husband and I had the bedroom, my son slept on the sofa bed and my daughter slept on the put me up bed.  There was a table and chairs in the main living area and sideboard and TV.  The TV had a few English channels ITV, ITV2, ITV4 and BBC1West.  The kitchen was small with 2 electric rings, a fridge and sink.  As we were half board we only used this area for making rolls for lunch.  The balcony had a brilliant view overlooking the pool and sea.  We were in room 512.  The doors to the pool opened at 9am…

title: Beautiful views
review: The hotel has wonderful views, especially if you are on the third floor or above.  The public rooms are to a high standard, but the bedrooms/suites are rather shabby and need upgrading.  Breakfasts have exactly the same limited choices every day, but evening meals are really good. The staff are very helpful and polite, especially Ellie, who is one of the entertainers.  She is so friendly and helpful and is always lovely to the clients. Good for all ages, especially families.

title: bad 1980 hotel
review: Stayed here in Juli 2013 and we will devenately never come back here. the pictures do not look like our room in anyway. hole in our bathroomdoor, fixed with a a4 paper taped over hehe". Hole in our bedroom door. when we turned on the ovn in our kitchen the main fuses for the appartment turned everything dark. Positive here is that the panel with the fuses visely was inside the apparment. The pool restaurant was the only thing we found here to be very good with a really friendly staff. The rest of the hotel should be closed and fixed up. No parking here hos a rental car is also very difficult. The location is good but sadly a good location dont make this hotel good.

title: Family orientated, fantastic hotel..
review: I have stayed here on 5 occassions and I truely cannot fault it. Its location to the Square is ideal for families as there is live entertainment nightly and for the young adult its a short walk from the strip where the night takes off. Extremely friendly staff from reception to housekeeping. 5 stars all day long.

title: Jardin Del Crap Food
review: Great location (5 mins from square with best Irish/Celtic pub ever - called The Celts Well with live music until 0200 or later !) AND great free entertainment for kids and adults in the stage in centre of the square.  Another pub in square called the Caledonian does great nightly Karaoke until 4AM and a great hypnotist show twice a week. Also nice place opposite hotel called Arkels for lovely fresh well priced Irish/British food.    Food in hotel was TERRIBLE in hotel and staff were usually grumpy.  However the maids were lovely and the place is really clean.  You are also only 15 mins walk or 4 euros from town Centre.  Also internet costs 6 euro a day and safe costs 20 euro  for the week (but you get 6 euro back).

title: Basic but clean
review: After returning for a fortnights stay at the jardin del mar i have to say it was basic but clean.  We were on a half board basis which was ok for me & my partner, however the food was not great for the 2 children age 2 & 8.  Our room was very basic, had a fridge & cooker (well 2 hobs).  The use of a kettle we didnt have as we would've had to pay to hire the kettle.  Although we were half board we were getting breakfast & dinner.  We did not have adequate facilities to make lunch.  The one thing puts me off booking this hotel again is the dash for the pool at 9am.  Its a joke to say the least.  People queueing with their towels from 8.30am & the second the doors open they RUN!!!

title: Excellent Holiday
review: Just returned after spending 10 days in TRH Jardin Del Mar. After reading some of the reviews before I left I was a bit apprehensive but have no complaints. The hotel room cleaned every second day. The views were excellent. The staff on reception were very helpfull. All in all I had an grate stay for the price I payed and would have no hesitation returning.

title: Disappointed this time round
review: This was our second visit to the jardin del mar.  We had a fifth floor front sea view and it was fantastic.  That being said, we unfortunately had 'noisy neighbours' - who screamed and roared at each other for four of the seven nights we stayed.  We had to call reception three of the nights and they dealt with the matter quickly on two occasions. However on the last night of our holiday we had to make three separate calls to reception - and had to endure a very sleepless night.  In our view the hotel needs to review its policy towards people like this so that other guests do not have to endure this type of behaviour.   Also if you wish to have a late check out ensure that you get it in writing and pay for it when you make the enquiry.  We had requested a late check out and were…

title: Bit dated now
review: Unfortunately Jardin del Mar is now a bit worse for wear and could do with some money spent on it.  Still comfortable enough but don't expect "classy" and you won't be disappointed.  If you are on the right floor then views are terrific but you do pay extra for this - worth it though.  Oh and don't go to Santa Ponsa at beginning of May - too quiet and the entertainment at the Square hadn@t started.

title: Hotel OK, tourists staying there embarasing!
review: I booked this hotel with trepidation due to the poor comments and theft allegations. On arrival all seemed fine, helpful receptionist and clean and tidy reception area. Then to the room, number 315, sea front view, which was lovely. The room was of low standard with a very small kitchen and adequate air conditioning. The maid service though out my week was poor, with not much cleaning going on. Because of the theft reviews I booked a safe at the reception area (which I would do anyway as who leaves their valuables all over a hotel room wherever they are in the world?) and had or heard of no thefts during the week. I did note the clientele staying at the hotel were only interested in booze and kebabs, so maybe on a budget and cold not afford a safe as that would mean 10 less…

title: Give us your money
review: Stayed here August 2013,  Side sea view is a myth,there is no view.if you stay on the third level down with a so called side sea view you might as well stay in the basement of a cruise liner where you will hear nothing but noise from the engine of the ship ,but in this case it's a pump house for the pool,air conditioning and god knows what else.(there are no views on these levels)   We asked to be moved the reply we got was (NO) The only item you will receive in room is a kettle not electric one you put on the hob,If you want a plastic cup in the so called bar no problem €1 Door to pool on a time lock, door will spring open at 9am followed by a charge of the light brigade for sunbeds,pool bar opens at 10.50 11.00 or 11.10am depending on the cranky people working behind it,they…

title: Great location...some improvements needed though!
review: This was our second visit (Came 3 years ago) and though the hotel is good, it needs to take some notice of its reviews or people will not re-book! As simple as that ! I have been more than generous giving it 'Very Good'- It could be but!!! Here is my view. Excellent location- the sea views and location are fantastic. Santa Ponsa great.  Our room was cleaned 3 times in 7 days and would have been 4 if we hadn't been sleepy one morning! Good standard of cleaning. Air con works, just, but again very basic! Ants in the bathroom and kitchen need sorting- this is 2013!!!! and we were on the top floor! Pool bar food good quality and value- drinks are a silly price! 6 Euro's for a beer and a small coke!!!  Go to the Spar and get San Miguel for 70cents!!  Pool very clean and a good size.…

title: DONT USE THIS HOTEL!!!
review: Whilst staying at this hotel both mine and my brothers mobile phones were stolen and also my fiance's football top. There was no sign of a break in and our balcony door was locked at all times when we were out so it was members of staff (cleaners) doing the stealing. My brothers phone was in my suitcase which means they were rummaging through my things and also the football topwas hanging up in the wardrobe which they also must have been snooping through. When we informed the manager he simply said we should have been using safety deposit boxes which yes fair enough but have we to start putting our clothes in these boxes too? Disapointing to be honest!!!

title: family holiday
review: We have looked at a lot of reviews for these hotel apartments,we were so not sure what to exspect,but we realy enjoyed our accomadation,it was of average size and comfortable for a small family,had realy great sea view,our only small problem was ants and we were on 6th floor, and getting a sunbed, all staff were polite and rooms cleaned 5 out of 7 days,local shops very close to hotel,but beach about 15 minute walk,nice place but do not think i would revisite.

title: Here we go...........
review: Ok, I stayed here in 2012 and loved it. Went again last week and was absolutely dreading it after reading recent reviews. The manner of the reception staff was vastly improved from our last visit, although then i put any difficulties dowm to the language barrier! They are handing out questionaires and have put up signs to lock away your valuables. What is wrong with people that they think they can leave vast amounts of cash and i pods etc in their rooms? I wouldnt do that at work, let alone on holiday. The rental of a safety deposit box is 12 Euros. I charged all gadgets over night then put them in the safe for the day. I then locked the key and the chargers in a suitcase out of sight. I also took a springy key fob, £2.25 from Timpsons, removed the room number tag and kept the…

title: DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!
review: Stayed here for a week and will never step foot back in the place! Do not waste your money!   Arrived in hotel around 12.30pm. Receptionist very ignorant - no welcome whatsoever! Got room key etc and discovered that it was room 037 which is right beside the boiler house on the ground floor. We refused to stay in the room due to the noise which was unbearable and also the view was terrible. We demanded for the room to be changed but were told that there were no other rooms and to wait until the next morning to speak to the manager. We then decided to stay in reception until they fixed the problem as we have heard of this happening to other people and ending up not getting a room change. The security guard was present during our check so then he tried to reason with us and try to…

title: Loved it, bargain price!
review: Stayed here 1st weekend in October 2011 for 4nights £30 a night bargain! Emailed prior to going and asked for a 1st floor room(as my husband is scared of heights) and got a beautiful room over looking the pool and sea. Only stayed self catering and can't really comment on the facilities because really who goes on holiday to cook! Room was just your typical spanish 3star apartment, was clean and tidy and a great location what more do you want! The location is spot on if you go out of the back of the hotel theres a beautiful walk down past the little coves and takes you to the beach/promende. If you go out of the front of the hotel it takes you on a lovely walk down to the centre passing shops/bars etc. Would definately recommend you stay here as weare in October! Recommend the…

title: this is going to be long
review: given different room from one we paid for beware they tell u there fully booked but yet offer u other rooms for a extra 20 euro a night. aircon is rubbish its like a hair dryer on middle heat get the ring cut to keep the power on all day and I also found the the fan settings are wrong as number 3 is slower than number 1 plus if u leave the power on all day keep the tv on with it turned up loud enough to keep the robbing staff sticky fingers away and put your do not disturb sign up to keep them out as cleaners don't do a good job floors are sandy beds are too and taps and sinks are covered in grime also. staff down stairs are useless,rude,wasters. all week we were there indoor pool was out of order. two out of three pool tables were out of order for two days. sunbeds were taken…

title: Fab family holiday!!!
review: Had an amazing 11 days here with family n friends: food lovely, fab location, rooms clean n perfect for our family of 4, no problems with safe or room security. It was our second year running there and we wud def return. Thanx to everyone there who helped make it a truly memorable experience :-)

title: Great value and a great stay
review: My family of 4 have Just returned from a 10 day half board stay with friends (another family of 4),  i was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the bad reviews about theft and poor staff etc. Here's my review which Is based on my own stay.  Our 1 bedroom sea view apartment on the 3rd floor (317) had an excellent view of the coast and was very clean and kept clean by friendly staff with plenty of clean towels. There is a Kitchen area which is very small but didn't matter to us too much on half board but is ok with a kettle and decent fridge which is on all the time and not just when the key that works the lights etc is operated. The room is a decent size with a good balcony. The only real negative is the air con, it was truly terrible For 35 degree plus temperatures, nights…

title: very nice time
review: just came back from seven day trip.looking at other reviews i dont recognise this as the same hotel maybe i was just lucky? staff were very nice and helpful to me .i hired the safe deposit box so left no valuables around. the room was basic but clean and functional.and the view was great straight onto the sea.i was on level four which is the same level as reception which i found very handy.biggest gripe i have is the beds are very hard and not very comfortable and the air con isnt the best and the cavalry charge at 9am each morning for a sun bed is a farce aint people weird. a short walk away you find little coves to relax in away from the hustle and bustle and the location is ideal a short walk into the town.overall i thought this was a nice hotel with nice staff in a nice…

title: WOULDNT STAY HERE AGAIN!!
review: Upon arrival on our stay (1st - 11th august) we were greeted by the receptionist. When checking in he informed me of how the hotel had made a mistake with my booking and we had to stay in a temporary room until the following day - the "temporary room" was awful. You could see the pipes along the ceiling, when the room above turned on water or flushed the chain you could hear it and it sounded as if it was driping onto the floor. The air con was crap like all rooms. You couldnt open the window because we were above the extractor fan which was to noisey. The following day i got a room beside my sister for "free" due to their mistake, in which its what i paid for really. Rooms was average, you get what you pay for. 4 days into our stay my sisters room and 5 other rooms were robbed…

title: Very enjoyable holiday ~Good Hotel, will book again next year
review: We have had 7 wonderful days at the Jardin Del Mar ,on arrival staff were ever so helpful and very pleasant, not sure why other people would say staff were not helpful as they were all so nice to us, from the cleaners to the reception staff and bar staff.  When we arrived it was too early to check in, we did know check in was 2pm  so this was not a problem to us, we read the Hotel details before we arrived, I always research the Hotel so knew  check in time.  If you were lucky though you would get in your room earlier than 2, this would depend who checked out and what time before you..We were unlucky as our room wasn't ready until 2.30.    The room we were given was on top of the restaurant, couldn't see the pool only a bit of the sea, nice enough room though.  We  asked to…

title: Lock up you possessions
review: The hotel in itself is good for a 3 star.  The rooms are a bit tired but the location and view is lovely.  However our room was broken into (we suspect a member of staff as the room was double locked when we returned), our ipad and some money was stolen.  The hotel staff did not care and just said that these things happen and we should have paid for a safety deposit box!  Not 1 apology, from a member of staff.  I even wrote to TRH in Madrid and have had no response.  Great customer service!!

title: Location great, hotel staff awful, stay vigilant
review: We had read the reviews prior to our trip and panicked but decided to go and try and see for ourselves. The reception staff and cleaners we saw were really miserable and when asked about any previous thefts and reviews etc they suddenly couldn't speak English and refused to even discuss, which didn't exactly calm our worries!  A neighbouring room was stolen from on our first day which prompted me to carry all valuables/money with me the entire holiday. It would appear the tall female cleaner has a tall man dressed in smart shirt and trousers with her when thefts happen (possibly giving he impression he is checking their work)? i did witness him standing at the door of the room which was stolen from whilst the maid was cleaning. Wether the thefts happen at time of cleaning or…

title: Never again will we stay at the jardin de mar
review: We arrived excited at our hotel as we hadent be to Santa ponsa in 7 years our kids were now growin up, when we went to our side see view room we could have cried our view was a wall with a bush on it, and a creepy allyway the door was broken, when we went to reception to tell them we weren't happy they were so unhelpful said that is what uv paid for and there was nothing wrong with the door we were persistent they had us look at another three rooms I wanted front see view but at a cost 20 euros a day so cost us an extra 200 euros for our 10 day stay, we were moved to fourth floor room 415,  it put a but of a damper on our holiday if id had know this we would have budgeted for this, very dissapointed with the travel advisor,  you have to pay for wifi and hire of an iron if wanted…

title: Much better than expected
review: I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Jardin Del Mar. As with some other reviewers, I was very apprehensive following some of the previous reviews and was expecting to be mugged, stolen from and generally abused by the staff, the minute I walked through the door.  Nothing could have been further from what we experienced as a family.  Reception on arrival - we arrived at the hotel at 12:30am. We were greeted by a serious, but professional receptionist who explained where our room was and when meal times, pool, etc, were available.  The room - We had room 314 ( I had paid extra for a sea view ). We had a fabulous view of the pool and sea. Yes, the rooms are small, but my party consisted of me and the hubby (both of us are on the bigger side, a 15 year old and an 11 year…

title: Great location, beware of thieves
review: Lovely clean apartments. I was on the forth floor which was very quiet, I paid extra for side sea view, wish I didn't as my view was not great at all, from talking to other guests some were lucky to get sea view without any extra costs, so it's a win or loose.  Most views thou are sea view or side sea view anyway.  I went half board food was ok, wouldn't complain to much as it saved us alot of money eating out.  Some staff need to break a smile thou, I found the younger dark haired lad that works on reception very helpful the others not so much, u will know wen u c him as he is the only younger one there.  Hire a safe,  it cost €24 for ten nights, but worth known our money passports  etc were safe, now it's a small safe.  There is a price to hire out alot of things such a the…

title: Make sure you have got good insurance
review: Unpleasant unhelpful reception staff.No welcome what so ever! Paid for sea view but got trees! Air con rubbish. Rooms basic but clean but now wonder why the cleaning staff n dodgy male staff member are so enthusiastic about being in the corridors all day 'cleaning'.  One of our party returned from pool to find room robbed. Anything valuable taken with no sign of forced entry!! When she went to report it there were many others there reporting the same. Last people in rooms were cleaning staff.  Management so unhelpful and did not care. said if they didn't double lock room with key a credit card can swipe it open!!! Surely at check in guests should be advised this as everyone assumed the click heard when door closed was it locked!!  The hassle and upset for so many guests was just…

title: Basic apartment but views amazing , would return no problem :))
review: Just returned from an 11 night stay, had room 519 which is a superior apartment with the most enormous balcony, more like a terrace with our own loungers & furniture, truly fabulous views of cove, pool & out to sea, which more than made up for the basic apartment.  We like many had read the reviews & were v careful, hiring a locker & nothing of value on show or left in the room, certainly no gadgets etc.  All the staff we met were helpful, polite & made us welcome, our cleaning lady in particular was a sweetheart.  My advice - if you can afford it, pay to upgrade to sea view & or superior & be sensible with your valuables, I had no reason to be suspicious at anytime but worth bearing other people's experiences

title: Don't believe everything you read
review: When I booked this hotel in February, I looked at trip advisor and read a host of good reviews. 2 days before our departure, I read the reviews again about the so called thefts from rooms and had a sleepless night followed by a frantic morning of desperately searching the net for alternative hotels, only to find alternatives at twice the price we paid.  Needless to say on arrival we felt incredibly anxious and hired a safe for 15 euros. Having been a holiday rep for 3 years and conducted probably 300 welcome meetings, this is something we always recommended to guests anyway.  On day 2 we met a couple who said they had things taken for their room including £600 in cash. I am sorry to say but I did not believe it. We never had any issues with things taken from out room, one day I…

title: Great location
review: Just come back from a 7 day long holiday at this hotel, which is in a great location and has very friendly staff and the rooms were always clean. The hotel had a great view of the harbour and was just a short walk from the shops as well as the tour boats. On the down side; there was no food for kids and the vegetarian option was very limited. Sleeping on the beds was like sleeping on a rock. the twin beds in the bedroom were like concrete and the sofa bed creaked if you as much as moved a muscle. I would highly recommend the area of Santa Ponsa.

title: Shame about the thieves!!
review: We booked six rooms half board at this hotel for ten days. I was anxious after reading reviews regarding thefts at the hotel. My fears were realised when my daughter's room got robbed. I will not say 'broken into' because there was no forced entry.  They stole cash and an iPhone from a Locked suitcase.  When we went to reception other guests arrived to say their rooms had been robbed. The receptionist was arrogant and unhelpful, the manager hid away in a room behind reception. They refused to get the police and basically did not want to know. This made us feel very insecure and unsafe.  There is no CCTV in this large hotel. I kept a 'do not disturb' sign on my door at all times, i just got clean towels and sheets off the cleaner and cleaned the room myself. We were on the ground…

title: Rubish!!!!
review: I would agree  completely with Wiskeyonemore, never again, this is a rubish hotel, the air con did not go below 35 degrees although we did file off the key an left it in the eletric all day it made absolutely no difference. My husband went to reception to complain an ask  for another key they said it was their policy one key only per room, which I have never herd off in my life! My husband spent every night on the balcony trying to sleep!  So if you were there between the 24th July and the 7th August im sorry for the very loud snoring noise coming from our balcony!!! He was told that someone would be up to sort it but no one ever showed. Some people are saying how much value for money this hotel is but I have to say I would not go there or recommend this hotel to anyone if they…

title: Never Again
review: Just back from this hotel and it was not a happy holiday experience. Firstly kept like caged animals at a door to be released at 9 am then all hell brakes loose to get a sunbed ( the only good point there was meeting some truly lovely people in that Q). Pool was far too small for the hotel and there was no remove to move  due to kids with lilo's and balls. Once you did get a sunbed they were so uncomfortable a lilo is a must.  Be aware if you are bookedfor this hotel a safe is a must as the stealing is rife and sadly it is the staff and it's not just money and phones it's aftershave and even Nike shorts  The only good point is the view and where the hotel is situated it is wonderful.If I where the owners I would take on board these reviews that are posted and step up or people…

title: Never put a foot through the door!
review: First night complained the air con wasn't working!they asured me it was fine eventhough the room was 35 degrees! When you removed your key from the room it turned aircon and eletric off so your room was like an oven! They have the eletric key welded on to the keyring ! My advice buy a file and file the key off ! That's what I did ! To be honest it didn't make a pile of difference but every little helped ended up sleeping on the balcony for 13 night ! Now for the staff if you could call them staff 3 words unhelpfull ignorent useless! Also the whole ground floor rooms were broken into valubles stolen from safty deposit boxes that you had to pay for! Dosent take a rocket science to work out it was an inside job! I just hope the owners of this hotel know the way it,s being run…

title: Much better than expected would return
review: , Been home a few days, from a 10 day holiday,  The thing that did bother me, after i booked the hotel was a run of bad  reviews regarding thefts from rooms, i guess this could happen in any hotel, and it depends who reviews, not eveyone reviews, what did surprise me was the those reviewed about the bad experience, thefts, who claimed to have stayed in the hotel year in year out, never reviewed the positive visits, and there must have been some or they wouldn;t have returned to the same hotel, this was our first visit, and i admit the run of bad reviews did un nerve me, but I can honestly say we had a great time at the hotel, obviously we never left any valuables in room, but there again i wouldn't do that in any hotel,  We where self catering, and if you are planning on making…

title: Excellent
review: I have now stayed twice at this hotel and found it to be of good quality, clean and in a great location. l have always found staff to be very helpful and friendly, the room maid on floor 5 could not do enough for you, pity they weren,t more like her in other hotels. Will definately be back next year.

title: Great holiday but beware!!!!
review: After reading reviews before hand we were a little sceptical about the hotel. All in all lovely hotel, not sure about comments about hiring kettle as ours was provided. Had a nice clean room on third floor with good views. Tv had bbc1 bbc2 and stv all free of charge which makes a pleasant change. Altogether a lovely holiday with great location. We did hear of quite a few thefts which is a shame as its a good hotel. Pity they can't sort their staff out. Just hire a safe and don't leave any valuables in the room unattended and you will have a great holiday. Don't take any chances as it does happen.

title: Great stay
review: Enjoyed my stay at Jardin del Mar.Area is nice and quite at night but is not too far away from all the action.It was about a 10 minute walk to the main strip.Rooms where clean and basic but you get what you pay for.Only problem with the room was the air conditioning isn't very powerful so can get warm at times.Also it turns off when you leave the room as you have to take the electricity key with you.Pool is nice and spacious.Hard to get sunbeds but that is always the case in any hotel I've ever stayed in.There was plenty of seating around the sunbeds which i found great to sit in the sun.

title: Excellent family hotel
review: Excellent family hotel,situated in a beautiful and peaceful part of Santa Ponsa. Rooms were a bit small but done us ok. Cleaning staff were very friendly but that could not be said for bar staff.Reception staff were very friendly too.Pool was beautiful but you would need to be up early to get a sun lounger.Located a short walk from the Square which had entertainment to suit all ages.Lovely restaurants and bars all in the area.A ten minute walk brought us down to main strip where the most amazing beach was.Calm clear waters.A must for families.

title: Beware  - please read!!!!
review: I returned home yesterday from a weeks stay and felt that I needed to warn future guests of the potential for problems at the Jardin del Mar.  Firstly the hotel was better than we were expecting, having read some reviews.  The rooms are clean and airy although the air conditioning is low and not adjustable, so it was a little uncomfortable due to the heat.  The self catering facilities are minimal although we managed. We did have to 'rent' a toaster and it was quite a challenge cooking for 6 with what was provided in the way of saucepans, etc.  the pool area is spacious but very crowded with young children. The dash for getting sun beds was hilarious - doors open at 9 and it really is a dash to get sun beds which are very uncomfortable so lilos are a must. The guests are very…

title: Good family holiday
review: After reading the reviews we were a bit apprehensive but turns out we had nothing to worry about.  The hotel was lovely.  Rooms are small but clean and the towels are changed every 3 days and beds every 5.  You do have to hire kettle etc but we brought a travel kettle and iron with us.  The kitchen is small but if you are just making breakfasts and lunches it is fine.  We ate out every night (try the tapas bar in the square facing the gardens and also try xlocs in the main street facing the tobacco shop).  The main shopping streets are very good and the beach is fantastic. No problems with the staff although the blonde receptionist is a bit sour but we found that a please and thank you went a long way.  The rush for the sunbeds is a bit ridiculous but the lifeguard removes…

title: Better than expected
review: Just returned from weeks holiday at this hotel.  I was dreading it after reading some reviews.  Was pleasantly surprised. Room was basic but clean with fresh towels most days and bed linen changed once.  I understand why people commented on the self catering facilities which weren't  great if you wanted to cook a meal as no oven and only two rings.  This was not an issue for me as  I only made breakfast and lunch   We had a room on the same level as the pool which was good. I found staff pleasant especially the young man on reception who was very helpful.  I never heard anyone talking about theft although we carried our valuables with us which we would do anyway. Good location as you can walk into centre of resort very easily.  I would agree air conditioning not very effective.

title: lovely apartments and seaview
review: I don't usually write about hotels but having read all the  stories about rooms small,robberies and unfriendly staff before i went, i thought i must put anyone going in the near future mind to rest. I went  in a group of 7 (2 families in 2 rooms) at the end of July, we had a fantastic time. Rooms are big enough and clean, my bed was made up and towels changed 5 out of the 7 days,probably  could do with a bit a paint but most hotels abroad could as well. I never heard of anyone being broken into while i was there but use the safety deposit box for any valuables and keep keys with you as you would at home. The rush for the sunbeds is true but i would give them about half an hour and then move towel off beds if they did not return (or send brother in law to get us a bed like i…

title: Fab fab time...
review: We have just returned from our holiday here, boo.. We have had an amazing time..we had a ground floor with a view of a hedge but hey ho we are in our rooms to sleep..whilst swimming in the pool you can see the ocean. Its a spectacular view..perfect location with the most gorgeous cove right on our door step, you can see the fish swimming from the top of the hotel its that clear.. Our boys were in the pool from 9am till bed unless we managed to get them out to so swim in the sea..food was good, plenty of choice and always hot..staff were great fun, made us feel welcomed and was grateful for a 'thankyou'.. We didnt go here expecting luxury but we expected exactely what we paid for and got more.. I recommend this hotel to anyone..i think the stories about being robbed happens…

title: Avoid if possible
review: Just returned from a 10 day break here and the only thing i  gave pass marks to was the location and, if your lucky enough the view.  We stayed in room 201 which had a decent enough view over the sea and a bit of the pool.  The room was pretty small but otherwise clean, kitchen was like a phone box.  The hotel is advertised as having air con but to experience it you had to stand on a chair 2ft away from it to feel it which can be tricky when your sleeping, this only worked in the living room.  The room was worse, imagine a polar bear breathing on you lightly and your half way there.  We did complain about it but were given the shrug and told thats it.  Heard a few other people complaining about the same thing so must be the whole hotel affected.  The electricity also kept…

title: Could be better..
review: I had read previous reviews warning of robberies and after arriving I could see why. The rooms are not secure with non-existent locks on the balcony doors and the front door could be opened with a kick. The staff were friendly enough except for one rather stern looking blonde receptionist who appeared to consider smiling a crime. We had a side sea view on the fifth floor which was lovely. The location itself is great as it's close to the square which had free entertainment every night which was needed since the hotel has no entertainment whatsoever for either adults or kids.   The rooms themselves could badly do with a makeover. We went self-catering and it was a bit of a surprise to find we had to rent such basics such as a kettle and a toaster and they didn't have a microwave!…

title: Be very careful with belongings
review: Just back from 2 week stay here and were well aware of all the robberies beforehand so we outsmarted them. We were given a room on the first floor but it was very squashed, tv didnt work and balcony view was of hedge. We then upgraded to the seaview on 7th floor which was 20 euro extra per night. You'll notice that they try and get money from you at any opportunity they get.. toasters, wifi, microwaves.. The balcony view was execptional of the sea and the room was a lot more spacious so i would say spend the extra money as theres a big difference in the room. We found the security guard very suspicious. On the first night we left the room to check out the area and returned shortly after to find him lurking about our corridor tampering at doors. But on other ocassion we had gone…

title: Good budget hotel
review: We have just returned from a 2 week break at this hotel. As previous guests have stated, we were dreading it after reading reviews, but it just goes to show that guests have different expectations. We had a great time, food was lovely, staff were polite and the hotel and our room were spotless! (room 708)  We did hire a car so we didn't spend a great deal of time by the pool, but I have to say my only gripe would be the reserving of sunbeds, I think the hotel should police this better as the few days we wanted to be by the pool we were unable to get a sunbed. However, a few mins walk from the hotel is a great cove, which was lovely and the water was calm and shallow. As we were leaving the hotel was getting busier so I don't know what it would be like in the height of the…

title: Excellent for families or couples
review: My husband and I stayed here as he had been with his family a few years before. The hotel and facilities are all great and the surrounding area is excellent. There were shows every night in the "square" but it was actually a circle. With shops and bars all around the edge and seating all around the staging. We watched "Elvis", "Westlife", "Rod Stewart" and "Abba" amongst others then went on to the Karaoke Bar which was one of the bars in the circle. Brilliant time.....

title: Great Hotel
review: We have just returned from a week in the Jardin Del Mar and had a fantastic time.  We booked this hotel then started reading past reviews and was dreading the thought of going.  I am pleased to say that we had nothing to worry about.  We had booked a side sea view but decide to upgrade and got a lovely room (320) with massive balcony overlooking the small beach, room was spotless, perfect.  We found all the staff to be lovely, especially the guys who work in the pool bar.    We hired a safety deposit box, which is located beside the reception and had no problems with that.  We didn't leave any valuables in our room but not because of theft in the hotel, we wouldn't leave them lying about in any holiday hotel room.    It's true what has been written about the sunbed situation,…

title: Great budget hotel
review: I read all the reviews before going and I have to say I was dreading my holiday, however on arriving I was pleasantly surprised. We were in room 111 which overlooked the pool, it was clean if a little dated but I've stayed in far worse 3 star hotels. I had decided not to take our iPad due to previous reviews of theft and to be honest we didn't even miss it as there was plenty to do. Our towels were changed 3 times and bedding once in the week we were there and the floor was swept. I found the staff friendly although there are a couple of grumpy ones at reception but they weren't rude. I liked that the pool area was opened at 9 so that you had a fair chance at getting a sunbed, some people took it too far by sprinting to the beds they wanted but having stayed in a 4 star hotel…

title: GRAND HOTEL ,PITY ABOUT ALL THE NICKING
review: I have stayed in this hotel about 8 times it total now, but after returning this year that's it im afraid,I'm finished with this place.my ipod was taken from the room, loads of other reviews have stated the same problem and the problem seems to be getting worse. the hotel itself is fine you get what you pay for, rooms are small, you have no control over the air con , they set it at the level they think it should be at, which is always low. pool area is good and the bar staff are helpful and friendly, the young guy at the reception desk was very helpful and he could teach a few of the other staff how to chill out. but the major problem is all the stealing going on, so go at your own risk if you wish, i will not be returning until the problem has been sorted

title: Don't stay here...Awful
review: Just back from staying here for 10days.. OMG it needs up-grading asap..stayed in room 422 and had an awful view of 2 trees..asked to move to another room and was told they were fully booked and if a room became available I'd have 20euro a night extra. I'd already paid nearly £1,700 for this holiday.. Had to stay in room given. These rooms are dirty we wouldnt even use the dishes or cups, we bought plastic ones..I had to clean the room each day as cleaner didnt even wipe birds droppings off balcony. We will NEVER stay there again and wouldnt recommend to anyone to go there. Santa Ponsa is lovely place but stay somewhere else...

title: staff thiefing from guests
review: just returned from this hotel, good holiday hotel ok. At pool every day and nearly every day there was a story of key entry into rooms. 1 couple had phones, money and tablet stolen after member of staff entered room using key. Superior rooms were targeted each time and staff were rude and unhelpful. Hotel is old and has no CCTV. Hotel in bad need of upgrade and need to sort out serious internal security issues.

title: Theives in Jardin Del Mar.
review: Just back from the summer hols. We had the worst hols that you could have, as my room was broken into by spiderman. It may sound funny but it is the only explanation as there was no sign of a forced entry from either the patio doors nor the main door into the room. Iphone, HTC  phone, two tablets a camera a bag and money taken out of the room. When I approached the reception to report the theft I asked the receptionist to get his manager who said she was busy. Other customers were starting to gather and listen. At this point I was greeted by the so called Manager. She was rude, uncaring ,unsympathetic and just very unprofessional. There was also a distinct lack of security processes in place in this establishment in that additional room keys were handed out with out checking…

title: Do Not Stay Here
review: I have stayed at this Hotel every year for the past 8 years,but never again.Our room was broken into (with a key)and my sons playstation vita was stolen.The staff were not a bit helpful no apology ,they said they would change the locks which never happened,and said we could be just making up the story.It happened to several other people while we were there but still the hotel will do nothing about the problem.

title: To All Brits Stay Clear Of This Hoilday
review: Just come back from this hotel (29th to 6th July 2013) there was 9 of us (5adults and 4 kids), we had booked  three rooms but when we arrived we where offered a room that 3 adults and 2 kids could sleep in on the sixth floor room 629 and it was a penthouse, really high up, standard room and we thought great because my husbands auntie who is in her 70's and granddaughter wouldn't be in a room on there own, my daughter and husband where in 014 with there kids, my husband auntie asked for a safe key but the reception couldn't understand, then on the thurs 4th July 2013 we noticed that 2tablets and iPhone charger was stolen from room, STAFF where not helpful and wouldn't phone police and didn't understand( they only understand when's her are taking your money) the little English…

title: Awful hotel..awful staff
review: We've been back a week and I'm still furious with this terrible hotel. We paid extra for a 'side sea view' and having been here before and paid quite a lot more for the 'frontal sea view' so decided I'd rather be at the side of the hotel (overlooking pool - as requested!) - on the 'side' of the building! On both arrivals we were given rooms at the back of the hotel and whilst they moved us to a room that we paid for the last time around..they refused us this time and the reception were unhelpful and rude each time we asked (3 times).  Our room was at the bottom with nothing but overgrown bushes - if you squinted then you'd see some water and also some sky! We also had the benefit of a balcony door that barely opened (took 2 days to fix) and punch holes in the main doors -…

title: Another enjoyable stay
review: My fiance and i have just returned from a 2 week holiday at the Jardin del Mar, once again we thouroughly enjoyed ourselves.  On arrival we were assingned a room on the bottom floor, the night porter "Pedro" was very honest with us and told us that the view was not the best and we were offered a superior room at an added cost, we chose to upgrade after kindly being allowed to see the room. Room 712 is very spacious with a great view and big balcony, we were very pleased with room and it was a great start to our holiday!.  This was our second visit to the Hotel and found the staff very polite and helpful, "Fencesco" on reception recognised us from last year and was always polite, as well as pedro the night porter, also veronika the life guard was always cheerful and chatty even…

title: Tired and requires an upgrade
review: In the bathrooom Thin threadbare towels, tiles required regrouting in the whole bathroom, black edges surround the bath taps are green with age. In  the kitchen  hob didn't heat up the kitchen surface was burnt and scorched the plates were chipped. No information how to use anything in the apartment, tv,hob,fridge,safe. No authority at the pool   lifeguard permits,jumping,bomb diving,air beds, and small inflatable boats there is a notice to say these are not allowed however, the guard was either nowhere to be seen or when was there took little interest. On a positive note The staff were all fantastic.  The pool area was clean and pleasant to sit, the music and bingo was annoying but that's a matter of taste. I would not return to this hotel as there are plenty others in the area…

title: Beware of thieves and lack of support from hotel
review: Warning to anyone going to this hotel. My pensioner parents have  just returned after an extremely upsetting experience. Upon arrival at 1215am (due to a flight change) they checked in ok, but had two women distract them at the lift and try to steal mums purse - from a zipped up bag! Mum thankfully noticed and the woman dropped the purse on the floor. When my parents told reception they asked if anything had been taken, when mum explained she was lucky and got the purse back they said "that's ok then, no need to report it to the police". What so they can carry on and do it to someone else? They got no sympathy or support. Other minor points in comparison, room not cleaned, towels not replaced regularly and had to ask reception for toilet rolls. The resort is fabulous, it's a…

title: Excellent
review: Great place....great location. ..3rd time here and will DEF be back...hotel staff were outstanding and entertainment was available every day for both children and adults. ...my 3 year old son had a ball at the pool area

title: Average
review: It was my first holiday with my boyfriend, two single beds shoved together as a room, the pool was freezing and the reception staff weren't helpful atall! There was good room space but that's about all.

title: Lovely Holiday,
review: Our holiday was great. Hotel was lovely, cleaned daily, staff friendly, pool great with lifeguard on duty for the children. I travelled with my husband and son aged 2 1/2. He had a ball. Great location as its up a little away from the main strip, but close to everything at the same time. Only thing about Jardin Del Mar was the apartment was a little on the small size but all in all we really didn't care as we were only in the apartment to sleep and shower, we spent the day outside. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

title: WARNING TO OTHER HOLIDAY MAKERS
review: Having returned with my partner from a holiday in Jardin Del mar beach hotel santa ponsa Mallorca 8-6-2013. I feel it is my duty to inform holiday makers of our experience at the above hotel. on the second day of our stay a thief gained entrance to our apartment and stole my partners hand bag, containing money, camera, and the safety deposit key. The signs at reception area did read 'we strongly advise you rent a safety deposit box'. The thief then used the key to gain access to the safe, that was located at reception area. To steel all our money and goods. To my total astonishment was the management and staff did not do anything to help are position and at first refused to call police until I insisted they do so. In no uncertain manner the management or staff offered no comfort…

title: be very careful with your belongings in this hotel
review: I have been to santa ponsa about 14 times over the years and can not believe how bad this hotel is dealing with the complaints we were only 15 mins in hotel and my handbag was stolen in the lobby waiting on the lift which was broken for the week we were there.  We had a wheelchair with us for my dad and 5 suitcases so had to get the lift meanwhile we were being watched by the robbers which were waiting to strike. I was lucky as i got my bag back but several other people were not so lucky when i reported it to reception (manager) they didnt seem to be too shocked the guy on reception said not again so it seems its a regular thing.  They have no security or cctv in the hotel so be very careful as they are professionals and i wouldnt like to see anyone else getting the shock i did.…

title: Stay away unless the lift is fixed
review: Having been here four times before we thought it was a safe bebut so disappointedt Our first room was dreadful looking onto a wall on the ground floor when we complained we moved to the 5th floor which was a studio we could not walk straight into the bathroom as the door omly opened a small bit and we paid for an apartment. Only one lift was working as they were installing a new one  and the noise was dreadful it was like living on a building site with drilling and grinding  Staff so unhelpful apart from one young man who was pleasant.

title: Basic Cheap Accommodation
review: Another couple I was travelling with in Santa Ponsa stayed here, and I visited the complex and had a look around. I purposely didn't book her because of the negative mixed reviews so thought a view from someone who recently visited it and looked in one of the rooms might help others. Remember this is a three star complex but it was recently renovated and the renovations make the place look good. If your looking for cheap, small rooms and basic accommodation with extras at a cost - this hotel does the trick and is well located.  From what I can see, the TRH offers budget accommodation that travel agents here in Ireland seem to push strongly. The Hotel is located relatively central in Santa Ponsa but a short walk from the clubs and pubs. So there should be no street level noise…

title: reception
review: just back from santa ponsa, stayed at the the jardin de mar,hotel was ok its was just the staff at reception we very rude you could not ask them a question, the management would want to sort this out before it spoils the hotel brand other then that it was fine, a must is the auld triangle pub 2 mins away great music every night (kevin heaslip) & great staff enjoyed every night, thanks kevin, would recomend "jackies" to eat lovely food & spotless spent a few nights there, its next to burger king.

title: Noisey hotel
review: On arrival we were given our room. It was on the first floor with trees over balcony. We asked for an upgrade, which cost 200 euros for a see view. We were delighted with this room and unpacked. Within ten minutes the noise was unbearable. We had been allocated a room next to the lift which was being replaced. We complained and were then moved to another room. Which meant packing and unpacking again. This room was acceptable. Maid service was just ok. Only big complaint was that I had to eventually put all the bins out for them to be emptied. There are only two lifts. One lift was operational which meant a lengthy wait or walk up and down the stairs. Reception staff were ok. There is a young man who was extremely pleasant and helpful. Staff at the pool area obviously didn't…

title: Good value
review: Firstly reviews need to be put into perspective. You do not get 5* hotels for the price of a 3* As such reviews need to be relevant to the cost of the hotel. Beginning with the rooms - These were clean and functional but small. Kitchen was very basic but at least you can boil a kettle for the obligatory cuppa. TV was OK, a couple of UK channels. Our 1st room was on the ground floor and faced an ivy covered wall with very little light and no view. However upon speaking to reception we were moved to the 2nd floor which had a side view of the sea and was mush brighter / warmer. Hotel - Clean. However there was building work (lifts being replaced) which meant a lot of noise from drilling. This would not be an ongoing issue and we were just unlucky.  Swimming pool - Nice pool ....…

title: marshman
review: our room had stunning sea view with private balcony complete with our own sun loungers if you have early flight you carnt check in till 2 wasnt a problem for us theres a bar across the road called eldorado best beer in santa ponsa  fab couple so well worth going there while you waiting  will be back at this hotel in oct

title: Excellent hotel !!!
review: Just had a brilliant holiday at the Jardin del mar couldn't fault it !! We paid extra for a superior sea view and had a large terrace over the bay with beautiful views !! The meals at the hotel were excellent with a good variety to cater for all needs, The staff were very courteous and helpful especially the young man on reception who was always cheerful and couldn't do enough to help. The hotel is very well situated and surrounded by shops and resturants so you dont have far to walk if you don't want to, but its a lovely walk around the coast into santa ponsa beach. I will certainly be returning again

title: Burglars!
review: Don't leave your key to the reception! We did. While we were having early dinner (about 4 pm), the key had dissapeared from the reception. We received a spare key and went to the room to look for "forgotten" key as the receptionist claimed. At this point it wasn't a suprise at any level that the room was in a mess. Clothes we on the floor, beds were open and separated. We went back to the reception and told what had happened. The best is yet to come: no apologies, nothing. The reception lady only advised us to go to the police station. Yeah, right.   We demanded a new room as the key was obviously in dishonest hands. The lock was changed in 10 minutes! okay, thanks for that. (They must do this quite often...)  I also let them know how dissapointed I was with the staff. As I see…

title: Good location, good value
review: The hotel features apartments rather than rooms which we really like - seperate little kitchen area, lounge with dining area, spacious balcony & seperate bedroom. Everything was very clean - you really can't argue for the price. The hotel is located near shops & restaurants with a supermarket right outside. The location is at the end of the bay with lovely views from the sea view rooms. You can walk to the beach along the bay which is lovely or up through the streets. The pool area is large with a free form pool and plenty of sunbeds. It's not 5* luxury, but it's very nice for the price. Beds were hard but the shower was mega !

title: My worst experience ever!
review: I booked this to be an affordable work stay but did not expect to end up in a hostel; the below is a summary of what I was offered or more to the point NOT offered;  - The room was dirty and in a very neglected, worn out condition. - Mold and grime around bath and floor bathroom. - The a/c was not working (I was told that at this time of year the hotel did not run the a/c!!!!) - The sliding door to the balcony did not work. - The room did not have any wifi reception despite the lady at the reception telling me it had. - The bedding was dirty and had hair in it. - The mattress was rock hard. Rock hard as waking up in pain! - The room had a notice that on two days of the week there would not be room cleaning! This was not in the booking details. - The safe in the room did not have…

title: Good clean budget hotel.
review: Have stayed in this hotel four times over a 8year period and happy every time .The location is excellent with a lovely walk via the pool down to Santa Ponsa beach.The views from the pool area are also very panoramic.It has always been very clean and the rooms basic but again clean.Balcony fine for two and the side view rooms on higher floors have an ok view to the bay.I have paid for the sea view before and been on a lower floor where it is obstructed by trees so its pot luck with that.There is also a little bay below the pool area which is very nice and suitable for sheltered safe sea swimming.I would quite happily return and think hotel is pretty good for the right price.

title: You get what you pay for
review: We are currently staying here at the Jardin del mar for a week. The hotel is dated yes but the location is excellent if you want a quiet break. I'm here with my 2 boys aged 12 and 6 and apart from the pool there isn't really anything else for them to do so we've been rock pooling in the small cove next to the hotel. It's beautiful here when the sun is shining. I expected the hotel to be busier but it only seems half full we've got a room on the 5th floor which has got a fabulous sea view and yes I paid the extra for this. The room is a bit basic but very clean with a couple of English channels on the TV .  The housekeeping staff are lovely especially one of the maids named Loli she can't do enough for you and very friendly. The bar/waiting staff are great too. The reception…

title: Just ok
review: Check in/out quick,but nobody else waiting. Heating system worked in the room, which was useful as it went chilly in the evenings. Beds firm mattress not to my taste, small balcony, small living room. We had a kettle,but anything else for the kitchen you had to pay extra for. Decor a bit dated, painted wood chip, but clean. BBC1 and 2 the English channels.  Noted in Santa Ponsa that the following had outside refurb jobs done, The Bahia del Sol, Portafino and the Deya.

title: First impressions
review: Stayed in June of last year. Had a good time and decided to go back. What a difference a year makes! My wife, my 2 year old and I arrived in the evening. The guy at reception was as arrogant as you could get. He actually ignored me during check in to tend to some couple who just appeared from the street and then started to rant about about the poor weather as if I had started the discussion. He gave me a room next to the lift which I asked to be moved due to the fact I had a child and the people traffic would affect her sleep. This, of course, could not be accomodated under any circumstance. He informed me that the hotel was full even though I witnesssed empty rooms the following day. The room was a side view (in the back). It was obvious they placed any parties there as there…

title: Decent hotel, great value for short break.
review: Firstly we only stayed 4 nights at the end of April at a cost of £90 ! so we can't complain at what we got for our money.  Hotel appeared busy for time of year and seems a popular destination and can see why its on a great location with plenty around it i.e. shops & bars.  Room (326) had the much talked about car park view but for what we paid we weren't about to moan, bathroom is massive bedroom a decent size and living area good as well, admittedly kitchen area is tiny but adequate. Only slight downside is you have to rent things like toaster & kettle etc. Room had aircon which also provides heat which came in handy as weather wasn't great a couple if days. Hotel offers wifi at a cost based on days or single day, there are 3 computers in reception that charge €1 for 10 minutes…

title: lovely hotel  not very friendly
review: Id booked this holiday as a surprise for my hubby and paid extra for sea view so when we got there we had to lean over balcony to actually see the sea! When i asked at reception the fella said oh your lucky your not lower down, you have to pay for better view, so i explained to him i had but was told it was fully booked and to come back on the tues, and this was sunday. Kitchen was very basic for self catering and had to end up hiring a kettle which was full of lime scale and very little utensils and beds were very uncomfortable, but do have to say it was very clean and the maids were spotless. it was very quiet and the hotel bar was empty with no music or anything on, was a relaxing week without any sun

title: Cheap, great location, great views
review: This is a fantastic value hotel. Most rooms and the pool face the sea, and it is very clean.  We paid extra for a sea view but were given a crap ground floor room by the pool which was noisy and we couldn't see the sea, but when you book 3rd party for such little money we didn't mind too much. But literally you can hear everything from the apt above.   However charging so little attracts a different clientele and we had some noise from young lads travelling together, but it was bearable as we were only there 2 nights and when we asked them to keep the noise down at the pool, they obliged ( there was no supervision or management presence visible ) .   Overall great value for singles/couples, families should give it a wide berth.

title: great location
review: Just back from a week in sun soaked Santa Ponsa.Stayed at the Jardin Del Mar.Good location about 10 minutes walk from town centre.Rooms very clean,great views pool and amenities very good.Only downside if you are self catering kitchen VERY basic

title: Excellent value for money with great views.
review: Stopped in the hotel sept2012 for the price I thought hotel was better situated than any other we'd stayed in hotel itself clean and close to all amenities rooms nice although we had sea side view wich faced hotel on opposite side but still very nice view.  We liked it that much we going again this aug . Would recommend self catering as food was ok on half board but lots of restaurants right on door step. This hotel is excellent for families and couples for price. it gets our vote pool area looks straight over med couldn't av a better view. local buss takes you to all other places like palmernovah magaluf for just a few euro s.run every half hour reliable in our apinuion a all round great hotel.

title: Very good value for money!
review: We went end of march which was quite warm,not much was on in santa ponsa round this time so we spent most of our time in magaluf which was only €1.50 bus to hotel,first of all the rooms are very basic & old,& yes you can hear the neighbours at night! The staff are not very helpful only talk to the man at desk in evens,the pool was luvly! Gym & sauna were locked! Local shops very cheap for supplys & gifts!  For the sea side room we paid €20 a day through gohop.ie We definaly couldnt compain,recomend to anybody!

title: READ THIS
review: We had two apartments and we were very excited as it was a family gathering with children and the main reason we went here was for the price and the sea view. where do I start..... there were a thousand people there and just over a hundred sunbeds and the pool is so small that you can't swim a couple of feet before seomeone hits you.The floor of the swimming pool is really dirty too and you could see that all the grouting had gone black. The rooms we had were dated and everything was rusty, under the table there was grafiti and in the wardrobe there were 10 hangers of which 5 were from previous guests. The beach is a mile away and the sea you see in brochure pictures is full of rocks and a hazard to swim in. To add insult to injury, the smell of the toilet stank the room so…

title: Egnore the bad reviews!
review: TRH Jardin del Mar is a lovely hotel located in a friendly family resort. Me and my family stayed here for three nights and we got it for a really cheap price. We wasn't expecting much as the price was so cheap but honestly you couldn't fault the hotel facilities. When we arrived, the man on the reception was quite slow and didn't really give us any informal information. However, not all reception staff are un-helpfull, there was one man who was lovely and helped me and my family with a few questions. The self catering apartments are ideal for preparing breakfast and snacks. I would recommend going out in to Santa Ponsa at night as there are some lovely restaurants. The sea view from the back of the hotel is beautiful and the outdoor pool is big and perfect for both adult and…

title: We thought this was very good value for money
review: We have just got back today from these apartments.  Either we got an absolute bargain for the last 5 days, or people expect far too much from 3* apartments.  You can't complain about the weather ( man who said there was nothing to do cos they didn't hire a car) it's Majorca, it is what it is, I wouldn't want to stay there for much longer than a few days, but it was absolutely great for our stay.  Convenient, clean and we ate at the buffet bar twice cos at 11Euros each it represented such good value.   On the day it was completely overcast we walked to Peguera - the next resort.  The following day we walked to the marina to see how the other half live, and there's regular buses if you're not able to/ into walking. Would I go back - prob not would try somewhere new cos been…

title: here right now
review: arrived quite late and the guy on reception didn't say much other than request our passports and hand us our keys, it was late so thought fair enough, however the next day the staff on reception still couldn't be bothered to talk to you. you don't get any information on the hotel, restaurant etc or local area. the apartment is very clean but the kitchen is tiny. two hobs and that is it. a toaster will cost you 2€ a day, cant remember how much a microwave would be. we had a side sea view which is ok. the loungers at the pool are uncomfortable and flimsy. the pool area is closed till 9am. it is accessed via doors. mini market is close by and hotel is located very close to the square, but its currently closed. writing this while on holiday as its not sunny today and as we have no…

title: Good value but don't expect too much
review: Myself & my family stayed here for 4 nights over the Easter holidays.  The rooms are a bit dated & self catering facilities are poor but if all you're after is a bed & good location then this hotel is ideal!!! I requested a low floor & pool view which we were accommodated with!!! My only gripe is that we could hear lots of noise coming from all around us- in neighbouring rooms, above & below and the landing. Maybe next time I'd request a quiet room!!!!

title: Basic Good Value
review: The Jardin Del Mar offers a no thrills, good standard of accommodation in a an excellent location at a good rate, which equates to good value for money. The rooms are of a good basic standard and serviced every other day, the majority have great views over the bay but those on the side of the hotel overlook other buildings or a car-park.

title: Great  hotel in a great location
review: I spent a week in this hotel with 2 of my friends, the apartment was big, there was plenty of room for the 3 of us! The only thing is the beds aren't very comfortable, it's hard to sleep at night!  The only other issue I had was the receptionist we met when we arrived wasn't very nice, we had spent a long day travelling and we found him very rude, it put us in bad form on our first day, thankfully every other member of staff we met after him were lovely.  The hotel is in an ideal location, it's very near everything, the view from our balcony was fantastic.  I really enjoyed my stay here!  The lift in the hotel has no sensor on it so be careful getting into it, the door closed as my friend was getting into it and she got lodged in between the doors, so anyone who's staying here…

title: 2 AND 2 MAKES 5..???
review: we booked in.no probs there,,the room was far too small,so,we got an upgrade..`. paid 36 euros..the view was great,,looking out to the sea with the pool included..no gripes about the room at all..spotless..my only problem was I never got the receipt for the upgrade,,,so", did the chap forget," or what"????...the reason iam saying this ,is, that,,,2 friends of mine upgraded also, and got charged 40 euros with a receipt...my friends stayed 4 nights and we stayed for 6 nights..   anyway...you can make your own mind up....

title: lovely been twice!
review: lovely clean hotel, plenty of room for a family in the rooms we were half board and food was great variety and plentiful. Waiters were lovely got a free bottle of vino (always good!) been twice here once with my mum and dad about 13 years ago and again with my friend and was just as great. santa ponca is a lovely area this hotel is about a ten min walk to shops bars etc so far enough away but not too far. right next to beach with lovely views.   Beware of ladies offering you a rose for a euro when you go into your purse they steal your money my friend had all here money taken by these gypsy ladies and police were not interested i had read about them in the welcome pack in hotel so i was totally aware of these ladies.   this has nothing to do with the wonderful hotel it could…

title: Honest review
review: From the minute we arrived we disliked the room. It was very bad and the pictures are much better than the hotel. The pool area is very small for the number of people around and we had to go to the beach every day. This holiday could be much better if we was in a better hotel. I wished I looked here before going to this hotel.

title: Good location and nice hotel!
review: We arrived last week of October. Weather was ok but not suitable for swimming. The hotel has an indoor pool but it is not open in peak season (including October). Location is good with short walk to the beach. Stores are just next door. The pool is nice but had no use for it. Food is alright, a bit lacking in the fruit and yoghurt department but otherwise met our expectations. Rooms are clean and general upkeep is good. Gym facilities are below par and need improvement (equipment). Generally we are happy with the hotel however end of October the weather is not warm enough. We spent most of our time exploring the island, hence I recommend renting a car right from the airport. Also, in case of bad weather, there are municipal pools in the area which are nearly brand new and a…

title: honest review
review: 1st time in 12 years that I've ever written a review on a hotel and the reason being is that I was so unhappy with this hotel. I am not a fussy person and relish any break away no matter if there are some aspects of the holiday that aren't great. Firstly we were promised by our tour operator (who were most helpfull-lowcostholidays) for a pool view on the 4th floor. On arrival at the hotel we were put on the ground foor (view of hedge).  When we queried this, we were literally told to go away (very busy!!).  The staff at reception were the rudest people that I've ever dealt with, honestly, unreal (room staff were very nice).  For example, I complained 4 days in a row about ants in the bathroom and the kitchen, each day it was a "tut", not you again! Eventually they gave me the…

title: Hotel needs updating
review: Good location. Stayed in October for 4 nights.  Would not like to stay there during the summer season.  Sunbed around pool were uncomfortable.  Rooms need upgrading.  No kettle or toaster in room but they were available to hire. Would upgrade to a sea view,

title: Old fashioned and run down
review: We stayed here after some deliberation on where to stay in santa ponsa. It was our first visit to the area. I wil not be returning to this hotel. The bedroom door had a hole where it was kicked in , tv had cigarette burns on top and beds were like sleeping on a board. To say this was a three star is being very generous. Its dated an let go. Its grand if u just want a basic place, no frills and plan on spending all ur time out and about! On a plus side the staff are helpfull and friendly.

title: Value for money
review: All the other reviews are spot on, the hotel is a great location but needs updating!  The beds in some of the rooms are extremely hard, and that's from someone who sleeps on a firm bed at home! The idea of the power going off to the fridges is ludicrous, we had to throw loads away!  The kitchenettes are extremely small with the only cooking facilities being a 2 ring stove and you have to buy absolutely everything, even salt and pepper!  On the plus side, the setting is perfect, especially if you book a 'see view' room, the views are quite spectacular from most of them!  The pool and patio area is lovely and well maintained with loads of sun-beds and tables to choose from!  The staff are very helpful and friendly.  There are toasters, irons, hairdryers etc available to hire for a…

title: OK stay in Jardin del Mar.
review: We have stayed in the Jardin del Mar many times and agree with some of the reviewers that it needs a little bit of TLC.  While it is clean and adequate it should be possible to have electricity in the apartments for self catering.  The fridge defrosts when you are out all day resulting in large blocks of ice forming in the ice box and food going off. The fridge in our apartment had the most offensive smell of fish which I could not get rid of. The previous guest must have left fish in the fridge freezer box and it went off when electricity was off. The fridge should have been properly cleaned before we got there.
