Also it should be standard to have a kettle, microwave and toaster in self catering.  There was free WiFi for one hour which is a  joke.  Of course you have to pay for…

title: lovely, but needs updating
review: just returned on 28th september. On arrival at 11.45p.m. we were greeted by 2 male staff who were very helpful. The apartments are quite small and kitchen is tiny - about 1.5 metres x 1.5 metres, with limited equipment for self catering. Beds are VERY firm and take a while to get used to, and were changed after 5 days of our 10 day stay.  Towels were changed every other day and rooms cleaned 8 out of 10 days.  Apartments are clean but need updating - looks like they've not been updated since the 70's, the t.v. doesn't even have a remote (which means you don't have to hire one) but does have British channels.  Kettle, toaster and hairdrier are all available to rent at 10 euros per week each with a 10 euro deposit.The air con was adequate at this time of year, but i can't imagine…

title: Value for Money and ideal setting!
review: I stayed in september 2012, with two friends for a week. We booked as part of a package deal and went self catering. The facilities in the room were basic, but very clean and more than adequate for holiday catering! Staff are lovely, extremely helpful and added extras such as staying on free of charge and using the gym showers free of charge are ideal if you're not flying until the evening. Also worth purchasing WiFi for only 10euros for three days if your room is on the ground floor and by the pool! No need to bring towels as they are provided, and you do also get a hob kettle, which i found misleading when reading some previous reviews.  The other great thing about the hotel is it's location. The views from the pool are spectacular, and there is a beautiful little cove for…

title: Disappointed
review: My daughter and i have just returned from a weeks stay here.I read the reviews before i booked and thought, yeh there are some bad ones but you cant please everybody. But trust me when i say, this hotel is very disappointing! I have stayed in a few hotels in Santa Ponsa( i used to live there so had some idea of where i was booking) and have always found them excellent value for money. This hotel was a big let down. We found the food awful. Not much choice, and very poor quality. I can normally find something to eat, but there was nothing on offer that i could contemplate eating. Beef stew 2 nights on the trot. Turkey swimming in oil. Lettuce on the salad section going brown. Runny lasagne and that was just on the 2 nights that we bothered going down. We had chips and gravy those…

title: Great 3 star
review: We needed a budget hotel but in a great location. All the reviews stated in need of renovating. Yes the hotel looks tired and the rooms could do with updating. However, our double room with sea view was perfect..it was clean and spacious, the kitchenette had everything you needed to prepare food and make a meal. the bathroom although old was clean and the hot water was plentiful. Towels were changed twice in our 5 day stay. The location was great away from the noise of the centre, yet within easy walking distance. Some good restaurants close by, los olas by the sea, la olivia just around around from hotel. Bar Lucinda was a great find, a wonderful host in Marcelo. I would return to this hotel again without hesitation. Our friends stayed next door in the 5 star Iberostar and yes…

title: Return visit
review: Stayed here  1   -15 September this year was here x 1 week also in may. Hotel very close to all amenities. Could do with being updated broken presses etc. the only thing that irritated was the towel change every 3 days I like towels changed every day where possible. Sheets changed every 5 days which is unnecessary -7 days is ample . Will go back again next year hopefully!

title: Great service
review: Have been here a few times like it for the convenience  to the Square  etc, clean hotel staff are excellent don,t undestand the negative reviews , we arrived mid August this year , room was overbooked the staff gave us complementry half board for the next day and put us up in a superior sea view room don,t undestand the negative comments if you want 5 star stay in a five star  food was lovly hotl very clean  would recommend

title: nice clean basic rooms a typical 3 star hotel
review: we  stayed here for 4 nights in sept 2012,got our room before lunch as arrived early,room was on 7th floor first impressions were average for a 3 star(however have stayed in slightly better in spain b4)..clean small basic room however needs updating in decoration,everything you need at hand,was impressed with 3 big mirrors which had a plug next to it was a bonus for us girls :)...you have to rent 3euros a day for kettle or a hairdryer so take yr own,beds changed daily and towels every 3 days,however i nicked some on my travels as needed daily ones,food/drink were quite cheap and good value in money,i.e bar pool toasted sandwiches 3euros and pint beer 2.50euros.great location 10 mins walk from the beach huns or places to eat/drink. heard about the sunbed sitution however this…

title: okay, wouldn't return
review: spent a week here end of august. clean apt apart from the ants. reported this to reception - nothing done about it.. As mentioned previously, you get charged for kettle, toaster etc. which is ridiculous. towels changed every 3 days, but it was just really the bath mat that was changed and i think i got one fresh hand towel and bath towel throughout our weeks stay. Heard someone asking the maid for a towel, it was embarrasing as she deliberated whether or not to give the gent it..  breakfast fair, 3 cereals on offer, cheese and cold meat, very greasy fried eggs, wee sausages or streaky bacon and bread and rolls. doors to pool open at 9am, people queuing from 8.30am for the embarrasing early morning bolt for a sunbed. It was a good source of entertainment watching it from the…

title: Lovely hotel...
review: Stayed at this hotel from the 30th of August till 6th of september 2012 with my partner, the hotel is lovely looking out onto Santa ponsa bay giving you awesome views, the hotel itself is very clean and well maintained so is the pool area and theirs plenty of sunbeds for everyone which was 1 of my worries after reading some reviews on here and watching a utube video where growing men and women are running and fighting over sunbeds however this never happend once in our stay here. Hotel food is nice and plenty to choose from, the staff are very helpfully and polite, I really haven't got a bad word to say about this hotel, the rooms are compact but very nice and have everything you need. I've been to Santa twice now and my mum visits very often between us we've stayed at 5 hotels…

title: Overbooked..........never again!
review: We arrived at Jardin del Mar to hear that they were over booked and we would have to stay two nights in alternative accommodation.  This was the last thing we wanted to hear after a very early start and travelling. We were offered HB in the other accommodation as compensation. The Receptionist told us that Alpha Rooms and other operators kept taking bookings despite the hotel letting them know that they were overbooked. I contacted AR by email and they said it was first they had heard of it? I was not one bit impressed with the alternative accommodation as it was very near the noisy main ‘strip’ and was only 2 keys rating. I always thought that when something like this happened you should be offered similar rating or better? After having some lunch we walked back to the Jardin…

title: Tired Hotel
review: We have just returned from a week at the Jardin Del Mar and have to say it was a terrible experience. We were allocated a room with a "side sea view"  okay if you are near the sea , otherwise the view will be of the supermarket car park , and if you are lower than the 3rd floor it will be of a wall. The rooms are small and very outdated, ours smealt of damp and the ants came as standard, we had very little sleep as people returned at all hours and there was no respect shown for other guests who may have been sleeping , also we had the cleaners station near our room and were woken every morning by there banging and clashing about. The kitchen area is small and dated , kettle etc all have to be hired at 10 euros a week, Aircon is very week and only operates when in room as you are…

title: Overbooked!
review: We have just returned from a weeks stay in the jardin del mar.  On booking the holiday we paid for a sea view room therefore that it was what we expected on arrival.  Our room was not ready on arrival and we were told we would be put in a room with just a window with no balcony for 24 hours.  We then were allocated a room the 2nd day of our holiday which did not have a sea view but overlooked the carpark!  On complaining about this - the manager was very unconcerned and blamed the holiday company, no apology was given.  The apartment was fine, very dated but clean enough.  Air con very weak. Some staff were very helpful but others very miserable. Good location, no overspill of noise from the square which was great for the kids. We didnt join in the sun lounger race but always…

title: good location
review: just back from a week in the jardin del mar ,over all a nice place but rooms need a bit of t l c badly, no toaster kettle ect you will have to hire them out for your stay,crazy this day in age. staff were lovely and helpfull grounds very nice pitty the rooms let this down alot.the lifts are dangerous just be carefull it can eat you up somethime .the location makes up for all that stuff is only 2 mins fron the square which is great for all the family ,if your not pushed about your room this place is perfect for you, enjoy your hols ,x x family from limerick ireland

title: Loved all of our holiday to Jardin Del Mar, Santa Ponsa
review: I have just returned from a 2 week trip to Santa Ponsa, Spain. We had an amazing time and the hotel was super. Although the rooms are small (with 4 of us in one apartment - 2 kids 7 & 12) we didn't care as we spent most of the time out in the pool or out and about. We didn't once join in with the sun lounger race, we like our sleep to much. But we got 2 loungers EVERY DAY of our holiday!! We took our own travel kettle and cheap toaster from Tesco after reading reviews. After re-reading some of these reviews, I have got to say that some ppl do half moan. At the end of the day, you are on holiday, should be enjoying the spanish sun and being with your family or loved ones. The hotel room is somewhere to leave your clothes and sleep in at the end of each night.   The rooms are…

title: Don't expect 5 star you get what you pay for!
review: Just returned from a 9 night break. Overall had a very nice time, was very concerned about hotel and being over booked but have to say we had no probs. At arrival staff were friendly and quickly checked us in. On arrival to room was happy very clean although on 4th floor when requested ground as have 3 children under 5, however view very nice just were extra vigilant with kids. Kitchen very basic, no electric toaster or kettle, just a kettle that you put in Stove that was fine for us. Air con not ice cold but adequate, sun bed run is ridiculous especially when people in large groups reserve lots of sun beds and barely half of them get used all day, very selfish. No entertainment or music what so ever round the pool and only once saw a nice lady for an hour or so who brought…

title: Location, location,location
review: We have just returned and would say that there are minor issues but overall this hotel is good. I do agree that there are minor issues. The day staff do not speak good English with better more helpful service at night. There is no entertainment and I think they are losing revenue from the bar from this. However, the rooms are clean (does everyone change their sheets and towels daily at home?) and the pool was clean and warm. We did have the sunbed issue later in the week as it got busier but this does happen at many hotels. The location and views were amazing. I would say that with Arkles cafe just across the road, with fab service, excellent and reasonable food and a takeaway service (great for a morning coffee), you do not need to pay the hire costs for kettles and toasters in…

title: Nothing special but adequate
review: I stayed at TRH Jardin Del Mar for 13 days in August with my wife and two kid’s age 9 & 13. The hotel is a large size with a lot or different nationalities. The one bedroom apartment was basic but adequate but could do with a refurbishment, the kitchenette does not have a Microwave, toaster or kettle although there is a boil on the stove kettle but be prepared to wait a while for hot water, these can be hired from reception for 10 euros per week which I think is poor as these items should be supplied free in your apartment in a 3*, there is a TV with BBC1, 2 & ITV1 & 2 which is great. The rooms were cleaned everyday with bedding changed once a week and towels changed every 3 days. The Air conditioning was a real bonus; a definite plus is at that time of the year, the room we…

title: Great view
review: we arrived at the hotel about 9:30 at night and was dealt with at reception very quickly and we had only booked side view room but once we got our room we were very pleasantly surprised to see we had a full on sea view looking over pool and out to sea, rooms were quiet basic but were very clean, there was 4 of us sharing room 2 adults & 2 children and was nice to see they had put 3 beds in bedroom and one in living area already made up for us, hotel is in ideal position only 2 minutes walk to square which has a good variety of entertainment on every night, the worst thing about this hotel is the sunbed situation as mentioned by others but on a couple of occasions we went to pool at about 11am to find 2 or 3 sunbeds available. i would recommend this hotel and thought all the…

title: disappointed
review: on arrival our rooms were not ready, told to come back at 2pm. did this only to find out rooms still not ready. eventually got keys from the reception settled into our rooms. room were basic but clean. bit disappointed didnt get room we were expecting. booked this hotel due to location but never got a chance to sunbathe at pool as there were no sunbeds to be had. sunbeds all had towels on them at 9am complained to receptions only to be told it was ok to reserve your sunbed as it was war for them. even though there were signs at pool stating u couldnt reserve sunbeds with towel. a few of the day receptionist were very rude and unhelpful the night staff were friendly. the maids were great. good location, in terms of quietness at night. close to beach and nitelife.next time i go to…

title: First impression - it was overbooked & we couldn't get in
review: On the beach booking.  Arrived midnight but stayed for 12 instead of 13 nights due to it being overbooked (A regular theme with one and half pages of A4 indicating the unplaced new arrivals revealed in reception) Dispatched to a very inferior "sister2 hotel Terranova in Palmanova (200 yards from 'The strip'). We didn't get a room available until 3.30PM the next day so our first day holiday was lost.  Receptionist blamed the cleaners for the problem, like they're in charge of admission policy! The management clearly don't care about thier customers first impression of them and to be honest it never recovered from the initial let down.  The hotel itself has good sea views and is reasonable in the strict sense of a holiday stopover with SC terms. Our room had some unwanted ants and…

title: Enoyable stay August 2011
review: The location was good. The beach being only a 10 minute walk down hill (the walk back was a killer though!). Lots of bars and restaurants were within 2 minutes walk. The Sqaure was great entertainment for adults and children. I must have one of those faces because I managed to get pulled up on stage twice!  Firstly to join the Take That tribute band for a dance and then again for the Girls Aloud tribute band (clearly enjoyed this slightly more ...). There is also a shaded park near to the hotel and Square, which was great place to chill out with my 2 young girls.  Our room was basic but clean. We had a side sea view which wasn't the best but you do have the option of paying more should you desire.   The pool area was nice. I never joined in with the sunbed fun run in the…

title: nice hotel
review: hotel restaurant is well run, lovely food, apartment small but adequate, had side view but didnt experience any noise through the night, air con not good. no problems with staff or cleanliness. dont expect  a lie in as you have to be up at 8.30 to queue for your sunbed, if you dont do it you wont get one. i was trampled on and pushed out the way, the doors spring open automatically at 9am then thats it youre off and remember to smile as people video you and its been put on you tube.

title: Overbooked & Rude Staff
review: We have just returned from 7 days at Jardin Del Mar, we booked through On the Beach holidays. The first night we arrived at 2am only to be told the hotel was overbooked by a very rude receptionist. We had no apology no explanation we were bundled into a taxi and driven to a flea pit in Palma Nova called the Torronova (the sister hotel). This place was an 18-30 type hotel, there were cockroaches in the room, it was filthy. I was absolutely appalled at the lack of communication between the Jardin Del Mar and On the Beach, neither are willing to except responsibility. We were taken back to the Jardin Del Mar the following day were we had to wait a further hour for the apartment to be prepared. This happened to 4 other families too, one family was offered a toaster for their…

title: Great for kids
review: This Hotel is great for kids, they will love the pool. My two never stayed out of the pool.Dinner is fine just dined once, breakfast is ok, a lot of bread though, the staff are friendly enough. if you do stayhere make sure u get a sea front apartment. You can hear everything in the apartments though especially in the morn. The side view one ur looking at a carpark.elevators are run down but other than that the hotel is spotless. At the side of the hotel is a lane way and it gives u access to the beach along restaurants and pools. the beach is about 10 min walk away. Its also a ten minute walk to the strip

title: Overbooked, Overrun, Overrated !
review: I have just returned from the Jardin Del Mar with my family after a 10 day stay. Upon arrival we were informed that our room was not yet ready and would be in 20 minutes, I had paid extra through Travel Republic for a room with a balcony and Sea view, when we were given the room we were overlooking a hotel at the back ??. Upon complaining I was told I would get another room the next day when someone else booked out and was given a complimentary evening meal and breakfast voucher (food not brilliant). I took this and returned the next day to go through the same scenario with someone different who said there wasn't a room available as they were overbooked, this later became apparent that this was a regular scenario !, I stuck to my guns and got a room with a beautiful seaview 45…

title: Terrible Service
review: I have just returned from Santa Ponsa and was supposed to be staying in this hotel but when we arrived we were told that they had overbooked and that we had to stay in another hotel in a different resort for 2 nights. This other hotel wasn't very clean and was full of groups of young lads and girls so we about turned and I sorted out alternative accommodation myself. While we were in the Jardin del Mar reception there were other families being told the same thing and the taxi driver told us this happens all of the time and it's always fro 2 nights. When we went back the Jardin del Mar after 2 nights we were told the room wasn't ready and to come back in an hour, this happened three times and on the third time my partner told the receptionist to personally go to the room to check…

title: nice pool - shame about the sunbeds
review: Just back from a week long stay in this hotel, overall ok value for money. Cons - rude inefficient reception staff.  Arrived at 12, didnt get our room till 5, receptionist had bad english and wasn't a bit friendly. Later on during the week bought tickets from same receptionist to the aquarium, asked her where the collection point was and she mentioned the chinese restaurant on the street.  I remembered seeing a second restaurant on the main street, and asked if it was this one (it was) and she didnt know, when she checked it out, it was indeed the furthest one. Went for the bus, and the driver wasnt letting us on as she was supposed to inform the bus company that we were coming, but didnt. the room was fine, quite cramped, but ok, not well equipped but liveable, had a side…

title: Honest review good and bad.
review: First the good,  beautiful sea views, good location if with a family as it is away from the noise but easily accessible to walk.  The hotel and the pool area was very clean and well maintained. There is no entertainment in the hotel but the jardin square accross the road is great.  Now the bad, Yes the sunbed stampede not good, rooms need updating and quite small for a family of four, air con very weak, staff not very friendly to the extent that my 11 year old did not want to go tho the bar on his own!. The lateral sea view overlooks car park so be warned. with all this said i would possibly go back but only in a upgraded room.  But i have to say that every time we passed reception there was someone there complaining and the reception staff just said nothing we can do sorry, i…

title: LOVELY PLACE
review: Just returned from this lovely hotel.firstly i thought it was great for a three star,yes rooms need refurb, new comfy sunloungers and controlled,can't believe the stampede,it was like the grand national lol.iwaited until 3 00 and always got one then,or lay on a towel on a flat rock outside hotel,lovely view. staff all great and polite work very hard.Cleaners ok.but not moped apartment all 10 days apart from bathroom.Have to sweep own floors .clean great on arrival. Had 7th floor sea view and wow never had a view like it made the hols. Santa ponsa lovely friendly place made some nice friends.Mixed nationalities lots of irish,german not many english although more arrived on second week.A big thank you Jardin del mar,making my holiday one of the best.

title: wmpt.
review: Hotel and facilities were good except for  the stampede for sunbeds at 9 o'clock in the morning,one lady put out 8 towels on sunbeds and that day only 4 of them were used until 5.30 that evening .We did not get a sunbed any day for the week we were there.The way I see to sort it out is if a person queues up they get one sunbed and has to use it straight away,the allocation of sunbeds have to be controlled by staff.

title: Sunbed stampede
review: Firstly, we knew we were walking into a bad hotel when one of the mirrors in he lifts had been punched and mashed. Wha they call air conditioning should be sue under the trades description act because it clearly did not condition the air at all. The kitchen door was hanging off its hinges and the bedside drawer was broken. The metal railing on the balcony was loose - you could lift it off (would'nt recommend high floors with young children). We were 2 floors up with a 3 year old. 2 pillows on the bed so requested more pillows but they arrived just as our holiday was about to end.  Then there was the sunbed stampede ( check out you tube - TRH jardin del mar) you cannot get to the pool before 9am and the queue starts at 8.30 and earlier in the hotel foyer. Once 9 am comes be…

title: lovelly hotel!!
review: This has been our 4th trip here and we love it.  Wish we had upgraded to a premium room as the standard sv rooms are very compact for a family of 4.  Our grievance we had was the stupidity of the great towell run at 9am, ridiculous, actually filmed it one morning coz we couldnt beleive these were grown men actually barging and running linford christie style accross the pool area to get a sun lounger that they wont sit on til 3pm.  The hotel need to sort this out, they are losing money round the pool by this farce as families are being forced to go else where in the day.  All in all great hols, nice hotel, lovelly spot but will not consider another trip until the lounger run has been dealt with.

title: Double booked!
review: Firstly I don't bother with writing reviews but this hotel has forced me to put this up, arrived and had paid for premium sea view room, told it was not free til next night so we put up with the tiny room they gave us, with two small children it's annoying not being able to unpack properly, went to desk next day at 12  and was informed they didn't have our room, and offered us half board as compensation, I wanted to see the manager but told she was at lunch and to come back so I'm having to chase her around. When she eventually came back she didn't even look up at me, just waved her arms and spoke to the guy dealing with us who suddenly appeared with our room key to our new room, was nearly 5 before we got sorted so day lost all together. The manageress has absolutley no…

title: Brilliant hotel
review: We went half board and paid extra for a sea view room which we would strongly recommend.The view was amazing.We were in a room with lounge and kitchen so we could make snacks and brews galore if we wanted. Linen and towels were changed daily.The hotel was very clean and the restaurant was very well run and serviced.Also there was a free laundry room on site so we came home with nearly a full case of clean clothes.Not too near main part so as to hear all noise but near enough for a nice stroll.

title: "Family from Scotland"
review: This is our 5th year at Jardin del Mar & went half board, thought the food & choices were very good. Dining area as well as pool, reception & rooms all very clean. Staff friendly & helpful. Views amazing if you pay a little extra for sea view but well worth it. Will be back again. La Solana good for pizza, bank, chemist, papershop all across the road. Best pub for large measures The Crown in the Square & The Glasgow's a nice friendly place to. You can get a wee flutter on the Gee Gees in the Rising Sun down the hill, friendly staff also.

title: Views to die for!! but pay the extra for them.
review: This is an excellent and well run hotel, good food, well organised dining room, rooms cleaned 5 days out of 7, pool area is very well maintained and clean with lifeguards present all day. would highly recommend that you pay extra for the front facing sea-view and again for the superior room, see pics I have put on site from room 419, best room we have ever had anywhere. location is perfect, shops, bars/restaurants, entertainment(jardin square) all within 100-200ms. If you want a sun-bed by the pool then you have to be able to run the 100ms in at least 12 secs and be prepared to begin queueing at approx 0815  for the dash!!. You will then find that many of the beds with towels on will not be used until they have come back from a day on the beach or whatever. Our only negative…

title: couple from scotland
review: this hotel is in great location away from all the noise of main resort but with in easy walking distance  rooms were clean but basic maid came in every 2nd day towels changed regularly the pool area is great but was very busy and the noise was relentless during the day iam in my 40s but not old fuddy! it seemed to be full of young teenagers unsupervised and corridors could be very noisy at night but didnt stop me from sleeping with my ear plugs. really hard to get sun lounger but the small cove is just a short walk away and was very peacefull reception staff were very helpful and friendly . great breakfast at arkles across the road and the chinese restaurant directly opposite hotel was so good we went twice.  if you want peace and quiet  round the pool dont go to this hotel well…

title: lovely hotel/place and amazing views!!!!!!!!!!!
review: i have stayed at this hotel 4 times over the past few years and every time it has been lovely. the pool is a decent size and clean, the area around the pool is very spacious with sun loungers and palm trees and a bar which serves really nice food and drinks at decent prices may i recommend the spag bol it delicious. worth paying extra for a sea/pool view as the views are stunning and u can watch the boats going past and the luxury villas from the balcony. the pool lit up at night is lovely also.  we went half board and the food was fine, enough choice to satisfy us and fill us. the staff are nice enough although there was an old guy on reception who was extremely grumpy and didnt speak unless spoken to and said as very few words as he cud; but who cares!! rooms were very clean…

title: Lovely hotel.  Amazing warm pool.  Noisy neighbours.  No view from room.
review: We have recently returned from the TRH Jardin Del Mar Hotel in Santa Ponsa.  The hotel is lovely, the staff are great, the pool is amazing as its warm and the views from most of the rooms are fantastic over the bay.  We booked last minute and the only room offered was a side sea view.  When we arrived we checked in and our view was over the back of a parade of shops and restaurants and a very noisy car park as when they all closed around midnight all of the staff would shout at each other (instead of talking) and sit in their cars revving their engines for around an hour.   We went to ask if we could upgrade our room to be told that there would be a charge so we decided to stay where we were.  If you stood on the balcony and looked to the right you did get a look at the bay and…

title: Best place to stay in Santa ponsa
review: Great location in Santa ponsa hotel was clean lovely pool and bar friendly staff only proplem was local kids came to indoor pool caused quite a stir shouting and jumping as people had small kids with them put security shifted them after nearly an hour and a load of complaints other than that it was a great holiday and I will be returning there

title: great place
review: just returned from a week here stayed half board, asked before staying for an higher floor and got the top floor which was great had view of the hills on one side and the sea on the other,room very clean came in a few times during week changing towels ,beds changed once,air con was effective as even at night the temperature was very warm,basic kitchen facilities but never used them,took own mugs,as only had those small cups, also no wine glasses,but  was fine,pool area very busy couldnt get sunlounger until very late in the day usual story towels all over beds and people off to the beach or on trips and this was english and irish pool area was well kept overlooking the bay and had a great little cove for swimming which was accesed from a path leading from pool area,location was…

title: i tell the truth [ awful ]
review: i arrived at the hotel on the sunday mid-day the front desk said they had no room that they "over-booked" the hotel of 9 people .They told us they will send us to the sister hotel just down the street called the "jardin del playa" we got told our rooms would be ready at 12 am monday we went down and it was NOT .it was around 5pm till we got our rooms . we payed for a sea veiw 1 room got a sea veiw the other 2 were looking out on a ivy wall .they gave us a free breakfast and dinner .it was awful they put us into the corner .the pool was amazing and the cove was amazing as-well .The walls were paper tin as we had a very loud crowd that arrived .The shopping is very poor it is a tourist destination .i would recommend the palma aquarium ..and if you want to shop go to palma shopping…

title: Double bookings
review: We arrived on the 25th June to be told our room had been double-booked (another family on our flight were told the same thing) we had to stay at another hotel for the night and eventually got into our room at lunchtime the next day. During the holiday we discovered we were not the only ones this had happened too (at least 6 other families) were told the same thing, one young couple with a baby were given another room in the hotel only because of the baby, the room was tiny with only a small window so high up you had to stand on a chair to see out! We are going to complain to Travel Republic who we booked through as we feel we lost a day out of our holiday. Apart from that the apt was clean and we did get one of the corner suites with the big balcony and great sea view,because of…

title: Better than we expected
review: We were a bit dubious after having read some of the reports here but on arrival we were pleasantly surprised. We arrived at 10.30pm and the receptionist said that the premium apartment we had booked would not be ready until the following morning and we could have free breakfast in the morning as compensation, rather than argue we agreed to accept this and were given an apartment on the second floor overlooking the pool. on Sunday morning we received a phone call at 11.30am to tell us our apartment was ready, we were still on the second floor but had the upgraded apartment with the large balcony, towels were changed and apartment cleaned every two days and sheets changed midweek. We didn't manage to get a sun lounger every day but when we did found them to be very uncomfortable,…

title: fantastic
review: just returned after 8 great days at this hotel paid for a side sea view but got a seaview which was brilliant room was spotless the maids do a fantastic job keeping everywhere clean ,pool was very good with a lifeguard all day hotel was 2 minutes from the square which had some great wee pubs and some nice eating places went to katies kitchen for brekkie really good the celts well what a great night we had in there the barman was taking our pictures to put on the wall, this hotel is a wee home from home will recommend it to family and friends i will definetly be staying here again

title: Great value for money
review: Nice hotel in ideal location for families.  Apartment was clean and adequate.  Towels changed 5 days out of 7 and sheets changed once a week.  2 electric rings and a fridge. If you like a cuppa bring your own travel kettle! TV with ITV1, ITV2 and a BBC channel.  Staff friendly and efficient.  My toilet broke and was fixed (spare part required) within 20 minutes.  The points against: Some overviews mention a safe in the room but they are no longer in use and it costs 15 euro a week to rent a safety deposit box in the reception area, a bit steep I think.  Also, gym facilities and a sauna are mentioned as far as I could see these were not in use.  There is no entertainment in the hotel itself but the Square is just across the road.

title: Wonderful hotel with great staff !!
review: We had wonderful two weeks in Jardin Del Mar and just loved all about it...reception was just perfect - took care of all our needs. Waiters was wonderful - funny and made us feel like home and the maids cleaned our room perfectly not a spot that they left uncleaned. We defently reccommend this wonderful hotel and have already make plan to visit it again as soon as possible !!  Maybe the rooms need a little update but that did not bother us.

title: Lovely stay.
review: We had a lovely time in Jardin del Mar.The staff is amazing doing anything they can to make your stay lovely.The food was really good and the hotel is clean in every corner.But make sure to order a seaview Supermarket on the corner and lots of nice bars like the Crown :) We had a great time.Basic apatmens but everything you need.

title: Moi Bien - Totally Loved It!
review: Well, I requested a seaview before arrival and I got it!  Must be doing something right!  Lovely clean hotel, food very good and the service from the waiters in the dining room in bringing my San Miguel was first class!  Some people say the beds are hard but I personally found them incredibly comfortable and had the best nights sleeps ever!  Loved the 10 min walk to the beach every day and there is plenty of night life which is a great way to relax and unwind; I loved it all.  I would highly recommend this hotel; well done Jardin del Mar - would have loved 10 days instead of 7; didn't want to come home!

title: couldn't fault this hotel
review: had a great time, had no Problems, basic apartments, pool area was lovely, wouldn't recommend too much drinking or playing music in apartments too late as there was a lot of families. central enough without being stuck in the middle of it all.

title: Still a good value choice
review: When visiting my Sister who lives in Santa Ponsa I stay at the Jardin, always a good value hotel, if not quite as good as usual this time, I was there for 4 nights, staying in a room on my own, breakfasts were very good as always, however on one occasion i did have egg shell attached to my egg! Room was big and clean, more than adequate, however towels were only changed once, (I suppose they gave 2 at a time so not really too much of a grumble there). Check in and out as always quick and without fuss, I would recommend this hotel, it is in a decent place and a good 3 star hotel, it is value for money, but decent too. Not liking plastic glasses in the bar though!!

title: Lovely Family Holiday, enjoyed by all of us.......
review: We have just come back from the TRH Jardin del Mar hotel in Santa Ponsa. We stayed for a week. Its my second visit to the hotel, on my first trip it was mature ladies in our 40s @50s. we were self catering, and we really enjoyed our stay. It was very clean and quite great views. I knew I would return with my kids this year. We arrived late at night around 12:10, we took a taxi from the airport 48.50 euro, I booked with alpha rooms on both trips , but the transfer bus last trip took about 2hrs. the taxi 30min, I made a mistake on my booking and booked a side sea view, we were facing a car park I was very upset and asked for an upgrade which we did get the next day at a cost of 60euro for the 6 nights. It was a bit steep but we got a nicer appt and the views were worth every cent.…

title: lovely hotel
review: just back from a wks holiday with friends and i must say the hotel was lovely ..after reading sum comments on this we were worried wat to expect from the hotel but on our arrival we were pleasantly surprised room was clean bed comfortable views were amazing and pool was lovely plentys of sunbeds arrival....i would advise get a taxi from the airport for £40 as the bus shuttle takes nearly 3 hours...we ate out most nites boston o reillys bein a favourite for all of us and great value had a bad experience in a resturant called no 8 where my friend was served raw chicken...the little beach nxt to the hotel ideal for a swim in the sea we went to the aqua pack great day ..was a brillant holiday and the hotel was great value

title: had a great time
review: my girlfriend and i have just returned from a 10 day stay at this hotel, and we loved it! i had read some reviews before going and decided to keep an open mind, i,m so glad i did! we had a room over looking the pool and sea, the room lovely, comfortable beds, balcony over looking the pool and sea, the views are stunning, we did not eat at the hotel as we were self catering so i cannot comment on the food, however i would recommend "kates kitchen" on the square we had breakfast there almost everyday and it was awsome!  We did a 5 hour boat trip which cost us 25 euros each but again was worth it, stopping for an hour at dragon island (additional 1 euro each) you also get to have several dips in the sea which is very refreshing and tapas and a sing song which is quite ammusing. The…

title: Nice but staff could improve there manners
review: We came here on june 3rd till june 12th 2 familys  7 of us,  I asked on arrival for a fan on leaving i still had not got it , the rooms were very small & the couch was very dirty i did tell staff but you might as well talk to the wall, The views were lovely and the food as we paid for half board was good too, Its very near the square which is good , When we were checking out the man behind the desk didnt even say goodbye , find them very not people friendly , ive been in santa ponsa 5 times this was the first time i stayed here ive stayed in better but they do have 2 great relaxing chairs that if u pay 1 euro u get 5 mins Massaging on your back, I loved this every day, The weather was very warm and the music on the square was great every night we went, I love Majorca but if i…

title: Enjoyable Stay at Jardin Del Mar
review: Lovely aparthotel for the price - very good value. All staff eficient and polite. Clean, quite hotel. Also location and surrounding area nice and quite but it was still early June. Beautiful view over bay from pool. Pebbley cove just under hotel was great for swimming. Beds were hard and the air conditioning wasn't great in our room on the 6th floor. Overall, Majorca lovely place to visit in general.

title: Great hotel, would stay again !
review: Stayed B and B ,great breakfast , great pool area, quiet location, 10 mins to Santa ponsa beach walking,plenty shops nearby, would recommend this hotel to anyone. The sunbeds on the beach at Santa ponsa are expensive.

title: Linda & David Holiday
review: We stayed for a week beg june, overall hotel was good, food was good, we had a fab sea view, it was lovely first thing in morning.  Apartments were fine, only thing was you had to hire toaster or kettle, which i found that now a days these should be part of the Kitchen.  Cleaning ladies were there every couple of days, and apartment was clean.  It was a lovely walk into town or just around corner was Jardin square, overall, we enjoyed our stay and would come back to this hotel again.

title: Great Holiday
review: Stayed here for a week end of May/first week of June, was on the 3rd Floor with a fab seaview room.  It was lovely to get up every morning and go out on the balcony and see the blue sea and blue sky facing you! You can also see the boats passing here every day as well it was nice to come back in the evening and chill out on the balcony.  I cannot fault this hotel in anyway we had B&B and the selection of food out for the breakfast was lovely from cold to cooked breakfasts and it catered for every nationallity I was very impressed.  We were greeted and checked in by a male reception staff who was very friendly and was a pleasure to deal with.  The hotel for me was in great location its only 8/10 mins from the beach if you go by footpath you can also go by seafront but its a bit…

title: jarden
review: just back from a 10 day stay in the jarden,  had a great time, hotel clean and staff very friendly,  the pool area is great and loads of shelter,my only complaint would be the works going on in the apartments  next door and one morning around 7.30 the staff decided to cut the grass but stopped after a resident complained,i would stay here again once the work next door was finished,next year hopefully

title: Fine for summer holidays - wouldnt stay 2 weeks though
review: Stayed here on 26th May 2012 for one week, 2 adults one child in a superior room. There was a few problems when first arrived - was given a room with little sea view and was told by reception hotel fully booked and no other room available, he didnt seem to want to accomodate me in any way - so sent my fiancee down to talk to him and suddenly other rooms available...We eventually got a room with a great view of bay, cove. Even though he said the hotel was fully bookd, the nicer apt next door to us was vacant all week long. Other reports are right in relation to works going on in the apts next door - the noise is drowned out by the pool and kids etc but be warned that the workers were spotted several times with binoculars looking directly into the rooms..... Hotel is very dated,…

title: OK ish!
review: I stayed for 4 nights in May/June 2012.  My room was very tired and most definately in need of major refurbishment, although they were very clean.  I had a room with a side view (no upgrade possible).  Side view over looks a less than pretty apartment block, the occupants of which have a direct view into your room.  Therefore I couldn't open the curtains at all.  The patio door needed a muscle bound he man to open and especially to close.  The aircon just didn't make it!The sunbeds, although plentiful, were of the slatted hard plastic variety with no mattress.  I stayed half board and wished I hadn't.  Breakfast was ok although not a massive choice but dinner was rubbish.  The best bit was the ice cream!

title: never to return
review: We arrived on the 23rd May for 7 days as a party of 4 for 7 days. Before going we had actually spent an extra £80 to upgrade to a premium because we had been watching the reviews and we were a bit worried. The apartment was very small to say the least, The beds were rock hard and the self catering facilities were very poor. We had two sunbeds on the veranda one which was broke. The lights on the veranda were out all week. There was only two lifts one broke the day after we arrived and was still broke when we keft. We often had to lift a baby in a buggy up four flights of steps. The staff were unfriendly and the entertainment none existent. The maids only do as much as they have to do. The veranda was filthy as it never saw a mop all week. Lets look on the brighy side though the…

title: nice hotel
review: i have just returned from staying at the jardin del mar.  having read other reviews of the hotel. i can honestly say the reviews were very acurate.  we had a brilliant sea view room. which i was glad to have as some of the rooms faced a block of other flats no views and dark. we went half board and there was a good selection.  good value for money saved us a fortune even though food is fairly priced around the cafes it  all adds up. the beds were realy very hard , my hips hurted in the morning. so i made up the sofa bed out front and that was realy big and comfortable. the staff were friendly enough. there is computers in reception area but no printer if you needed e-mails printed off.  the staff are nice enough. the beach is a fair walk back up hill to hotel so i reccomend you…

title: building works next door 8am to 7pm 6 days per week
review: basic hotel but very clean but when we booked with alffa rooms they did"nt tell us building going on next door 6 days per week so if your looking for peace and quite forget it this building will go on for another 6 weeks at least we asked for a sea view didnt get it even though the hotel wasent even half full so we paid 42 euro extra for sea view we also paid 25 euro for late check out staff most of them friendly i notice from the newest reviews no 1 said anything about the building works just wondering if they stayed in the same hotel as we did, would i stay here again maybe when the builders move on,  tip bring ear plugs and a dust mask

title: Very pleasantly surprised.
review: I have just returned from a weeks stay at this hotel and am pleased to say that I have nothing negative to say about it. On check in I was pleased to see that I had been allocated a top floor room as requested, yes, it was one with the side sea view but as it was so peaceful I was happy to stay there. The thing that struck me most was the soft closing device on the door, which meant NO BANGING ! All hotels should have them. I say room, but it was actually a mini apartment which felt really spacious fo me on my own. It was really nice to have somewhere comfortable to sit as there was a sofa bed in the living area.Everywhere was spotlessly clean. TV had Sky News and BBC World News in English. The idea ocurred to me that I could have taken a portable DVD player and hooked it up via…

title: 1st time
review: cannot fault this hotel in anyway.food,service,cleanliness,locality....however the resort is catered ,irish....perfect if u support celtic  n drink magners ?? for kids nothing we had 5yr old with us .cant say we seen anything at night to entertain...if u like typical spanish avoid..cheaper headin into glasgow ..as i say cannot fault jardin del mar hotel

title: excellent 4 night break at hotel jardin del mar
review: excellent value for money , food really good, plenty of choice. location and views stunning. very child friendly, our 5 year old grandaughter was treated like a princess. weather gorgeous, we will be returning in near future

title: Excellent location and value for money
review: Stayed here mid April. The staff weren't rude at all but weren't overly friendly either. First impressions of the hotel were good the communal areas were clean and of a good standard. The rooms are basic and could do with a refurb but you get what you pay for. I paid £100 for a week half board and as such had no complaints. We had a side view room on the first floor which was perfectly adequate and the view was fine. If I had of wanted a sea view I would've paid the extra. The pool area is set on the cliff over the sea and is excellent. The weather wasn't warm enough for the outdoor pool so the fact that there was an indoor pool was a bonus. The food was on the whole fine. Some bits did get a little repetitive but I was full each day. As we were there as a couple we did eat out…

title: Looks better from the outside! But not bad.
review: This hotel looks lovely, new and modern from the outside.  The pool area is lovely and clean, the reception is also.  But unfortunately the rooms could do with being updated and refurbished.  We stayed here in April 2012, family of 4. Was a little cramped, and had the most uncomfortable and noisy beds I have ever known!  We ended up taking in turns to sleep on the different beds, so at least 2 of us got a nights sleep!!  The beds were clean but the "put me up camp bed" was the worst Ive slept in.  In fact, we took up the bed and put mattress on floor!! Was slightly better that way!   The kitchen didnt have a lot of equipment. The kettle was very, very slow to boil. It was one of the old fashioned ones you put on the hob and wait for it to whistle - though you could hire a better…

title: Average dated hotel-but beautiful views
review: Just returned from a short break at these apartments. For what we paid i wasn't expecting a lot and to be honest you don't get it. The rooms are very dated, quite small with very limited facilities for cooking and the most creaky beds i have ever heard! Having said that they were very clean and our view from floor 1 was lovely of both the sea and pool area. The hotel is around a 10-15 min walk to the beach but only 2 minutes from the square which i expect would be great in high season but was mainly closed down at this time of year with only a handful of place open. also be aware if you're taking small children here the shallow end of pool is still far too deep for them to go in which disappointed me and made it a much harder prospect for the adults having to be in holding them…

title: Short Break
review: Just got back from a short break to santa ponsa we stayed in a apartment with side sea view we were about 4 floors up and could see the sea from the side just, the apartments were basic but as with all santa ponsa they were very clean, we took our own kettle as theres boils on top of the cooker very slow, also no hairdryer bathroom was nice enough the water was always hot. Reception was always on hand if you needed them. The square would be nice in full season but was very quite when we were there although we managed, theres a large supermarket a few yards from the apartments that sells all you need. 104 Bus to Palma about 2.75 euros,we also got the bus into santa ponsa town and taxi back 3 euros.

title: Poor quality & stff uninterested
review: We arrived on Friday at 10:30, the receptionist was rude and uninterested in our party of 8 and she couldn't be bothered hiding it. We got our rooms which were adequate, although there is very limited equipment in the kitchen, so dont plan on cooking any meals! We had the tv and lights on and that blew the fuses,so dont use more than 1 electrical point at a time. You can also hear whet the people in the next room are saying, as it was our friends not too much of a problem, had it been a honeymooning couple there would have been a big problem!  The worst part was by the time we checked on Monday we had recieved no clean towels or bedding for the durtion of our stay.. Yuk!  You get what you pay for and if your after cheap and cheerful, well its cheap no cheer!

title: Dated Hotel - but lovely location
review: We arrived back today after a last minute, 4 day break. Basically you get what you pay for. The hotel is dated and very much aimed at catering for German tourists - who are looked after by their respective on site tour reps.  It was evident that the majority of the British (like us) were accommodated on the Ground Floor with a side sea view (of a bush and a storm drain). Our walls were paper thin and we didn't get much sleep on any of the nights (as late as 3am on one night) because of this. On our first morning we witnessed 2 separate British families complaining to Reception about the rooms (along our corridor). One of the families had stayed at the hotel before and had stayed in a much better standard sea view room. Even though they had offered to pay for an upgrade the…

title: Clean ok Apartments
review: I stayed in the Jardin for 6 nights in April 2012.After the initial check-in in which we booked a side sea view we were given a apartment which was on the ground floor and had a wall view with absolutely no views of the sea.On returning to the Reception we were given a alternative room with sea view for a extra 6 euro a night which i suppose is not too expensive.The apartments were clean and basic.If anything they could do with updating their towels as the ones in my apartment were old and torn.The resort itself is old and tired and could do with a bit of a update broken paths and lot of boarded up shops and resturants.There are 2 pools 1 indoor which was good as the weather wasn't great but i suppose it was only April.My overall impression is that it was ok and a little few…

title: friendly helpfull staff
review: My Husband and I stayed here for one week, we was greeted by a male reception staff who had only been there for 2weeks he was very helpfull with a friendly smile. Always happy to help nothing was too much trouble. We was give our keys to our appartment, this was clean and basic  we took our own kettle, but i forgot my hair dryer the hotel hires out such things like hair dryers, kettles ect...   Usual things in appartment, inculding two ring electric cooker,small fridge, Sky TV but we could only get news in English, we didnt cook in the appartment since we booked Bed n Breakfast.  Self Service plenty of food to please all tastes. Fresh fruits, English Breakfast and Continental Breakfast, staff greeted us with a smile each morning and we was free to choose our own table. Our…

title: Nice apartments but need more of an atmosphere
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here during August. It was our first holiday together and also our first time in Santa Ponsa. The apartments are a bit away from the main strip however the spanish square is not too far away and has some irish bars and nice restauarants. The apartments are not too big but spacious enough for what you need them for. We had a lovely view of the sea from ours. The pool however would be my only real negative about the apartments as it was too deep for me to get into. There was no shallow end as i cannt swim this is always important to me that i can get into the pool. That was a bit disappointing. There is a pool side bar where you can get snacks and drinks and nearby there is a restaurant called archils where you can get nice breakfasts. The main strip is…

title: Nice Hotel
review: Stayed here a couple of times as i like the location, its a nice stroll to the centre of santa ponsa and the spanish square is very close. The pool area is lovely and has a nice snack bar, ive never had a problem with getting sunloungers but we were never there during the high season. Theres access to a small cove from the pool area which is good as the main beach is about 10-15 minute walk. The rooms are basic with a small kitchen for self catering, a small seating area and a separate bedroom. The views from the rooms are lovely as long as you opt for a sea view, the first time we stayed we had a room facing a wall that got no light at all and the sea view room made a big difference. I find santa ponsa hotels can be very noisey at night and this is the only one ive stayed in…

title: stayed here twice ,,,,had a ball twice
review: right, im a dad of two, first time i stayed here i got a bad room, went to recep got a better room,(easy). so if ur not happy with ur room explain why and get it changed(simple). there is a small rest/cafe just to ur left as you walk out of main doors which food is unreal and cheap, there is the square 2 min walk from hotel which is great for the kids and adults and believe me i am the real victor meldrew and i loved it, dont eat the crap from the local chipper in the square though, horrid,beach is a good walk downhill, not so good going uphill on the way back when ur wrecked,sitting by the pool in the hotel was great,although i got my mrs to run down to grab some chairs before i even got outta bed,so if we all went down together id say we d be standing. overall id stay here…

title: we still enjoyed it even though we were robbed
review: when we arrived my husband and i had a nice impression the reception was large clean and bright.  the room was a let down as it was very dated but we werent that bothered as it was clean, the only real downside to the rooms was the beds were so hard i didnt get a good nights sleep on them. we payed extra for the sea view room and wow that view from the 7th floor was very amazing . i stood out on the balcony every night watching the boats and the sunset truly amazing. the first day we arrived i went back to the room around lunchtime and realised someone had been in my handbag which was in the wardrobe . they had taken a £20 note out of a brown envelope i had kept separate with some receiphts which were work expenses. i ent to reception and reported this . there was no evidence of…

title: Great Christmas and New Year
review: My wife and I spent 2 weeks here on half board and enjoyed it very much. Food was excellent and plentiful our apartment was roomy and comfortable, the kitchen was on the small size but adequate. Staff both on reception and the restaurant were friendly,polite,and helpful. There is a small super market nearby which could provide all our needs,there is a larger supermarket about 20 minutes walk away but the walk back is uphill. There is a bus stop close by and the buses run about every hour to Palma.

title: New Year
review: New Years Eve fantastic food, wines, champs all included, room was a suite fantastic, views fantastic, best New Year ever, hope the same next year

title: Made the holiday!
review: Originally we had booked 2 rooms but when I got there they had over sold th hotel so they had put us in tiny rooms -- to make up for it they gave us comp breakfast, comp dinner and best of all moved us to the penthouse of the hotel!! The view was amazing, th hotel's pool was really nice, the fact that it's in a quiet location just minutes from Ponsa nightlife was great! Although my friends and I caused torture for the staff they really excelled! Great hotel for families or young adults who don't mind walking a bit!

title: Not recommended, food poor, hotel in need of a refurb
review: Stayed in Majorca for 4 days here and 4 days at the Eden Alcudia.  The Eden Alcudia I rate an excellent 3* hotel, this 1* (although it was a bit more expensive!). I wouldn’t stay with the TRH hotel group again, there was evidence of cost cutting and cheapness all around. The reception area was dingy and the staff un-friendly.  The hotel is run down with peeling paint.  The rooms are ok, yes, a nice sea view but the hardest beds ever. The room wasn't cleaned once in four days, I didn't mind that  but I had to go and find the maid to get my towels changed. (Thin threadbare things that passed for towels). By the pool were the nastiest cheapest plastic sun loungers that did not adjust, you couldn’t sun bathe on them unless you purchased an inflatable lilo to go on top. But the worst…

title: Awful!
review: will not be returning to these apartments, found it run down and everything was shut. The gym was empty,pool bar all shut. We paid for a sea view which was nice,but the apartment was really small and ill equiped for self catering,the walls are paper thin and you can even hear the person in the next apartment talking and using the toilet!.  The reception staff are some of the most miserable i've come across. The area its in is scruffy,the 'square' was all closed up as it was end of season,then you walk in to the vast amount of Irish bars. these are 2 star at most!.

title: A little Gem
review: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here each summer from 2007 to 2009 and it was so good we kept going back. I have seen lots of negative reviews on here but in the 3 times we stayed there we had no problems. The rooms are basic but clean and if you get a sea view its fantastic!   The pool area can be quite busy but if you go down early getting a sun lounger should be fine.  Although its a 5-10minute walk from the center of santa ponsa its a perfect location as you can come back to your hotel and get a good nites sleep. There are lots of little resturants beside the hotel to get some mid day lunch also. And arkles across the road is excellent for breakfast.  All in all i would not let negative reviews on here put me off and we both plan to return again soon.

title: Robbed!
review: Never before have i wrote a bad review,but i have had to warn others about this hotel. we are a family with young kids who travel to majorca four times a year (usually staying in palmanova,cala dor or cala millor/bona) first time in santa ponsa,and will be the last. The resort was dirty,beach filthy and full of dog dirt. I've been everywhere in majorca and have to say this hotel was the worst....its in dire need of a refurb!,looked nothing like the brochure photos and the reception staff are so rude its untrue!. On our last day my nephew left his blackberry on charge whilst we went for a meal,the door was double locked.On return it had been stolen,along with the charger, No forced entry so had to be with a key! (we had high floor sea view) we reported it to the night…

title: good value hotel, excellent views
review: After reading some reviews we were a little worried about staying here, but we needent have been - we were very pleased with the hotel.   Check in was fast, the guy on desk was friendly, no problems with any other staff we came across.  The room was quite spacious, on a corner room with huge balcony with sunloungers and table and chairs, had stunning views. The room was good size, looked refurbished compared to some of the other rooms we walked past. Big bathroom and the apartment was clean. Kitchen was fairly basic but did the job.   The swimming pool area is quite small for the size of the complex but off season it was fine, and the waterfront location meant lovely views as you swim or sunbathe. The inside bar area by the pool was fairly pricey, but you expect that in a hotel,…

title: Girly holiday!- AMAZING!
review: In August/ september of 2011 me and two other 18 year old girls went to the Jardin Del Mar for ten days! It was AMAZING!  The hotel was fantastic (basic but we got what we paid for) it was clean and maintained by fantasic hotel staff. The pool was clean and the hotel staff were welcoming and happy to help with everything!  About 200 yards down the road are shops, cafes,  a doctors, English pubs and bars and many restraunts and pubs where great food is quickly served... everything is really easy to get to and very well priced... we would recommend the La Plaiza which is about two doors down from the doctors to eat as they are open until late, the food is very cheap and the portions are big and very tasty! We ended up going to that restraunt a few nights out of the ten!  Before…

title: great holiday
review: first of i have to say that i dont understand people complaining about noise,its a holiday resort ofcourse its going to be noisy.also i found the staff very helpful,they are rude to you if you are rude to them.the view from our room was beautiful.the pool was amazing although the water was freezing but after a minute you get used to it.another thing i have to say about people complaining about the state of the hotel,its a 3 star hotel if you want luxury go to a 5 star hotel.i would definitely come back.

title: Good basic but noisy.
review: If you like a good beach and lots of Scottish/Irish bars, Santa Ponsa is for you. Nearby Paguerra possibly has more attractions and charm - 3 beaches -  favoured by Germans. Jardin del Mare was a good basic hotel, good selection of food, good pool. Seaview rooms to be preferred but avoid rooms *11 and *12 on every floor as they are on the corner and so overlook each other. Also it can be quite noisy from other guests staying out very late on their balconies. For more authentic feel you need to go inland - the market at Calvia was a pleasant trip.

title: Noise and rude staff
review: If you want to spend a week in a hotel where you can squash ants in your bathroom, listen to the TV in the next door apartment from 1am until 7am every night, walls were so thin I could even hear the next door using the toilet, and be looked after by the most rude and miserable staff on the planet then this is the hotel for you!!  I did not see one member of hotel staff smile once in the whole week that we were there and the atmosphere in the dining room at meal times was terrible, I felt like they were looking for something to tell you off for!  We sat in the hotel bar one evening, we were the only ones in there, the kids were engrossed in a nature programme on the TV, and the waiter took great pleasure in coming out from behind the bar and putting the football on so he could…

title: No frills hotel not the best....
review: We have just come back from Jardin Del Mar, we stayed here for 4 days after deciding on self catering, well the facilities could have been better, you get a 2 ring hob, fridge, cuterly and a pot, pan and frying pan, there was no kettle, no toaster, no microwave, if you wanted the kettle or toaster you had to pay for them by the week. However we managed! The room was pretty dated, but did the job required, had the odd ants crawling about, the beds were uncomfortable to say the least, but for a basic hotel it was ok. The hotel facilities were ok, however the indoor pool was out of use as was the gym as they had taken most of the equipment out, and the sauna you also had to pay to use! The staff at teh hotel seemed friendly enough, all in all a no frills hotel

title: A Little Disappointed !
review: Booked a " self-catering " week at this resort and afterwards read some very uncomplimentary reviews and therefore arrived with some nervousness on what we would find ! However the reception area the apartment condition were just fine for the price paid - however room serviced on only two days . The sea view from the balcony was great and the pool area was clean and picturesque . We did have 3 areas of some concern ! Firstly the kitchenette area was rather small and was about the worst equipped we had ever had - 2 old fashioned hot plates with control details no longer visible , no oven or grill , no microwave ,no toaster , a broken whistling kettle and virtually no cooking knives/scissors/tin opener/etc..If you wanted to practice " self catering " then that would not have been…

title: Great value and awesome views
review: We stayed at this hotel for 9 days over Christmas/New Year last year.  They didn't have any double beds, so we just pushed the two twins together. The apartment was nice and big and plenty of kitchen equipment to cook our own meals each evening. The only english channels on TV was the news. The view from the balcony was amazing looking over the bay and out to sea.  The hotel was very quiet, not many people around. Only saw a small handful of people apart from on New Years Eve when they had a event going on in the ballroom.  Pool was big and clean, inside pool was very warm. Didn't trust going on any of the gym equipment as it looked very run down. Had to sit in reception to use the internet as the wireless didn't reach the room.

title: Sea View is amazing
review: reading other reviews i was dreading our holiday here but overall we had a fab time. room service was excellent our made was lovely if you wanted clean towels everyday it wasn't a problem reception staff not that freindly but they did their job, we made a point of saying rather loudly "hola" every time we went through reception to which they did look up & reply. its not as close to the beach as i thought it was, this was our 4th year running at santa ponsa so bit of a treck ,but along the front it's very pretty. we were on the 3rd floor & the view was amazing, we didn't eat or drink at the hotel so can't comment on that. hired safe as we usually do for peace of mind & insurance purposes. it has the square a couple of minutes walking distance away where there is entertainment…

title: Good 3* Hotel
review: The room was dated but clean with excellent room service 5 of the 6 days we were there. We had booked a room with a  sea view but on arrival no such rooms were available. However, we were told to try reception the next morning and when we did we were lucky enough to get moved as some others who had booked a sea view room didn’t get one. I’m glad we did as the view was brilliant, the best we’ve ever had in a hotel and it made the apartment seem a lot more open and brighter than the one we had on the night we arrived. We were bed and breakfast and we couldn’t fault the breakfasts, a good selection to suit everyone. The location of the hotel was great, only a 10 minute walk to the beach and just along the road from a square where there was entertainment every night, a kids disco…

title: great budget break
review: This is our 2nd time staying here at the the Jardin Del Mar,the place is spotless clean and the staff were very friendly to us,weather was beautiful for this time of year,great to go around in flip flops in october,we ate out at a place called the glasgow grill mosts mornings and evenings,food was lovely,the location of the hotel is ideal as its 3 mins away from a supermarket,bounty of shops and places to go,10 min stroll from the beach which is gorgeous,1 downfall which didnt happen to us was that we were told of stuff going"missing"from peoples rooms,ie cigarettes and in on case a laptop and a mobile phone so needless to say we were cautious from then on,a great stay once again though,only thing i would recommend is that you use the safe in the room,just in case. :)

title: It's a good 3*!
review: Decided to head to Santa Ponsa for a late break and booked Jardin Del Mar (€29 r/o per apt per night on www.travelrepublic.ie) on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor. Our transfer got us to the hotel a couple of hours before check-in time so we were able to store our luggage. There are lots of bars/restaurants in the immediate vicinity so it was not difficult to pass the time. The location is about 2 minutes' walk from the square (tribute bands finished for the season before our arrival date) and no more than 10 mins from the beach if you take the main route. A rockier path at the rear of the hotel will get you there in a few minutes. When booking we requested apartments on a higher level as we had read about the good views over the bay and were given rooms on the 7th…

title: Awesome views.
review: Stayed at jardin del Mar for one week recently.  Had a lovely room on 7th floor.. all that we needed and an enormous Balcony with views over the bay. The room was somewhat dated but very clean, towels, bedding etc were changed frequently thanks to Maria.  Cooking facilities were limited, we had breakfast at the hotel which was very good and ate out every evening. Sebastians and Mrs Murphys both were good.  The hotel is ideally situated away from the town only a ten minute walk away. There are plenty of Bars in the Square and tribute acts each night.Bus stops are just across the road and also a Taxi rank.  The hotel staff were very polite.We would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return.

title: No frills hotel
review: This is a good hotel if you´re looking for a cheap stay somewhere. It has good views of the sea and good places to eat.  However, be warned that this hotel is probably not the most couple friendly as most of their rooms are advertised as "double" but are in fact twin rooms with single beds put together (not so comfy for hanky panky). They especailly have rooms with double beds which they call "marrige rooms". This leads me to belive they are extreme catholics. So if you´re gay - forget it mate. lol   We had a self service apartment which was not in tip top condition, with things like light bulb missing, and bad cooker, bad toilet, poor TV and poorly supplied in terms of cosmetics as you´d expect in other hotels.  They also do not change beddings on Wednesdays and Saturdays, so…

title: Brilliant Stay! Lovely pool and FAB location!
review: We have just returned from a week in this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it!   I had read, as you all have about the theft and was paniking. We had NOTHING stolen at all! we took our valubles, ipad 2 iphones and a sat nav in a bag when we left for the day and kept it in the boot of the car and on a night when we went out etc inside a locked suitcase.  I even left a few euro in a draw and they were still there when we returned! Just dont be stupid and leave temptation on display!  The hotel is lovely, the rooms ample size, clean (beds could do with being a little more comfortable lol.) Electric kettle on hire from reception, but we used the old fashioned boiling one!   We had paid for a side sea view (car park view) we should have paid the extra £30 quid when we booked in the UK,…

title: Super, will return.
review: Just spent a short break in Santa Ponsa and stayed at this wonderful hotel, what a great place to stay it was too. I travelled alone so was a little surprized to have a room big enough for four people, 2 beds and a double sofa bed, the room itself was very clean and more than adequate to say the least, nice balcony too. Breakfast was outstanding and all the staff really friendly, I would highly recommend this place and will definately stay there again in the future, full marks!

title: Great Opportunity Missed
review: Spent a week from 16th September, just the 2 of us. Had prepared ourselves for the 'pool' run and other highlighted issues that listed in reviews.  Honestly, enjoyed the week and met a variety of good natured people both young and old. Yes on the first night there was a few loud rooms but this settled after this as the possibly ran out of steam. Had sun bed everday as we got up for open doors.   The poolside bar did food that was ok but in fairness a touch pricey and within 5 mins walk you could venue to little establishments like the pie 'n' pint that offer cheaper prices, better value and a friendly enviroment.  The disappointment for us was in the main that the place is very tired, pool a little small with sunbeds I can see lacking in the summer. As for the room, very…

title: Good Hotel
review: Just back from this hotel and was very nervous having read the reviews on the site about the place.  Very good hotel, was on fifth floor and had sun on terrace from early morning until about 7pm, excellent sea view.  Room was clean but towels not changed on a daily basis which was a downside. Kitchen left a lot to be desired from an applicance point of view, would advise taking your own travel kettle, we did and it made all the difference.  Staff were friendly enough if you were friendly with them.  Pool was adequate but could foresee problems in the high season as it was quite small considering the size of the complex.  Eat at Miami restaurant about 50 yards from hotel and this was excellent, with good service and value for money.  Supermarket just around corner from hotel;…

title: Great holiday
review: We was a little unsure about these apps after reading other comments but we went with an open mind.  This is a 3 star hotel and you get what you pay for. Cant understand people that pay a very reasonable price and then expect 5 star. Get real all the moaners........its a 3 star. 3 star is what you pay and 3 star is what you get.  As for the theft of money from rooms, well we did not hear of anything like this but wise up a little and put your valuables in the safety deposit boxes in reception because they dont cost the earth. Theft can happen anywhere, even in a 5 star.  It amazes me what some people complain about. They seem to go on holiday just so they can moan about the slightest thing like the fact that there was no electric kettle, toaster or even an oven, so what, your on…

title: Great hotel excellent value
review: Went to this hotel last year (2010) in October and was advised that the local square has evening shows but they finish end of Sept so went earlier this year and is brilliant for kids and free of charge. Hotel great location with stunning views.  If eating out try Paco's on the way to town centre (lovely food very cheap) and if you want avoid frustration get taxi to and from hotel/airport. Shuttle bus took us 2.5hrs. It's last stop so ye see loads of the island if you're into that. Taxi 20 mins and 37euro (dearer on sunday).

title: Great Holiday
review: I stayed here in August 2011 and was slightly concerned as we seemed to be a fair bit away from the main strip but it was a reasonable walk - though a slight hill to get home at night!! We were in a ground floor apartment and it was fine - great view of the pool and cleaned regularly. The only complaints were that there werent enough loungers and the morning stampede to get one was a humorous highlight every day and there seemed to be a lot of problems with the lifts. The beach and main resort centre arent too far away and the hotel is right next to The Square where there were plenty of bars and entertainment though geared towards fmilies with kids. A nice hotel and I would stay again.

title: Enjoyed our stay in Jardin del Mar
review: We have stayed in this hotel many times and never had reason to complain.  The staff have always been pleasant and helpful.  Some reviewers have complained about being robbed. It is not advisable to leave money or valuables in  hotel rooms anywhere. Safes are available at the reception and they are worth the cost for peace of mind.

title: Good hotel -great value for money
review: We stayed at this hotel for four nights arriving on 25th September. The room was basic but clean and comfortable and cleaned every day with a towel change mid way tjhrough. We did have a problem with the electrics but this was sorted out quickly and without any fuss. No problem with sunbeds and the view over the bay was fab!
