We paid a little over £15 each per night for our stay.....great value and would definately go back again. Hired a kettle and a safe and they did reduce the weekly price of rental for our four night stay.  Staff helpful and polite at all times.

title: Cant wait to go back!
review: There was 3 of us that stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in Aug after reading some of the reviews I was a bit unsure but had got good reviews from people that had stayed there before.  We checked in at 10.30pm at night met a lovely man at the reception he was more than helpful, Our room was on the 4th Floor which meant we didnt have to go up and down on lift, I would recommend a room on the 4th floor we were facing the sea it was a stunning view and could see the boats passing into the harbour it was fab..We did not eat in the hotel we ate down near the square most nights, I liked the location of the Hotel very near and central for everything a taxi rank just around the corner from it..Beach about 10/15 mins walk which is lovely we went down there most days.  I am looking…

title: Value for money
review: Large hotel just along the sea shore from the Santa Ponsa beach.  Very clean and basic rooms but good value for the cost.  The breakfast buffet was excellent, very fresh and a good selection.  Excellent sea views from the balconies.  Just a short walk from the hotel to the centre of the resort.  Lovely resort, good restaurants and bars. Beautiful beach, good for families.  Have read some of the other reviews - it all depends on who you get at reception but everything we asked for was done.

title: good basic hotel that could do with rooms given lots of T.L.C
review: we returned from a 4 day break at this hotel yesterday . it not as bad as people have put on the reviews , i will admit after reading some of the reviews on ere about the hotel n staff i was a bit worried about staying here , but we arrived at 12.10 am and the 2 male staff in reception were waitin for us was very welcoming and spoke nicely to us , the only thing was the guy gave us our key n said room 27 so we said wheres that he said by pool we had to say hang on we only just arrived we dont know where pool is so he said sorry n told us the way to go.   rooms are very basic but was clean n could do wiv gd lick of paint, we was suppose to ave side sea view but coz we was on bottom floor we never had this but never complained coz we were only there for 4 days n didnt intend…

title: good location hotel very basic
review: We stayed in the jardin del mar for one week mid september. On arrival the hotel looks very classy with a very nice reception area. Our room on the other hand was very different very dated furniture which had seen better days chipped and in need of a lick of paint, our beds were like sleeping on a piece of wood and the pillows had a lot to be desired, on saying that the room was very clean and was cleaned and towels changed every other day.  Our room was situated opposite the reception so we had a lot of noise from people coming and going and the night staff didnt appear to be bothered if people coming in late played loud music or carried on their night life in their room. When we asked reception if they would mind speaking with our neighbours as they were very noisy everytime…

title: Great hotel and a view to match
review: we turned up at 11 mid day and our room was not ready till 1.00pm which we were not happy about but other than that we had a great holiday here. I heard one group of girls were messed around more than us and weren't in their room till and 3.00pm. My sea view was to make up for all this. Room 116 must be the best view I have every had any where. Looking on the the pool and the sea. I did hear some people moaning about their sea because it was in a corner behind a few trees but mainly people were happy. Great place for all ages I would say and most things near by. It took longer to get to the hotel than I thought because of all the drop off's at palma nova and magaluf which are before santa ponsa.  Lots of Irish bar's here and scot's

title: Fab location and great holiday but hotel could be better
review: We stayed at the jardin del mar for 2 weeks from 13th august 2011 the location of this hotel is brilliant minutes away from the square with good entertainment and bars (I recommend shenanigans with Ricky who was fab) the hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the beach if you go the cove way but this is quite rocky. The beach is lovely and we prefered it to the pool as you had to que for sunbeds before 9.00am to get one this could easily be solved by providing more sunbeds, there were a few robberies while we were there so be aware and keep valuable belongings with you or in the safes in reception. At first we were given room 208 which did'nt have a good sea view which we had paid extra for so after complaining we were moved on the second day to 605 which had an amazing view and was…

title: Great Holiday Break
review: we have just returned from Jardin del Mar, it was lovely, clean, staff especially Pablo on reception were most helpful.  The Restraunt was clean, organised and lots to pick from.  Pool was clean and plenty beds available.  A bit quiet, but it was September and suited us. About a 15 min walk to the beach and all downhill, a short taxi-ride back if you dont fancy the walk.   Our room was spacious, clean and had a great view of the pool and beautiful sea.  Loved it and would go back.

title: san/rea
review: very well located hotel and standard average rooms everything you need close by.snack bar nice food and also rooms were clean

title: Brilliant
review: Have stayed in this hotel many times over the last 11 years and as usual had a fantastic time here. The staff are always friendly, the hotel is always clean and tidy. The pool area is lovely. We love that they have a seperate section of the pool for children. can't wait to go back next year

title: Our experience
review: Firstly, consider booking a taxi transfer from the Airport to the Hotel and back when you book your holiday in the UK. The bus transfer is terrible as the Jardin Del Mar will be the last stop after dropping off all the rest of the passengers at their hotels in different resorts on the way. Chances are, you will be on this bus for up to 2.5 hours plus. Taxi is 30 minutes max. When you do arrive at the hotel and book in, you hand your passpoprts in at reception, and they will photocopy them and hand them back to you.If the person on reception is an older guy with glasses, beware. He is not very friendly, so please don't try and crack a joke. When you are allocated your room look carefully at the room number. If it is 030, 131 or 231 get those alarm bells ringing inside your head.…

title: IT WAS HELL!!!!!!!!!!!
review: We have just come back from the JARDIN DEL MAR. They put a group of lads next door to us, after that it was down hill all the way, the noise was unbearable day and night, we asked to be moved but was told no. We paid for BB for a week, we left after 4 days. I think this hotel should not have families and couples mixed in with groups of lads/lasses, we was not aware of this when we booked it. If you want a nice quiet, peaceful, safe holiday, DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL....YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Be prepared you get what you pay for!
review: Stayed in this hotel 1st week in sept, we arrived in to reception at 12pm midnight as we where on a late night flight in, the hotel had previously been advised that we where a late check in, dispite this we arrive only to be told the hotel is fully booked, they told us they would transfer us to the sister hotel in another resort ....... we agreed as we where so tired, got tho the sister hotel its a kip, and our room is facing the street which ment we got no sleep, we returned to Jardin Del Mar the following day and they had our room it was ok, we knew what to expect as we had been before, we had read the reviews on this and made sure we left no money or valuables in the room which was a pain bringing everything everyware i know there are safes but the price is a joke, the rest…

title: Lovely 3* hotel
review: After reading the reviews it's safe to say I was panicing over going to this hotel, I needn't of bothered. We we're a party of 4, with each couple in a 1 bedroom apartment, when we arrived they advised they didn't have our rooms yet till the next morn So each couple were placed in a basic room till the morn and given a complimentary breakfast after this we were given 2 rooms on the 7th floor with the most amazing views of the sea. The  rooms are what you expect from self catering basic kitchen with 2 hobs, fridge and sink; if you expect more then that you've obviously been traveling to far fancier self catering, as I've never come across anything different anywhere else!!! Rooms were spacious (for a couple anyway you might feel diff if you had a small family) air conditioning…

title: no sleep for a week
review: this was me and my girlfriends 1st holiday, the room was very basic, kitchen was to small with only 1 bowl to share between 2 people, bathroom and shower were great hot water all day, beds were a disgrace we asked for double bed whe nwe booked it and got 2 singles stuck together, there were also springs sticking in every part of our bodies so we had to take turns to sleep on sofa pillows are also hard and uncomfortable. neighbours were a disaster, we had to complain several times but the and nothing was done. breakfast was pittyful we had to pay 7 euro each for 2 slices of toast. pool was fantastic clean and plenty of room and sunbeds. hotel is to far from beach up and down hills to get to it, no activities to do at night in hotel. very disapointed.

title: Rude staff, dirty beds, insects galore!!!
review: Me, my boyfriend and another couple went for a week on the 6th of september. When we arrived at the hotel they seemed nice, we got penthouse on the top floor with an impecable sea view. We settled in fine but noticed that it had not been cleaned as it was quite dusty, there was cob webs in our rooms, our pillows had mascara and makeup on them and when you pull down the top sheet it looks like the underneat has not been washed the whole summer because its all hairs and dirt. There was 1 double bed and the other two singles. The back room with the two singles we where told was the quitest. Not the case at all our poor friends had to sleep on the sofa because they couldn't sleep with the noise from the air conditioning vents and from the fan for the lift which was on the roof where…

title: Very average 3*
review: Room was adequate, and large enough for 2 adults. Could do with updating but clean enough. Shower good, plenty of hot water. Matresses and pillows very hard and uncomfortable, we do camping holidays and have slept better on a thin foam matress. Self catering facilities very poor, no kettle or toaster but we ate out every night and took our own kettle after reading reviews prior to going. Had also read about all the robberies in the hotel so very apprehensive and hired a safety deposit box for 15 euros for the week (plus 6 euros deposit). Locked all our valuables away or took them out with us.  Location is good, with shops and bars nearby. Beach a bit of a walk but was worth it! Spent most of the week on the beach. Santa Ponsa is a lovely place to stay but we would not return to…

title: Loved it! Will be re visiting this hotel!
review: We stayed here from 9th - 15th September 2011, myself, my partner and out 18 month old son and another couple. The views from most of the rooms in this hotel are fabulous! Just underneath the hotel is a cove where there are lots of people snorkelling, lots of fish to seek out down there! The pool area was clean everyday, pool bar was open everyday apart from Wednesday. didn't use the pool bar alot anyway as prices were rather high. We had breakfast and dinner whilst staying in the hotel. Breakfast was lovely, with a good choice of foods, the evening meal was also good, not fantastic, but was good enough for us! The location of the hotel is great! supermarket a 1 minute walk away, entertainment square a 2 minute walk away, bars, restaurants and shops right on the door step. We…

title: Great Value for money & fabulous location!!
review: I have stayed at this hotel three times now, and it is a great get a way! I stayed at the hotel from 2nd Sept - 9th Sept and the holiday cost a total of £230 and that was for flights & accommodation which was an absolute bargain!!  Transfers - the transfers were horrendous! we were told that our transfer time would be approx 25mins, 2 and a half hours later we arrived at our hotel! horrendous service and the timescale was the same on the way back to the airport, basically the problem was too many stop offs on the one coach!!   Hotel- Great location, rooms basic and what you need! beds were a little hard but at the end of the day, what do you expect for £230??!?!?! was good enough for me! hotel was very clean and although people have commented that the staff were rude, i did not…

title: the real truth
review: after many years of staying in 3* hotels i could have cried when i seen our room it was very small with a big folded up camp bed to put down as there was 4 of us,my partner managed to change room around so the camp bed wasnt in the way as i had visions of it being stuck in the middle of the floor blocking getting out on the balcony for early morning cuppa.the bathrooms are great plenty of hot water.the pool and area is lovely cleaned every night,spoke to a lot of people on holiday no one had anything stolen but after reading other reviews paid 30 euros for saftey deposit box,one of the lifts did work itself no and again but next time you went up or down it was working again so no hardship there.the square with the mini disco adult games and tribute actsare about 3 minutes walk…

title: Not sure about this one .... not bad but not great either.
review: Arrived at this hotel with a totally open mind as even the best 5* hotels get some poor reviews. We arrived at the hotel at 4am to be told by the most ignorant man on reception that check-in wasn't until 12 and that the hotel was fully booked so we would have to wait. However he also added that if we paid 110 euro we could check into a sea-view room on the 6th floor right away (not exactly fully booked then!). After a long debate, exhaustion won and we just paid it. Not really the best start.   The room was basic - bedroom, kitchen and bathroom - not very comfortable and would benefit greatly from a bit of refurbishment. The views from the balcony were gorgeous. The pool area was nice and was cleaned every evening. We didn't have much trouble getting sunbeds but  it would be…

title: What can i say!!!!!!
review: After all the reviews regarding theft in this hotel, i was a little weary about living there, well i can honestly say there was no need.The staff were very nice and helpful, and id like to thank Maria the chambermaid for handing in my jewellery that i left in my room after checking out. She handed it into reception for me which i think says a lot for loyalty and honesty. I think this review should a least let people know not to worry and not everyone is unfortunate.

title: the truth
review: just returned from a 8 night stay at this hotel.must say i was worried about staying there as had read reviews before i went but need`nt have worried.the hotel was very clean and well presented.rooms were clean and nothing like people had said.we only had side view but wasnt as problem as we were on 3rd floor and could see the sea and cove perfectly.food was not the best weve had but there was always something to make a meal with and for what we paid we couldnt complain (some people expect 5star food for 2star price).the staff were very friendly as were the chambermaids.this hotel is ideal location for the square where the entertainment is great.we also went down towards santa ponsa beach where on the way there are loads of shops and bars which are child friendly.we loved…

title: basic 3 star hotel
review: we stayed in the jardin del mar on the 29th of august for 10days. we heard about all the robberies before we came so we kept everythink with us at all times. we didnt have any problems i payed extra for a seaview and i got the 1st floor but was still a nice view from the room so couldnt complain. had no problems with the staff, and the square was great for the kids and familys maria does a good job. if your going to stay here do what we did take anythink that is valuable and keep them with you at all times. dont leave them in the room or in safes. i heard about 1 irish couple complain to reception about he had 100 euros in the deposit box and it was gone. reception said we will call the police but they may not come and the manager is available. but it was not a forced entry…

title: Nice hotel needs a bit of "TLC"
review: Just got back after a week with my family kids aged 17 and 14 the room is not big enough for a family of 4 unless you have small children, but we managed.  Air conditioning non existent so was unbearably hot at times in the rooms and restuarant apart from that hotel was very clean and the food good. Santa ponsa is a lively resort almost a mimi Magaluf in parts but enough areas suitable for families of all ages, we had a car for the week so managed to get out and abouit everyday the western water park was exceelent if a little pricey. All in all good holiday but hotel could do with some updating.

title: THEFT, THEFT AND MORE THEFT !
review: We have stayed at this hotel 7 times in last 10 years so have the experience, knowledge and a duty as law abiding citizens to let people know the truth about this place. First of all the positives are views above floor 3, pool is nice and clean, towels and sheets changed enough times during stay, location is great, with supermarket, bars, restaurants and Spanish Square (live tribute acts, bars, arcades, restaurants every night) on doorstep. Staff are generally nice enoughon reception (except English lady who has been consistently miserable and unwelcoming all these years but makes us laugh for the wrong reasons)  NEGATIVES - Here we go, air conditioning is ineffective and will only work when you are in room via key on wall, would be nice to leave on while out so cool when you…

title: A Great Time had by all ;)
review: We spent a week here in August, four adult and two children age 16 and 13. We all had a fab time, location of hotel is perfect. We had no problems with theft nor did we hear of any one else having a problem. No entertainment but the Jardin Square is great with tribute acts on everynight, The Crown was a great bar with free internet to customers which was a big hit with the kids. Food was well cooked and piping hot, not loads of choice but we never went hungry. Drinks in hotel are expensive but the supermarket next door was cheap and we kept the drinks in our fridge and freezer. The sunbed run at 9am was funny and if you can't beat them, join them, ha ha. All in all it was a great holiday, we all  had a fab time. I am sure we will return to the hotel one day. Take no notice of…

title: Great hotel on a budget
review: The hotel is in a great location; supermarket round the corner, pubs/restaurants very close by and a 15 minute walk to the beach (along the sea).  Basic room but clean.  I would say to hire a kettle because it took 20 minutes to boil the water for a brew in the morning!  Good for the money during summer holidays.  Stunning views from the fifth floor (sea view) actually one of the best balcony spots I have experienced - gorgeous.  Staff were grumpy but do you need to make friends with them?! Santa Ponsa is a great resort.  We had some lovely meals - El Ciebo did a great steak, cracking pizza at Jackies and a few good ones down by the sea (can't remember names - but down some steps off main road).  Use this basic hotel for a relaxing stay in a great resort.  One more thing...if a…

title: Theft major problem in this hotel.
review: Just returned from 1 weeks holiday at Jardin Del Mar with my husband and 2 childern aged 6 & 8. After reading the reviews we felt we had to get a safety deposit box which cost 21 euros but they are so small they only just manage to fit your passports, money and important travel documnets in. On the 4th evening we returned to our room to find that 2 mobile phones, an i pod and as Nintendo DSI charger (the thief obviously thought this was a mobile phone charger) had been stolen. These items were hidden away under books and clothing in the bedside cabinet not on view to anyone who entered the room. These items were used very regular by us so thats why they weren't in the safe. Luckily we had the DSI's with us otherwise the children would have been really upset. It was bad enough…

title: Most untrustworthy hotel I've ever stayed in.
review: I stayed at the Jardin De Mar and a cleaner stole £20 and €20 out of my wallet and reception did nothing about it, they would not even give me the name of the cleaner! On top of this I heard someone else complaining about money missing over €200 from their wallet after a cleaner had been in their room!! I would not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel, they are untrustworthy!!!

title: Avoid if you don't want money stolen from your room!
review: Avoid this hotel as we had £100 english money stolen from a bag that was zipped up in our room. Whoever did this must have been  a trusted member of staff with a key as there was no break in, we went down to the pool and on our return only 2 hrs later my partner checked his bag so he could change some money and noticed that there was money missing! From then on we did not feel safe in room. Shame really as the hotel is in a nice location with lovely views.

title: Good 3* Apartments
review: We were a family of 7 - 4 adults and 3 children of ages 7, 12 & 14. We had a side seaview room on the 3rd floor. It was a 1 bedroom apartment with basic kitchen facilities - 2 rings and a fridge. The room was clean and maids came in most days & made beds/ changed towels.We had nothing taken from room but did hire a safety deposit box after reading other reviews. The shower was excellent - always hot whenever you used it. We went half board and found food fine . Breakfast great - cereal, fruit, bread, cakes and fried. Dinner - salad, bread,soup, chips, other potatoes, rice and meat & fish dishes. Icecream, cakes & fruit . There were 2 lifts one of which kept getting stuck which wasn't good for people on a high floor. The reception was on the 4th floor and pool on 0. Found staff…

title: Plus and Minus Points
review: On the positive side, location fantastic if you want bars, a supermarket and pebble beach access, views from high floors are stunning and pool area doesn't get over crowded. Rooms typical size and decor, and shower was fantastic.  On the negative side, queuing for sunbeds from 8.40 was a total nonsense, pool staff toy with the guests and refer to the running as the 'stampedo'; females cause most of the mayhem by screaming and shouting. Reception staff the grumpiest I've ever come across, especially those of non-Spanish nationality, but maids really pleasant. Lifts constantly out of order, not good in a 7 floor hotel.  On balance, I had a great holiday but wouldn't ever consider returning to this hotel.

title: Wouldn't return
review: The hotel was ideally located, close to the 'Square' which had tribute acts/entertainment every night with a choice of pubs would recommend the Crown bar which had good prices and very friendly staff.  The pool itself was a good size and clean but you had to be down before 9am to queue for a bed.  We ended up not bothering with the sunbeds and used the chairs instead as they were more comfortable. We were allocated a ground floor room on arrival and after reading reports of thefts we  asked to move, the receptionist who moved like a snail said we couldn't move until the next day so had to put up with the terrible room with no view until we were moved to a fifth floor room with a side sea view which was much better.  There was no kettle or toaster, when we used the cooker it…

title: 3* Hotel Basic And Clean
review: We stayed for one week 3 Adults four children 16yrs 14yrs 8yrs 4yrs. The Hotel is good for a 3* and people have to remember that when they book and the price they pay. Rooms large enough for a family of four cleaned every day except Thurs & Sunday. Staff very friendly. Hotel as no entertainment day or night. Nice pool and area cleaned very well. Safe 21euros for the week, please get one, can not understand why people write about theft when they leave laptops and electronics and money in their rooms so tempting for all humans you can not trust no one. Restaurants, shops, supermarket all 2mins outside hotel, lovely square across road for family entertainment every night. Hotel views are 5* asked for level 4 or above and sea view. Shingle beach 2mins from hotel, main beach 15mins…

title: Amazing
review: What a view   Good time  Go back tomorrow  Free wifi in bar and reception

title: fabulous holiday, everyone was happy
review: Well I have to say the Hotel is not as bad as other reviews make it out to be.  What you have to remember Jardin is apartments and they will look different to real hotels.  I must admit 'yes' some of the reception staff are very blunt and dont really go out of their way to smile or make you feel well come. The rooms are very basis, nice layout, good size, clean, large enough for 3 adults really and we felt very comfortable, my sister had the other room that they advertise with the blue cupboard because she was a family of 4. Hire a safe at the reception 15 euros for the week for peace of mind. Loli our cleaner was very friendly and helpful, thanks.  The pool area was nice not to over crowded and 'yes' im one who runs for a lounger but thats holidays for you. The little cove by…

title: Better than expected after reading some of reviews.
review: Was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews (after we booked!) relating to thefts within this hotel. Overall hotel turned out to be basic but good.  Hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. Rooms were basic but cleaned regularly. We were on the bottom floor ( room 23 ) These rooms tended to be reserved for families with children and although on the bottom floor, they were quiet and cool. We were half board, breakfast was of a decent standard with cereal, fruit or fried. Dinner was of a good standard also, well presented although a little repetative. The pool run in the morning is generally what you would expect in high season, I didnt find this too problematic, be there at 8.40 for the doors to open at 9 and you should have no problem getting beds. Have seen worse…

title: Nice Hotel, lovely view.
review: We stayed here for 5 days at the end of July in a one bed apartment.  Rooms were nice and kitchenette area adequate, we were B&B and eat out each evening,  Breakfast was nice, good quality and good choice.  The scramble for the sunbeds in the morning is funny to watch, we usually went to the pool later in the day and had no problem getting a sunbed then. Best bit is there is no loud music round the pool all day to drive you mad!  There is a tiny beach behind the hotel which is good for snorkelling and their is a pathway round to the main beach at Santa Ponsa.  Would recommend Katies cafe in the square.  I would visit again.

title: Unpleasant
review: Our stay was mercifully short, just two nights. The Hotel was noisy (our rooms were next to reception) dirty and our rooms were smelly. As we were only staying 2 nights I requested the Maid not to clean our room during our stay. However while we were out one of the rooms was cleaned, unfortunately during the same period my Lap top and a quantity of cash went missing! (no break in). At reception they were completely uninterested and told me to report it to the Police at Palma Nova.

title: Just got back after 1 weeks stay and had a great time
review: We are a family of four with 2 teenage kids and could'nt find much fault with this hotel. We were a little aprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews posted leading up to our holiday regarding theft, rude staff, bar prices and lack of sunbeds. Let me put the record straight , that we found this entirely untrue. We stayed in room 607 which looked out over the pool and the Bay of Santa Ponsa which was breathtaking.There was no evidence of theft or people complaining of whilst we were there although we still took precautions as most sensible people do while away and hired a safety deposit box located in reception costing 15 euro for the week . 24 hr reception with cctv and security guard at night.Did not find the staff rude at all but friendly and helpful. There is a…

title: Fabulous Holiday Here.
review: I came to TRH Jardin del Mar with my family, definitley recommended for familys, not a very lot of sunbeds but didn't really have a problem with getting them, but we went down around 9 to get one. The pool was fantastic and quite spacious and not always crowded. You are not allowed inflatebles in the pool only very early in the morning or late in the evening. The pool area closes at 7pm when the restaurant opens. The food is lovely and something different everynight, you get a table of you're own in the evening but in the morning you can sit anywhere. The pool bar and drinks inside the restaurant was quite expensive. The entertainment in the square ( Square of Jardines ) was amazing, different acts everynight all very good, and the cheapest bar we went to was Shenanigans and the…

title: Fabulous time
review: My family and I have just returned from a wonderful 2 weeks stay at the Jardin del Mar. This was very family friendly, my nephew loved it. The apartments were perfect with fantastic sea views and location to the rest of the resort. Plenty of places close by to eat and drink and a lovely pebbled beach cove if you could not get a sunbed by the pool. I preferred the little beach to be honest.  My family and I went self catering however we did try the resaurant at the hotel more than once. Fantastic buffet selection and the staff were very helpful. My dad would have eaten there every night!  There was very little noise before 12.00am with any 'rowdiness' very quickly stopped. There was no noise throughout the night which was perfect for young children and the older generation (my…

title: Great Holiday
review: We as a party of nine including 7 adults, 1 teenager (14) and 1 child (5) stayed here is three rooms for one week the rooms were split 2 adults, 1 teen and 2 adults and 3 adults 1 child.  The room with 4 people was a bit coyy but spacious enough for the amount of tie spent in the room.  All three rooms were situated on the third floor over looking the road down to the coast.  The room closest to the coast had the best view of the bay and the little cove which was always busy.  The rooms were basic and the kitchenette not to be used other than for preparing non cooked breakfasts and cold lunches, brews do take awhile so best to out the kettle on first.  The rooms however were very clean and the maids came every day except Thursday and Sunday and were very nice and helpful, we…

title: Enjoyable Family Holiday
review: This was an enjoyable family holiday.  Food in the hotel was okay, there was plenty selection and we did enjoy it.  The rooms were basic and quite small but comfortable enough and the free air conditioning was handy going in July. We liked the fact they were cleaned everyday, the staff were friendly enough and willing to help. The hotel is situated near the quieter square but this suited us and we really enjoyed the entertainment which changed every night. It was a 10 minute walk to the bigger square, where there were lovely restaurants, bars and entertainment. Overall we had a good family holiday and I would go back.

title: Wait for the but...
review: As you walk back to this hotel in the evening you will notice the illuminated sign above the reception is half lit, for us this kind of summed the place up. Only one lift worked, there is plaster cracking on most of the external walls the decor is dated and furniture tired. Gym sauna indoor pool all shut. Manuel Fawlty on the desk can only handle three guests per hour regardless of how busy reception gets. The Sunbed scramble (youtube) is a farce that gave us a laugh every morning there are as many watching as running, yes running! If you are quick enough you still need a lilo on it. The slightest  noise is carried around the complex after dark so if you are a light sleeper it could be an issue. We heard of a couple of theft incidents so left nothing of value in the room. BTW…

title: 3 Star Hotel with 5 star views
review: Just got back today 7th August 2011, stayed self catering which was prefect for us as a family. Its not cheap as the EURO as bombed as we all know. I'll start with the hotel, you must get a room on the 4/5th floor or above and request a sea view, we were on the 5th floor (503) with views of the sea looking straight down to the beach. The rooms are basic and have stayed in better, but you don't spend much time in them anyway. The pool run every morning its crazy. If you are not an early riser then sorry you will not get a sunbed for the rest of the day. You have to queue from 8.30am for the doors to open at 9.00am then its a dash for your beds. All beds taken by 9.10am. Plenty of places to eat, Arkles which is across the road from the hotel does some great breakfasts plus for the…

title: wouldnt stay in it again
review: we got a 3rd floor room with no view only a laneway and a brick wall,when i asked to have a room with a pool view as i had two children with me i was told there were none available,then a different staff member told me id have to pay an extra 10euro a night for a pool view which meant another 140euro on top of what i already paid,the staff are not helpful or friendly at all.there is no entertainment on init at night,i personally wouldnt recommend it,the pool is a good size thats about the only good thing.

title: nice hotel but food was horrible,would recomend going self catering.
review: would advise getting sea view room the rest were small&basic,good location very close to the square,not enough sun loungers and unless get up at 8 to run for a bed you have no chance,wouldnt go half board as food was horrilbe and ended up eating out,

title: Good budget hotel
review: We were a little concerned about the hotel having read some bad reviews but found that the Jardin del Mar was a descent hotel for the price we paid.  Rooms were well used but clean and comfortable with enough space for the three of us. Pool area was nice - don't hang about in the morning if you want a sunbed however as these get snapped up as soon as the pool opens at 9am.    There was some noise from teenage guests but this was dealt with very quickly when we complained.  Lots of comments have been left regarding thefts. We hired a safe deposit box in the reception area which provided peace of mind.  The little cove next to the hotel was a bonus and lovely for swimming and snorkelling.  The hotel is very close to the square where there is live entertainment and lots of shops…

title: Santa Ponsa - nice -Hotel in lovely area.
review: This hotel is a 3* basic hotel. Rooms are adequate we were a family of 3. Tv's in rooms- seperate bedrooms.Our room looked out onto the pool area and the sea. Hotel was noisey at night seemed to be full of younger holiday makers.We are only in our 30s but found this so bad we complained. Overall holiday was fine .

title: Good basic hotel but does have a problem with theft!
review: After reading the negative reviews I was quite worried but I have to say was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are clean and adequate for a self catering base. Maid came every day except Thursday and Sunday and the kitchen has all the basics though you do need to hire a toaster for 10 euros a week. The staff were friendly contrary to other peoples experiences and were prompt in mending the air con when requested and providing extra pillows. The food at the pool area was good and reasonably priced.  Enjoyed Santa Ponsa with no shortage of bars and restaurants. The square is great for families with younger kids and plenty of lively bars for the older ones. Check out Fat Sams restaurant at the other side of the bay for fantastic steaks, burgers and ribs. Huge portions at reasonable…

title: We'd give it 6/10
review: I stayed here May 2011 with my boyfriend we went self catering. We chose this Hotel because of its location, price and mostly the internet pictures made it look gorgeous. We cant really complain for paying £200 for 6 nights… but I will say it didn’t really live up to the pictures online.  Location is right beside the busy “square” area were you get family entertainment on stage surrounded by bars. Beach is 15 walk away. The outside pool was open, however the indoor heated pool closes in April all through the summer months. You can ask reception for a key to use the sauna, although they want you to pay extra cash and for very short use of it.  It is one of those energy saving Hotels, where you need to put your key in the wall at the door to turn the electricity on, so once you…

title: Relaxing value for money
review: We went in the first week of January and it was I would say a very clean 3 star, room was good with separate living room and kitchen.  The indoor pool was fantastic and we had it all to ourselves.  The food was okay - perfect for the kids.  Bit boring for the adults but lots of it.  The puddings were brilliant.  We went half-board.  There is a supermarket (good prices) about a 2 minute walk away.  There is a hob in the kitchen so you could easily go self-catering.  The sea views are gorgeous.  The drive from the airport is about 1 hour.  Off-season the town is pretty much dead as a dodo.  The walk to the main beach (the coastal way) is very rough and you can't do it with a pushchair - it is like mini mountaineering.  The road route to the main beach is very long.  There is no…

title: Good central hotel
review: We have just arrived back from this hotel. There were 20 of us in total 11 adults and 9 kids aged 2 - 13. We had a great time after reading the reviews before we left we were very worried about the hotel being rubbish but we were pleasantly surprised. The worst part was the race for the sun beds in the morning as we were a large party we had to run for a bed to get them together we did manage to get beds all the days we wanted to go down. Also the big pool is deep about 5 foot at the shallow end but the small pool is shallow enough for the wee ones to walk around in. The hotel is central to the taxi rank, bus stop and a short walk to the beach. We went to the Western Water Park for a day out, McDonalds were doing vouchers for a free child when 2 adults pay so our family of 4…

title: loved our holiday here, its very central
review: the rooms are basic but clean, pool area was clean and a lifeguard is on duty all day, staff were  fine, i cant find fault with the hotel so very surprised at some of the negative comments, my family had a great holiday and i would go back in a minute

title: horrible, dont stay here
review: If your planning on a nice holiday with your family. Do not stay here in this hotel or even in the area of SANTA PONSA! The hotel rooms are dated, very run down. The a/c was not working properly and even tho i complained about this nothing was done to fix it. The beds were uncomfortable and very hard. They never once changed our towels during our 1 week stay! The poolarea is a joke! The pool is dirty, lots of kids AND adults PLAYING over the little fence that separates the kids pool from the main pool making it quite hard for little ones to play in it safely.  The britts staying there are loud, nasty and rude. With very weird behavior against other children who do not speek english yet...they dont seem to understand that us adults do understand their comments... The sunbed rush…

title: Basic but far better than I expected
review: A party of 9 ladies booked for a sort of hen holiday 14th July, we only paid £199 incl return flights on easyjet for 4 nights stay S.C. We got 3 adjoining rooms overlooking the pool/sea on the 4th floor. Arrived at the hotel at 10.30am an only 1 room was ready which was fine. The room was bigger than some I have stayed in for S.C. Reasonably large lounge and the sofa bed was very comfortable as were the beds. Clean sheets and towels. Kitchen was basic but had everything you needed and the fridge was cold and had a freezer compartment but no ice tray. Good size balcony. Room was clean and bathroom quite big with lovely hot water and some shower gel and soap thrown in. Walls are thin and you get noise from the corridors but its no real hardship, you dont spend that much time in…

title: great location,clean spacious rooms,nice pool,views amazing.
review: me and my family, two adults,3 kids, 11months,5 years,16 years, stayed here for a week from 8th july-14th july 2011, after reading some reviews we was pleasantly surprised, the rooms were clean and spacious, basic amenaties but it is a 3 star hotel. the pool opens at 9am so you have to queue for a sunbed untill the doors open, which was rediculously funny, watching people run to get the same spot every day..video on you-tube..i managed to get a bed just walking, but i think later in july and august you might struggle to get a bed. as there wasnt alot to go round for the amount in the hotel. we did`nt try the food in the hotel, so can`t comment on that. location of the hotel was perfect. just in front of the hotel was a strip of bars and places to eat, and a local supermarket was…

title: we had a great time at this hotel
review: pool area.....10/10 (but be down at 8.50 for a sun lounger and dont embarrass urself by running...ull get one!) no lilos allowed in the pool so save ur money unless you want them for the beach. mostly familys with young children round the pool.....didnt see any groups of lads lasses stag/hen night style.....the pool bar area ....tasty enough snacks but the large beer isnt a pint.......its 400ml. a lot has been reviewed about the staff being rude?.i didnt witness any of this. the rooms are very clean and yes the kitchen area is basic but i didnt come on holiday to wine and dine in the room!!!   air conditioning was good and the overall cleanliness of the rooms/hotel are very good.

title: We'll Deffinatly GO Back..........
review: After reading some poor reviews on here i was a little open minded about staying at this hotel, but really had'nt of worried. The hotel was very close to all restaurants,shops etc & only a 5min walk from the Square Los jardines which provided entertainment every night foc, starting with a kids disco @ 8.30pm. If you can i would recommend upgrading your room to a sea view.... you won't be dissapointed. Self catering facilities are very minimal but do the job, you can hire a toaster,kettle or hairdryer from reception if needed (toaster was 12€ +10€ deposit) safe's are also available 33€ for 12 nights that also included a deposit of 6€. One bad point was the beds ....you could feel every spring, I put the blanket from the wardrobe on top of mine & it did make it a little better,…

title: Fantastic Place
review: Great hotel -- wonderful veiws ...great food--right on the beach...fantatic place

title: Some good points, some bad
review: The hotel rooms do not have safes.  They are located in reception, which is manned 24/7.  The hotel reception has free wifi.  The rooms are average quality and cleanliness.  The pool area is very small, too small, for the number of guests.  The pool area is locked until 9am each morning and when opened people rush out of the hotel.  You will NOT get a sunbed after 901am.  The sunbeds get reserved despite notices not to.  Most people then go away and come back about 12 noon.  The views from the poolside area are wonderful.  We arrived at 12 noon and were not able to check in until 130pm.  We didnt eat at the hotel and there are a number of restaurants close by.  There is a supermarket a few seconds stroll from the hotel.  The indoor pool, gym and sauna were all closed.   At…

title: Disgraceful Place!
review: ok starting of, when we landed to the hotel we wernt as much as greeted upon arrival bearly given directions to our room. when me and 3 of my friends arrived to the room we were appalled by the room, cleaners were only making up our beds as we went in the door. never have i seen this done before. night after night we were blammed for rucess coming from the flat below us at one morning we were called down to the office and were told to pack our bags and leave that a hotel was booked for us in magaloof ..alomost and HOUR AND A HALF AWAY!!!!! when we complained that the walls are very thin and you can hear conversations from the next room the blonde british receptionist LAUGHED in our faces! she is nothing but rude and ignorant.. i would NEVER recommend this hotel for family, or…

title: would never return to this hotel again
review: was told it was for families,the pool area was but thats about it really,the hotel was full of groups of young lads who stayed up drinking on balconies till the sun came up,those that didnt came back in the early hours banging shouting ,swearing,even fighting,we complained every night as we have two young children who were pretty frightened at some points,we didnt get a nightsa sleep in the whole week we were there,after spending every night at reception complaining we got no help at all as the staff didnt seem to want to do anything about it,we had to grin and bear it,so as for our holiday being relaxing and having a week of rest ,,,forget it!!!!!,,we looked on trip advisor before we went and read good and bad reviews but thought none were bad enough to put us off but now ive…

title: really nice hotel
review: Just spent 11 nights at this hotel very nice, lovely location looking out over the bay, close to the beach.  Staff nice (don't believe what people say on here about the stafff).  Main door was open all day and night.  Safe available to hire to keep things safe,  those who have been burgled did they not hire 1? remember this can happen anywhere. Rooms a good size, looked in a room which was smaller than ours but this was even a good size, i have seen worse in England! If we were to complain about anything it would be the sunbeds around the pool, not enough and many were broken. Kitchen adequate for what you need on holiday. Didn't eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on it, found many nice restaurants around the hotel

title: Robbers !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: Just back from a week at this complex…. Disgraceful !!!!!! Staff are ignorant n RUDE !!! Money was robbed from our rooms clearly by the cleaners who were on the landings when we left our rooms !!! Reported this to reception and they were useless , the man on the desk shrugged his shoulders and walked off !!! when we reported this another unfortunate couple were walking by and heard us complain and they also had been robbed !!! Not to mention at night there is only one person on reception so when he decides he wants a break he locks the front door so your left sitting outside till he decides to come back !!!!!!!!!!! Also no service to rent a microwave, my sisters baby is only 6 weeks old so bottles need sterilising,,, all that needs doing is the steriliser to be put in the…

title: WARNING DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: Just home from a weeks stay at this hotel with my family. Where do i start............the staff are so RUDE...............not one bit helpful they pick and choose when they want to speak english.........the pics advertised for the hotel are of the penthouse which you certainly dont receive on arrival, more like a dogbox and to top it all off 2 of our rooms were ROBBED!!!!!!!!!!! Coincidentally the locks werent tampered wit and when we reported to reception money had been stolen from 2 of our rooms from our group they couldnt help us at all.............while reporting this at reception another couple overheard us and said that there room had been robbed that day 2!!!!!!!! Its obviously happeneing on a daily basis and the reception staff are in on it too so yoyu will never get…

title: Very basic 3 star hotel
review: We finally arrived at this hotel at around midnight after a 2 1/2 hour shuttle trip from the airport (25 minutes it may be distance wise but not when its a full coach). Our hotel was the last one on the drop off points.  When we checked in I mentioned I had requested on my reservation  a room with a sea view and was told this was not possible as there wasn't any.  We were given a room on the first floor with half a seaview and a rooftop..  Not a good start !! so don't expect to get one if you request it.  I also specified on my reservation my gluten free diet, which after a problem on the first evening in the restaurant this was catered for the rest of the week..this was grilled meat or fish but that was all there was nothing to go with it unless it was on the buffet table…

title: It`s very quite in May
review: We stayed for 4 nights on HB we had a very spacious apartment on the 1st floor with a large balcony which over looked the cove.   We used this hotel as a base as we were touring Mallorca. The hotel was very quite the food was OK but not great.  I would recommend self catering as there are lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Katie`s Bar in the square short walk away did a very good meal they were packed out every night. The bar prices in the hotel were expensive so better to go out. The hotel is right by the sea.  There is a small cove by the hotel but if you prefer a sandy beach then it`s a 10 minute walk. The reception has small safes which you can hire but the ones in the rooms are not available to use. The bathrooms do not have hair dryers.

title: Beware robberies at this hotel !!!
review: My husband and I have just returned after staying a week at this hotel.  Our first 4 days were enjoyable and the hotel was fine.  The hotel is inexpensive and rooms were basic but clean with nice sea views. On the 5th day we returned to our room to find that there had been items stolen! Everything else was still as we had left it. This happened to other families!  We were on different floors and our doors were locked and we were in possession of our room keys.   Someone must have a master key that can access the hotel rooms.  The hotel has safe deposit boxes in the lobby which fortunately we used for most of our valuables. We reported the theft to reception and the first person that we spoke to said that they couldn’t speak English.  We were passed to another person who listened…

title: Loved it and wish we where still there.
review: We stayed in this hotel self catering for a week with my 4 year old and 15 month old and had a ball!  Rooms where clean and cleaning staff very frinedly and helpful if you needed anything. The pool area is kept great and they have a kids entertainer on everyday to keep the little ones happy. As we where self catering we ate out but pool bar did some really nice food we did not use the resturant. First time in Santa Ponsa and would go back in a minute. Try Burlington Berties for the kids excellent place and staff are amazing. only 1 Euro per child for unlimied play while the parents can relax and have a beer. Katie Bar and kitchen in the Square was great for food and accommodated our kids every night

title: Only terrible due to room being robbed! :(
review: I'm only giving this hotel a bad review due to the fact that we had our room robbed on day 5 of our 10 day holiday.  The reception staff were very unhelpful and although they had spoke English before seemed to conveniently struggle when I spoke spoke to them about somebody taking items from our room.  I was told that anybody could enter the rooms, which wasn't very reassuring and then ignored.  There was nothing out of place in our room, we were on the 5th floor  and our door was locked which to me shows it can only be a member of staff.  They couldn't even tell me where to go to report the robbery.  In the event you do need a Police report you have to do this over the phone first and then collect you report from Palma Mallorca within 48hrs NOT Palma Nova (Unless you apeak…

title: Typical Spanish 3 star, fab views, good location
review: We stayed for the last week in may. The room is what I would expect from a typical 3 star Spanish hotel, the kitchen area was well equipped except for a toaster. I found the beds to be fine and our apartment was very clean. We have 2 young children and the hotel supplied a travel cot for our youngest. The pool are is lovely and spotless clean and there is access to a nice little cove from the hotel. We didn't have a whole lot of dealings with the reception staff but we going them quite friendly, and the cleaning lady was also lovely. We got clean towels every day bar one, and the sheets were changed once midweek.  The location is very good, right next to the Spanish square which our two year loved as there is lots to do for small kids. If I was to return to Santa ponsa I would…

title: Good - Fantastic Location, nice Sea View Rooms
review: Positives: ------------- - Fab location, situated right at the Santa Ponsa square, which houses a variety of restaurants spanning multiple cuisines + a supermarket + a taxi stand. - From the Airport, taxi takes just 25-30 mins and costs 36Euros in the daytime and 45Euros at night. So, commuting from the airport is not an issue at all. - Room size is comfortable, has a separate area for TV with a sofa, dining table, kitchen and balcony. The other area is the bedroom. If u go for the Sea facing room, like we did, it does provide nice views of the Sea (although hindered by the trees) and swimming pool. - Loads of beaches can be accessed by taxis at very low costs from the hotel because of the location. THE BEST BEACH around Santa Ponsa is the PAGUERA. Fabulous eating and shopping…

title: The saving grace was the view
review: I stayed here with 3 of my friends for 3 nights-we really where not expecting much as it had been pretty cheap however on arrival we where given 2 seperate rooms even though we had booked 2 bedroom apartment-the guy at reception then offered us a larger room which we greatly accepted.  When we got into our room it had cobwebs under the wicker chairs, behind the bathroom door and the place seemed really dirty, we had to go buy toilet cleaner and gave the place a good clean.  Food I thought was ok, what I would expect for 3 star in spain! only ate in rest onece!!  The maid service and cleaniness of this hotel really leaves alot to be desired! On our last night we had to check internet as our flight had been distrupted by the ash cloud however when we went down to reception we…

title: Average but room for improvement
review: The rooms are dated but clean, and the mattresses are very poor quality. They do not allow your own food or drink by the pool, even though it is self-catering, and their own bar is very expensive! They only allow 1 key per room, which is also needed for the electricity, so for more than 1 person it is extremely inconvenient. The staff are generally unhelpful, an there is no information provided in the rooms about any of their services, and the lady on reception is extremely rude to us and every other guest and the manager refuses to speak to anyone with complaints (and there were many from guests during our stay).

title: Disappointing
review: We have stayed at these apartments before and found them cheap and cheerful with great views, however we have just returned from a 5 night stay and found the staff incredibly rude and the cleanliness of the rooms and maid service have gone downhill rapidly! We will never stay at these apartments again.

title: very romantic
review: paid extra for side view of sea and was facing apartments and car park, would advise when booking to ask for full sea view. when I went to the reception thinking they made a mistake the girl behind the counter was rude

title: great value with views to thrill
review: just returned from our second stay at this hotel, this time we went half board, and didn't regret it, the food was ok, there was always something on offer that took our fancy. Its so expensive in santa ponsa now so it was a great saving, especially we got a great deal with travel republic. we were in room 217 looking on to the pool and sea, great views. Met a lot of nice people sitting by the pool everyone seemed to mingle nicely. not the friendliest staff ive came accross but didnt find them rude either. There is a singer on on a saturday night, give it a miss. sebastians is perfect for a lunchtime snack. good food served by a true gent. further down in the hogan stand ray will welcome you in if you like the footy and he now has a new member of staff micheal who after ten…

title: very clean and tidy
review: Nice surroundings at the pool area and the rooms are basic but very clean.   the only downfall is the price at the pool bar example small bottle of water 3Euros, but the whole of Spain and Majorca is now over priced, would recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent Value - comfy rooms - fantastic views
review: After booking, I was very sceptical after reading poor reviews.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  I really don't know what some people expect from a 3* Spanish hotel.  It is a typical 3* hotel, basic rooms but extremely good value, with 5* views if you book a sea view room.  One definite benefit was having a completely separate bedroom from living area.  If I woke early, I could go into the living room / kitchen / bathroom / balcony without disturbing my partner, which was great.  The room was cleaned regularly and was spotless.  On arrival, our toilet was broken and didn't flush.  We reported it to reception and it was fixed the same day.  All you needed in the kitchen, i.e. hob, kettle (not electric), pots, pans, crockery etc.  You can also hire items from reception if you…

title: Lovely hotel
review: We stayed at jardin del mar for 8 days. Really nice hotel situated in a really beautiful place. Everything you need is all around you. Only a 20 mins car journey from airport. There are shops, restuarants and bars on the same street and the beach is a 10 min walk away. The hotel rooms are very basic but very clean. Maid service 5 days out of 7. I think Thursday and Saturday is their day off. The only problem we had was there were no cots available. Luckily our youngest isn't too young so coped with sleeping in a bed for the week. There is a rental shop around the corner where you can rent a travel cot and various other things for a good price.we requested a low level floor because of the children and had no problems when we arrived. The food in the retaurant is ok. Not brilliant…

title: Lovely location, gorgeous sea view, good food, excellent value for money
review: Stayed here for 6 nights in April, just myself and two children aged 15 and 11. We were on floor 4 which is the same as the reception. The view from our room was stunning, I would definitely reccommend paying a little extra for the sea view, yes the rooms could do with a little updating especially the kitchen area but for the money it was better than I had expected. We went half board and overall we found the food excellent especially the evening meal, lots to choose from and of a very high standard. The reception staff were not the friendliest in the world it has to be said but I didn't have any problems with them during our stay. I loved the resort, its a nice walk to the beach along the sea front, we also went to Palma Nova for the day and played Crazy Golf, its a bit pricey…

title: Embarrassment to all Spanish
review: I have never felt compelled to right a review of any holiday until now.  My wife and I booked a short 5 night break at the Jardin Del Mar in late April. Being very reasonably priced neither of us expected much but were actually pleasantly surprised at the accommodation. The Hotel itself is clean but dated, rooms are comfortable if a little shabby and the pool area is well maintained.  I most definitely however would NEVER return to the hotel. The service we received from the Spanish female employee on reception was absolutely disgraceful. Our hotel information stated we had booked a lateral sea view room. When we got to our room we looked out at the view from the balcony and saw only a car park. We went back to reception to query this with the same member of staff who checked us…

title: get what you pay for
review: i stayed here 14th-21st april with my mum (50s), myself (24) we paid a little extra to get the sea view room, room 608.  the room was what we expected, 2 single beds, and then sofa bed in sitting room.  first of, view was AMAZING, defintaly worth the extra cost, small balcony area was big enough for the 2 of us, didnt have a table though, so we put coffee table out there, which did the job. we went self catering, kitchen was rather small but again big enough for us, when we arrived it was filthy though, sink was blocked, got someone to 'fix' it, ended up just doing washing up in bathroom sink.  can hire bits if needed- toaster, kettle, remote control, hair dryer (all at €11 for the week). i slept on the sofa bed which was comfy enough, very creeky though, my mum slept on one of…

title: Absolutely fine
review: This is a good 3 star hotel, very clean, comfortable with friendly staff - no prblems encountered here and would definately return.

title: Brilliant
review: Just back from the Jardin del mar.  Ignore the negative reviews - think if you pay for 3 star, you get very clean 3 star.  Yes the rooms are a little dated - kitchen very small and basic but to be honest we ate out all the time - recommend "Royal Garden" for evening meal and "California" for breakfast and lunches.  Without a doubt we would go back to this hotel, found reception staff friendly, bar staff pleasant and cleaning staff (who you see all the time as they work very hard at this hotel) are a very friendly group of people.  We stayed 5 nights and our room was cleaned all five days.  Loved it.  Whole family enjoyed.  Santa ponsa is a great place for kids.  Hot tip - find "Dionis" it's a bar/cafe with a pool, loungers, sun terrace and great views over the sea - fantastic if…

title: Another great stay
review: This was our third stay at this hotel and again we had a lovely time.  The rooms are adequate, the views spectacular and the food is well prepared with plenty of choice.  The hotel is well suited for families and couples who like a quieter more relaxed holiday and not for rowdy groups!  Unfortunately the 'hen party' from Derby arrived during our holiday and spent their first afternoon around the pool drinking their own alcohol, being very loud, swearing, and pushing each other into the pool.  Later they went back to their rooms and played some very loud music.  Luckily they were only there for a few days!!

title: Not over it yet, horrible hotel
review: Dont stay here. The staff are nasty unhelpful and one is even aggressive the night receptionist was without a doubt the worst of the lot. I was told they had no booking for me I was then told the hotel was full I moved rooms three times in the end i just gave up.  The first room was at street level and the patio doors did not lock nor did the aircon work.  Room two was dark dank and dirty I had paid for a seaview,  room three had a glimpse of the sea from an edge of the balcony it was not clean and the aircon did not work but by then i had given up and stayed where I was. The food was hot there is not much else I can say about it I am vegan and did not expect much but I did far better than my friend  at least  there was plenty of salad and fresh fruit. The hotel is about ten…

title: Pleasant Stay - just a little noisy
review: We've just returned from a lovely week at the Jardin Del Mar.  Apart from a rocky start where we discovered that they had cancelled our booking but managed to "find two rooms" within half an hour it went quite smoothly. We booked in. I was a little worried by the locks on the doors and the allen keys in the windows, especially as we were on the ground floor and after the reviews id read on here but we had no security problems at all,  aside from my mothers lighter being stolen from the balcony during the night.  It is a little worrying though that there is no security gate between the slope at the back of the hotel and the pool area meaning that anyone could get round the back of the hotel at any time of the day or night, this is something they need to address.  The food was…

title: Lovely stay
review: I have just come back from a week at this hotel travelling with my 2 friends and 2 children.  We had a problem on arrival as we were told the hotel was overbooked and we had no rooms and were being moved to Magaluf.  We argued the point and eventually 2 rooms were found (looking at the numbers of people through the week we are not convinced that the hotel was actually full but he did get a room).  The rooms were clean and the towels were changed on several occasions and were left with at least 7 towels and 2 bath mats on some occasions to cover the days when this wouldnt be happening.  The beds were made most days and I cant say that I had any issues with the maid service.  Onto the food I am veggie so im limited wherever I go.  The breakfast wasnt really to my taste as there…

title: Excellent value for money. Would definitely return.
review: I am writing this review on my last night (23rd April 2011) at the Jardin del Mar having spent 10 nights half board. The hotel has free WiFi available in the reception and bar areas. I had a 3rd floor room overlooking the pool and the bay. The room was one bedroom with 2 single beds, a living area with TV, table, chairs and sofa, which presumably could be used as an extra bed. The bonus for me was a small kitchen area with the usual 2 ring hob and a fridge. I only used this to make tea, but it was useful none the less. There seemed a decent amount of cutlery and crockery, and also a whistling kettle to sit on the cooker! The food was the usual Euro Buffet of decent standard. The restaurant waiters were all very attentive and friendly, although the chief front of house guy was a…

title: URGENT - PLEASE READ FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY
review: I generally do not pay much attention to these reviews. People generally complain about food, cleanliness, sheets being changed etc and from my experience those who write reviews like that expect 5/6 star luxury when paying 2/3 star rates. Completely unrealistic. I booked in for a week at the Jardin Del Mar. It is clean. We were on the ground floor, small apt, overlooking the pool and close to the bar. All seemed adequate. Now for the part that has let me to write this. On the 4th evening of our stay we were both napping in the bedroom. I awoke just before 6pm to find a man standing at the foot of our bed wearing a green & white stripped top, dark hair, late 20s (I got a good description) I jumped up in fright and said "excuse me?!!"He turned and left the apartment and I…

title: Get what you pay for!
review: We went there for a hen party and found a cockroach in one of our rooms.The phones didnt work and one key per room with the electric key welded to the door key. Also the reception staff are rude and obnoxious. The pool was nice and clean though. Not ideal for group of people who go back to the rooms at different times.

title: Fantastic value for money!
review: My family and I have just returned from this hotel and we have had a brilliant holiday for the price that we paid. The hotel is situated with lovely views of the bay and is surrounded by numerous cafe's bars and restuarants. We would recommend the restaurants El Jardin, Royal Garden and La Solana. The supermarket is next to the hotel and there is a taxi rank also very close by. We were initially disapointed on arrival as the "side sea view" room looked out onto the back of a block of shops and a passageway, however the next morning for an additional 5 euros per night per room we were upgraded to a sea-view room which was fantastic and much larger. We would recommend paying the extra and asking for rooms 319,320,419 or 420 as these are much bigger and a lot more modern. If not…

title: Stay well away
review: Great location, nice hotel,tho tired in places and could do with a spot of TLC. Had a sea view room (i use the words loosely), great for 3 people but 4 was impossible without a removal day and night. The towels were never changed once in 4 days and 2 days room service missed. Food was abysmal, we went to the restaurant with a strong stomach and a heavy heart, after 2 nights we could do it no more and ate out. The staff are the most ignorant, arrogant, miserable beings I have ever come across in my life. They always say if you have a complaint ask to speak to the manager, so I did and was told there was no manager on for the whole of the weekend! When I asked to see a deputy manager I was told there wasn't one of them either, but if I didn't like it I would have to leave the…

title: Not bad unless your a couple
review: Nice clean hotel although there is not a lot to do in the area. Our room had to single beds and when i asked at reception the clerk told me that 90% of the rooms did nopt have double beds. Not much good for couples.  There is a local restaurant called Mark Anthonys which does British food from British sourced foodstuffs. The food is great and the prices are very reasonable.  There is an Irish Bar Called The Auld Triangle near to the hotel and they offer Live Music every night with a great pint of Guiness.  These two make the hotel and resort enjoyable.

title: NICE LOCATION - SHAME ABOUT STAFF
review: The location of the hotel is perfect, we stayed in room 131, side sea view ? - looked out onto a road to a rocky cove, not a nice beach for a 4 yr old, sea view if you have a long neck. Breakfast is adequate and edible, evening meal was not , only had one good evening meal in four nights-when we ate out at "Katies Kitchen" in the Music Square. One lift had a mind of its own. Just enough space in the room for 3 adults and one child. A must visit is "The Crown" "The British pub in the music square" just a short walk away. Say hello to Mark - the very aimiable owner- gave me a break when he played football with my 4 yr old grand son. The hotel reception staff really need to attend a course on "customer service" and learn some manners ! It costs nothing to be polite and helpfull.…

title: Wouldn't go back
review: Just returned from a week away at this hotel. Hotel was okay, basic and rooms ok. Food in hotel was disgusting, someone i chatted too at the pool described it as dog food. I was there with my mum and my niece, at first we were given a room on the ground floor, 3 floors below reception and with no view at all. We did not feel safe in this room due to the ground floor and that we look on to tress, receptionist was unwilling to move us advising hotel was full, my mum went on to tell her that 3 women staying alone should not be on the ground floor, so then she could move us up one floor but then advised 'view will be the same' we paid for half board but i felt physically sick and what was out in the dining room and im not a fussy eater. pool was ok and in general an okay hotel. Some…

title: Perfectly adequate - no frills
review: We stayed at the Jardin del Mar for a week in mid February on B&B terms.  We had a side-seaview room on the 4th floor (same floor as Reception) and although it was a little too cold to sit on the balcony, we could see the sea.  The apartment itself was fine.  Quite large living room area, adequate bedroom with two ironing board beds as is standard in Spanish hotels and apartments.  The bathroom was basic but OK.  No bidet.  Maid service was a trifle erratic and desultory - there was a day when we were "forgotten". Breakfast was buffet style - plenty of choice.  Hot and cold foods, cereals, toast - the usuals.  Coffee dispensed from a machine, undrinkable.  Tea OK.  Fruit juices also dispensed from a machine, variable.  Some of our fellow guests seemed to take their entire daily…

title: This is a glorified Hostel, not a 3 Star Hotel
review: Booked this for 12 weeks via web. Stated Small Gym and sauna. When arrived, told Gym was only available in summer due to safety aspect. As children could be hurt. I said only let adults who want to use it have key, it is locked at other times. When I viewed it it was empty. They then said equipment is only available in summer. So I said where is it kept in winter. One lame excuse after another. The sauna is available but at 5 euro a time. Web site did not state this. I complained bitterly, and asked for a room upgrade, to a sea view at first they wanted paying, but I said as gesture of good will and compensation, which they agreed. But it seems out of spite. The chambermaids are only in my room for 90 seconds. I've timed one. My loo was not cleaned for 3 weeks until I…

title: Clean, tidy, lovely view over the pool
review: We stayed here in the October school holidays, we had 2 rooms, one of our rooms had a pool view, we paid a bit extra for that and was well worth it, the other room was on the side of the hotel, the view was ok. Its worth paying a bit more for a better view.  We had heard when we arrived that there had been items stolen from rooms, but we never came across anything like that everything was fine for us, we did leave items in our room such as nintento ds and mp3 players they weren't taken.  We did find that the sunny weather during the day was warm but at night it did come in pretty cold and you need to wrap up, as the walk back to the hotel took approx 15 minutes from the centre  and walking in a cold breeze wasn't particularly nice.  We also found that some of the shops were…

title: Great holiday on a budget.
review: I took my daughter and two grandchildren ages 10 and 12 to Santa Ponsa, staying at the Jardin Del Mer. I was on a very tight budget and expected to find myself in a shoddy hotel with not much going for it but as long as it was a roof over our heads for a week I wasn't really bothered. What I found when we got there was a nice clean hotel with a lovely pool. Rooms were adequate for us and we were on the 2nd floor with a view out to the side which overlooked a pathway down to the beach. Some of the reception and bar staff were a little grumpy, but hey, share a smile and they generally smiled back. For self caterers such as ourselves supermarkets were nearby and food reasonably priced. Plenty of restaurants around with Arkles, across the road from the hotel a favorite for breakfast…

title: Would never go back
review: We arrived on the morning, party of 9 altogether although 6 of us arrived earlier (family of 4 and a couple), with the other 3 arriving at night time. We asked if we were altogether and were told we were. When we went into our room we were facing a wall (rooms 130 and 131). Rooms were tiny, there was a twin bedroom, settee and fold up bed. 1 set of sheets for settee, none at all for fold up bed. Rooms were too small to put the bed up. One of my sons had to sleep in sister's room all week.  Other 3 arrived later in the evening and were told hotel was fully booked and had to stay at a different hotel for one night but would be given a sea view room when they returned.  When we went to bed a security light shone into the room making it broad daylight, we couldn't have window open.…

title: You get what you pay for
review: Hotel is basic, but reasonably clean.  The rooms swept out, bathroom wiped down and towels changed 5 days out of 7.  The childrens entertainer and staff were all lovely people.  We had a side view of the sea and it overlooked a car park, however, we don't spend a lot of time in the room so it was fine.  The beds are the most uncomfortable we have ever slept in.  The pool is a lovely area to sit around and there is a lovely walk along the beech to the resort centre,(not for anyone with a walking problem or buggy etc). Santa Ponsa is not very spanish, we felt that we could have been in britain, except for the sunshine, however, if you like that sort of holiday then it is an ideal location.  We prefer something a bit more authentic.  Restaurants:  Manolo's very good food, and for a…

title: will definately return
review: Hotel was lovely with lovely views, very close to bars, pubs and restaurants and a 10min walk to town or to the beach.  It was very quiet although think this had to do with it being the end of season.  Pool area was brilliant and very clean as well as the bar and amenities.  The only criticism is that the staff at reception were quite rude on arrival but was no problem as we didnt have to interact with them after that, bar and restaurant staff were brilliant and very friendly. would recommend to friends to stay and will be back

title: dreadful hotel
review: this hotel has advertised as having safes in the rooms - they are there alright - but you are not allowed to use them. We rented a safety deposit box in reception at extra cost. we came back from the beach to find video camera, three mobile phones and digital carmera had been stolen. our holiday insurance will not cover us as we did not have them in the safe. alpha rooms still not taking us seriously, hotel would not take resonsibility. out of pocket by over 1300 euro - very unhappy. we were told there had been no robberies in the last 20 years, only to discover another party which had three rooms done over the week before. reception staff friendly until you needed help, then they became so rude. we had paid extra for a sea veiw - did not get it, or a refund as the hotel was…

title: Good Views & Rooms
review: Basic spanish hotel in good location, breakfast of limited choice & quality. Near to most amenities, taxi rank diectly outside front door. 10 minute walk into town or 2 minute walk to 'the square'.  Was very quiet when we were there but that was mosy likely due to time of year anyhow, we were golfing so didnt really matter.  11 euro in a taxi to Magaluf so a night out doesnt break the bank, we went in 'the piano bar' which turned out to be 'grab-a-granny' night......not my cup of tea but amusing all the same.  Would stay again at Jardin if the price is right but there are other better hotes in Santa like Pionero or Hesperia although these maybe a little more expensive.

title: not impressed
review: i would never stay in these aparts again. I was with my ealderly mother and young son. We could not get a second key to the apart and the spanish receptionist with the long hair and glases was extreamly rude you would think i asked her to cut her hand off. Also i heard the  blond english one being very rude to another guest not one of them were aproachable.Also the charging for the sunbeds in the morning was awful. There as not enought of them for the amount of people staying.  My ealderly mother and my son and i has to walk to the verdemar aparts everyday to get sunbeds and we had to pay for them there.Every other time we went to santa ponsa we stayed in the verdemar and this year we tried the jardin del mar well never again. The verdemar is a fab aparts to stay in i would…

title: Great Hotel, pity about the hot breakfast
