review: Stayed here in March/April 2010. Lovely hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Rooms cleaned every day. Bus stop, restaurants, pubs, shops - everything really close to hotel. Hotel itself is 20 minutes walk into Santa Ponsa  centre and beach. Our first morning we all went for breakfast - a fry- and that was our last. We ate out in local cafes and restaurants after that, which was a pity as we would have preferred to have eated breakfast at least in the hotel. That said, this is the only complaint we had and I would highly recommend the Jardin del Mar and hope to stay there again.

title: Great view and value for money
review: Just returned from the jardin del mar after a relaxing 10 day stay. We paid extra for a sea view which was breath taking, the pool area was fab we relaxed there everday. The rooms are a bit small but view makes up for that. The only thing was the hotel was a bit far from the beach in the hot temps about 15mins walk and also the reception staff were a bit rude with the exception of the english lady who was always very pleasant. Another thing was you have to hire everything ie kettle,toaster,microwave which we thought should be included in hire of room. Overall we enjoyed our stay

title: Good 3* hotel, excellent views over the bay
review: This hotel is excellent value for money, the views over the bay are fantastic so I would recommend a sea view room for the small extra cost.  Pool area is lovely and clean and relaxing.  The location is great for the 'square', Literally a 2 min walk and a 10-15 min walk to the main beach which is lovely. We had a family room (2 adults, 1 child, 1 baby) which was a great size. The room had a small kitchenette but we did have to hire the kettle and toaster for 10 euros each for the week.  As we booked self catering you would think these would be included. Overall I would recommend this hotel.  it is a 3 star hotel with 5 star views, great location and excellent value for money.

title: Excellent, clean & perfect location!
review: I was very happy with the quality of the TRH Jardin Del Mar, the location was absolutely spot on as you simply walked down the hill and you were met with shops, restaraunts, cafes and it was only a ten minute walk from a strip of more bars, cafes etc and the beach! The rooms were spotless and our side sea view was lovely. The swimming pool was very spacious and sunloungers were very easy to come across (maybe due to time of year we visited though) the view from the pool was beautiful and unlike many other hotels along the beach you didn't get people walking along the poolside. The staff were very very friendly, letting us use the pool, showers and gym (which wasn't quite as exciting as we'd planned, there were only 3 pieces of equipment, each a bit worse for wear) after we'd…

title: Good value for money holiday
review: Stayed at this hotel for 9 nights, we were a bit worried about other reviews that we had read, but we were pleasantly surprised. We went half board food was varied, breakfast was ok but the evening meal was better again meat dishes,salads,fish and plenty more. The manager for the evening meal was a very nice man always spoke each evening some of the other staff a bit reserved.  The rooms were a bit dated  but clean.  Reception very friendly. Pool, well what can I say, it was a sun trap, and we did not have a problem getting a sun bed, views were just magnificent of the bay. The pool bar is a bit pricey but handy if you want a drink or a meal. The area around the hotel was lovely a few nice shops and restaurants a small stoney cove just below hotel. The el paso restaurant I …

title: never ever
review: cleaning been terible, location - so so... in the pictures looked beter never ever i come back int this hotel even food been poor choice............... no no no!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

title: Had a great holiday can't wait to go back.
review: well where do i start it was a great holiday. our apartment was lovely with sea view, we had no need to go anywhere. it was so relaxing just what the doctor order. great time SANTA PONSA here we come next year and Jardin del Mar

title: Needs a lick of paint
review: Just come back from a 10 day holiday and had a great time. The room was very clean but that did depend on which cleaner was working that day. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. the pool was clean and there was plenty of room although there were a lot of inflatables.  The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the main beach either through the town or along the coastline if you don't mind a few steps and rocks. you do need to watch where you're walking in town as there is a lot of dog mess everywhere! The square just down from the hotel has entertainment every night, although the childrens entertainer might get on your nerves!

title: Excellent Hotel.
review: Recently spent 10 nights at Jardin Del Mar and thoroughly enjoyed it. Staff were courteous at all times, maid service was very good and pool area was great. Fantastic views over the bay. Brilliant location for nightlife and restaurants yet could sleep at night without any noise. Very friendly atmosphere around pool during the day. Can't fault this hotel.

title: Excellent Value For Money
review: We spent two weeks here in mid august with two teenagers. Having read alot of mixed reviews we were a little unsure of what we would find, We had a brilliant time, the food was good and all the staff were friendly and helpful.One day our key broke in the door,my husband went to reception and within in 20 minutes it was all sorted no problem.For a good value holiday you cant beat this hotel.

title: Clean, Comfy, Great location!
review: My boyfriend & I had an 11 night stay at TRH, feeling apprehensive after reading recent reviews! Well we had nothing to worry about, i don't know what previous reviewers were expecting, it's a 3 * aparthotel and doesn't pretend to be anything else! We weren't expecting luxury for the price we paid but the apartments were air conditioned, comfortable and clean as the maids visited 5/7 days of the week and they were very thorough. The only gripe we had was having to rent toasters, kettles etc. But there is a kettle to boil water on the hob so it wasn't really a problem.  The pool area was nice with a very reasonable pool bar, we had no problem with sunbeds really unless we went in the afternoon but that's expected at most hotels i would think.   We stayed self catered so cannot…

title: Thoroughly enjoyable!
review: After reading many bad reviews for this hotel, I was quite apprehensive. However I needn't have worried at all. Of course I wasn't expecting luxury due to the price and star rating . It's basic but very clean. The maid came to clean 5 days out of the 7. We weren't in the room much anyway. Our side seaview was ok. We had requested a high floor which I would recommend as you wouldn't have much of a view at all from the lower floors of the side of the hotel.  We never had any problems with the staff. They were very polite. We went half board and I was extremely impressed with the quality and variety of food. I'm vegetarian and had no problems. At breakfast there was plenty to choose from. Evening meal was lovely. Fresh, tasty soup to start, nice salad bar, great choice of mains…

title: what was all the bad reviews for?......excellent
review: just got back after a seven night stay, half board at this much criticized hotel.holidaymakers must remember this is a 3star typical Spanish hotel and it's reflected in the price you pay, however after reading most reviews you'd be forgiven for not wanting to go......so here's my truth's....  the rooms: large , very , very, clean...bit dated but typical of Spain.maids did a thorough job and i'm fussy about my bathrooms but these were as clean as ive ever stayed in....great value, plenty of room for us and airconditioned  staff: efficient, pleasant.......i wasn't looking to make friends with them , i wanted them to do their jobs and they all did, nothing like the monsters in the reviews.....again no complaints  food: great variety if you looked beyond chips as most Brits seem…

title: STOLEN MONEY AND PHONE WITHIN 3HOURS OF ARRIVAL!!!!!!
review: Arrived at the hotel to find rooms were not available, after a 1 hour wait we then were given our rooms on the second floor. We changed and locked our money in the suitcase and went down to the pool area to find our bearings.  No more then 3 hours later we came back to our rooms to find that someone had been into our room, broke the suitcase and lock and taken all of our money and mobile phone. No sign of any damage to door or balcony, we had locked the door when we left and the room was over looking the pool so not possible that somene came over the balcony bearing in mind this happened in the middle of the day.  Went down to the reception and spoke to the most unhelpful, rudest, unsympathetic, suspicious woman I have ever had the misfortune of speaking to. She started by…

title: Hit & Miss
review: Just had a 7 day stay at the hotel with the family, and will seperate the review into positives and negatives to try and be helpful. Positives: Good locaton, near the square where there are live acts each evening. The pool is a suntrap so you can lounge about all day without worrying about shades.  Kids will love it as the pool is the right size and parents can keep an eye on them.  There is a life guard which is sensible.  Food is actually ok for a 3 star, the traditional dishes are so much better so be experimental.  Service from the reception was pleasant.  The kids entertainer was ok and tried his best.  Negatives: Bad experience on the first day as the hotel had no record of our booking (i would not blame the hotel for this but the travel operator).  Rooms were small for a…

title: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!!!
review: If anyone books to stay in this hotel, then be prepared for a rotten holiday!  By the third or fouth day I couldn't wait to come home. This place is the absolute pits!   We arrived to find our "seaview room" looked ontp a car park- apparently the hotel was "overbooked". The "appartments" are clean, yet extremely small- and supposed to fit four people!  The sunbed situation it utterly ridiculous and I agree with all the previous reviews on the lack of sun beds. The morning scrum was a joke with people queuing up to an hour at the door to get a sunbed, this meant that the beginning of everyday was really chaotic anf not the relaxing holiday desired. People also got into full blown arguments over sunbeds which was pretty unpleasant.   The staff are the rudest I have EVER met. The…

title: Great time had by all!!!!!
review: Just returned from the Jardin de Mar. Had a Fab time. Weather was brilliant, room was basic but very clean. Beds a wee bit uncomfy. Didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment as there are many restaurants just outside. Very close to Square Jardin which was great as the hotel didnt seem to have any evening entertainment whatsoever.  Pool quite small and not nearly enough sunbeds. Sunbed run at 9.00am was something that shouldnt be missed. It was mad! People being knocked over in the stampede. I would Recommend trainers for this as Flipflops are a real danger!!!!!! some people were just mad but if you want a bed, unfortunately it has to be done. Fortunately for me it was my knid husband who took part in the race as i did it once and was quite scared! All in all.... a good value for…

title: dissapointing
review: i stayed here for 2 weeks with my fiance.. at 1st we had paid for pool and sea view and and arrived to realise we wer lookin on2 a roof!! with minimum view of sea. the staff however did move us to a room with fantastic views 3 days later. it is definitly worth stating that you want to see the pool as some appartments are either lookin onto a roof or looking at a stone wall!! out of the 2 weeks we stayed we managed to get seats at the pool only 4 days. the doors open at 9.00 am for the pool but u have to be down queing from half 8 in the morning! ridiculous. then its a stampeed once the doors are opned of adults and kids racing to get beds and at 9.01 am all beds are completely used up. people will put towels on sunbeds and mite not even head down to the pool. so if u dont queue…

title: Lovely time!
review: Me and my Boyfriend stayed here for 5 days in May 2010 to celebrate his birthday. We had a lovely time, and wish we could have stayed for longer. My only tip would be that if you pay with last minute bookings.com.. THEY DON'T TAKE THE PAYMENT, YOU HAVE TO PAY WHEN YOU GET THERE! We found this out the hard way when we had to pay for our room we thought we'd already paid for. Apartments are lovely, we had a lovely view out to sea and of the pool. The location is good, if you walk about 10 minutes down the road you come to a nice beach, although as it was quite out of season there wasn't much sunbathing for us. The food is lovely, there are plenty of nice places to eat. Just make sure you investigate fully on your first day, every day we would find a new part of town with loads of…

title: has its good points as well as bad...............
review: We stayed here for 10 days, booked thru travel republic.  We payed the extra for a sea view but like most of the people who arrived had to argue with reception to get what we'd paid for.  Had to wait till the next morning but was satisfied once moved.  The rooms themselves are adequate in size although beds were a litte on the hard side.  The maids were in 5 out of 7 days like specified.  The reception staff were a little on the unhelpful almost rude side especially the english lady I have to regretfully say.  Unfortunately after speaking to many of the guests there, it came apparent that here had been a break in, in the original room we'd had on the 5th floor, which the guests had put down to an "inside job" and also there was an incident where guests had woken in the night to…

title: Great value for money hotel - enjoyed every minute!
review: Just returned from a week at the Jardin Del Mar and had to write on this website.  After reading reviews on this site I must admit we were a bit apprehensive.  Our room overlooked the fabulous cove and bay, room itself was very clean and the maids kept it that way.  The beds were very comfortable, the kitchen area was adequate and we were provided with a kettle, some cups, sauces, plates, glasses etc and a frying pan!  The air conditioning wasn't the coldest we've ever known but it worked.  We stayed half board and I must admit one of my children is quite a fussy eater, no problems at all.  Breakfast was either cereal, fruit, cheeses and meats, sausage, bacon, eggs etc.  Dinner was varied each evening and included fabulous salads and a wide range of meat/fish/pasta etc.  A…

title: Great place to stay if u love the square
review: i have waited in jardin del mar twice its a great location if u want to go to the square where there is nightly entertainment for all , if you want younger bars there is green hills about a ten minite walk away. jardin del mar is your average run of the mill hotel the nite porter is horrible well one of them any way but the manager is fab so make sure u ask for him the food is awful so dont eat there the apartments are ok.... you have to pay for extra s like toaster or kettle there is no english on telly except for sky news the pool is ok but there is no shallow end , tough there is a small kids pool ..it has become more ran down since the first time i waited there but as things go its ok  dont worry u will enjoy it there is no horrible story s to tell .....altough i did find…

title: clean hotel, great location and an enjoyable stay
review: I stayed at the Jardin Del Mar for one week from june 26th onwards with my husband and daughter and i must say i was very impressed with the overall service at the hotel. In particular the male staff were very helpful at reception desk. My first impression of my room was that it was immaculate but I was sorry I didnt book an apartment/balcony overlooking the pool,alcove and bay as the view I had was of a car park at the rear of a supermarket, some trees and the pathway down to the alcove! Also we only had sun on our balcony for only a few hours in the morning but otherwise i had no other complaints! The pool was a fairly nice size and the alcove was very scenic and a lovely place for a swim but be careful there as it is quite stoney and rocky and you can get a few cuts on your…

title: Nice hotel, but so many issues that could easily be rectified - Do NOT go half board!
review: This is a nice hotel in a fairly quiet area of Mallorca (unlike boozy Magalluf!). However, there are so many issue in the hotel that could easily be sorted out. The hotel and resort are family orientated, and this hotel was particarly popular with families. Most of the guests seemed to be Irish or German, with a few British people in the mix.  We will start with the good points of the hotel: Firstly, the room was very appealling. It was nice and clean, and had a balcony with a lovely view of the sea, and across the bay to the other side.  Also, the cleaners did an excellent job of maintaining the room (and accommodating our need for a lie-in). The room was cleaned nearly every day, irresepective of what time we removed our 'do not disturb' sign (someimtes after 12pm). Reception…

title: good
review: we stayed at the hotel for 10 days and it has to be said that we enjoyed are stay. we got a room on the 3rd floor but ares was bigger than most other ones since ares was situated on the jult of the buliding.we had no problems with the cleaning of the room everday we would have our beds made and fresh towels layed out. the only bone we could pick was that at about 7.30 in the morning you would swear that a stampeed was being let loose through the buliding as people rushed out to reserve there sun lounger.we reported this to the mangement and they said simply if there is no one there just remove there towel and take the sun lounger. the hotel is situated about a 15 min walk from the main beach but there is a little stoney beach beside it but i wouldnt recommend it unless you like…

title: Good value for money apartments
review: Although the Apartments look a little tired from the outside, inside they are just what you would expect from this rating of accomodation.  Booking as an independant traveller saved us at least £300 on tour operator prices and thats with paying for taxis  to & from the airport.  The views from the full seaview rooms are great.   The pool is a lovely size and overlooks the bay.  It is less than a 10 min walk along the side of the shoreline to the main beach.  There are lots of excellent eateries within the area and you are just 2 mins walk away from the Square where entertainment is on every evening.  Tribute bands to Abba, Queen, Westlife, Platters and other entertainers, check the huge board at the way into the square.   When we were there the accomodation was quite at night…

title: If you can - get a suite!!
review: We had to walk in and ask for any vacancies after some greif with the other hotel we had booked and were told that we could get a suite for 65 euros a night.  Sold!!!! We had a massive (MASSIVE) balcony on the top floor, overlooking a small quiet cove and the rest of the Santa Ponsa bay - I've certainly had worse views. Any of the staff we met while we were there were polite and friendly and although we did have to ask at reception for a change of towels one day - they were delivered immediately to the room. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would go back for a break to the sun.

title: Poor
review: Not to be recommended. The (female) desk staff were cool to the point of being rude. Basic items like toasters and microwaves had to be rented. The noise from a football supporters convention went undealt with. The only plus is the location. 5 minutes from centre.

title: SUPERB VALUE, GREAT LOCATION
review: absolutely great value , apertment was spacious and well equipped, though balcony faced onto trees and therefore gave no views and only had sun in mornings !!staff were both friendly and helpful and the pool area was superb, though the lifeguards were a bit ott with safety towards bathers !! we went to santa ponsa for the celtic supporters convention and the hotel was ideally located for the square which was only 3 minutes walk away , so not so far to stagger home !!!  despite the hotel having lots of fellow celtic supporters who were returning at all hours throughout the night we were not disturbed or woken - a truly great value hotel and we would not hesitate in booking here again !!!!

title: no complaints
review: clean,basic but everything at hand in the room.good service at the desk and the standard across the hotel was very good,pool,beds etc.would deffo reccommend the hotel,its very well situated,giving good access to the square and a few mins from the main front beach.

title: Rooms basic but clean, sea views amazing!!
review: Stayed at the Jardin Del Mar 19th May 2010 for one week. I honestly can't understand why anyone complains about this hotel, ok rooms are basic but they're clean and staff were always very pleasant. We had no problems getting a sunbed at the pool no matter what time it was. We went self-catering so can't comment on the food but this hotel is ideally situated with plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Try the california (above the supermarket) for breakfast, we had a lovely indian meal in Khaans and the food in the mexican restaurant, Amigos, was to die for (They had a special from 7-8pm for €9.95 per person). We also came to this hotel in April 2009 and had a side sea view room so this year we paid extra for sea view and this is well worth it,  views across the…

title: amazing view
review: this really is a no frill place, but great location. The hotel doesn't have much of a beach but if you take a 5min walk, you are at the public beach. Beautiful setting and Mallorca is an awesome island. If you can rent a car to discover the rest of the island do so.....

title: Fantastic Hotel!! Very Good Value For Money
review: Ive stayed at the hotel four times over the past year an a half. It is a fantasic hotel if you get it when it is low in prices. I wouldnt pay over £200 pound for stay as it is basic, but i always look and book it when its cheap you can get a weeks holiday for £55 pound per person plus book cheap flights with ryan air, easy jet. For £55 pound for 6 Nights it is a bargain!! It is in the middle of loads of shops, bars, pubs, resturants.  The is a supermarket right outside the hotel we stayed self catering which it is why it was so cheap, the kitchen is small but fine for cooking, the room is standard room but very clean. I would advise anybody to go it really is a great holiday in a fantastic location, very friendly and i will be going  again on different times in the year.

title: Good value holiday
review: We stayed at the hotel in the middle of April.  Booked through travelrepublic, paid about £120 each for half board paying the extra for the sea view room - hugely reccomend this. Hotel has 6 floors in a u shape with the bulk of rooms facing out to the sea.  Flight was early morning so arrived to hotel mid morning with hotel ready at 2pm which we were fine with as this is the norm.  Left luggage at hotel and explored.  Rooms - We paid about £30 extra for a sea view room - I point out there are lots of palm trees around the hotel which means though our room was in theory a sea view room on the 2nd floor we could only see snipppets through the leaves of the trees, ask for a higher room.  Rooms themselves very spacious with tele, fridge and small kitchen area.  Beds are comfy…

title: Basic but good value and location
review: We stayed for 6 days and had a great time even though the weather was awful! The worst weather in 20 yrs we was told. The hotel was good the rooms are great and ask for a high floor its good views and quiet. Well worth paying the extra for sea view. The only thing was its self catering rooms and you dont get a toaster or kettle you have to rent these which we didnt like. The gym is also rubbish everything was broken when I say everything I mean all 4 machines so not a great gym. The pool looks nice but we didnt use this due to the weather shame. Defo a nice enough basic hotel though.

title: OKAY FOR TWO PEOPLE-REALLY CRAMPED FOR 3 OR 4
review: Hi - stayed here with large hen party of 28 at end of April. We all had apts to sleep 4 however, this consisted of 1 large bedroom, a sofa bed which creaked every time you moved and a camp bed which most people ended up putting the mattress on the floor. Hotel clean and pool area lovely-plenty or room-pool bar just opening up. Hotel located at top of hill approx 15 min walk to centre of santa ponsa but not too bad of a hill. Supermarket just beside hotel on the right and some good restaurants beside it. Surprised at price of food in Santa Ponsa-v reasonable-10Euro roughly for 3 course meal. Mrs Murphy's kitchen excellent for dinner and very fast service, the glasgow for breakfast(4euro for large fry). There is a beautiful steakhouse on the other side of the bay(not sure of name…

title: fine for a cheap week away
review: We stayed here for a week and got a good price last minute.  Santa Ponsa is not a place I would rush to go back to, but the beach is lovely and there are a lot of bars and resturants all serving usual holiday grub.  There is a small cove at the back of the hotel which is lovely for swimming in, although the beach there is quite rocky.  I also enjoyed the hotel pool, which was almost as cold as the sea! Forget the gym and sauna, though - I never saw these open and the indoor pool was locked most of the time too.     The hotel is clean, the apartments are sizable, although the kitchens are small, but we were half board so never used the kitchen. The beds are the usual two singles pushed together and weren't the most comfortable.  We requested a sea veiw which is worth paying extra…

title: Superb value for Money
review: Just back and could not recomend higher.Santa Ponsa is beautiful resort with nice mix of Spanish Irish English Scandinavian....... tourists.We booked through Alpha rooms (inc the transfers) and they were also excellent. Buffet breakfast 1st class only problem was ages to boil a kettle !!!!!! but might be shortage of sun loungers in high season (nb take lilo as quite hard). Restaurants a bit dissapointing and seem to all sell nothing but pizza - thought I was on the Amalfi coast  !!!!! but would recomend Manolos(great garlic soup) Sebastians(3 course pork loin deal exc value) and The Royal Garden(?) big one on the corner for mixed grill.Arkles opposite for pint of larger at 1.5 eu and next door for pre dinner drink. Will def be going back in autumn(when prices are cheaper again)…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: I visited Jardin Del Mar last year with 7 other guys. We were there to enjoy ourself and were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel. It's fantastic value and we never had any problems with service. We even tried the buffet one night, great selection, good quality. In my opinion its one of the best locations in Santa Ponsa, unbelievable views of the beach and bay, yet it is far enough away to not feel like you're in the middle of everything. About a ten minute walk from beach and the main restaurants and bars. Rooms are a good size and can comfortably fit up to 3 adults. Recommended for adults who want to relax or go out and families alike, and we had great fun with the poolside entertainment - waterpolo etc. Definitely worth a look

title: Hotel not quite up to 3 stars
review: We stayed in this hotel back in 2004, so we booked a 12 night stay in April,through Travel Republic. We already knew this Hotel has a great location and I paid around £10 extra for a room witha sea view,which was great, overlooking Santa Pomsa Bay. But sadly this Hotel has gone down hill since our last stay.The hotel advertises safe deposit boxes in the rooms,(which they were on our last visit), but not any more, they are now in front of the reception. After paying around  30 euros, plus deposit, I realised that I could not get any thing more than documents in the safe, it was not large enough for cameras, etc. So after pointing this out to reception, they offered me a larger one, AT TWICE THE PRICE!...After a heated disscussion and arguing that the safes were supposed to be in…

title: Fantastic value for money
review: Booked a cheap deal through travel republic and requested highest floor. We also booked sea view and half board. Room was not ready when we arrived but that was not a problem as there are good bars nearby. When we got into our room after waiting only an hour, we were on the sixth floor (only seven floors in hotel), the room was spotless and the view was wonderful. Regular maid service and linen change in the one week we were there. Piping hot shower any time of day. Kitchen area small but adequate. Evening meals were very good, huge salad bar, spanish and english main courses and lovely dessert bar. There was plenty of choice and quantity and was very well cooked, cannot comment on breakfast as we were too lazy to get up and go down for it! The location is excellent with bars,…

title: if u like mice u will like this hotel
review: The pool and views are lovely and the hotel location is excellent . Easy access to Palma Nova by bus or taxi . However we had very little sleep during our stay as the ground floor aptmt we were in was invaded by mice - kept us awake all night - We complained to reception who promised to put a trap down but nothing was done - glad we only stayed 5 nights . We also had an ants nest which was ignored 2 ( feel sorry for the next lot of holidaymakers who get our room). Even though we had clean towels every other day thats all that was done - rooms werent swept , bathroom not cleaned once and we found mouse droppings everywhere which we swept up ourselves.However  we did enjoy our break but dreaded bedtime !!!!

title: would go back tomorrow
review: I spent a week at this hotel just after easter, with my 2 sons, 18 and 21. We only booked a side sea view room, but were really pleasantly suprised with our view, and enjoyed breakfast on our balcony in the sunshine most mornings. Also, could hear the waves lapping on the little cove at night. Our room was cleaned, towels and sheets changed etc 5 days of the 7 - and further to an earlier review, we weren't up and out till around 11 or 12 most mornings - I left the sign on the door asking for the room to be cleaned and it was, every time. The apartment was clean and comfortable, and I found the kitchen facilities perfectly adequate - I do not go on holiday to cook, so we only used it for snacks and cups of tea and coffee. The bathroom was lovely, with the best shower I have ever…

title: Excellent Value
review: Stayed here in April 2010, booked through travel republic £120:00 for a week. It is 3 star and thats what you get, very clean, reception helpful and the rooms nice with their own seperate bedroom, would recommend you book a room with a sea view, cost an extra £5 per week. Very good value for money, did not eat or drink in the hotel went next door to the supermarket bottle of beer 60p, bottle of wine 1 euro.

title: lovely views clean hotel grumpy staff
review: Arrived 10.30 at night was given room quickly not the floor we asked for, but on inspection of our room we had a lovely view off the sea even though we were on ground floor, we were also near the pool which was nice. Room was very clean and roomy with very comfortable beds and air con if you needed it we used it for the warm air because it could get bit nippy on a night, we also had it cleaned for the 2 days we were their and beds made they did a lovely job.  We went half board food wasnt up to much in my opinion not much choice by the second night we decided to eat out as the night before we were shown to a table and was told by the staff this is your table you must sit here was very stern with us. The indoor pool looked lovely but didnt use as so did the outdoor plenty off…

title: Great location - great relaxation!
review: Stayed at the Hotel Jardin del Mar at the beginning of April for a week with my daughter - a pre A-levels chill out.  We needed a comfortable hotel close to amenities that was quiet and relaxing.  We were not disappointed.  We pre-booked a full sea view and this seemed to get us an entirely different apartment than those advertised.  Lovely room layout with a huge L-shaped balcony, with table, chairs and two sun loungers - well worth it.  But the view alone was worth the little extra money - right across Santa Ponsa bay, catching the early morning sun right the way through to the beautiful Majorcan sunset over the Mediterrean.  Amazing!  Hotel and pool facilities top end of three star.  We ate out so only needed to boil kettle in room - very basic facilities as stated but suited…

title: brilliant views
review: we stayed at the jardin del mar for 4 nights from the 28th march.on arrival the rooms were not ready and told to come back an hour and a half later .on getting our room we were put on the 7th floor with sea view.the sea view was excellent .we were half board and found the drinks expensive .overall the appartment was excellent.may i point out the door to the room had a little spy hole to look and see who was outside your room.please note anyone could look in your room as the spyhole let people look in.that was the only fault with the hotel.it is quite a walk to the beach .personally i would go back but without the children .

title: A week at Jardin del Mar
review: Have just returned from a weeks stay at the Jardin Del Mar. First the bad points. If you have booked a side sea view forget it you wont get one. We were put on floor 0 which is four floors below street level and the only view we had was of a 60 feet high hedge. We had a small like stream that ran from the hills at the back of our room and I should imagine in the heat this could be a bit smelly, because it smelt in April. If you can afford to upgrade to a sea view then do it because if you are on floor 0 and you were thinking of sitiing outside in the sun forget it because of the hedge you get no sunlight at all. if you are self catering which we were, then you will struggle to do any cooking,, you only have two electric rings. I suggest you take a travel kettle as it takes ages…

title: Great value, excellent views
review: Visited off peak and there was not a lot open. Spent almost every night in Hogan stand (owner very friendly and couldnt be more helpful/pleasant. After this went to the Auld Triangle just up the road from the Hotel, Great live music and well worth spending an evening in.  The hotel is great provided you get a room with a seaview. Waking up and overlooking the bay was excellent. Rooms are small-ish and basic but they are clean. Very friendly staff and cant believe some of the bad reviews. Really nice hotel not far from the main street but far enough away that you can sleep well. Indoor pool great for offseason breaks but in april it was 16-18 degrees on average with nice sunshine, although nippy in the evenings.   For great food try La Solana (directly across from hotel) and also…

title: you get what you pay for
review: I would not go back here, especially not out of season, spent a fortune eating out, meals out on average 7 euros each for a bar meal, drinks around 2.50 -3 euros for beer (which was cheaper than hotel bar) .Burlington Berties was a nice freindly bar down the road with a room for kids with plenty of entertainment and toys for little ones, cost 1 euro per child.  Breakfast in hotel ok but just typical spanish hotel breakfasts. No playground for our daughter, it was packed away for the winter but there is one close by.Indoor pool ok but no shallow end for little ones. Not much in way of hotel entertainment and no kids club. Staff friendly except reception staff . Beds not made three days out of seven. Luckily we hired a car so saw a lot of the island. We found all other resorts…

title: good value holiday
review: We went Feb half term 2010 because it was dead cheap for hotel. Researched area and weather forcast so we knew it would not be hot and Santa Ponsa is very much a tourist resort. The hotel is excellent, all staff friendly and very helpful, clean and facilities very good. Indoor pool for off peak seasons. Restaurant buffett style good for evening meal. There is a nice little restuarant across the road which we ate in. We went self catering but this was bit of a struggle (1 adult, 3 child) with only a two ring elec, large pan, small pan and tiny frying pan. Managed pasta and meatballs, fried eggs and bits, but ate out the rest of the time. Supermarket just outside was ok. Off peak season there were very few places open, however would not like to go peak season as I can imagine it…

title: stay very clear uve been warned
review: had money stolen after using the safes at front desk left 70 euros had them stolen via the cleaners told management and there english suddenly becomes very little not much entertainment pool is nice staff a little rude a little out of the way u defo need a car unless u loveto walk a lot rooms are very  very small be warned avoid at all costs

title: Excellent value for money
review: Very easy place to stay.  Clean, enough space, reasonable furnishings - I think exceptional for the cost.  Quite impersonal, but staff are very helpful when you request anything; we wanted to change our room because a tree outside blocked the view (but might give nice shade at warmer times) and this was easily sorted out.  It was unusually cold during our visit but the aircon could also be used as a heater. On the negative side; 1) the self-catering is limited with no oven or microwave, just two small electric rings you cannot cook much, 2) alongside that the quality of restaurants etc in the vicinity was poor (we did not actually try the hotel itself so cannot comment), but quite a lot of restaurants were closed and due to open in March.  How many times can you eat steak with…

title: Great value for money in Febuary
review: After seeing the reviews on tripadvisor my wife and I booked with some hesitation however we found the hotel offered exceptional value when booked via tripadvisor on a half board basis. It is well worth having a full sea view room. At this time of the year the local tourist office even offered free coach trips to many beautiful parts of the island.It may be hell in the summer but excellent off season.

title: Terrible hotel for old people
review: In hotel stuff is terrible and very rude. There is no sound isolation, so after 9p.m. we had to wisper or they would call police and throw us out of the hotel. We didn't knew it in first day, so they almoust lost their voice by yelling on us and didn't listen what we have to say. If we moved chair from the table old people came to us and yelled - why are we moving furniture (even if you moved it only once). They spoiled our vacation ir first day. If you are young and want to have fun, don't stay in this hotel!  By the way there is very expensive internet.

title: Staying in TRH Jardin Del Mar was absolutely fantastic
review: Staying in TRH Jardin Del Mar was absolutely fantastic. We enjoyed it very much. The rooms are lovely, the view is wonderful and the location is excellent. We really enjoyed every minute of it. We booked it in Last minute travel web site for a fair price and were happy to discover it was a good choice we made. We highly recommend it!

title: Value for money
review: We have stayed in Jardin in beginning of October.   Minuses :   - ants in the room   Pluses :  - price was quiet small - great swimming pool  - nice breakfast with lot of choice  We spend there a wonderful moments , but above all I recommend this Hotel especially for people who rent a car.

title: Ideal holiday get away
review: I have just returned from 2 week in the Jardin Del Mar and had a beautiful time. Yes the rooms in the hotel were small but we were prepared for this and coped very well, there were three adults staying in the apartment and after putting the coffee table on the balcony everything was fine. The hotel was very clean and the pool area was gorgeous and very relaxing. Our rooms were cleaned approximately every second day as was our towels, beds were changed about every five days which was fine. We were very convenient to The Square and within a lovely walk from the town Centre. All the staff we met were very pleasant and helpful. We had a wonderful time and could not find any fault with the hotel except the absence of a toaster!!!

title: Awesome views, fantastic sunsets
review: This was our fourth time to santa ponsa this year and it just keeps getting better.

title: Brilliant value, clean, great pool and beautiful view
review: My boyfriend and I stayed at the TRH Jardin del Mar between 1st - 8th October, we paid £140 for 7 nights  self catering via LowCostHolidays.com - we were very pleased with our accomodation!!!!  Would recommend to any couple or family!!!  Room on 6th floor  - Lovely view of pool and gorgeous panoramic view of Santa Ponsa bay from balcony.  Seperate bedroom, kitchen with fridge and hob, bathroom with shower over bath.  The maid visited 5/7 days, made bed, brushed and mopped floors, bed linen was changed on day 4 and towels changed regularly.   The pool was great! Very big compared to nearby hotel pools.  Very deep but with a designated shallow end for young children  The pool/poolside were spotlessly clean,  and there were plenty sunbeds for everyone, no 9am dash!  Poolside bar…

title: Great Holiday
review: We have just come back from a great holiday at the TRH Jardin Del Mar.  We had a self-catering apartment on the 3rd floor (room 312) which had a great view of the pool and the sea. The apartment was exceptionally clean and the hotel is in a great location. OK, the staff aren't the most friendly that we've ever met but they were at least efficient :) For the money, it's great value in a lovely location. If you go in high season maybe you get a different experience but in October it was great.

title: Brilliant holiday!
review: This holiday was by far the best I've ever had! The view from our room was amazing despite the fact it was quite a small room. The pool was brilliant and a very good size compared to other hotels. There was also a small sea-water cove just down a flight of stairs from the pool which was beautiful. It is well worth paying extra for a sea view as it is spectacular and try to get a room on the highest floor possible for an even better view. The location is great as it was right across the street from a variety of shops which have friendly English-speaking staff and have everything you could possibly need. There are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby as the strip is only a 5 minute walk up the street. In particular La Solana was our favourite restaurant. It had a great menu with…

title: Excellent location, hotel okay!
review: Just back, great hotel in terms of location and worth paying extra for the sea view which is amazing.  Hotel staff okay, however room wasnt very clean when we arrived and got worse as the maid service is practically nil.  The room is a bit shabby and small, there was a burn on the sofa, not that youd want to sit on it anyway as was very dirty.  We were there for 6 nights and the sheets werent changed at all, and the towels changed once.  Maid literally made the bed and didnt even sweep or mop the floor.  Sunbed situation is a joke, but we werent too bothered.  All in all this hotel is okay but could be so much better with a bit TLC.

title: Great resort and clean but basic hotel
review: Santa Ponsa really is wonderful, stunning beach.  We would have preffered the hotel to be situated closer to the beach more in the main area rather than a good 10 15 minute walk to the hotel  Although it was situated right by the square and restuarants and super market, there was more going on down by the beach.  We picked the best week to go with big fiesta and carnival really wonderful experience.  My two yr old and 5 yr old had an amazing holiday.  The hotel is very clean but we never ate there once so cant comment on food.  The pool was great one small one for kids and the larger for us adults, we always went the beach in the morning and when we got to hotel after 2pm we always managed to get one or 2 sunbeds.  We found majorca very expensive and spent 1100 euros in one week…

title: we enjoyed our holiday and would go there again
review: Although the rooms were pritty basic, they were clean and had most things you could need except a hair dryer or a propper pan as 2 nights out of the week we decided 2 have tea in the apartment but there was only 2 frying pans in the very small kitchen.  The rooms got cleaned every 3 days.  We were on the ground floor which was right next 2 the pool which was perfect for us with 2 children aged 9 and 11. The hotel had mainly english and irish staying there and a few dutch familys which made sure there presents was felt. the only problems we had was 1 of our towels got stolen off our balcony and the walls were very thin any the people in the room next door was quite noisy.  The pool was smaller than we expected and was over 8 foot deep at the deep end, most of the pool was about…

title: Good hotel, perfect location
review: Had an absolutely fantastic holiday in santa ponsa. Although would only give hotel 3/4 star, i would give santa ponsa itself a clear 5/5. The best part of the hotel easily was the location. within a 50metre walk from the front door of the hotel, you had access to several shops, a supermarket, taxi's, a bus stop, and the start of the chain of shops. Immediate impression was very good, as had read alot of bad reviews about the hotel, so wasnt expecting much, but was very pleasently suprised. We stayed on a self catering basic so cannot rate the food.room was basic (fridge, 2 hobs, kettle) and i have to say quite dirty, although this is one of very few complaints. only other complaints would be staff not over friendly and not great english but then my spanish isnt too great either,…

title: Not a bad hotel...but just a few warnings!!!!
review: I stayed at this hotel in middle of August, 8 girls altogether. First impression of hotel was great, big welcoming reception, friendly staff.  The apartments are basic but well equipped. Nothing more, nor nothing less than we'd expected, although the view from our balcony was of a tree which wasnt pleasent but sure we didnt go there for the view!!!  The view from the pool however was fantastic. The pool was alot smaller than we;d thought from looking at the pictures but sure it wasnt an olympic sized pool we were looking for anyway so it done us just perfect to cool down in and have a wee swim. Mainly a family hotel with alot of kids. We were a young group celebrating a 30th but were prob the only ones there without kids but we didnt complain as we didnt mind. Now for the sun…

title: worst hotel and customer service that i have ever experienced.
review: Arrived at hotel to be told that our room wasnt ready and to come back in about 2 hours which was the last thing that we wanted to hear after travelling. Had to wait about 10 minutes for the lift as there wasonly one working. When we eventually got to our room we were very disappointed with what we got for the price we paid. although it was clean when arrived it definitely wasnt what we expected and didnt even come close to the pictures that we shown on the internet. Beds were very very uncomfortable and sheets were only changed once for the whole week that we were there. On the fourth day of our stay we arrived home from the beach to discover that somebody had come into our room and stolen some of our personal belongings and gifts that we had bought for family. Lets just say…

title: wouldnt hurt to smile
review: I stayed at these apartments for a week with my family, and staying at these apartments essentially ruined our whole holiday.  On the second night we were greeted at our door by the extremely rude and unpleasant security guard who told us "no drinking on the balcony after 12" and "no noise on the balcony after 12" which would be understandable if any noise was being made... but there wasnt a sound.  After a long and heated discussion.. he decided that because we were a family this was "not a problem".  However, just the next night, while standing on our two separate balconies- the security guard as if to shoo us back into our rooms, was looking up at us in disgust.  True to form he came up to the 7th floor in an instance and buzzed a room with a 5year old son, who hadnt even…

title: Word of advice before you book, dont!
review: i read a number of reviews on this hotel and was a bit weary, however like everything else i thought that everyone has their own experiences, and we definately did! let me just say the location was brilliant, it is in the middle of shops restaurants and right beside the square complex! its about 10 mins away from the beach but its a nice walk. the rooms and general hotel areas are basic but clean and nice. there are fantastic views over santa ponsa bay, HOWEVER you are not allowed to step onto your balcony, which you have paid for after 12 midnight, well thats the case according to the ignorant security guard. he told us on our second night to get off our balcony on the top floor because he thought we were young people and feared for our safety, fair enough. but then he was…

title: zoo..
review: Nothing wrong with the hotel..But if you're couple stay far away..It's like a playground.Santa ponsa is really terrible place same as magaluf. better to try to find something in Palma.. It's wonderful city .definately Kyklades Greece next year........................ps .if you go there.try to rent a car or bike.. really hard to find nice beach..

title: fantastic hotel
review: after reading some horror stories about this hotel we were pleasantly suprised to find how good this hotel was . The staff were helpful , food good , hotel very clean . room was good and spacious but you must ask for rooms ending in 5 . really good location next to the fabulous square .

title: sun sun and more sun
review: just returned from a fantasti holiday in jardin del mar hotel great location crntral to restaurants supermarket and shops and nightlife not sad enough to rush for a sun lounger spent the days on a sandy cool and beautiful beach  only 10 min walk along coast  ate out every nite fantastic value and food super rec sebastians or pepperpot 9;99 euro for 3 course dinner kids meals 5euros rooms clean and maid service excellent   kitchen small but didnt go on hols to cook very family orientated  my son had a great week made loads of new frinds the teenagers partied until dawn would recommend nite life   spanish squqre excellent 2 mins from hotel tribute band on nighlly  no cheesy hotel entertaiment  no reps to guide us this year as we booked independently much cheaper   all in all would…

title: Clean, affordable - but try getting a sunbed at the pool!!
review: We are just back from 10 days in sunny majorca. We booked this last minute and were a bit worried about what to expect.  However we were pleasantly surprised!  The apartment, though compact, was clean and suited us just fine.  The apartment was cleaned everyday (except for Thursday and Sunday)andclean towels provided every day.  Our only disappointment was the promised "sea view" - yes there was one if you stood on tip toes on the balcony, otherwise we were looking at brick wall!  You will be entertained by the early morning scrum for sunbeds.  There are signs stating that sunbeds around the pool cannot be reserved, however as we discovered on day one, a queue forms from around 8.30 onwards at the doors to the poolside and as soon as these are opened all hell breaks loose - we…

title: We had a good holiday - Hotel better than expected, great location
review: Spent 8 days in July at Jardin Del Mar with my wife and teenage daughter. Our room was facing the pool with a sea view an the 2nd floor. ( Best sea view rooms are on the 3rd floor and above due to palm trees obstructing some of the view) I would recommend a sea view at an addition cost as it is well worth it to get a fantastic view across the bay of Santa Ponsa. Our room was clean and tidy with a large modern bathroom. The kitchen is tiny about 1.8m x 1.8m and has no oven. the living room has a pull down bed leading to the balcony. The main bedroom was large with nice fittings. The air conditioning in the our appartment was great and if turned up to high we were cold even when it was 95' outside. Being half board we used the restarant every day and found it to be very good with…

title: great location -value for money
review: We have just returned 14 july for 7 nights great location,view,hotel clean and rooms of standard you would expect for 3 star if you have children in push chairs it is bit of a trek to beech,otherwise it is 10 min wal;k on bumpy ground very limited cooking facilities ,you can hire a toaster !  reception is a bit hit and miss i.e they could not find our booking when we arrived and acted like it was out fault,but were helpful on other issues  only downside is 9am 'stampede' for towels is hilarious,one morning I got up with my running shoes on and challenged all the 'sadows' for a race for the best beds with my family and friends cheering from the balconies  I won the race and cheered as I gasped on my bed,only to suffer the glares from 'losers' There are plenty of beds if the hotel…

title: I would no recommend it
review: After staying for 2 weeks in the hotel, I want to mention that the place can be over-crowded, not enough sun beds and the outside swimming pool is too small for the hotel. You can smell the drains, if you are lucky to get a sun bed. There was a queue at 9am to put your towel. My sheets were not changed after the 1st week, so I had mention it at the reception and was told by an old receptionist to wait for the cleaner next morning (as if there is nothing better to do on hols.) The hotel is 20-25 min walk to the beach which can be called steep. Some neighbors from Ireland would come back at 6am after clubbing and blast their music on full volume for hours, but the hotel stuff wouldn’t interfere. Some rooms only have 3 foot tiny baths. The gym, sauna advertised by Travel Republic…

title: Great value for money
review: Just returned from 5 days at the Jardin Del Mar, staying with 2 friends self catering.  The hotel is clean and the rooms comfortable, but these things pale in to comparision to the fantastic sea views from the balcony!  The Jardin Del Mar is well sitatued, far enough from the resort centre but with plenty of bars and resturants within easy walking distance.  There is also easy access to the sea round the side of the hotel (although would suggest this was mainly for adults).  The pool and sunbeds area is clean and spacious although the morning dash (9am) for sunbeds is unreal....people running for beds and reserving them before going back to bed.  We even made a point of getting up early to watch the people running as it was so funny, it must be even better in the hight of…

title: Meooow
review: Stayed in this hotel with my friends for just 5 days was asked on about three occasions to leave the hotel and to stay in Magaluf, we got blamed for making noise once again on numerous occasions when it wasnt even us causing the rucus it was our neighbours below us!!!!!! The cleaners obviuosly wer'nt doing their jobs correctly as we had ants one evening when we got home all over our kitchen work surface..  Our toilet repeatedly made a stupid squeaking noise everytime it flushed so we could not flush the toilet after about ten pm as it was unfair on the neighbours.. the blonde receptionist with a brittish accent was nothing but rude and extremely unfriendly, we were not surprized when one evening when we went in to pick up our keys she flung them at us, with not so much as even a…

title: Fantastic holiday
review: Just returned from a week in Jardin Del Mar booked through Barrhead Travel. We picked this hotel because it is only 2 minutes walk from the children's entertainment at The Square and there would be no need to queu for a taxi home. It was ideal although near the square it was quiet and peaceful.  The children's entertainer was excellent and she encouraged all the children to get on stage and join in. The hotel was great, stayed half board and there was plenty of choice at meal times. Waiters and waitresses were very friendly, we did not have much need to speak with reception staff.  Rooms were cleaned every day but one. Will be returning soon.

title: A Great Holiday
review: Stayed at the Jardin del Mar for 1 week in June, we booked self catering but upgraded to half board when we arrived, only cost 14 Euro per person per day. The hotel is very nice, clean and comfortable, we didn't realise but you have to hang a reminder on the outside door handle of your door if you require the room cleaned. Great sea views, the food was good all week with plenty of variety. Safes are 21 euros with 4 returned with the key. Bit of a walk down to the beach, approx 20 mins and fairly steep coming back. Lots of bars and eating places nearby, best place for drinks is The Crown in the square and Mark makes you most welcome, six plasma screens for all your sports.

title: Grumpity Grumpity Groo!
review: I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff were as unfriendly and rude as I found them to be at the Jardin del Mar. Upon arrival we were greeted with a 'What the hell do you want' demeanour, as if we were uninvited intruders upsetting their daily routine. No please or thank yous or so much as a smile during our entire stay.   One night we returned to the hotel and we were asked for our room numbers. The man at the desk took down the time and I simply asked why he had done so. 'Evidence!' he snapped. Another night we returned to the hotel and one of my friends burst out laughing upon hearing a joke. 'Shhhhhh!' the man at the front desk scolded loudly, a look of utter contempt on his face. If we were being too loud (which we were not, my friend merely laughed as we made our…

title: Great location and value, forget bad review´s
review: We (my wife and I and our 6 year old son) just spend 17 lovely days at the Jardin del Mar. Forget the bad reviews. Friendly and helpful reception and cleaningstaff. Basic but clean appartments, o.k. for 2 adults and one child. Location is perfect with a wonderful view from the balconies. Only negative thing: the Balcony table is much to small (We bought our self a 20 Euro plastic table for the balcony in "Carrefour" in Palma - great supermarket). Pool area is great, but must be hell in the main season. british and german guests cant read the "Do not reserve sunbeds with towels" signs. All in all this place is great value for money. For breakfast and or lunch etc. go across the street to "Arkles". Best breakfast and burgers in town. Simon and his crew are just great. Peter H.…

title: Great Apartments, pity about the reception staff
review: Apartments are clean and location is great but the reception staff let the entire holiday down. They were rude and obnoxious, barely raising their heads to salute you when you needed something. Santa Ponsa itself was very very quiet with most of the bars fairly empty. Food was good- I'd recommend Manolos or Pergoda up near the hotel and stay away from Tony's on the beach. Good holiday but very little to do. Will defintely not be going back there again. Dirty Nellies is a good spot for a bit of life.

title: Brilliant hotel to stay out of season
review: We stayed for 10 days at this hotel on a room only basis and had a brilliant time.  The rooms are spacious with good air conditioning.  We had a room on the ground floor which at first were disappointed with but it turned out to be the best floor to be on as that was the best access to the swimming pool.  The pool area does not open until 9am in the morning so stops people coming down early to put towels on sun loungers and walk away.  The pool was great with a seperate area for kids.  We did not eat in the hotel restaurnat nor drink at the bar but the service and drinks at the pool bar were great and reasonable prices.  ubs to look out for are the watering hole at the other end of the beach which is also good for lunches and snacks and you must go to The Gormet Burger Restaurnt…

title: Nice Hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel for 12 nights with my mum. Hotel itself was clean and nice pool area. Was a little noisy at nights it didn't bother us was just because the walls were quite thin.  It was a good bit to the main bars and the beach however it also didn't bother us, the square was just accross the road and was entertainment there every night. We would go to this hotel again but would take a toster with us as had to hire one.

title: Lovley place
review: Stayed here for two weeks,hotel nice very peaceful.Lovley view from your balcony.Have to say when we got there and said we had payed for sea view we were given a side sea room,which was just facing the wall of hotel nextdoor.My husband went straight back down to reception and showed our booking form again which said sea view not side sea view and we were moved onto the top floor straight away it was lovley.Have to say found staff at reception very nice and the ladies who clean the rooms very pleasant, we gave ours a tip which she appreciated very much.Some nice places to eat and bars to have a drink in around this area,hopefully will go back to this hotel in september.

title: good value for what you pay
review: stayed here for 10 days,for what we payed found to be good value.rooms are basic but have air conditioning and are clean,clean towels etc every day.contrary to other reviews i found staff very helpful.down side if you are not a swimmer the pool is very deep and i would think it would be very noisy peak season,also the lifts kept breaking down.overall you only get what you pay for so dont expect 5 star

title: Nice place, great location for square
review: There were five of us age range 14-64 on this trip, and we all enjoyed our stay. The hotel was nice generally clean, and food very good. We found the pool area too small for size of hotel and you had to be up early for a bed. It could be very noisy at night, and on one night there was a fight in one of the rooms above us, and a chair was thrown over the balcony along with someones clothes.  Location for the square was great and we went there most nights. The beach was a good walk away. Santa Ponsa is a nice family orientated place.

title: Jardin Del Mar
review: Just back from a week staying at this hotel.  Have stayed in Santa Ponsa last year and decided to return this year as its cheap to fly to and stay in.  The hotel is clean, basic and serves all we needed it to. Stayed on a self catering basis. Were checked in quick and efficiently. Rooms of decent size for 2 people, pay extra for a sea view otherwise you get a terrible room!  Towels changed daily.  Reception staff not the happiest but neither am I when I am at work, they do their job.  Can't comment on hotel food as didn't eat there, but hotel was overall great for what we paid for. Would definitely return.

title: Great Hotel in Beautiful Location
review: I stayed in the Jardin Del Mar last summer (July) with my girlfriend. We're both in our early/mid 20's.  We had a great time and found the hotel to be perfect for our needs. We didn't pay top dollar so we didn't expect five star luxury so I think if your realisitic about what to expect it'll suit you fine. I did request a sea view but on arrival this didn't materialise, however the room we did get was small but well maintained and kept very clean, the middle-aged spanish cleaner was a bit of a character!  I think the vast majority of people in the hotel were families, and not just parents with kids! It seemed like whole families were there, this meant the atmosphere in the hotel was good but I got sent out at 8am every morning by my girlfriend to try and get a sunbed in a decent…

title: amazing views and very relaxing
review: stayed here for a week end of april.  went with husband and toddler and 3 others.  ew requested rooms next door and they couldnt do this.  they were actually 3 floors below and on other side of hotel.  found the man on reception very very rude.  on the bright side the room was lovely and we had amazing views of the ocean.  we found the rooms about right size for three of us. great having the separate room as we used to put cot into sitting room at night but left bedroom door open.  only english speaking channels were Sky News, CNN and Eurosport which is fine if your going out at night but a bit boring if your sitting in with a toddler every night!  the beds were made daily except two but floors never swept.  very quiet around the pool but the holiday season hadnt' yet started. …

title: Nice hotel, miserable staff.
review: Just returned from a weeks holiday at this hotel and,overall, it was very good,however, the staff are so miserable. I don't think they like the Brits or maybe it was just my imagination. The hotel is in a nice spot overlooking Santa Ponsa bay.We booked a sea view which was lovely. Rooms were adequate but I felt that they could have been swept more. We had dust and fluff all over the place. The beds are terrible and everyone was complaining about them. We were all inclusive and had no complaints about the food. It was the usual buffet style so there was always something to eat, even for a picky eater like myself. Watch out for the older waiter on the resturaunt door, he was trying to charge people for their last meal before they left. Our last meal was a lunch and he tried to…

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Enjoyed our week stay at the hotel. Very clean , and apartments were more than basic and enough to keep us through the week. We paid for a sea view and thats what we got.  Did not have any problems with the staff, infact, found them very helpful - and they DID smile!!    We were there out of season (April) so not many bars/restaurants open. Must try El Ceibo for a good meal, but you need to book as its the most popular restaurant in town.  Although Santa Ponsa was a little quiet its worth the 10 euros in a cab to nearby Magaluf.  Mactavishes was good place for a kareoke/football.  The Acorn for a cheap/quiet drink.

title: Staff Please Smile!
review: Stayed Easter for 3 nights All Inclusive, Food was Excellent, service was fine, Hotel nice & clean, you must pay a little extra for a sea view & hope you land a room higher up! [ we got side view lower down - not so good ! ]  Walking too beach & resort center is not flat walking but O.K. when you get there!  Only negative is  " Staff  please,please,please smile if only ONCE ! - never in all my visits to Spain have I seen staff this SAD !!!!

title: grand hotel for the price
review: was a grand hotel for the price(around 200€)we got it at this price as we booked independently,staff were lovely and the apartment was basic it was very clean,no bugs etc anywhere,,,great place for a budget holiday

title: nice hotel ruined by poor staff attitude
review: This was a last min booking for some winter sun so we had no great expectations.  The location was fine although few restaurants and bars were open around us as it was early season.  The hotel was adequate, rooms cleaned every day except two.  The beds were very, very uncomfortable.  The indoor pool was good, the outdoor was just being filled after repair and was freezing cold. The children's play area was a small climbing frame held together with duct tape and a couple of plastic tables. The hotel's biggest downfall was the attitude of the front of house staff.  Very rushed, uninterested and on the most part unhelpful.  Big language barrier, one woman was English and unfortunately she was the worst.  However - it is what it is, we went for sun and relaxation and we got it.  The…

title: should be at least a 4 star, great hotel.
review: me and my husband stayed here feb 09, we was so happy with this hotel we didn't expect what we got is was better and more the rooms were big and clean, the cleaners only didn't come for 1 day, nice people, great pool area, good for kids, would defiantly stay in this hotel again, should be going back aug time with the kids, the restaurant across the road on the corner was great big dinners and very cheap price we eat there nearly every day we were there, can not wait to go again.

title: Ok Hotel
review: Stayed at the Hotel mid September with my wife and found the hotel to be ok! ,   As it was coming to the end of the season we did'nt have any problems with the pool being overcrowed although i bet it would have been aweful in the summer not really that big and not many sun loungers available.  The prices at the pool bar were on the steep side and we did,nt eat at the restuarant as it did,nt look that appealing really but with plenty of places to try around town was not a problem.  The hotel was generally kept clean although the maids did,nt really put in much effort but kept it presentable, towels and bedding was changed as advertised and the reception was ran well.  The room was small but adequate just right for 2 but anymore it would have been a squeeze, the view was poor also…

title: grubby ,no way 3 star accomadation
review: Recently returned from our holiday with 2 young kids age 6 and 3.We feel the 3 stars for these apartments were over rated.On our arrival we paid extra to have a sea view,which we had already paid for!First impressions of the room were good!Then we realised there was only enough beds for 3!5 minutes later the staff came and set up a folding bed,which stayed open in our living area for the whole week,with sheets on it too!!!Also the actual sofa had a sheet on it too the whole week!!Where are we all supposed to sit!Self catering facilities are a joke,2 cooker rings,a fridge and a few pieces of crockery and cutlery,the workspace area was slightly bigger than a postage stamp!The fridge was dirty,as was other parts of the kitchen.We never cooked in it,only made sandwiches or heated up…

title: Poor staff attitude
review: Just back from a 10 day trip via globespan from the Jardin Del Mar with my wife and two kids along with my brother and his family with mixed reviews.  The hotel itself was clean and tidy with the rooms sufficient for a family of four. The facilities at the hotel were excellent but unfortunately in October there is little or no acess.  Sunbeds were limited, the gym,restaurant,sauna and indoor pool were all closed. Time and time again my wife attempted to get access to the laundry but there were no tokens available and the attitude of the staff was stinking.  The main thing that spoiled my holiday was the theft of property from my room.The room itself had undoubtedly been entered by key as the door was double locked and the items that were stolen suggested it was a female…

title: ''Loved it''
review: We arrived at 3o clock in the day, the weather was really hot! the appartment was very clean, and while we stayed there it was cleaned on a daily basis! as i went so late in the season not many places were open! We had to walk about 10mins to get to the night life or we got a taxi which only cost 3euro!! the view from the balcony was beautiful! the staff were very helpful, you could buy your tickets for boat trips and to the water park!! If your a going out kind of person who loves irish music i would reccommend going to the Shamrock Bar it is brilliant there.. Another bar which is good is Daniels Corner staff are very friendly too!! i would mostly reccommend this to young couples....

title: Hated it
review: We were given a room 3 floors below road level, we looked out of the room onto a high wall, the room was filthy and the doors were hanging off.  We lasted 24hrs, we contacted our rep who in turn moved us to a fantastic hotel in nearby Palma Nova.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, the staff didnt care about our problems and were unhelpful.  This is the first time I have ever complained about a hotel.

title: Fab hotel
review: Hotel was really nice, rooms very clean and large. All rooms face the sea however some views are distorted by the palms but thats not a bad thing.  The pool area is large, only down side to the pool is the depth in the main pool -very deep im 5.3 and water was to my neck in the shallow end so not brill for ball games but great for swimming.  You can walk to the beach in about 5 minutes either around the coast or through the town. Santa ponsa is a great place -we only ended up there by being moved from the trh in plam nova due to them having no rooms due to fight in the hotel the night before we arrived and i loved it. the main square is on the door step and their is a large seating area to enjoy the nightly entertainment all you need to do is buy a drink we watched the beegees…

title: great location
review: to be honest this hotel wasn't worth the money we payed for our holiday. it has a great location its right beside the spanish square were nightly entertainment is provided...kiddies disco...cover bands..absolutely brill for families with kids.  only short walk into main resort of santa ponsa we did it daily and that was with a 6 year old and a 17mth old in a buggy so dont believe all the negativity about the hills...THERE IS ONLY ONE!!! and not that big a deal!! the room itself was clean but small but you are only really there at night to be honest, so it doesn't really matter.  we pre paid for a sea view room and got it on same floor as reception  (4th floor) the view was fantastic and the lifts are both woking now so your not waiting too long on it. the price of stuff at the …

title: Great location, good clean hotel
review: Recently returned from this hotel - our family of two adlts and two children aged 10 and 5 stayed for last two weeks in August.   The hotel itself is in a great location, literally a two minute walk from the Square, where there is free family entertainment and different shows on every night. A good selection of bars and restaurants are again right beside the hotel, and also line the walk down to the resort centre which is about a 10 minute walk away. The beach itself is only another two or three minutes away. There's a gorgeous little beach around the other side of the bay. It's a good walk, but worth it.  There are loads of Irish bars, and plenty of others too in the resort itself. Its very family friendly, with plent of trips and things to do. 2 Water parks, the Pirate Show,…

title: Lights out time for bed
review: Stayed 2 weeks at Jardin Del Mar and was very disappointed with the self catering facilities.  Couldnt swing a mouse in the tiny kitchen.  No toaster, no kettle - all had to be hired - what a take on!! Fridge needed to be defrosted.  Ended up eating out more than we intended.  Apartment was small too and the dining talbe was disgusting.     As a family of 4 we travelled with another family who were placed in the next apartment which we were delighted with as we hoped we could put the children to bed after we came n from the Spanish Square and stand out on our balconies with a drink and some craic. Balcony lights however went out at 12.45 and we soon found out that security expected you to go indoors by 1am - they came to our door 3 times to tell us to keep the noise down and all…

title: not a good hotel
review: stayed there for 2 weeks, just back on friday there 15th of august the appartments were quite small, and on the 5th day of our holiday someone with access to the appt went in and stole all our spending money, the satff were not a bit helpful, and when we said we wanted to get the police, they were not 2 fussed, but we got them anyway, we were they with our 3 kids, and this was just a terrible thing to happen to us, we cant say if it was someone who worked in the hotel or an outsider,   santa ponsa is a great place to go, but we as a family will never be back to jardin de mar.

title: sunbed madness
review: our party stayed at the jardin del mar at the end of july/beginning of august and had a great time. we were self-catering and found loads of places to eat and drink try 'the crown' for a friendly bar to drink in the square. the hotel was average quite well maintained but we found the cleaners to be lazy- yes they came in and straightened the beds but hardly ever washed the floors the balcony was washed once in two weeks. great views of the bay staff on the whole were friendly but the morning sprint to get a sunbed was insane. we went to the beach a few times to avoid the crush. at 9am the doors to the pool opened and everyone ran to get beds at 9.01am no beds were ever left. not that most people stayed round the pool they disappeared until after 12pm. if anyone had fallen they…

title: dont believe bad reviews
review: me my partner and our 20 month old son stayed here for 7 nights and loved it.. i was doubtful about the hotel so went with an open mind and was worried as my son is soo young. i found staff to be very friendly and helpful great english too which some of the other reviews said otherwise..we traveled with budget travel and the rep was fantastic great help also.. just a minutes walk to the square which we found great the entertainment great and full of people with children..we stayed in a seaview which is soo worth the money fantastic view you can just relax and enjoy the view all day if you wish. as other reviews said the sunbeds are all taken at 9 o clock every morning and it is actually hallarious to look out at people running for them every morning at 9 it didnt bother us too…

title: nothin to complain about really
review: we stayed here for 2 weeks i was a bit concerned about what i had read in the reviews but went with a open mind and what a nice suprise we had, the lady on reception was english and she had a smile on her face. the room was clean but the kitchen tiny but what do you except. One of the lifts was out of action but only for 3 days cos they were updating it . the room was cleaned 5 days a week . the clientel is mainly irish with only a few english and scots overall it was a nice stay

title: Great time had by all
review: Just back from the Jardin del mar after a ten days stay . We had a great time , on arrival we were give a key to the side sea view room we had paid for(this is only what alpha rooms could give us) also we were given a key to a full sea view room . We checked out both the full sea view room was so big and a large terrace with table and chairs and also two sun longers, The apartment its self was on the large side with patio doors from living area and bedroom, so we paid the extra for this room view from terrace was great., rooms cleaned and towels changed daily apart from thursdays and sundays. pool area was clean, can not comment on food as did not eat at hotel and did not stay for entertainment. Hotel in good location  only a short walk to square . i had read reviews before…

title: Whats Happended?
review: Oh no i dont know what to say, I stayed her two years ago and loved the place, in fact i wrote a review about how much i loved it and posted it here, but after spending a couple of days here before we went to another hotel, I feel i might have to retract it..
