We stayed her for two nights before we went to stay in another hotel (we wanted a longer holiday so stayed here for the extra nights), when we arrived we were greated by a frown and a curtisy "yeah what" then when checking in we were greated with a lot of huffing and puffing and then told where our room was, but due to "Local Vandals" the lift aint working but is being fixed (it wasnt and someone said near the end of our holiday it still wasnt fixed) so on we trudge to our room (we were self catering) we get in and the room…

title: Pleasant stay
review: We we're a party of 10 & each one of us enjoyed our stay at the Jardin Del Mar.  The location is good.  The accommodation was absolutely fine for the money we paid (£188 each).  Although if you like sea views i would recommend you pay the extra because our balcony was opposite some trees so we didn't have a view.  The pool area is pleasant & has a nice view of the sea.  We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food.  Restaurants we'd recommend are Mexican - Amigos, Le Pergoda & Maison Del Mar (Seafood).  For good breakfasts (make your own) we enjoyed the Royal Garden.  If i go back to Santa Ponsa i would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Not As Bad As All That
review: We stayed here with our two kids for the Easter holidays.  The resort was very quiet but the weather was great.  Pay the extra for a sea view it is definitely worth it.  We went all inclusive and the meals were fine, even managing to cater for our fussy kids.  The apartment was clean and spacious and there was maid service with fresh towels nearly every day.  As other reviews have stated, one lift was out of order most of the time.  The outdoor pool was freezing but because it was out of season the indoor pool was also open.  The staff were friendly enough and there was table service for drinks at lunch and dinner which is a nice touch for all inclusive.  You must pay a visit to Shenanigans Bar in the square.  Our daughter had her 6th birthday while we were there and the owners,…

title: great apartments will go back
review: After reading a number of bad reviews i was dreading my holiday in these apartments but ended up having a great week.  Apartments were small but clean and were cleaned every day we were there except for Sunday.   Supermarket beside apartments, taxi rank across road, short walk to centre of Santa Ponsa resort either on main road (past shops/pubs/resturants) or coast walk from beside pool (go past small cove and walkway right in to santa ponsa beach though not sutiable for prams).  Plenty of shops and resturants around apartments as well.  Great views from apartments (had booked sea view) and from pool which looks over sea.  Free entertainment every night in "the square" straight across road from apartments starting with kiddies disco at 8 and bands/tribuite groups etc. until half…

title: Basic, May suit older couples
review: Just back from a two week stay in these apartments, as most of the review have said before me, Spectacular sea views but not really for families with young children.    The rooms are small, Our rep (booked with Budget Travel) told us that there are bigger "suites" but they have two bedrooms and are more expensive.  The food in the downstairs buffet was very poor. for what its worth if you are staying here you should try eating in the restaurant across the road called  "Miami" very nice food and very friendly for kids.  Facilities need a major overhaul, the children's play area had a plastic climbing slide and wendy house which were both filthy and in dire need of replacement.  There is no club.  If you are renting a car I would recommend renting from the reception as they were…

title: Staff Terrible
review: Just back from a week with my boyfriend and our 18mth son, It is basic and clean but not for young kids. The views are great but the kids pool was not for babies. We had to go to a hotel near by to use their pool. No entertainment  for the week we were there again went to a near by hotel and the square for that. The reception staff all but 1 have NOOOOOO english  and are very ignorant. 1 Lift still broken but we are lucky to be on the same level as reception so it didnt effect us. Would condider going back with kids just for the location of it being next to The Square.

title: its not the ritz but its ok
review: Hi All,  just came back from this hotel, i found it clean and basic. The walls are paper thin. The views are spectacular. the breakfast was very good. the location is good. One lift was constantly out of order. but overall we found this a nice apartment small and basic.

title: Not Impressed.
review: Stayed here for 1 week.The weather was terrible but because they have an indoor pool didnt mind.The indoor pool was colder than the outdoor.The hotel facilities need a bit of upgrading.One of the lifts were out of order for the week.The room was small,there was three of us and it was about ok.You can hear everything from the corridors.The TV is great if the english channels were tuned properly!The maid service was very good, towel change everyday.The staff weren't very happy or helpful.Santa Ponsa is a great resort for Families especially THE SQUARE at night!Had a good time but wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

title: dont stay there
review: Stayed at the hotel for 10 days and all you could hear was screaming kids and foul mouthed irish. we stayed in the apartments so didnt use much of the hotel had a front sea view which was lovely but the balcony was overlooked so there  was little privacy maidservice was very good with clean towels every other day. reception staff were miserable in fact when we checked out noone even spoke to us we just handed in our key and got our safe deposit back and left with noone asking did you enjoy your stay or have a safe journey home or anything. santa ponsa is a great resort with loads to do and great place to eat and drink   give squiffeys a try  sue the host is lovely and plays any music you wish to hear.great cocktails too. we had a great holiday but will never stay at the del mar…

title: Happy days - Not.
review: The hotel is a good location to get to the square for evening entertainment (5 minutes) and about a 20 minute walk to the beach.  The hotel offers a traditional food menu offering some local delicacies such as pig's trotters, rabbit and squid; not good for kids. Being half board meant that we had to spend a fortune on eating out to at lunch time to overcompensate. Soft drinks, tea and coffee that are available with breakfast are not included in the price of the evening meal. Oh and watch out for the cock roaches! The atmosphere in the dining room was unpleasant and the staffs were rather abrupt in their manner.  Lifts were rarely working which means that getting from the pool (on the bottom floor) to reception (fourth floor) and to you room can be hard work.  The Rooms were…

title: Won't go back...ever!
review: We have just returned for a week's stay in this hotel...early!  I tried to keep an open mind after reading a lot of the bad comments about this hotel as I appreciate that everyone has different expectations of a hotel and holiday, but boy do I wish I had taken note of the comments!!  Although we paid extra for a sea view our room looked out onto a brick wall, we were on the ground floor with no view whatsoever, room 030.  If you are given this room number on arrival all I can say is do not accept it, it's the worst room I have ever stayed in, with the pool generator next door which kept us awake all night!  After much deliberation with staff at the hotel we were eventually moved rooms to a room that overlooked a supermarket car park...lovely!  The staff were fine but there are…

title: brill sea views
review: just returned from jardin del mar apartments where we stayed for 5 days. we paid extra for the sea views.and boy was it worth it!!!  we were on the sixth floor and had spectacular views across the bay. apts were basic but very clean and were cleaned every day. pool area had lots of sun loungers though the pool bar was shut as it wasnt high season. Apts are close to the spanish square and there is a supermarket next to them. A 10 minute walk takes you to the main sandy beach though there is access to a pebble beach next to the apts where you can swim in the sea. would recommend these apts to my friends

title: never stay here
review: We stayed in this hotel for my future sister in laws hen wk end. It was a group of 15 very excited girls that arrived to the check in desk ,all went well we all got our room keys and headed to the rooms,my future sis and i got room 322.We had said that we would just dump the bags and  all head out for an hour to explore so thats excatly what we did all 15 of us met up again at reception and off we went. on our arrival back to our rooms (less then the hour) i went to get my money out of my bag IT WAS GONE the girls turned the room upside down just to be sure but to no joy so off they went down to reception to be told that there is NO camera on floor 3 a Credit card or ATM card can open the doors to make it worse the security guard was only laughing at them, Then 2 days later we…

title: Couldn't wait to get home
review: Well, what can I say? I have just returned today from a week's break to Santa Ponsa and myself and my partner stayed at the TRH Jardin Del Mar (half board) after reviewing many hotels and deciding that it sounded a good deal.  The break was not expensive but it certainly turned out to be given that we ate out at restaurants 5 nights out of the 7.  The food was well below average and I would not recommend ANYBODY going half board.  The breakfast is average and edible but the choices are very limited (usual ham/cheese and crusty bread/fatty bacon and soggy eggs)  The dinner choices are extremely limited.  On the nights that we ate there,  there was ONE starter (seafood soup), the usual boring salad bar (which I ate the 2 nights that we ate in the hotel), rabbit, chips and a few…

title: Good value for money
review: We have just returned from a 5 day break in Majorca in the TRH Jardin del Mar Hotel and really enjoyed it. The hotel itself overlooks the sea.  We initially paid for a half sea view room but decided to upgrade when we realised we got no sun on our balcony during the afternoon and we wanted to get a tan while our little boy had his nap!  It was lovely weather and when we upgraded (for only 9 euros per night) our room overlooked the pool and sea.  The rooms themselves were very basic.  You got a kettle but if you wanted a toaster you had to pay for weekly rent which I thought was a bit OTT.  The rooms can't have been updated since the 1970s but were clean.   We stayed half board so had breakfast and tea at the hotel.  It's all buffet food but really very nice.  The breakfast…

title: LOVED IT
review: Well we were there 2 years ago and what can i say it was lovely .The staff were so kind and the apartments were very clean. I went with me and my family and my grandaughter loved it to bits there is a lot to do around the hotel for kids and adults down by the pool there is kids clubs and clubs for 13+ i would say. We loved to view and all i can say is it was a FANTASIC holiday place to go to ,and there shops are bout a few mins walk away from the hotel there just across from the hotel and the bars are aswell so you dont have to go far.There is also a place thats called `the square` were there is live music and all so hope this helps  Danielle

title: not impressed
review: rooms very good,service in different,food very poor and over priced

title: Ideal for short winter break
review: Centrally located, clean and tidy public areas. lovely pool. great indoor heated pool. Food was above average. friendly and helpful staff. apartments were a little small (too small for family in summer self catering) but great for half board short break. No real entertainment in evenings which is a bit poor. But cant complain, overall Jardin del mar ideal for short winter break.  Pay extra for frontal sea view, the view is lovely.

title: Not worth the money
review: Rude staff. Didn't have full use of the facilities and will milk you for every penny.  Not very family friendly and absolutely not appropriate for young people.

title: perhaps not for young people
review: my friends and i decided that after all that hard work getting our degree , we needed a wee week away somewhere. you know like a short flight, reasonably priced and good places to go and eat.  santa ponsa came recommended to us.   we werernt expecting good weather( just as well with 6 outa 7 days raining) but wee just wanted to chill out.  before we arrived we had booked 2 rooms with a seaview. however on arrival after waiting ages to check in wee went down to the rooms only to find that there was anything but a seaview. am not sure how to describe the view apart from awful.  For my friends this was a big issue because wee had been charged extra for this, and on going back to recptiion we were promised we would be moved the next day.  however that did not happen instead the…

title: wot a lovely wk
review: arrived @ jardin del mar & was met by friendly staff. room was really nice & there was plenty of space for two. views were lovely. everything worked, except i had some trouble pulling the knob for the shower which i mentioned to reception & it was fixed that day. the food was excellent, plenty of choice. we were all inclusive & the bar staff were great. the outside pool is freezing!! but the indoor pool & sauna were lovely. gym equipment could do with updating, but who goes on holiday to work out in doors, when there is plenty of beach to walk along via the rocks & the woods are nearby, where fantastic views can be had. the weather was warm but not hot, but we didnt care, the bars werent open in town but who pays all inclusive to go out to the bars. we spent the week eating,…

title: total disapointment
review: we stayed here over xmas it was a xmas present for our 2 boys. we choose this hotel for the all inclusive program which included archery and shooting for the boys. there was nothing for the kids to do we tryed to contact the manager who was not in the hotel for the next 4 days. there was no activitys no entertainment and there was supposed to be snacks available for the guest on the all inclusive program but there was nothing. being the xmas period we relied on the hotel for the entertaiment as we knew most things would be closed. our two 12 year old boys were so board and upset. never again

title: Jardin Del Mar. Santa Ponsa Majorca
review: In July 2007 I booked a 4 night stay in this hotel for the New Year period. On arriving at the hotel after a lengthy wait at reception we were told they were overbooked and we would be staying at the Hotel Tobago in Palma Nova. We telephoned our agent and after three hours we were given a room in the Hortel Jadin Del Mar  this was thanks to the agents in particular, Boris and Mike  who solved the problem for us, although it was not a seaview which we had requested  and paid for. The hotel reception staff were rude and very miserable, out of 39 couples booked in on 28th December 2007 34 couples were sent to various hotels for 2 or 3 nights then they had to return to this hotel.  After all the hassle we did enjoy the resort and would visit it  again, but not stay in this hotel.

title: Dont go to Santa Ponsa in December
review: Have just returned from Santa Ponsa after a very disappointing  one week holiday. The island of Majorca was closed with the exception of Palma which is beautiful and Palma Nova which is not. Santa Ponsa was like a ghost town with only 9 out of approximately 200 bars/restraunts open, each with a kareoke or a jukebox playing music at 1000 decibels and served with a delightful selection of burgers, pizza and chips!  The hotel was nice and clean but the resort  wasnt, getting from A to B without  dog muck on your shoes was a work of art and as there was a lot of digging going on the smell of raw sewerage was indescribable. There was nothing remotely Spanish or traditional about the place and in the middle of  "Spanish Square" was a Poundstretcher shop, closed of course!!  Incidently…

title: Nice accommodation
review: Me, my mum and my brother stayed at this hotel for 9 days this May.  We were looking for a cheap getaway, but still far enough removed from the maddess that can be Santa Ponsa.  This hotel was exactly that.  It was at the top of the main road which led down to the beach/nightlife so was in an ideal location for us as it was a pleasent walk each day.  The hotel itself was exactly as the website described it nothing more, nothing less.  The triple rooms were more than large enough for 2, but were a bit small for 3 of us (but in fairness we are 3 adults!!)  Our room had a small kitchenette with all the necessary utensils, a seating area with TV, dining table and chairs, bedroom, bathroom (with full size bath as well as shower!!) and a good sized balcony.  We didn't really use any…

title: Good Hotel, Good Location
review: Just back from Jardin del Mar where we spent nice holidays. Everything was ok (apartment, pool, staff), it was very quiet in low season, good  location in Santa Ponsa. Note that the fitness center is very poor, nothing works ! And the buffet breakfast is not good, it does not worth the 6 euros per person.

title: Pleasantly surprised as well!!
review: Had a great week at this hotel.  Can only agree with previous reviewer on all points.   Good quality 3 star hotel,  staff pleasant and rooms clean.   Booked self catering but we only used this for making coffee and knew we would be on the beach so did not use pool area.   Could see from balcony that there were plenty of empty beds even at 11am athough the sunbed area is small for the number of rooms, could be a problem in July and August.   Would go back but probably only in early or late season.

title: Pleasantly Surprised!!!!
review: After having read the recent reports on this site we were worried that our holiday was going to be a disaster. We went to the Jardin Del Mar expecting the worst and were very pleasantly surprised!! Before i give you our review i will make a couple of points.  This hotel does not use a porter service, so you are responsible for getting your luggage to and from your rooms. We did hear that the lifts were a little unreliable, but we didnt encounter any problems while we were there. So if your old and infirm, this may not be the place for you, but if your fit and well you shouldnt have a problem.  We self catered the whole week and didnt eat in the hotel at all so we cant comment on the food in the dining room. If you like to self cater and cook all your own meals in your apartment,…

title: ok for a cheap week
review: My partner and i stayed at this hotel for a week at the beginning of Sept. when we arrived there were no problems at check in. We were located on the top floor I think the room number was 714. The aparment was quite large and consisted of a seperate bedroom with the bathroom leading off then a kitchen area and a living area. Both the bedroom and living area had doors on to the balcony, however these doors are very narrow! The balcony door off the living room would not lock so we went to reception and asked for this to be sorted and they sent up a technician, young lad, nice and friendly. We needed to go out and meet family so we took our passports, money etc. with us and just left our cases in the room. When we got back that night the door had been fixed with a new handle. Our…

title: hotel jardin del anightmare!!
review: 16 september 2007. I have just returned from a 14 night stay at the Jardin del Mar hotel santa ponsa with my parter and mother, and i can say for certian if i was offered another 2wk holiday there for FREE i would without hesitation gratefully decline. I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff are so extremely rude unhelpfull and unintrested in any of there guests!! Firstly on arrival we were told to wait as our room was not ready the bar was closed and all the seats taken so we, including my partially disabled mom had to stand for 30 / 40mins as the room holding suitcases was full, we were told just to wait very abruptley! eventually we got to our room to find it very small and old fashioned, the self catering facilities were a joke a rusy wistle kettle, a fridge that…

title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
review: I was seriously disappointed with this hotel as I had high expectations of it, spending four months working in santa ponsa four years ago and had always admired the views from this hotel. From the beginning of the stay it was a disaster. There was only myself and my boyfriend, and from the minute we walked into the room we were surprised with how small and old the room was. We did not get a sea view either and when I questioned this I was told we had only paid for a side sea view so as you can imagine we were disappointed looking into the rear of another appartment block. I must say that only one of the reception staff were nice. I never met such rude people besides that one person, and the majority of them were women.  For three whole days we were walking on puddles of water in…

title: great holiday
review: We have just come back from the  jardin del mar and feel we have to comment on some of the other reviews. We found the hotel be very clean and although the rooms were not massive we found that they were big enough for ourselves and our two children. We would recommend upgrading to a sea view which was nine euro per night. The view over the bay is fantastic!! The hotel is situated at the top of a small hill overlooking the bay. Over the road is a selection of shops and bars with two supermarkets near by. At night their is good quality entertainment in the square which is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. Santa Ponsa centre is about a ten minute walk away and gives a lot more entertainment although for most people, especially those with family, will find all they need at…

title: Not for the faint hearted!
review: Lovely view but that is all that can be said about the Jardin Del Mar.  It seems to me that since the hotel changed hands earlier in the year it has gone right down hill.  Most of the staff, especially the English lady were thoroughly misserable.  The rooms were small for a family of 4, the lifts broke regularly (we were on the top floor with a pushchair), the entertainment was shocking, kids disco was one woman standing in the bar waving her hands about to german songs we had never heard.  The pool bar was extremely expensive, a small bottle of water cost 2 euro.  The pool area was ok but large pool was far too deep for children and not really big enough for the amount of people.  Stampede at 8am for sunbeds is an understament.  Whilst we were sat round the pool a child stood…

title: We called it 'borstal'
review: Returned from the Jardin del Mar yesterday...luckily we only stayed four nights and, even then, the sight of it through the rear view window of the taxi couldn't come too soon.   To give you a flavour of the accommodation, one of our party took one look at her apartment and checked straight into the Iberostar next door and those forced to remain renamed it 'borstal'.   Our room - on the third floor with a sea view - was fine for three to share with two in a bedroom and another on the couch. If you find yourself sharing, bagsy the couch as soon as you walk through the door as the beds are painfully hard.  The pay off for the softer couch mattress was admittedly sleeping in closer proximity to the contraption of death in the corner - a pipe connected to the air conditioning unit…

title: great hotel- great resort
review: Stayed at Jardin Del Mar in June had a wonderful time. Although we booked and paid an under occupancy supplement for a 1 bed apartment we were given a studio (not hotels fault ,direct holidays messed us about) The staff on reception were really nice and moved us as soon as they could to a lovely room with sea view. The hotel was full and we didn't spend much time round the pool which was really busy (towels put on sunbeds in the middle of the night) prefering to spend our days on the beach. Only about a 10 min walk to beach which can be by road past shops, restaurants and bars or it can be reached by a rugged coastal path (not a good idea in the dark when you've had a few drinks) Santa Ponsa is a really pretty resort and the Jardin Del Mar is well positioned never far from…

title: not what i expected
review: I stayed at the Jardin Del Mar in Santa Ponsa in July 2007.  The Hotel is not at all as i expected.  Maid service was only provided twice in the fornight we stayed there.  This was only a change of towel service and not the usual tidy-up that is normally given with a maid service.  The pool was way too deep for my 11 year old daughter as well as my 5 year old.  We were put in a room beside the main boiler room which made sleep impossible.  When we complained we were told to come back in a week.  No chance we told them to move us room or move us hotel they eventually gave in and moved us to the bottom floor.  The lift was broken at least 5 times and with a pram this can be quite annoying as receiption is on the 4th floor.   The hotel was very noisey from 3 - 5 am.  The receiption…

title: beware
review: I have just returned from 2 weeks spent at the Jardin del mar.I travelled with my 12 year old son and my husband.On day 3 of our holiday my mobile phone was robbed from our room ,apparantly I wasn't the only one 8 other mobile phones were stolen and the safes which were key operated were prised open with a crow bar and other peoples money was stolen.The maids were leaving the doors to the rooms opened so an accomplice could enter and rob.The hotel and travel agent were no help whatsoever.In addition to being tiny with very basic cooking facilities there was only one room key which had the key for the airconditioning attached on a welded key ring so if you left the room you came back to a hot stuffy room.Never Again.

title: Ignore the rest, its fab!
review: We have just returned from a fabulous holiday at the Jardin del Mar in Santa Ponsa. The location is fantastic and more then makes up for any negatives as it is only a short walk from the resort centre (and away from the busy road) yet there is still lots of activity around.  'The Square' is a must for evening entertainment, especially if you have children. It is only a stroll away, but close for returning at the end of the night (entertainment finishes around midnightish!) The apartments are quite small, but hey, it is only a base to sleep in. The pool area is great and safe for the children, although you need to be up at 8 for a sunbed - tell me anywhere that you don't! All in all, I would recommend and would definately go back.

title: great area shame about the apartments
review: Stayed here the middle weeks of july  great area of Santa Ponsa but would never stay in these apartments again.  There were 2 adults and 2 children and the apts were tiny. Did get towel change every day bar Sunday and Thursday...had to ask for change of sheets and then had to do it myself.  there was a lifeguard but he had his phone glued to his ears for the 2 weeks.  the prices that were charged at the pool bar were frightening my son was charged 1 euro 60 for a bag of crisps.  Only one washing machine and dryer for the whole place and the recieption werent interested in getting you any coins for the machines it was always come back tomorrow   some lovely resturants around the Miami accross the road is lovely if a little expensive and Jackies just up form the main beach(you…

title: Straight to the point & honest review
review: Resort- Santa Ponsa is a lovely part of Majorca with a great beach. Although good 10 min walk from the hotel.  Hotel Location - ideal for restuarants and the square where there is live entertainment every night.   Hotel - Basic, showing its age, and it feels like Dublin has emptied and moved to Spain.  Rooms - ours was a frontal sea view on the 4th floor great views pay the extra and get rooms - 01 -10 on floors 3 or upwards.  You can hear everything thru the walls and its your donald duck who you get landed with next door. I heard people talking about finding vomit in their corridors after groups of lads coming in at all hours with security doin hee haw. We had a family of around 5 staying next to us I found the 3 boys out on the balcony numerous times firing catapults, and…

title: Very Disappointed
review: First Impression of the Hotel seemed OK, when we was allocated our room we were surprised to find how small it was, fortunately, there were just three of us so we managed, however the kitchen facilites were very very basic, it took approx, 20 minuted to boil a pan of water to make a cup of tea. We arrived on a Wednesday so we didn't see the cleaners until Friday, the only thing they did was come in and empty the bins. We had to ask for clean towels each time we needed them, after the first week we pointed to the sheets on the bed in the living area to ask for clean sheets, when we come to get in bed in the evening, the cleaner had only changed the ones on the bed that we'd pointed to. We didn't get clean sheets for the whole 2 weeks stay. The pool area wasn't big enough for the…

title: read some bad reviews but top class hotel, nice place to eat across the road
review: just returned from santa ponsa and i loved it the jardin del mar was a lovely place on the first day we got there, they said there was a problem with our room it was over booked so the put us up in a 4 star hotel jardin del sol and paid for our food wile we stayed. we wer there for 2 days and it was lovely but its more for retired people not for young couples or familes. we didnt want to go back to jardin del mar as the hotel they put us in was lovely but when we got to the jardin del mar we loved it the rooms wer bigger and it was more lively we had a great time and the view of the sea is a reall bonus i'd advise anyone going there to pay that little extra for the view its really worth it. there is also a little privite beach at the hotel it really peice full. there is a…

title: nice resort, bad apartment
review: My party of 2 adults and 2 children traveled to Santa ponsa on 20th June 2007 for 2 weeks. We booked our flights with jet2.com, transfers with easy jet and the apartments through travel republic. All travel arrangements went without a hitch, we were more than pleased.  We stayed in the Jardin del mar in santa Ponsa, this was our 5th trip to the resort and our 1st time in the Jardin del mar.  Santa ponsa is a wonderful place to go on holiday with kids, the restauraunt Miami is the best on the island, the Spanish Square is amazing with free entertainment every night on an open air stage, the kids are well catered for with kids disco etc by the compare, the beach is amazing and the water sports are good, although watch out for the paddle boat guys, it is 9 euro to hire the boat and…

title: A Let Down
review: We had booked 2 apartments, one for my sister, her husband and baby and the other for myself, my 10 year old son and parents. We were advised that the apartments were well suited to our needs so we were happy with this. On arriving we discovered that the apartments were tiny..cat & swing comes to mind.  When we questioned this at reception we were told really they were only suitable for 2 adults and 2 children under 12. If we had have known this we never would have booked as we did, because we all including my son paid full price for our stay. Anyhow, apart from that,  adequate towels or toilet paper were not supplied.  Cleaning was every 2nd day only but never on thursday's or sunday's which we only found out when it wasn't done. I slept on the bed settee in the living area but…

title: Holiday 2007
review: The location of this hotel is really good. Right on the edge of the bay with everything around you - including a square just a couple of hundred yards away that has evening entertainment every night, with plenty of bars round the edge to sit and relax. Lots of good restaurants, shops, pharmacy etc. At least two car parks nearby - we never had any problems parking the car. Beach was nice too - although watch out for the jelly fish. One down side - reception staff were absolutely useless. If you have a balcony don't put a towel on it - because if it falls off they won't get it for you - and you can't get it! Restaurant downstairs was nice (buffet) and pool was good too. Recommend this hotel for families - just don't expect any help from reception.

title: Fabulous location .... but!
review: Went to this hotel for a 10 day holiday.  First impressions very good, rooms furnished comfortably and very clean - we were self catering but the facilities were limited - not even a kettle or toaster (which you can hire for about 10 euros a week from the hotel).  Our room was side facing - good points are you still get a view of the bay from the balcony - bad points are you are immediately behind the supermarket and the air conditioning system from there kept me awake during the night - then the lorry deliveries start at 0800hrs!  Next time I will definitely get a sea view with no distractions!  Balcony lights switched off at midnight which is fair enough.  Location of hotel is fantastic - 5 mins walk from nightlife, right on the coast with superb views over the bay.  Pool area…

title: strange staff ....  LOL read on
review: nice hotel... location is good near the square so it is good for familys and its right on the sea front!  i went with a group of friends...we werent loud or distrupting the place, but we did have drinks in our apartments before we went out each evenings .... they turn off the lights on the balconys at 11 so obviously no one is allowed on the balconeys after then!?! ( i dont know if it is still like this!we were there about 6 years ago)  one night me and my 2 friends,my friend and her boyfriend, were sitting in our apt TALKING and the manager came up and told us to go asleep !! and proceded to tell us to turn off the lights  --- in our apartment.... that we had paid for....  and were still using !! -- and wouldnt leave untill we turned off the light -- what a joke...I would…

title: Good Value Apartments
review: Have just returned from holiday at Jardin del Mar (2nd time) which is under new ownership (previously Barcelo).  Apartments/complex still of good standard and very clean.  Only complaint is that the bar staff are not as friendly as staff in other hotels/apartment complexes i have stayed in.  Wonderful to wake up to the sun shining and a sea view over the bay.  Apartments are well situated to take in the nightly entertainment (which on the whole is usually very good tribute bands) at Irish Square.  Shops, cafes, restaurants, supermarket all nearby.  Very good chinese rest. almost across the road from the Jardin del Mar.    Location of apartments may not be suitable for those with any kind of disability due to fact that they are situated up an incline - can be a bit of a struggle,…

title: Unfriendly Staff
review: I stayed at the Jardin Del Mar in May of this year(2007) the best thing about it was the weather. I was twice confronted with cockroaches in the bathroom in the morning and found the staff at the front desk rude and unfriendly especially the english woman who was rude to both me and my elderly mother, and who doesnt understand the simple words like please or thank you.  the guests in the nearby rooms stayed awake most of the night talking in loud voices on their balcony's . When i brought this to the attention of the staff i was told to get some earplugs! I dread to think what the staff will be like near the end of the season. My advice if you are going to work on reception at a hotel please be pleasent to the guests many have saved all year for their holidays and it is nice to…

title: Excellent stay
review: Just returned from a one week stay at the  jardin and was pleasantly surprised at the overall standard of hotel.Rooms were more than adequete for two people though i think they would be a bit cramped for more than three people .Paid a bit extra for sea view but the views when you awake in the morning were well worth the extra money.Rooms were spotless and well maintained during our stay with fresh towels every other day .The down side was the hotel didn't give enough information on what was available on site though they give you a leaflet to tell you that it was 2euro for a toaster per day ,the rest you have to find out by yourself .Hotel has indoor pool which is open during winter months, outdoor pool and poolside bar for summer, sun loungers are free ,but you have to be early…

title: good stay
review: The Hotel was OK and after talking with other guests I wish I had paid the extra for an all inclusive deal. The indoor heated pool was very handy during the unfortunate non sunshine days. After a great 2 week stay I feel the hotel is in a good location and would visit again after considering the following points: The appartment size, the mini kitchen does not have a microwave oven, oven or toaster for self catering and you can hear all your holiday neighbours. English speaking TV channels were Sky News, CNN, Euro sport and BBC 1&2, however we lost BBC 1&2 signals during the evening. A good stay overall.

title: nice hotel
review: Hotel is lovely and clean.  Bedroom fine for 2 or 3, too small for a family of 4. Sunbeds situation is a joke,  all the beds would be taken by 8.10. Watched from my balcony one morning, saw women pushing, running and throwing towels on beds.They would go back to their rooms and not use the beds all day. Not fair! The snack bar by the pool was good value. The pool got very packed, very small shallow end.Would not stay there again, not relaxing enough by the pool. No comfort.

title: Our home from home
review: We are both senior citizens and have stayed at the Jardin Del Mar every year for about 11 years, I've lost count. We loved it from the start, the staff (mostly the same in all that time) are friendly and helpful. It is worth paying the extra for a sea view. We used to go half board but I found the dinners not really good enough for the whole 14 days, we now go s/c and perhaps eat there a few times. The pool-side snack bar is good at lunch time. We look forward to returning there every May.

title: Great appartments
review: Great appartments, clean, good size for two of us. Best to book frontal sea view, you have to pay a bit extra but worth it for the great  views over the sea and the beach. Bedroom and bathroom were a good size. Overall very clean, friendly staff, great location, pool is a good size too. Would definately stay there again.

title: Great holiday
review: Stayed here 16th - 23rd August (myself, hubby, & 2 kids 13 &11). Lovely location with great views over the bay. Room very cramped with 4 of us (twin beds, sofa bed & camp bed) but very clean. Kitchen also small (no toaster but you could hire one from reception! No kettle - had to boil water in a pan!)  Staff friendly & helpful (except reception on the day I went down to report that the maid had only left us 3 bath towels and was told "sorry we have a problem with the laundry today & have no towels"!!!)  Pool area & poolside bar kept clean & tidy but like everyone else we had issues with the sun lounger situation! Doors to poolside are kept locked until 8am each morning but the enthusiastic are queueing up at 7.30am!!! One day 4 beds next to us had towels on them & had still not…

title: Great apts but beware the so called animacion!!!
review: I stayed here for 2 weeks from may 25th 06, the hotel is now owned by TRH hotels and not Barcelo. I found the hotel in a beautiful location. Maids were very very friendly and the bar staff second to none they were indeed very light hearted and efficent. I was self catering but the food on offer was very reasonable and good quality. the rooms were big and very clean but if you dont have a sea view beware the view is very poor. One big setback was the entertainment it was a joke the entertainer drove the people from the hotel and when she took charge of kids frightened them there was volleyball , football advertised but was never on she was so lazy she talked all day and might have a rifle shoot or archery this despite various activities advertised daily!! she was very happy to…

title: food not up too much
review: Stayed at this hotel on 29 march for one week with my husband and two children aged 5 an 7.  we were all inclusive.  Food was rotten, kids hardly ate a thing the whole week they were there.  Catered mostly for the spannish and cerainly not for children.  Entertainment was nil.  Maybe this hotel would be better during the summer months but definately not in March/April.  Would definately not return here out of season.  Only consolation was weather was great.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: Planned a nice relaxing holiday following 6 months of chemo.  On arriving to this hotel, we were double booked for the first night, wasn't too happy but found amusment in the receptionists name "Toly" who was very apologetic.  We arrived the following morning to find that "Toly" god bless his cotton socks, had upgraded us and gave us half board and free drinks for 3 nights, which he didn't have to do!!!! (The cancer card comes in handy at times). The apartment was fantastic and boasted an enormous balcony with stunning views!  The apartment was spotless clean and in a great location to all amenities.  If you are planning a trip to Santa Ponsa I would totally recommend this hotel.    I was planning on a nice relaxing holiday and ended up partying till dawn each day!  Love the hot…

title: Another review!
review: Room was very comfortable and very clean, with enough items for self catering. The room would have been a squash if we had taken any teenagers, rather than one 3 and a half year old. Booked with Alpharooms - everything ok there. We did have a side sea view (but only from the balcony - but it was close to the sea). The maids were very friendly and made a fuss over our daughter. The pool area was very clean and tidy and had a nice 'quietness'. No rowdy people around at this time of the year! My daughter had someone to play with when we visited it for two hours per day. There was an excellent, safe play area for children under the age of about 6. Casper the 'entertainer' was a nice lad - although we still couldn't win any cocktails! Went for breakfast once (6 Euros). Not enough…

title: Loved These Apts
review: I go to these apartments every year twice a year they are just fantastic. They are great for a family holiday & great for a quiet holiday also.The staff are fantastic very friendly & helpful with any queries you may have. I would highly recommend the complex.  Really impressed Customer

title: great location
review: We Stayed here in June of 2005 loved it so much we went back in Oct of the same year, spotless clean towels changed and room tidied every day except Thurs and Sundays. The only thing I would have to say against the apartments is that they are too small the bedroom with twins beds is fine but the bed in the living room didn.t fold out so we were given a camp bed and both very uncomfortable and also the kitchen is very small but supplies all needs. We thought that as it was a family resort there would be some entertainment at night but unfortunately there was bingo and some music for the kids so we didnt stay in much another night there were flamenco dancers which we did enjoy but it didnt start until 10.00 and was over at 11.00. The pool area is fab compared to othere resorts…

title: This is a Great Hotel
review: I'll not mention the hotel in detail because other reviewers have done that. I'll just say that I have been to very many hotels/apts over the years on holiday, and this is the best. Yes, the rooms can be small so don't take two teenagers with you, and if you take two toddlers it will be difficult staying in the room. I found the food was astonishingly good. Of a very high quality and so much choice. But if you prefer the standard of cafe food served in the so-called restaurants outside, then you won't like the Hotel food. In the Hotel you got what you wanted, when you wanted it and as much as you wanted. With waiters who were very pleasant and helpful. AND you couldn't beat the price. Overall, it was so good that out of the 19 days we stayed there we could only trust ourselves…

title: Not nearly as nice as expected.
review: Located about 30-45 mins drive from Palma, this hotel is firmly aimed at families. Neither my wife or I have a problem with kids (we are expecting), but unless you adore kids 24/7, neither this hotel or most of the local resort will be of much interest to you.   The pool area looks great but in fact despite big signs forbidding it, most sunloungers have towels covering them by 8:30am and it's not a place to relax around until around 6pm (when the pool bar shuts). Decent sized beach about 15 mins walk, otherwise just some rocks down by the side of the hotel.  The hotel is very clean but the room are very basic, especially the beds which were, erm, nasty.   One bit of bad luck was being woken one morning at 6:30am by an industrial lawn mower and strimmer, working in the pool area.…

title: Lovely hotel.
review: Clean rooms and well maintained and clean pool and sunterraces.Food was of a buffet style and was of average standard. Rooms were adequate for two adults or two adults and one child, and were nicely furnished. There is a fridge, a two ring hob, hob kettle, cutlery, plates etc. There is not an oven or a grill. You can hire the safe in the room for two euros a day.If you have come self catering and would like to upgrade, it is 6 euros per adult, 3 euros for children for breakfast, and 11 euros per adult, 6 euros per child for evening meal. You can get half board for 14 euros per adult, 8 euros per child per day, for a minimum of 3 days. There are so many restaurants and cafe bars right beside the hotel though, you will be spoilt for choice. Also, there is a big supermarket around…

title: Plenty on offer
review: Nice hotel in an excellent location, easy to reach all the bars and restaurants although the rooms were slightly smaller than average. However, the cleaning staff were excellent and the rooms were kept clean and tidy and replaced with clean towels every day. The 'beach' next to the hotel is small and rocky but a short walk leads to a lovely white sanded beach. The pool area and pool side bar were kept very clean and the food and snacks were nice and affordable. The hotel also offered activities for children and adults to join in with and evening entertainment (the water polo proved popular). Although a word of caution, there are tiles missing in the pool were a member of our party cut his foot so do be careful, other than that the hotel is wonderfully kept and the lobby and bars…

title: Total chill out
review: This hotel/apartment block is superb. Our third visit and certainly not our last. Unbelievably clean. Superb views from the balconies. Very family centred and safe for children to wander around. Quiet even when busy. Mainly families with young children, grandparents etc. Not really for the 20 somethings looking for a wild time. Pool was meticulously cared for, pool area had plenty of shade, a great play area for young kids and a very welcome little cafe/bar. In house entertainment was typical of the area - magician, acrobats, flamenco dancing  etc - all of differeing qualities, but all of it popular with our 12 year old!  Only down side - the lifts were rather temperamental. Since we were on the 7th floor, this was a bit of a problem when both were out of order. Service lift…

title: Great accomadation
review: I am just back from my stay at the Jardin del Mar and I would definately reccommend it to anyone who is going to visit Santa Ponsa. The rooms were very spacious and because we had a sea view, there was a spectacular view of the bay of Santa Ponsa from our balcony. The staff were friendly and the appartment was spotless. The only bad point I found was the buffet on the ground floor. The food was cold and there was not a great selection for €21 and that price didn't even include drinks. There was a lovely restaraunt down near the beach called Mrs Murphy's Kitchen which I would fully recommend. Overall however the Jardin del Mar is in a perfect location close to the beach, bars and restaraunt with a taxi rank outside the door for those wishing to travel elsewhere.

title: Very nice Hotel
review: Just back from Santa Ponsa and was very surprised that the resort was so nice. The hotel/apt was spotless as all the reviews I read stated. The cleaning staff were very nice and if you didnt want them to call early, which was 10.30 in the morning for us, they were only more than happy to call back later in the afternoon. We had a side view but I personally think it didnt matter. There were quite alot of children at the apartment so if you didnt want to be disturbed then where we were was fine . You could actually see the little cove down by the beach so I suppose we did have some bit of a sea view! Supermarket is very near and is excellent. When going to the Deli ask them to cut the cooked meat for you, alot nicer than the packet meat.  We went to the El Jardin one night, but to…

title: Excellent holiday very friendly staff
review: Stayed in Jardin del Mar for the second time,it is an excellent hotel the whole place is spotless there is lots of space in the rooms with seperate sitting rooms and a small kitchen and small but adequate balcony depending on room location you can have a great view or not so great but you can lounge at the pool outside and get the sun all afternoon. The dining room serves breakfast lunch and evening meal all buffet and at six euros for breakfast and ten for lunch and dinner, I think it is great value also a bottle of wine for dinner is only about seven euros so you get good value for your money in my opinion I am will definatley return.
